['The place to eat when you want a real gallet. The service is friendly and they served our order really quick. The gallet with emmentaler and mushrooms was delicious. Also was the cider. As desert we shared the cr√™pe Suzette. Yumyumyum.', 'The lunch special was all I could ask for. The savoury crepe I chose was egg with
their tasty ratatouille which went very well with the "bowl" of hard cider (included). Followed up with a sweet crepe - lemon. Each crepe was crispy on the outside and delicate on the inside - delightful. Very helpful, cheerful staff. A great deal too for less than 20‚Ç¨', 'Exactly as I pictured my first meal in Paris.  Everything was fantastic.  I will be visiting here often while I am in Paris.', '1) English menu card
2) English speaking staffs
3) Vegetarians can have a customised dish.
So, in any of the Non Veg dish, the meat can be replaced as per your favorite veggie üòÉ

Excellent service and ambience ‚ú®', 'Absolutely loved the buckwheat savoury crepes and the friendly staff. They are super nice and the food is an absolute delight.']

['We celebrated my mother‚Äôs 80th birthday at L‚ÄôAssiette & we couldn‚Äôt have been more impressed. Between us we tried most things on the menu  ! Everything we tasted was stunning from the cold pea soup to the unctuous  Cassoulet , creamy Cantal vieux fromage & boozy Rum Baba . The wines were delicious , perfectly matched & advised by the maitre‚Äôd / Sommelier. The service impeccable & our delightfully charming waiter really made the evening complete . We would all go back in a heartbeat!', 'Cost cute little bistro. Amazing food and wonderful service. Chef is a Japanese transplant and I think he brings the Japanese meticulousness to the french food. Waiter was excellent, knew all the dishes very well and recommended excellent wine pairings

Will def be back next time in Paris!', 'Come for the cassoulet and brilliant wine selection. Leave with a feeling of warmth and a full belly. The young woman who runs the front of the house is absolutely brilliant, charming and cute.  Starters could use some enhancement to include a bit more selection and mains could use a chicken or similar but that cassoulet will keep us coming back. Large portion and very shareable.   The fromages served as a starter since we are quite hungry on arrival.', '"Euro-food" is a term I use to define restaurants that stay safely within boundaries. Safety is a great concept for the hotel concierge that use places as their safe place. And they can. Few would leave here with a bad impression. And for the most part, we, too. First clue of euro food is the fish selection, sea bass, sea bream. All the same regulation sized fillets. Close your eyes, and the "bouillabaisse" sauce could be anything. The accompaniments too are deviod of any real farmed character. If you have to top your potato with cabbage and speck, then its obviously not a remarkable potato to start with. And France is busting with amazing potatoes right now. But "right now" isn't a safe way to construct a menu...too much adjustment is expensive and work. Apart from the lovely pesto, everything on the plate could be at any euro capital city midmarket concierge recommendation. The bread is delightful...genuinely the highlight of the meal and undoubtedly the only really bespoke element.
A special disappointment is the dessert. This regal dish of caramelised pineapple is a great of the culinary world. Here, they destroy it in a tragedy of cornstarch "caramel". The beauty of this dish is the caramelisation of the outer of the fruit in butter, sometimes with enough sugar on the exterior of the fruit to ensure it caramelises (though great pineapple doesn't need this). The fruit done, the sauce is then formed by making a caramel freshly from the just liberated pan. Short cutting by heating the fruit with no caramelisation, and using a cornflour thickened sauce, which has none of the deep  characteristics of real caramel. Sounds like I'm making a lot of this, and I am, but it's like paying to see Pavarotti, and hearing as the curtain rises that his cousin is standing in, and taking a swing at it...how hard can it be? Answer, to do it right, very.
The service is good, and the wine list ok. The wines by the glass aren't listed, and it seems most of the bottles are ‚Ç¨60-90. But that's Euro food for you.', "Absolutely divine cassoulet, great wines by the glass and the salted caramel creme caramel was out of this world. Come with an nice empty tummy! We were sat by the door which doesn't shut properly so sometimes meant we were sat in an unpleasant cold draft.. but that's the only complaint."]

['Great find.. lovely authentic pizza absolutely love the ambience and service. Food is delicious, generous with ingredients and price is reasonable. Just look a the pictures.. they speaks‚Ä¶', 'We arrived to Paris this morning and we had our first meal in this place! The food was delicious and full of flavor! We ordered the Alla barese pasta, bomba burrata and a regular margarita pizza. My mom was so satisfied with the taste of their pasta! I‚Äôm definitely bringing her back again. Besides the delicious food, the chef and waitress were very welcoming and helpful. The place was cozy and cheerful. We are always looking for talented local places to dine in and this one was fantastic.', "I ate in this restaurant and all I can say is that it's delicious!. All the staff is polite and nice, and the food is the best. I ordered a Agnolotti alla Fiorentina (Ravioli trais √† la v√≠ande, Poitrine fume, champignons and sauce tomate). It has been one of the best raviolis I have tried! The Bomba Burrata, the pizza, linguine... The place is clean and tidy. I really recommend this place to have a dinner or to enjoy a beautiful night with friends or family.", 'We had pizza there twice and really enjoyed it... And afterwards we heard their pasta was excellent too. Next time.', 'Great pizza reseraunt with a good overall atmosphere. Pizza bases are nice and thin with a nice variety of options.']

['Plz open a branch in London!
Not feeling thirsty after the meal nor sugar-coma after desert is the best thing I can think of French dishes.
Cooking of the pork shoulder is amazing. Tender, juicy and crispy on the outside. The roast chicken is also great.
Very friendly to non-French speaking tourists like us. Highly recommend', "Always amazing, we come here everytime we're in Paris. The food is always excellent, the ambience lovely and Sebastian is always welcoming whether for lunch or dinner. Well priced, exceptional food and fabulous service. You cannot go wrong.", "Lovely local bistro/restaurant.

Food was delightful and service was 10/10. The foie gras was really lovely and the portion was relatively generous.

The fish was a bit bland but it's hard to get it right I guess, other than that everything was perfect. Will come back. I believe they have a set menu on lunch :)", 'had the bouillon, souffl√© and lasagna. bouillon was slightly salty, warm and hearty. souffle was warm and the pears and ginger were a nice addition. lasagna was perfect, tasty and great blend of all flavours', 'Had a dinner there with good French friends. Food was fabulous and wine was good. Loved the atmosphere as well. Would def go there again']

["such a rich and unique experience to dine here! it wasn't like any other restaurant or steak place! don't bother going here if you like your steak well-done, or even medium-well. I don't think I can have steak tartare anywhere wise now that I've tried William's. and the fried potatoes... don't make me start about it!
the genuine hospitality that I received was so beyond anything similar!", 'Ordered a steak a point / medium rare - 50‚Ç¨ for it and frites. Received the plate pictured, which is absolutely medium if being generous, and very much on the medium-well side for much of it. Tried to talk with the staff, only to be talked down to and have him rudely point to another diner‚Äôs steak as medium rare (theirs was very, very rare, and looked somewhat more edible to be fair). What I received ate absolutely tasteless and tough. And totally dry (medium rare, right?). Ate a few bites and left. The overdone steak is one thing - the truly dismissive, patronizing service is way worse.', 'I really loved our meal at Severo. The place is really cosy and charming, the food was the best. I had the tataki and my partner the tartare, and they were both really good. The owner was also really nice and patient. We had a really nice meal üôÇ', 'Very high quality of meat if you‚Äôre looking for a good steak in Paris. The meat is really tender (looks like they aged it for at least several weeks). Fresh home made fries. The wine suggestion was average.

Nice decoration and ambiance. Small, warm and cozy restaurant in a quiet corner.', 'My first stop after my flight landed in Paris. Because first things first. It pretty much set the bar and the standard for the french cuisine experience during my stay. I knew what I wanted beforehand. To try both the tartare and the filet de boeuf. Both were excellent. Also tried the creme caramel, which was decent (for my portuguese sweet palate). It was a delicious and no frills food. The focus was where it should be, the perfectly cooked meat. I had a great and relaxing time. I will definitely be back soon!']

['Absolutely fantastic! We visited the restaurant for dinner as we were staying at a nearby hotel. They serve food until late in the evening, which was very convenient for us. The food was delicious, and the service was absolutely excellent‚Äîreally kind and friendly staff. We ordered the salad, beef carpaccio and both white and red wine, all of which were outstanding. The meal came with complimentary bread and olives with a selection of condiments, which was a lovely touch.

We couldn‚Äôt have asked for more and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We also loved the ambience of the restaurant‚Äîit felt vibrant and could be used for drinks as well as dining.

After the meal, I realised I had forgotten my wallet at the restaurant. The incredibly kind staff went out of their way to bring it back to our hotel, which was above and beyond. Thank you for making our evening so special‚Äîwe would love to return the next time we‚Äôre in Paris!', 'We came for lunch to this restaurant before going to the airport. The place was cozy, the waiter who served us was nice and friendly and the food we good. I highly recommend this place.', 'Good service, friendly people. Portuguese and English speaking attendees.

Food very tasty, I had a rabbit leg and my wife fish and chips on the menu of the day.', 'Our waiter was super friendly, politely explained choices in English to help us out.

We loved our food. We shared snails, my daughter had pasta, I had octopus.  They had a wide range of choices.', 'My morning breakfast favourite restaurant üòã. Lucian was very welcoming and helpful with a very nice smile ü•∞']

['We visited with a small group on Christmas Eve. The service was very good and the meal delicious and well spiced. We also enjoyed a Morroccon wine. Would recommend.', 'This extraordinarily beautiful restaurant is the best Moroccan restaurant I have been! Through the doorway that resembles that of a traditional riad, the restaurant interior brings its visitors a piece of Morocco in the heart of Paris. The food itself was also of excellent quality and portion, even though the price is simply standard with Parisian Moroccan restaurants (17-24‚Ç¨ for an authentic tagine). I highly recommend this place for your next Moroccan meal !', 'Best place to eat Moroccan Tajin & Couscous: delicious food, fresh ingredients, clean place, friendly staff, perfect service.. highly recommend it !', 'The first time I went, great food. The second time I went not so much. Meat was very dry and I hard a hard time eating it. The couscous is not that great considering the price. Staff is very nice and the Moroccan tea is quite nice too.', 'Wonderful dinner!  We had the Tajine Agneau and Poulet Couscous - we would have eaten more if we could fit it! Staff (owners I think) were so warm and friendly. We hope to be back for a coffee before we leave Paris. Merci for the great meal.']

['The food was delicious. The staff was very polite and didn‚Äôt miss a beat. Some of the other reviews seem petty and extremely biased.

Reading the reviewers history you can tell they are just like that everywhere they go.

The food has good flavor and is made well, it is not greasy either. The restaurant was very clean.

I would not call it a tourist trap but would suggest that individuals make up their own experiences.

There were plenty of locals enjoying the service when we showed up for dinner and the restaurant became packed shortly thereafter. If you are a traveler, looking for delicious Asian cuisine that isn‚Äôt buffet style food but is budget friendly I recommend.

If you‚Äôre going to be hyper critical maybe try opening your own restaurant and cooking your own food.

10/10, would recommend.', 'Great food, fantastic service.  Beautiful atmosphere.', 'If you‚Äôre an American/English speaker, avoid this restaurant at all costs. My family and I were mocked for speaking English and trying politely to order food. They did not understand   (although each item was in English on their menu), so we used Google translate and barely got by. As a gluten free customer, I also politely tried asking for help with which items were gluten free but wasn‚Äôt given much help, only an irritated attitude. I ordered the chicken skewers after being told they were gluten free. At the end of the meal, I tried ordering a banana split, this time in French, and spelling it out using Google translate, they still did not understand me and brought me a menu where I had to point to where it literally said ‚ÄúBanana Split.‚Äù

The entire staff gathered and were quite obviously making fun of us in another language the entirety of our meal. We left very embarrassed and defeated, and sick because the skewers were not gluten free.', 'I definitely recommend this restaurant! The food was maybe one of the best asian food I‚Äôve had, the staff was super nice, and the atmosphere was great as well!', 'Beautiful food great atmosphere the food was that nice we forgot to take a photo of it üòÜüëç
And the staff were so friendly ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è']

Adresse: 35 Rue du Commandant Ren√© Mouchotte, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews: ['I walked past this brasserie everyday while i was in Paris and decided to give this place a try. For 10E breakfast deal you get: bread, croissant, juice and coffee.\n\nService was really fast and staffs are friendly.', 'My boyfriend and I traveled from England and were staying at a hotel just down the road, we came across this place and thought the food was excellent especially for the price! The waiter was lovely and very kind. We ended up going back two more times after this.', 'We had a lovely evening at Cafe Ernest eating and drinking. It‚Äôs a well patronised place and the staff are fun, courteous and ‚Äòsympa‚Äô. We had such a lovely evening that we left our small backpack under the table inside only realising it the next morning! We were staying a few metro stops away! We rushed back as they were just opening and we were beside ourselves with angst! The staff had found it when closing up and it was behind the bar! We were so thrilled and thankful. Never been so gratefulüôèüéâ Merci messieurs!', "Nestled in the heart of Paris, Ernest Brasserie exudes a charming ambiance of Parisian elegance. I highly recommend Ernest Brasserie to anyone seeking a truly authentic French dining experience. Whether you're a seasoned foodie or simply a Francophile at heart, this brasserie will not disappoint. Do try their croissant.", 'Okay so to start off positive the staff is very nice and accommodating. The restaurant looks beautiful and as soon as you walk in there‚Äôs a nice size bar and plenty of seating. But please understand the other reviews are accurate when they say there are mice. I was seated in the restaurant on the upper platform and there was a mouse roaming through the tables. Because of this I didn‚Äôt order any food, I finished my wine and kindly chose to leave. There is a lot of construction around which could be the reason for the issue but I can‚Äôt say for sure.']

['Excellent food and service. The waiters were both super friendly and we were never rushed to make a decision.

Starters:
Catch of the day (Seabass & Pollock)
Crispy Minced Beef Tongue

Mains:
Beef Cheek, Polenta, Olives, Beef Marrow
Fish of the Day (Cod), Asparagus, Doughnut with ginger [Favourite Dish]
Suggestion of the Chef (Razor Clams and Cockles)
Rumpsteak was favourful and tender

Thank you! :)', 'Delicious food, perfectly presented with correct price. Very kind service too. The ‚Äútarte au Citron is just amazing!', 'Grabbed a quick lunch and the service was delightful. Very friendly and helpful. And the food, amazing! they even pointed us in a good direction to find a cab as we were in a rush', 'Lovely French brasserie! The food is of excellent quality and the prices are fair. The service is great! I would totally recommend this place, as it is truly a French experience!', 'Great place for lunch and dinner. Typical Parisian bistro with friendly staff and great menu. A little expensive for what you get in my humble opinion, but still a good value.']

['The best of the best pizza in Paris. If you want to eat pizza in Paris, you have to go to Pizza Valentino. Very nice Man, who make delicious pizza. Thank you so much.', 'Absolutely delicious pizza and the owner was the nicest guy ever! I would highly recommend the place! Also really good value! Very affordable:)', 'Best pizza in the area. Great seelection and made to perfection. The guy is always the same, maybe the owner. Very friendly.\nHighly recommended if you are looking for a take-out pizza.', 'The pizza was so yummy and and the Pizzaman was so friendly and Made the pizza by himself in only 5 minutes.', 'From the outside seems dodgy, but the pizzas are very good and REALLY filled. Only take away, literally no room for one single chair']

Nom: Sushi Pacha - Restaurant Japonais √Ä Emporter ou En Livraison - Paris
Reviews: ['This is probably one of my favourite sushi place in Paris. The customer service was very friendly and welcoming. The food was even better. 100% going back there before leaving Paris', 'i went to paris for vacation & i was craving sushi after a longgg day of exploring the city. we came across this amazing sushi spot and it did not disappoint! we went in at 1am and the quality of the sushi was just chef‚Äôs kiss. will definitely be going back whenever i‚Äôm back in paris :)\nside note: on the smaller side/ not ideal for dining in with a group of friends', 'This is one of those places that you stumble upon looking for food late at night. The staff are super nice and welcoming. The sushi was delicious and well priced imo. The set meals are super filling too! From what I gather, it is also halal but I‚Äôd recommend confirming if everything is halal.', 'During my vacation in Paris, my boyfriend and I decided to order sushi for takeout from an excellent restaurant. The fish was super fresh, and the dishes were well-packaged and delicious. Moreover, the waiter was very friendly and helpful, which made the experience even better. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for quality sushi in the city that‚Äôs open late!', 'Excellent service! The food is delicious and the menu includes dishes that you have never tried before. We did not hesitate on trying them and absolutely loved them.']

['Accidentally ordered 4 chicken korma and tried to call them to correct it. Got voicemail 3 times, left 3 msgs. Never heard back. Got my order but the naan was missing! Called again, never got a call back. Food was bland, no spice at all. Will never order from them again.', 'Been here now 3 times, since Dec. 31, 2022
Amazing food and great service.
Will be back for sure in the future.', 'The best Indian food I have tasted in Europe till date. Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was very welcoming and made sure we received the best service. A must visit restaurant for sure. Don‚Äôt forget to try the Mango Lassi and butter naan ü§§', 'Good clean restaurant with good host. Food quality very average.', 'Bassanti ‚Äì A Taste of India in Paris

Tucked away in the charming streets of Paris, Basanti is a gem that offers an authentic taste of Indian cuisine with a touch of elegance. As soon as you step inside, you are greeted with warm, inviting decor that sets the stage for a delightful culinary journey.

The food at Bassanti is nothing short of exceptional. From the first bite to the last, every dish bursts with rich, vibrant flavors that truly represent the diverse culinary heritage of India. The menu is a well-curated mix of traditional Indian favorites and modern twists, ensuring that there‚Äôs something for everyone. Whether you‚Äôre indulging in the creamy, aromatic Butter Chicken, savoring the perfectly spiced Lamb Rogan Josh, or enjoying the variety of vegetarian options like the Paneer Tikka Masala, each dish is prepared with the utmost care and attention to detail.

What truly sets Bassanti apart is the impeccable service. The staff are not only knowledgeable about the menu but also go out of their way to make you feel at home. They are attentive without being intrusive, always ready with a smile and a recommendation. Whether you‚Äôre a first-time visitor or a regular, the warm hospitality makes every dining experience memorable.

The ambiance at Bassanti is both elegant and comfortable, making it the perfect spot for a casual lunch, a romantic dinner, or a special celebration. The subtle Indian motifs in the decor, combined with the soft lighting, create a relaxed atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience.

In a city known for its culinary excellence, Basanti stands out as a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Indian food. The combination of outstanding cuisine, exceptional service, and a welcoming atmosphere makes it one of the best Indian restaurants in Paris. If you‚Äôre in the mood for a true taste of India, Bassanti should be at the top of your list.']

['We stopped here for dinner right after arriving in Paris from England. They did not speak much English and we spoke no French but they were so friendly and worked with us. The food was out of this world! 10/10 recommend and will come back!', "Small neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere.. Even though we don't speak French the weight staff was extremely friendly and made us feel right at home. If you want a cozy restaurant with great food at a reasonable price this is the place for you.", 'We loved the food and the service. We ordered a few different items for our family. The steak with egg was amazingly juicy and tender. The chicken burger had such great flavor and their fries are absolute perfection. Happy we came.', 'Very cozy place! The girl who served us showed patience and was very nice üëå. The food was great!! Half chicken and fries, just delicious and portion more than enough. Pork ribs niceee and fries very good. Really good prices I just loved the place, recommend 100%', "Good food, good price and will come again to try another menu in L'As du Poulet.."]

['Delicious and fresh sashimi ü§å We enjoyed a very late dinner and were warmly served. Very reasonably priced, would recommend. üíé', 'The sushi was great and the owner was kind and generous.', 'Cheap and delicious sushi üç£. We had a 1 week stay in paris and came here 2 times to eat. Always paid less than we expected. Great place', 'Typical Parisian-Japanese food fare. Brochettes and sashimi. No distinction to other restaurants of the same kind. One knows what one will get from the pictures in the window. The service was ok as was the ambiance.', 'The food is pretty good and the service was decent. If you want to take away you pay less. This place is pretty affordable and the portions are sufficient. I suggest this place']

['Nothing much to say since the service was so ‚Äònul‚Äô I left without ordering anything.. Maybe it was a bad day for them, or a new server, because not everyone seems to have had the same experience...', 'We have been having lunch now for 6 consecutive days. Not on one daybwe have been disappointed by our food or the service.', 'Cool good service not expensive food', 'Very bad customer service', 'Good']

['They are so nice, found the bar in just passing with my daughter through gare montparnesse. A true gem.', 'Good place for meeting friends, relaxing and enjoying the delicious Salad and Pasta', "Absolutely great bar, great staff and music!\nThe staff are so friendly and helpful. I can't say enough good things about this place.", 'Lovely place with live music in the evening. I enjoyed the food.', 'A bit disappointing taste for cous cous, lamb ok, chicken tasteless. Service nice and friendly.']

['We had  a terrifc and cost effective lunch at this center-of-the-community establishment.  The food was fantastic and all of the locals stopped by to chat.  Welcoming and wonderful!', 'Good lunch, nice food at a fair price, friendly proprieter.', 'Friendly atmosphere, home-cooked meals, good value for money.', "It's super good", 'Excellent welcome, very helpful staff, well done. Very good cuisine‚Ä¶ I recommend.']

['Lovely little restaurant!  Delicious food, friendly and polite service, nice relaxed atmosphere. Came 2 nights in a row during our short break to Paris.', 'Excellent pizza. ü•∞ü•∞, and clean resturent, friendly staff..\nI recommend. 100%', 'Found this lovely little place as we were exploring Paris. Highly recommend it. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was welcoming and the food‚Ä¶the food was excellent.', 'During our stay in Paris, we went to Pizza Nellie two nights in a row because it was SO good! The food is amazing, the pizza‚Äôs were to die for! Quality-price ratio is perfect! Besides that, the staff is SUPER friendly! They gave us directions to the best sightseeing in the city, tips how to get there, they where flexibel, helpfull, funny,‚Ä¶ like a big family. We felt so welcome. This is a must visit in Paris!', 'Excellent food. Great service. I honestly wasn‚Äôt expecting much, this restaurant was just convenient. I tried the famous cheeseburger, the eggplant parmigiana, and the salmon pasta. All the was very delicious.']
['Welcoming, friendly, superb food generously served', 'Great food experience', 'Correct', 'excellent couscous', 'nice']

['A real hidden gem in the middle of Plaisance! Booking for a table was easy - completed this online. There was a set menu. I went for the Sea Bream (amazing fish and cooked vegetables in garlic and lemons) and my Mum- a meat platter. The waiter took the time to explain each dish and recommend great wines. We even got a lovely table seat watching the rain fall down. I would definitely visit again next time I am in Paris. The restaurant is a minute walk from the Metro station which is helpful!', 'Delicious food, smiley happy service and lots of locals speaking French - not a touristy place.', 'From the moment we stepped into L‚ÄôEssentiel in the bustling Rue d‚ÄôAlesia, we were greeted with the kind of hospitality that every tourist dreams of. Our waitress, Naoual, was a beacon of warmth and expertise. Being unfamiliar with the local cuisine, we entrusted our palates to her care, and she orchestrated an unforgettable culinary journey for us.
The starter was a symphony of flavors, featuring smoked salmon that melted in our mouths, beets that were a revelation in themselves, and devil eggs that were devilishly good. The gambas salad was a fresh and zesty prelude to the main course, which was nothing short of spectacular.
For the main dish, we indulged in a perfectly seared beef steak that was the epitome of tenderness and a fish with cauliflower that showcased the finesse of French cooking. Each dish was a testament to the chef‚Äôs prowess and the restaurant‚Äôs commitment to quality.
The grand finale, the dessert, was a trio of classics done right - a cr√®me br√ªl√©e with a gloriously caramelized top, a tiramisu that was the right balance of coffee and sweetness, and a chocolate mousse that was sinfully smooth.
L‚ÄôEssentiel didn‚Äôt just serve us food; they served us an experience that we‚Äôll cherish. It‚Äôs not just a meal; it‚Äôs a memory crafted with care and served with pride. Thank you, Naoual, and the entire team at L‚ÄôEssentiel, for a meal that was the highlight of our Parisian adventure. üçΩÔ∏è‚ú®', 'Incredible food and a wonderful atmosphere. A gem!', 'Very tasty fish & ratatouille and steak & frites and creme Broulee! The waitstaff are especially kind and friendly!']

['Very tasty dishes. With the deal on The Fork I have a great quality/price ratio. Highly recommend', 'Finally a real Korean restaurant in Paris!!!
This is the address to go if you want to eat or try Korean food.
It is tasty and real flavor.
I advise you to book before going as there is limited place.
It is not too expensive the owner will welcome well.
If you are in the 14th district, please go to try it.', 'Quite a small restaurant you might not see at first when you pass in front of it but definitely worth it! The dinner menu for 25‚Ç¨ gives you two small starters and a main. The japchae and mandu are quite good and the bibimbap is very nice as well. The lady takes care of all the tables on her own with a nice smile without making you hurry even though it can be quite busy. A nice and pleasant dinner! Just a shame there was no hotteok left for desert!', 'We love Korean BBQ and since this restaurant is conveniently located close to our hotel we decided to give this small restaurant a try. We were pleasantly surprised! Good quality of meat, friendly service!', 'Delicious Korean food. I can highly recommend.']

["ƒ∞f you're looking for products that are past their expiration date this is the place you're looking for ! ƒ∞ would absolutwly NOT recommend buying any fruits or vegetables from here.", 'Doors closed not indicated (for several weeks). Pallets in the middle of the shelves at 7 p.m.... preventing access to the product... what about the management of this Franprix?', 'Cashier who puts cream while we wait to pay, no hello or goodbye, no respect for customers', 'Attention store CLOSED AT 9 p.m. and not midnight!! Thank you for correcting the times, because walking 20 minutes to be told that there is only Uber Eats which operates after 9 p.m....I will remain cordial but I think no less.', "Since the team changed it has become nonsense.
The last time I went there I asked for information from a woman who is obviously new (because she doesn't know much about the store) and I advise you not to go talk to her.
You must not disturb her otherwise you risk preventing her from sending messages to I don't know who.

A very nice seller but who doesn't understand anything we ask him :/

Very disappointed...

On the other hand, let's not forget some very kind, friendly and attentive sellers."]
['Tres bien!! Tasty food, very nice people.', 'Great food\nGood service', 'Best in Paris', 'Super', 'Super']

Adresse: 7 Rue Francis de Pressens√©, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Another lovely small cinema in Paris used by Lost in Frenchlation for their showings of French movie with English subtitles. The seats are comfy but it almost seems like the front rows are higher than the ones further back.', 'L\'Entrep√¥t... It sounds like the transformation of this cinema library into a trendy restaurant for "bobos" (bourgeois bohemians) has diluted its original charm and identity. It\'s even more noticeable when seeing the manager saying hello to bobo community having their habits here, ignoring anyone else. The space once dedicated to cinema culture has shifted toward a more commercialized, vintage aesthetic, losing its soul in the process. While the cinema itself still offers high-quality indie films with good technical aspects (sound, screen, seating), the venue no longer feels like a genuine haven for cinema lovers. The loss of tribute to film art in the d√©cor and ambiance seems to have turned it into more of a bourgeois social spot than a celebration of cinema culture.\nRestaurant offers limited meals options though food is good.', 'Very cute cinema with a nice selection of movies. Great atmosphere and friendly personnel.', 'Delicious creative cuisine in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Very friendly service. We will return for sure!', 'I did enjoyed this place. Very comfortable, very nice reception, staff very welcome. Relaxing and clean place at affordable prices.']

Nom: Chez Victor / Cuisine maison et march√© frais
Reviews: ['Food was excellent.  Changes frequently based on local ingredients.  Owner/chef and staff very personable and take great pride in their food and service.  Highly recommended.', 'My husband and I ate lunch here in July, 2024. We had the lentil dahl with white rice, and chocolate mousse and fountainebleau for dessert. Everything was very yummy! The dahl was excellent and very aromatic and flavourful! From the adjoining small market we bought sausage and goat cheese, both of which were perfect. We were served by a very friendly young lady who spoke English and kindly walked us through the menu options and made us feel welcome. I definitely recommend this place for a quick and relatively cheap bite (we paid 15 euro for a main course+dessert) if you are in the neighbourhood.', 'A cute little coffee shop, slash, mini local product market.\nThe place is cosy and inviting, and pretty quiet which has been convenient for me at the end of the day to finishing up some work on my laptop. They serve coffee - also organic certified coffee you can buy and take home with - and other warm drinks, and a variety of treats to satisfy any sort of guilty cravings. I have been there twice so far and don‚Äôt regret it. The barista is lovely, and always available to assist for any more informations about products they offer. I look forward to try more of what they have on their brunch menu.', 'Had soup, quiche and a beer. Everything was delicious and the service was great. Bought a bottle of pinot noir from the store too üëåüèª went down a treat! Would definitely recommend', "beautiful, tasteful and fresh produce, only seasonal fruits and veggies. If you're in the 14th and looking for some quality greens, it's the place to go."]

['Order at the counter then they bring your order to your table. Comfortable chairs.', 'I found the prices to be reasonable : 9e for a combo with a drink or select what you want by weight.\n\nStaff is really nice. They are super busy but managed to check on us while we were eating.', "Nice place with good Chinese food (rare outside of Chinatown) and pleasant service at reasonable prices.  Also spacious enough so that you are not sitting on top of your neighbors and with good, quiet acoustics.  Draws a large local clientele including a number of Chinese (who must know it's OK)", 'Audit HSE optimal', "Starters a bit greasy and main nothing special for the money. I've had worse."]

['I like the atmosphere and small plants in the restaurant. The guy was nice and the price is reasonable.

However, I did not like the mussels in the seafood pizza and the salmon one was too salty.

And my pizza was burnt on the below.', 'I ordered the spaghetti with tomato source and grilled chicken. The flavor was so light that I doubt they forgot to add salt at all. The dish is definitely not worth the price.', 'This is an underrated pizza place, I came in here for lunch and got a pizza to go in less than 10mins. Quality is great and so is taste. Perfect for a quick indulgent lunch that has quality and care. I will certainly be coming back here whenever a crave a speedy good pizza. Will be trying more of their options as well !', 'Came here twice during our stay in a nearby hotel. Pizza the first time, and spaghetti the second. Both were very good and affordable! Note this restaurant is cash only.', 'Good pizza, lovely owner in a simple and cozy setting. Perfect fix after a long walking day. Good value for money']
['Chicken curry is really üòã\nAmazing lovely team\nFast service', 'Nice food', 'very good', 'No conditionner. It was really hot. But tasty meal', 'Very nice clean and good pizza']

Nom: Papy aux Fourneaux I La table d'h√¥tes I Montparnasse
Reviews:
['This charming French neighborhood restaurant is truly a hidden gem, offering an eclectic yet cozy vibe that transports you to an old-world dining experience. The interior exudes warmth, with intimate settings and thoughtful details that make you feel at home.

The highlight here is the three-course limited menu, which combines the finesse of French culinary tradition with a comforting, home-cooked essence. This isn‚Äôt fine dining but each dish feels lovingly prepared, with high-quality ingredients and an emphasis on local flavors. The options cater to a variety of tastes, ensuring everyone finds something to love.

From the beautifully rich onion soup with a hint of Comt√© to the hearty mountain pork sausage paired with a rustic medley of potatoes and vegetables, the flavors are vibrant yet balanced. Desserts, like the pear and almond tart topped with pistachios and chocolate, are the perfect sweet ending‚Äîboth indulgent and refined.

The atmosphere is lively and inviting, making it ideal for a relaxed meal with friends old and new thanks to shared tables; or a special dinner for two. It‚Äôs a place where you can slow down, savor every bite, and feel genuinely cared for. This restaurant is not just about the food; it‚Äôs an experience, one that stands out as both personal and memorable. A true delight for anyone looking to enjoy authentic French cuisine with a side of character and charm.', 'Loved this restaurant so much! The food was delicious and everything I hoped it would be. We had the roasted chicken, the fish of the day in a chorizo cream sauce (amazing) and the st Germaine soup. A perfect spot for a cold winter night.', 'Good food?

While the restaurant hinges on the concept of sharing--sharing meals with your partners and friends, sharing tables with strangers--its main goal should be to propose food that tastes, that can be savoured, that inspires memories and triggers new associations.

Nothing like that happened at Papy, at least to us. This evening, our meals were unseasoned and a bit too raw to be enjoyed.', "We had the pleasure of dining at this highly recommended restaurant, and it truly exceeded our expectations! The culinary experience was nothing short of amazing, with each dish bursting with incredible flavors and exquisite richness. The attention to detail in the restaurant's decor was evident, creating a delightful ambiance that enhanced our dining experience.

What pleasantly surprised us was the reasonable pricing considering the exceptional quality of the food. It's rare to find such a harmonious balance between value and taste. Moreover, the service provided by the staff was exceptional. They were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction throughout the meal.

We wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone in search of an exceptional dining experience. It's an absolute gem that deserves recognition for its outstanding food, inviting atmosphere, and remarkable service.", "Wonderful restaurant, real family feel. Choose a plate to share and enjoy a real home cooked, French meal. Attentive and thoughtful staff, games to play while waiting, reasonable wine prices and a highly recommended experience. Worth a visit and reserving a table if you don't want to be disappointed!!"]

['Very fun little bar.  Great owners.  They don‚Äôt speak English, but luckily one of the other patrons did and ended up taking her order! Really enjoyed this fun little place, just don‚Äôt ask for water.', 'The lady was extremely rude and disrespectful. In a way in which other customers showed me sympathy! Avoid it at all costs !!!', 'Favorite local bar, the two women running it are great! Thanks a lot.', 'Friendly staff, nice atmosphere, yummy omelette. Would definitely recommend.', 'The staff was very friendly!']

['The espresso was on point and delicious and pastry was good. The service was quick. I was in a rush to get somewhere. I wasn‚Äôt in Paris long but I noticed Parisians are not much for rushing food service. Good place to stop for a quick drink on the go when you are headed out and about sightseeing!', 'I just had a quick Caffe Latte with vanilla before my trip back home‚Ä¶ loved the atmosphere in side. Outside was not much of a view ( a hospital is across the street). The waiter was friendly and helpful.', 'Used to live in the 14th and after the 15th and was there when this place opened. Such a nice surprise and a lovely owner and his wife. And the service, food n coffee is always good. Yum i miss it :)', 'While visiting Paris for two days, we enjoyed starting the day at this cafe and ending the day there for dinner! The pizza was excellent! Salads were some of the best we‚Äôve had! Coffee was excellent as well! The owner was friendly and helpful. We loved the atmosphere. Great job!', 'Just a little flavour of Southern Italy around this quiet corner of 14th Borough. Coffee is as good as Lavazza can get in Paris, which is outstanding... Loved the homemade pastries perfect to pair with full bodied espresso: canistrelli with a twist (pistachio or chocolate cream) cornetti with Nutella, simple and effective ! Great service with a smile to top-up and turn this simple spot into a cloud of coffee happiness.']

['We stopped here on a whim whilst walking by and decided to get some food. We were pleasantly surprised about the atmosphere and the attentiveness of the server. The food was good as well, no complaints, great little restaurant.', 'An excellent place for dinner. Delicious steak tartare and carpaccio for a reasonable price for Paris. Great outdoor seating in the Place Flora Tristan.', 'Haven‚Äôt eaten here, looks very nice from the outside however', 'Amazing terrace, very tasty pizza (Tartuffo), and friendly waiters.', 'Very delicious food and drinks and very good service! Thanks Greg :)']

['The best falafel wrap I‚Äôve had in Paris in 10 years - excellent, friendly service as well.', 'Hight quality food. Nice ambiance and very good service. Special thanks to Alex, very welcoming and good vibe.', 'As a tourist who struggles to speak french, the younger man working at the restaurant was extremely friendly and caring.\n\nThe original wrap was extremely fresh and tasty. I would definitely recommend stopping by to any tourists in the Didot area.', 'The best Lebanese garlic in paris. Exceptional team.', 'This place is the best Lebanese restaurant I ate in Paris. As a Lebanese person, I can say this place offers food that taste much more authentic and delicious than so many other Lebanese restaurants I went to in Paris. The servers were very sweet and friendly. Upon asking about the secret of the authenticity here, they said that the grandmother of the owner does and guides the cooking process. We loved it and we highly recommend it!!! Thank you for offering us a lovely taste that feels like home!!!']

Adresse: 18 Pl. des Cinq Martyrs du Lyc√©e Buffon, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Very nice and friendly personal, food was good (I would say average). WiFi connection is also available. I had a good time!', 'Great place to have a quick lunch, always ready for the pause d√©jeuner, good quality and great variety', 'excellent !', 'Ashamed ! This establishment uses the anti-Waste TGTG app to increase its turnover and not fight against Waste with baskets that have nothing to do with the amounts advanced!', "Pleasant atmosphere despite peak hours. FAST and friendly service despite peak hours where it's overflowing. Lots of choice in desserts and starters, the dishes are delicious and fresh. I recommend!"]

['A bit pricey, minimal selection of goods.', 'The supermarket that helps me out after my sports sessions when I forgot to shop for dinner or breakfast
You can find the essentials there, at reasonable prices I think for a small supermarket.
Very kind and courageous staff to work until 10 p.m. every day
I recommend!!
See you soon üëãüèª', 'We are often late in the mornings because of the supply truck from the intersection which has no problem blocking the entire street. It would be wise to do this at night or outside peak hours... Think about people who work.', 'Very expensive and very small area so really limited choice. Many affordable products have been replaced by very expensive products. Staff not always friendly.', 'We lived opposite this small intersection and would like to particularly thank one of the managers whose name we have forgotten (who has a house in Agadir..). Thank you again for the good humor and all the little services provided! Zo√© and Simon (owners of the beige Citro√´n C3). Great shop!']

['Useful staff, speaks English. Great choice of goods.', "Seemed to start well. Now seeming to revert to type. Frequently out of stock. When people say it's cheap, you need to check price per Kg. Store card is much worse than Auchan in terms of benefits. In fact, I can't see any benefit...I was pleased to see an Intermarche in the area, but I guess it's a franchise so 100% depends on franchisee. Time will tell", 'Excellent supermarket in the Montparnasse area. The wide assortment, excellent selection of French wines, freshly pressed juices, grilled chicken and regular promotions make this my daily grocery shopping. The personnel is also pretty friendly and helpful.', 'Prices always wrong, and strangely always to the detriment of the customer', 'I loved it. Nice and affordable clothes.']

['I came on a school trip, had a lot of fun. Easily accessible, but off main roads. I thought there were lots of options for food and drink, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. However, my vegetarian friend said that they felt that the meals were not as good at catering for their needs as for mine. However, the non vegetarian food was pretty good. The staff were very friendly, and spoke a variety of languages. Rooms accessible by front stairs, back stairs, and lifts. Altogether a good review though, I had an amazing time there.', 'I enjoyed my stay at this hostel. You can put your luggage in the luggage room before the check-in time. They have spacious shared spaces for just chilling or gathering with the group. Also, they have the iconic Charlyüêà', 'The best hotel and company experience I had was at FIAP. At the reception, they gave me the best help and attention. Laura was excellent and offered great service, solving some questions I had. Honestly, I felt super comfortable with her, and the attention she gave me, and it feels good to be welcomed as a customer. I would definitely come back again.', 'The front desk staff was always attentive and friendly like Santiago. There is a very cute cat at the reception.\nThe bed was ok but a bit cold the room, the bathroom was clean and with towels there is no soap in the room but you have to always ask at the reception. If you‚Äôre going out all day to see the city, this is a great option. You have 2 metro stations 4 and 6 nearby. It comes with breakfast included, which is basic and contains the essentials.', "Came here with 33 others as a college trip and would never recommend coming back. The receptionist was nice at least, but the caterers were awfully demanding and pushy, just trying to move you on quicker. A lack of food at breakfast and barely any taste, and I even skipped breakfast twice because of this. Dinner was handed to me raw and the microwave barely cooked it. The rooms are basic but comfortable and I slept quite well in my bed, however the bathroom door wouldn't lock and eventually wouldn't close. This was a problem as I was sharing a room with 6 others. The bathrooms provided bathtowels but no hand-wash, let alone hand-dryers. There are showers but no necessities provided - no shampoo, conditioner, bodywash, etc. The only reason I can give 2 stars instead of 1 is because the rooms were comfortable. Everything else is a total waste. Please sort it out."]

['This was my favorite restaurant I visited while in Paris and I‚Äôve been to Paris now 3 different times. The ambiance was stunning. I loved the florals, the lighting and the piano player. The food was delicious and the cocktails were so carefully crafted. The cocktail list was also very extensive. Our server was so kind enough to get us a seat in the bar after our meal, directly in front of the piano. I‚Äôd come back in a heartbeat. Go here for a romantic date night!', 'The establishment was exceptional.  Our server provided attentive and engaging service, enhancing our dining experience with his helpful wine recommendations and witty conversation.  All dishes were delicious, and the ambiance, complemented by live piano music, created a perfect atmosphere for our inaugural Parisian dinner.  We highly recommend this restaurant.', 'We visited this restaurant to follow in the footsteps of the legendary James Joyce, the author of the fantastic piece of literature, Ulysses. The restaurant didn‚Äôt disappoint, and the food and selections were excellent for a Paris restaurant. Once again, this restaurant is off the traditional tourist trail, so it is worth a visit.', 'Hemingway steak was excellent.  The wild boar was disappointing: very little meat, mostly cabbage, unable to detect fau gras.\nThe "pear" dessert was out if this world.\nExcellent service and waiter spoke excellent English.', 'I had a memorable experience at La Closerie des Lilas. Many dishes were prepared tableside, adding a special touch to the meal, and everything was delicious. The atmosphere was lively and festive, just what my family was looking for. I will definitely revisit this restaurant on my next trip to Paris.']

Nom: Caf√© Oz The Australian Bar Denfert
Reviews: ['Really liked the atmosphere here. You can enjoy an Australian beer while watching a live sport. Multiple bathrooms. Great location. Prices are moderate (for Paris)! Staff is nice. üëçüèºüç∫üá¶üá∫\n\nTip: fries with cheddar cheese and fried onion was so delicious!', 'Looks like a good watering hole for when you‚Äôre in Montparnasse, the staff tend to amuse themselves when it‚Äôs slow but when there‚Äôs work to be done their on the ball. Food was good and reasonably priced as with the beers. Music was not too loud for a afternoon session. Most importantly it‚Äôs air-conditioned and comfortable as it is 38¬∞ outside.', "I came here during a bar crawl, it was the last stop for the night and oh am I glad it was! Music was great from the time we walked in until the time we left. The drinks were amazing! The staff was so nice! There was indoor and outdoor seating and bars, this place went on and on.  Its very laid back in some spots so if you don't want to be in the big crowd but listen to the music, there are sections in here to enjoy the atmosphere. This place is so much fun!!", "Okay let's make it Clear... Caf√© Oz Paris is not a restaurant at all. You can get some snack, fries, C.Wings but it's a Club where you drink and dance, dance and till dawn. Lovely ambiance mostly locals young student, I enjoyed music and talked with lovely parisian girls The point I really liked is the terrace at the entrance and the outdoor space where you can smoke and talk... Will go back 4Sure üòä", 'Me and my husband went to Cafe Oz Denfret to grab some drinks and burgers. Biggest mistake !! Turns out the burger was so bad quality that my husband got food poisoning to an extent where we had to go to emergency room (i didn‚Äôt end up eating my burger cos it tasted bad). Please serve atleast acceptable quality food that doesn‚Äôt kill people !']

Nom: Les Fondus de la Raclette Paris 14eme - Montparnasse
Reviews:
['Dry beef and fondue were nice. They can‚Äôt be bad. Glasses could be cleaner. Bread in Onion Soup and brought by fondue only upon request was old and already hard.

In Korea, barbecue restaurants offer you big plastic bags to put your coats in so they don‚Äôt absorb the smell. That‚Äôs not common in France. So your coat is going to smell like French cheese for a while.

They offer you to pay a service charge on payment terminal. That is a sly tactic. You feel bad when choosing none or any amount less than 10% despite you are not fully satisfied. Indeed, service charge is already included as you would see on their menu. Other cafes and restaurants I have been to in Paris are skipping this screen before handing the terminal to me for me entering my card password. Does this place really need that?', 'We had a great time. As Americans and non French speakers the staff really helped us navigate the menu and different styles of food options. They told us when we ordered ‚Äútoo much‚Äù food and that honesty was helpful and appreciated because we had a party of 7.

This meal was a highlight of our visit to Paris and I would completely recommend to all.', 'Besides the table was shared with another stranger couple (we wanted to be more intimate), the food was sublime. The onion soup (starter) is mandatory, you got to try it! Definitely recommended!', "My second visit to this fondue restaurant. Their fondue with mushrooms was delicious, but I think more mushroom could be added. It comes with salad and breads for dipping into the fondue. I recommend booking ahead of time because it's packed after 7 p.m. it's a small restaurant and the staff are friendly.", 'We went with a friend for dinner, during our stay in Paris, and we were really happy with the food. Next time we are in the area, we will definitely come back. It is definitely worth making a reservation, because every day the place is always full of people and delicious food.']

['Food :good
Service: good
Typical french food, good service, only issue is that they don‚Äôt have big seating despite saying they have it. We reserved for 15 people dinner but we had to squeeze chairs to make space for our colleagues and almost felt like we were sitting in the passage. Place is small.

But food was good, will recommend for smaller group', 'After watching Olympics games, there were only very few places with kitchen open at 11Pm. So Chez Papa came handy, offering a long list of options. In this perspective, it is very tourist-friendly.
Heard it is a famous local French fast food chain. And indeed French it turned out to be. My favorite part is they served roasted potatoes over lettuce alongside a foie gras burger, lol. Yeah why do we need fried chips to add more feeling of guilt? Let the lettuce balances the scale.
Back to the food. You could go heavy or light. My friend‚Äôs pappadelle with foie gras was decent, not over greasy. My wife orders a salad bowl and it was served warm, with cooked beans and eggs.
Maybe not an impressive gourmet spot, but it saves the tourists‚Äô kitchen work.', 'This was our first bistro in Paris. We were jetlagged and hungry. Boy did it hit the spot. We had the escargot served Papa style de shelled and in a cream sauce, the formule (set menu for entree, dessert and coffee)

Everything was delicious needless to say.

Pictures from left to right :
Escargot Papa and chicken and cheese Au gratin. This was more than enough for 2. The apple tart however had cold spots and was not thoroughly warmed all the way through.', 'The food was good but we were given dirty cups so i must minus the service star. Also they dont speak english much, an unfortunate for sll the travelers. The atmosphere is brilliant with the weather and the wind and i do not have anything to complain about. The portion is HUGE so be aware guys. Also try the steak and the Foie Gras, it id expensive but it is worth every bite. By the way every dishes have potatoes as side dishes‚Ä¶', 'Delicious and authentic French food, abundant portions, very friendly personnel. Pleasant atmosphere. Tasty cassoulet, perfect for colder autumn days!']

['Stopped here for lunch. Nice outdoor seating, was totally impressed with the cheese and meat board, the falafel was incredible and the veggie burger had great flavor and sides.\n\nWould definitely return.', "We were welcomed in right away and decided to have breakfast instead of waiting the 30 minutes until lunch started(12:00). We ordered a special at ‚Ç¨14.50(I believe the name was Le Sal√©) and we got a croissant, half of a baguette split and buttered with jam on the side, ham & cheese omelet with a small salad on the side, one hot drink(I got an espresso) and a freshly squeezed orange juice. It was all absolute perfection. We enjoyed every bite and barely left a crumb on the plate. It was such a great value, and so I'm glad we happened upon it. Merci!", 'Very welcoming and very attentive staff. Convenient location just in front of the Saint-Jacques metro stop and few steps away from Denfert-Rochereau. We stopped for a lunch and were very satisfied with our choice!', 'Amazing place. Ate here at least 10 times and was always super happy. The chicken salad is a legend. Lovely restaurant, wish them success and all the best! Highly recommend ‚ò∫Ô∏è', 'Decent option in the south of Paris if you are looking for a taste of french brasserie food. The settings is nicely set and the restaurant is overall very clean. The welcome was cordial, and the apt has to offer many indoor and outdoor seatings. Daily specials as well as menu combo are suggested. Besides the tasty food (well seasoned and great choice in the flavors. The "caf√© gourmand" was a great end to our meal), we would have like a better service: a smile or two would have been nice, not begging for more breads or water refill is always nice.']

["Had a great start to the evening with friends. Cocktails are great and the place is understated. The staff are welcoming and friendly.  Didn't try the food this time, will definitely return for more cocktails üçπüç∏", 'Very expensive cocktails... unfortunately the cocktail was not good. Finally a non alcoholic cocktail cost about 10 ‚Ç¨. A normal cocktail was about 14 ‚Ç¨... One star just for the nice ambiance.', "Really relaxed and enjoyable evening. Great margarita, cheese and wine. Prompt, friendly service. Made for a really lovely evening. I'd definitely go back.", 'Excellent establishment.
A 1930s bar with a great bar and superbe jazz music.
A definite place for a good time.
Live music on some evenings in a great setting.', 'I recently discovered this cocktail bar that instantly transported me to the glamour of the 1920s. This hidden gem is a true delight for those seeking a taste of vintage charm.

Upon entering, the ambiance sweeps you off your feet.

The cocktail menu is a trip through time, offering classics like Old Fashioneds and modern twists.']

Adresse: 1 Bis Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Food was actually really good. Vibe was great and they had an unbelievable magician (Paul) just going around at each table. He did some mind blowing tricks and was very entertaining while we waited for our food. Right across from the Catacombs. AMAZING.', 'Its a very nice restaurant at the corner of the street and the view is very nice. The staff was very helpful.  We had cheeseburger and steak hach√© and liked them but it would a little bit nicer if they seasoned the meat better.', "The best cafe i have ever been to. 3.7 that's such a huge lie, absolute bullsh*t. It deserves 4,5 stars at worst. I ate the tacos, they served 3 per portion. They said the tacos were small, they were a normal size and absolutely deliciuos, I could have ate 9.", 'We have ordered alcohol drinks and desserts. There was  no alcohol taste in our drinks. The service was very slow. The taste of the dessert was normal.', 'Went here before visiting the catacombs. The ambiance of the restaurant was noce and the staff was very friendly. The prices were fair and the service was very fast. I had a chicken fajitas salad and it was very good, I was so satisfied with my choice. My friend has the chicken nuggets and they were very tasty as well. We left nothing in our plates! Afterwards, we ordered a brownie and it was sweet, decadent and delicious!']

Adresse: 5, Denfert, Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
['This McDonald‚Äôs was probably one of the most awkward and unwelcoming ones I‚Äôve ever visited. The atmosphere was far from friendly, and the overall vibe was disappointing.

The staff seemed overwhelmed, with only a few people visible in the kitchen trying to handle everything by themselves. They didn‚Äôt speak English, which isn‚Äôt unusual in Paris, but there wasn‚Äôt much effort to bridge the communication gap either, which made the experience feel less accommodating.

On top of that, there was a 50-cent fee to use the restroom, which added to the sense that this location wasn‚Äôt very guest-friendly. As for the food, it was standard McDonald‚Äôs fare ‚Äì nothing to complain about, but also nothing to elevate the experience.', 'Clean, affordable, and cheap like in every place in the world ( I guess).

Restrooms 0.50 cents

Limpio,  r√°pido,  gentil, amable, simp√°tica cajera.

0.50 centavos', "This Paris McDonald's was a big surprise! My wife had the McChicken and loved it! I ordered an egg McMuffin and Fanta for ‚Ç¨4.50 and loved it too! It was much better than the American restaurants I've eaten at. I have eaten at A LOT of American McDonald's, too! The American restaurants are just fine too, I'm not trying to say they are bad! The quality of the ingredients at the Paris location was top notch! I highly recommend it if you are in need of a quick affordable meal!", 'Horribly dry burger with a frankly pathetic amount of bacon or veggies.
The bun was also strange.

Macaroons are wonderful in terms of flavour but a bit soggy and cracked
Very nice chicken wrap.

The flavoured water is also nice.

Just a normal McDonalds I suppose', 'Strange, unpleasant vibe inside and outside, you need to pay for toilets. Staff seems ok']

Adresse: Al√©sia, 71 Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
["A degraded restaurant. You have to wait 25 minutes for a medium chicken and goose McFirst to arrive. The night manager with chewing gum in her mouth and not in charge of the restaurant at all. Only her screams were heard and she did not move from her seat to help the team. What kind of fast food team are they?
The food was cold and I had ordered an ice cola but it came warm. It's hard to talk to the manager for a bathroom token because I don't know English or any language other than French, and when you get what you see, the bathroom is dirty.", "The hotel we stayed in was near this McDonald's so it was one of the spots we'd go to for meals. It's quite nice and the staff were friendly.", "Didn't get what i ordered. Quite long time to wait. If you don't speak french you have no idea which number tjey are calling out. Food looked like it was lying there for a couple of hours.", 'Food quantity getting worst and worst(mainly breakfast) the egg was gray edges, means its rather old or over cooked.
The Place was dirty and disgusting.
Order machines are broken and not offering table service, even the software always ask for a card number (you have to give any number to continue the order)', 'I love coming here and enjoying good food with my friends. I love that there is no loud music bothering us and that there is a lot of free place. The service is good and fast. I recommend!']

["A fresh, delicious meal in the perfect setting. Oysters, moules frites and a cold crisp chardonnay, set on a bustling market street, but enclosed enough that you don't feel too observed. As it is also a seafood market stall, the seafood is the freshest you could possibly get.\nDelicious, thank you!", 'Plenty of Sea food choices but get ready for the long line of the clients', 'LOOKS SENSATIONAL ! This seafood shop was very close to our apartment on Rue Daguerre, Paris. Everything looked the best of quality !', "This place is amazing!! Looked at a million Huitre places and I've been to many. This place had the freshest oysters, service was impecable. I'm surprised at why their rating is so low. I  went to two other oyster better rated places and nothing to do with this site. Freshest oysters, beautiful decor, would go back a million times. This place is homey and they make you feel right at home, wait DID I MENTION AN AMAZINGLY FAIR PRICE FOR OYSTERS!?!", "Friendly staff, usually I call in to get the fish prepared and pick it up later on. Good quality products, I've tested cod and salmon so far. Looking forward for my next order."]

['A classy Lebanese restaurant with a huge amount of tasty foods. We took a lunch course for 39euros per person. The main dish was daily fish.', 'Very good Lebanese food. I am super picky on the fatouch and humus and this time it exceeded my expectations. Perfect if you wish to give foreigners a taste of real lebanese cuisine', 'I genuinely give this place a 5/5! The food was absolutely incredible, transporting me to the charm of an old, antique Lebanese restaurant. It truly gave me a sense and taste of home. Every dish was exceptional. We were a group of 7, and we all agreed that this was some of the best food we‚Äôve ever tasted. A remarkable experience overall!', 'Excellent place to experience the authentic Lebanese cuisine. All dishes were very delicious (especially the Asanabel Humus, Bed Ghanam (not for the faint-hearted), Sujuk, Habra nayyeh, lamb Lsanat, cheese rakakat, arayes kafta and mix grill platter). Friendly staff. Always recommended to be taken with a glass of Arak.', 'You will never find a better Arabic food (mshawy), Arabic dessert ( halawet aljubn), friendly and very gentle professional OWNER like in Assanabel!

Even tourist will come back again for the food.
Highly recommended and it was a pleasure and great experience being there.']

["The experience obtained in this establishment on a very cool and rainy Paris evening warmed my soul despite our on-site cold beer consumption. The wait staff was very patient to take our order whilst our party of two was perusing the VERY extensive beverage selection offered. A heaping serving of curried mussels and another cooked in beer, with a shared side of salad and frites, were more than enough to fill our stomachs. However, an apple crumble with fresh cream accompanied by the Barman's Rhum found their way to our table and made for a great ending to a terrific evening. Pricing was very reasonable. Don't hesitate to go here!", 'While we arrived in Paris, it was quite late evening. So we took a walk to look for a restaurant for our dinner.

We found this one. Sitting and eating  outside.unfortunately the atmosphere wasn‚Äôt that great. However they had some good dish. I love their spicy chicken very much though.', 'Excellent selection of Belgian beer and good food!', 'We were looking for mussels and beer. And found it here. A la cr√®me and Roquefort were pretty good üëå‚ò∫Ô∏è
And the staff is very friendly.
Also prices are relatively low (to what you can usually pay in other places )
Selection and of beer is really good !!!

That said I highly recommend this place!', 'We used one of the large tables outside to enjoy what is likely one of the best selection of Belgian beer in Paris, at a reasonable price. 10+ on tap, 100+ bottles (including favorites such as Chimay, Delirium, La trappe, Westmalle, etc.).

Happy hour 3pm-12am (!): 6 EUR a pint (instead of 8.5).

Service wasn‚Äôt very attentive - we had to walk inside to call the waiter‚Äôs attention, for each order. So this can‚Äôt be 5*‚Ä¶

I‚Äôll be back!']

Adresse: 4 Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
['10/20/2024

Solid breakfast, the orange juice was fresh and pulpy. I enjoyed my cheese omelette too. The service was good but maybe a little rushed, but still very good. The price was right too, 12‚Ç¨ for a lot of food', 'I just had their duck confetti and it was overcooked and simply bad. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend ordering main course. Everyone around me was ordering drinks so I would recommend doing the same. Not the place to have French cuisine.
The service was nice like others mentioned. Got a table quickly and the servers were nice and quick.', 'Not using a real espresso machine, which I didn't notice until I tasted the "flat white" I was brought and it had no flavor. The omelette tasted of nothing and was so full of cheese I almost gagged while chewing it. The only good thing was the croissants, which they brought in from the bakery next door... It's maybe fine as a bar, but better skip at breakfast time.', 'Nice place in the neighborhood, best for happy hours , friendly server, and good appetizers .
YOU MUST TRY IT.', "Absolutely fantastic beef bourguignon  casserole.  Best I've ever had. The fillet steak my Mrs got was amazing too. Lovely staff and the coffee milkshake is to die for."]

['A busy restaurant convenient got the metro; very good home cooked Lebanese food, and good menu fixe midi @ 17‚Ç¨. Recommended.', "Great find in Paris for a Lebanese treat next to the Catacombes. Very nice and helpful owner. The serving staff is not existing and that's the sad point: the owner by herself has to seat, serve and clean while the staff was just looking ...
Other than that great food, tasty and reasonable quantity. A bit spicy but totally tolerable, make sure to ask the owner.", 'I came across Baladna very randomly, as I was looking for a place to eat on a very rainy day in Paris. Baladna is not a huge place but it feels very homey and cozy. We were directly greeted by the waitress who sat us down and gave us the menu.

We ordered the plat du jour, which came with a choice of entr√©e: Hommos, Salade Orientale, Taboul√©, Laban Concombre ou Foul Moudamas. For the main plate, I got Ailes de poulet. As a Lebanese person, I was expecting it to look more like a plate of ¬´djej bel saniyye¬ª but it was still very good despite not being what I expected.

The dessert was probably the best part, I got the Mhalabiyye and it was incredible.

For 14.90euros, I think it was definitely worth it. I would love to go back and try the dinner menu some other time!', "It's a small shop and the staff are patient and friendly. There are many kinds of salads and sauces, and the overall taste is sour.
*newspaper eat", 'Nice place and very friendly team. Food is fresh and tasty. Service is fast and price are cheap... I recommend!']

["Visited this place on September 18th, I'm a chocolate fan and I love the deep flavor of their chocolate gelato.", "The ice cream is just delicious. The line was big but it didn't take too long. The price for the classic cup is 5‚Ç¨. You can choose many flavors as you want.", 'The staff were very pleasant, there was no wait but that might be because it was raining. I loved the care that she took creating my rose. And of course the gelato was delicious.', 'One of the girls who works here with the dark complexion is nasty and not helpful in any matter towards the visiting tourists. Would not want to return to this location just to avoid ever dealing with such an unpleasant girl.', 'Very delicious Gelato . I gotten the petite Cone with coffee and it came with a lot  of ice cream and worth the money  . I also tried the macarons and while they were delicious the Gelato was so much better']

['This place is cozy & little but they serve huge portions of sauerkraut! If you appreciate Alsacien food, you will love Au Bretzel. My husband and I had our dinner here. We were greeted by a very friendly gentleman who is a tad comical! We spent over 3 hours here. It was a dining experience. üòä', "Simply luv it.
I was looking for a place where I could  taste a traditional Alsacien Choucroute. Several restaurants came  out but most of them were those large pricey and noisy tourist factories but one, this one. Tasty and fresh dishes, efficient friendly service in a weinstube like decor, I was agreably impressed and we really enjoyed our diner. A Choucroute is around ‚Ç¨25 for a large portion (you'd better be ravenous) but I'd also recommend the creamy flammekushe sp√©ciale ‚Ç¨12. Booking is highly recommended.", 'Very good service, good food (Alsatian- i would call it German). The owner is very friendly and made us feel welcome. The tarte is very popular and a good deal. Its basically a pizza with a pastry crust- super light and flaky.', 'Delicious Alsacien food. The gentleman who works there makes it home for the visitors. His charming personality is reflected everywhere: you will see customers serving themselves, joking with him and overall spending good time.
If you happen to be in Paris and looking for Alsacien food in a home-like environment, Au Bretzel is where you should go.', 'Love the service!! The owner explained everything about making the best choucroute.
Great food and great wine. This is the place to go for authentic choucroute. Not fancy just good food that is what it is all about.']

['Great traditional high end seafood. For our meal, I think they forgot our main courses (no apologies either) until we reminded them, so it took a while longer and ended up being a 2.5 hour dinner. Otherwise service was very friendly and good.', 'Unfortunately, the date we went the lunch menu just wasn‚Äôt up to expectation, especially with the price tag and the reputation It comes with. The coffee and tea machine was also so broken, so I didn‚Äôt know how to finish my dessert without my coffee.', 'The surprise ‚Äúnot so surprising‚Äù of our trip. I read and heard a lot of good things about Le Duc, but we weren‚Äôt expecting it to be that good. Being big seafood lovers we are always looking out for the best spots and this is definitely among them. From the moment we walked in we were treated extremely well. The clams with wasabi and the langoustine tartar were out of this world. The sole blew my mind, about perfection, all paired with some great champagne. We even got our Michelin guide signed by the owner, you guys rock! We will come back over and over again', 'Great seafood selection, small menu but great selection. Wine was good too!', 'Both the taste and the freshness are beyond amazing. Would give 10 stars if I could ‚ù§Ô∏è']

['Decent food with quick service. I am not sure about authenticity. But the shrimp in rice coating is worth trying. The steamed rice roll is tasty. Not too sure about the stir fried beef, which was lack of wok air. In general a good place for budget option.', 'The first time i came here with my friends and I love this place so much. Its not only I‚Äôm Vietnamese so i like this food, but also this restaurant have the dishes are exactly to northern Vietnamese cuisine and very delicious in both appearance and taste. I really recommend you guys try PHO and milk coffee in here. Btw I also like the restaurant atmosphere make me feel warm and comfortable and very clean with best service. Haha unrelated but the owner is very lovely and beautiful she gave us free coffee \U0001faf6üáªüá≥', 'I like Pho soup, which makes me remember in my hometown. Also the pork is greatüòçüòçüòç . Atmosphere is warmly and clean üòôüòô', 'Excellent and affordable little Vietnamese restaurant, the menu has some chef‚Äôs specials as well as a variety of classic Vietnamese dishes around 15‚Ç¨. The restaurant has vegetarian and non-vegetarian options.', 'A charming little restaurant that offers generous portions, perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of salt. Although one of our three dishes was slightly cold, the food arrived incredibly fast, and the atmosphere was delightful.\nI highly recommend visiting if you‚Äôre in the area!']

['After we sit for a while the Madame came and asked directly what we‚Äôre going to order without giving us a menu(this never ever happened during my 2 years in Paris), and when we asked for a menu, she brought us a paper of 2/3 cocktails (absolutely just an ad paper, not the real menu, because I saw the menu outside), and after we asked for beers, she didn‚Äôt ask for the size or brand of the beers, and bringing directly the largest portion and didn‚Äôt inform any brand. The worst service I ever got in Paris', "This place looks and feels fantastic, it's worth checking out for the aesthetics alone.

Waiters are busy and in a hurry, but I have never received my food this quickly before. They were faster than the usual McDonald's.

The meat I got was very chewy, but tasted great. The creme brulee was fantastic.", "Very disappointing: unfortunately not worth the price you pay.
Despite booking early, despite asking several times, we were put in a room in the far corner and on patio furniture. Terrace furniture. The food was also unfortunately only so-so. Really: I strongly advise against a visit. It's not worth the money (especially as some of the prices on site were higher than on the same menu online on New Year's Eve) and it's not even worth one star.", 'The food was amazing that it made me visit there with my family for 3 straight nights! Magnifique!', "Food is good and service is friendly, even entertaining. Beware you cannot get happy hour prices on drinks if you order dinner, so either just go for drinks or settle up before ordering dinner (this is not noted anywhere). Check your bill, they are busy and we were double charged for coffees that were on a formule. Food is very good (especially seafood), but don't ne shy about asking for a salt shaker."]

['We just stumbled on this restaurant while searching for a dinner place in Montparnasse area. My husband and I have never had Creole food before so we were very keen to try. We asked the server regarding recommendations and we got what he recommended - the whole fish and the goat stew dishes. They were both very delicious. They tasted authentic and flavourful. The facility was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The prices are also very reasonable / affordable. I would recommend this restaurant for anyone who wants to try something different while staying in Paris.', 'This spot caught our attention as we were strolling along the Montparnasse Blvd. We walked in and were immediately seated. Appetizer was good. We ordered the crab cakes and enjoyed them. For the main entree I ordered the steak and my wife the curry goat. Surprisingly, my steak had no flavor. I couldn‚Äôt even taste the salt or pepper. May have been my worse meal in Paris. My wife thought the curry goat was ok.', 'A very good discovery!
I highly recommend this place!
We took the ‚ÄúRougail Saucisse‚Äù and the ‚ÄúColombo de cabri‚Äù. The Samousa are also great.
The staff are friendly and welcoming.', 'in central paris there's few places where you can eat well for a reasonable price. this is one of those rare places.
have some rum too!
its all good!
we reserved at "thefork" and we got a discount for it.
we particularly liked the plantain bananas
you can start with a mixed platter for two persons.', 'This place was amazing! We were attracted to it by the happy hour menu but stayed for the food! We love creole/caribbean food, so this was a pleasant find! We ordered the codfish fritters (accras de morue) and the stuffed crab (crabe farci). For the mains, we had the goat stew (Columbo de Cabri), king prawns stew (Carry de Gambas), and the creole sausage specialty. We especially enjoyed the prawns and goat. Highly recommend this place if you enjoy this type of food. Oh and get the hot sauce! üî•']

Adresse: 73 Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
