['I found this place by chance. It was a great surprise. I didn‚Äôt have tickets, so I went to the bar in the upper floor. It has a superb art dec√≥ decoration.

I loved it! The staff is super attentive and nice and the drinks are amazing.
I sat at a table in front of the window and the view was gorgeous.
I strongly recommend the Terrine Campaigne! For the ‚Äúgrignotage‚Äù (the French way of saying small bites) that is perfect. And the Gin&Tonic was superb.

The toilettes were impecables.', "Beautiful theater, great sound and projection, but starting to show some age and wear. Popcorn isn't made fresh onsite, definitely not worth the price!", 'Great cinema, perfect screen (8), great sound, very good seats and nonissue with people blocking your view. A real big screen environment so highly recommended. Well worth going to and lucky they do lots in VO.', "Good number of screens and the screen Halls are well maintained.. the staff are friendly and helpful. Food options are more suited for kids as they have candies and crisps every direction you turn (not complaining.. just that the shows are scheduled such that it's during lunch or dinner and it would be nice to have some sandwich options. The path√® in ivry-sur-seine had them). The online booking system is easy and the offers on prices are good too. There is Dolby ATMOS feature in the screens here. Overall, you can expect a good movie experience.", 'Came here on a Sunday to watch Dune 2 and had a great time. The ticket for a student was 12‚Ç¨, which I thought was expensive, but then I remembered I‚Äôm in Paris on a Sunday. Snacks were the same price as any other cinema in Paris, 8‚Ç¨ for a medium popcorn. Cinema room was very clean, with sofas which I thought was nice, and sound wasn‚Äôt too loud. I will come back.']

['Good price clean good stuff good air conditioner good location good', 'Their scale is literally scam - i bought a self composed  salad and they add grams to it - i was surprised i Paid so much because it wasn‚Äôt heavy at all - I went to nexdoor veggie store and weight my salad that was 50 grams less than what they charged me for üò≥ SCAM It‚Äôs not about my 80‚Ç¨cents but if they do it on a mass scale they profit from regular customers On a big scale', 'I was short about 30 cents in coins and the owner/worker gave me change to help make up for my purchase that was less than 5 euros. Very nice!', 'Every person that works in that store was very helpful and even friendly.', "It's next to me during my stay in Paris.\nPeople worked there were friendly, rational, open-minded and helpful."]

["Excellent!!
The menu consists of all the standards but prepared and presented very well.  The service was flawless, with a sharp sense of humor :)  We had pleasant conversations with other nearby diners who were each pushing their favorite menu items!  The wines were excellent as well.

Will definitely go back the next time we're in paris", 'La Rotonde is a true gem for anyone who loves classic French cuisine! The tartar beef was wonderfully seasoned, and the steak was cooked to perfection, full of rich flavor. The oysters were fresh and delicious, but the real star of the meal was the snails‚Äîthe best I‚Äôve ever had, hands down! Each dish was prepared with care and authenticity, making for a memorable dining experience. What truly sets La Rotonde apart, though, is the exceptional service. The staff (Morgan) was the warmest, treating us with genuine hospitality and making sure we felt welcome and taken care of from start to finish. Their passion for great food and top-notch service truly shines through. I highly recommend La Rotonde for a fantastic meal and unforgettable experience!', 'We visited here to have French cuisine, following a recommendation from the travel guide book.

It was a nice restaurant with lovely food.
The location was also good, close to Tour Montparnasse, and the inside atmosphere was elegant.
And the staff were friendly and helpful.

Here was well worth your visit.
We would come here again and recommend you to visit here.', 'Very lively, beautiful view of Eiffel Tower, lots of seating inside and out. Food was very good and prices were reasonable.

Service was great.

Lovely experience!

I was a bit tired of French cuisine and they had delicious Pad Thai!', 'Ambient restaurant decked out in red. Great if you love fish. I tried the French onion soup, cod, scallops and cr√®me br√ªl√©e. Was all nice.

French onion soup had a bit too much cheese. But otherwise, flavourful. All the fish was super nicely done. I think I preferred the scallops, though!

Cr√®me br√ªl√©e was good, but I think gelato or Mille Feuille would be a better dessert pick.']

['Yes! Eat here! Good food and wonderful service. She was so kind. Our best experience this week in Paris.', 'Excellent service and food.

We got Caesar Salads and, unlike everyone else‚Äôs we had tried while visiting Paris, the chicken was grilled and warm when served, which was what we expect.  What we‚Äôve seen typically is crispy chicken served cold.  Harmony Cafe‚Äôs lettuce was fresh and green.   The sauce was also very good.

They offer a ‚ÄúWine of the Moment‚Äù for a very reasonable price.   We bought a bottle, and it was served in a bottle, and was very good.

Also, there is a variety of seating that includes some very comfortable chairs inside.  Ambiance very nice.  We look forward to our next visit.', 'Great experience - we were unexpectedly in the area due to a family member being ambulanced to the nearby hospital. The waitstaff were very kind and friendly, and were very patient with our limited French and our special dietary requests for the kids (son has Tree Nut allergies - see specific dietary restrictions comments). Dining area was fun and casual (be prepared for tobacco smoke in the outdoor area). Food came relatively quickly and tasted great. When we left, we unknowingly left a bag at our table while we walked around shops, biding time while waiting for the hospitalized family member. Around 30 minutes later, we were walking by the Caf√© back to the hospital and the waitstaff saw us, called out to us, and hurriedly brought our forgotten bag to us. They were so sweet and kind - definitely a positive dining experience that sticks out from my trip to Paris!', 'Really good fish and steak. Brilliant service and chill environment. Definitely deserve a dinner here.', 'Food was ok, but we had to ask for the receipt multiple times and ended up having to go inside to pay.']

["Excellent Excellent Excellent is what I said to our waiter! The location, the friendly greeting from the manager, sitting outside, our friendly and efficient waiter. My wife & I ordered the Sole fish and the John Dory fish plates. White wine along with sparkling water. Tarter Tatin & Mousse de Chocolat was our dessert and a after coffee to relax. Everything was well prepared and presented nicely! We cannot say enough how pleased we were. It's some 30 meters off the main Boulevard but well worth a try! 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è", 'Very quaint French restaurant with EXCEPTIONAL food. The monkfish is one of the, if not the best, fish main courses I‚Äôve ever had. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre looking for French cuisine.', 'This was recommended to us from a tour guide living in Paris - she was not wrong.  We were seated quickly by the manager who greeted us and then quickly switched to English.  We went with the calamari for starter, the scallops and the shrimp risotto for mains, and tatin and baba for dessert.  The calamari was great - served on large pieces and cooked to perfection.  The scallops were also amazing, cooked perfectly with a sauce that was absolutely delectable.  The risotto was outstanding but the shrimp was overdone - Aussie critique.  The tatin was also beautiful, covered in almond slices.  The baba was a beautiful sponge cake stewing in a sweet rum sauce that was intoxicating.  The service was amazing throughout the meal.  Excellent meal - highly recommend.', "From the point of view of an American - this place was top notch. The food was excellent, and the waiter was able to explain their French only chalkboard menu in English to me, along with providing recommendations when I couldn't decide. I was so pleased with this meal and that it was my last before leaving Paris, great last impression!", 'Okay, seriously, Le Bistrot du D√¥me? It's my new happy place. I went there, and OMG, the "encornets" (calamari) stole the show. Tender, juicy, and just a burst of flavors.

I also had The Sole, which was so fresh and every bite was delicious. For dessert, the Mille Feuille‚Äîit was a sweet indulgence that wrapped up the evening on a perfect note.

The ambiance exudes classic Parisian charm, and the attentive service added to the overall enjoyment. Le Bistrot du D√¥me is a culinary haven, and I highly recommend savoring the encornets along with exploring the diverse menu for a truly unforgettable dining experience. ü¶ëüçΩÔ∏èüëåüá´üá∑']

['I was visiting from NYC and my Parisian friend recommended this place. First, I arrived at the restaurant and I received the warmest most courteous welcome. I felt like a queen. My friends and I were delighted with the staff. The oysters were the best we‚Äôve ever had. I forgot to take pictures of the food but everything we had was delicious. The place is so Parisian and so fancy. Truly enjoyed the dining experience at Le D√¥me.', 'The space is gorgeous. The service was great. The food was very expensive and no better than the usual good French food restaurants. But it was still really fun to dine at one of the classic Montparnasse places. The large sole meuni√®re looked large when he showed it to us from the kitchen but then was a LOT smaller when it came to our table. ü§∑\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏è', "OMG, I'm glad I went here. The restaurant is so nice inside. It's very cozy. The servers were quick to take orders, and the food came out at standard time.     My fish soup was so delightful o lala. üòã  ..Best mashed potatoes I had all here, so fluffy, not heavy yet so delicious.  The fish was prepared perfectly, mouth-watering, really ..I was dancing and rocking in my seat the food was so good lol. üëç üòã . Upscale restaurant excellent food worth the funds.", 'Food was amazing! The blue lobster was really fresh and juicy, the oysters were very umami as well. The beef and foie gras set was a perfect match, super tender and delicious. The napoleon cake dessert was a nice surprise, the pastry was exceptionally well made!', 'I‚Äôve had some good sea-food but this is top tier. The atmosphere of the place is just incredible..adorned by beautiful art-deco furniture and decor. Service was also brilliant, they were very attentive and professional. Anthony Bourdain was certainly right about this place.']

['Had a drink at this bar on the terrace. The bartender was attentive, friendly making small talk and the service was quick. We got some nibbles accompanying our drinks and brought bigger bowls fitting our appetite. Nice view on the terrace watching people walking by.', 'Cosy neighbourhood coffee shop. Friendly owner and staff', "Although we aren't fluent in French, the staff was very welcoming and helpful. Would recommend this place over and over again.", 'Good service, nice food', 'Quick and friendly service']

Adresse: 20 Rue de la Gait√©, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Average bistrot, good but nothing special.', 'I did live this place', 'I was pleasantly surprised. I ate veal. Very tender meat. Very well presented dishes and very kind waitress. On the other hand, it was a little cold in the restaurant. I would happily return.', 'Very warm welcome, the waitresses and waiters are present, responsive without disturbing privacy.
The menu on the slate leaves a wide choice and we were delighted with what we chose.
Excellent value for money ‚Ç¨24 for the evening menu, starter, main course, dessert. Even the bread was good.
Not insignificant little extra; the amenities were clean!
I recommend', 'A good restaurant but not worth the detour to get there.

The service is OK, the dishes are good (but very bland! Having Thai pasta which had no taste was disappointing!) without being exceptional.

The quality/price ratio is acceptable for the neighborhood.

In short: an address that helps more than it seduces, without being to be avoided either.']

Adresse: 3 Rue de la Gait√©, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Visited with family and booked in advance (recommended as it was packed). The space was tidy but accommodating. The service was good though. Unfortunately, I think I was unlucky with my meal, my steak was full of nerves, which was disappointing. The aligot was interesting to try, but not particularly memorable for our family meal.
Overall, it was a good experience to check off the list.', 'Rustic French food in generous serves. Great service and good atmosphere. The French onion soup was disappointing, rare entrec√¥te was good, salads were generous. The mashed potato is served with some theatrical flourish. The desert of the century, a combination of apple pie and cr√®me br√ªl√©e, was good.', 'Busy place (Walk-in may result in long waiting). Lots of seating (in & out). Aligot with Steak was really good (careful when you order WellDone steak, may result over cooking).', "Came here for the steak and aligot. We were seated right away with a street view. Both of us got the entrecote with aligot/fries. There was a lot of aligot but it was really good. Steak was cooked a little too long for a medium but that's okay. Great Parisian experience and would recommend", 'Good and convenient for the railway station, just a few minutes away.
The menu is slightly confusing, so I opted for one of the omelettes, with lardons and potatoes, which arrived quickly and was good.
Save some room for dessert- the chocolate mousse is very good, and absolutely huge!']

["Excellent place to eat, if you're near the Catacombs I highly recommend it. Great service from Bryan - thank you very much!

I had the salmon and it was delicious; moist and flavorful. It came with a great Bearnaise sauce. My friends had the duck and the steak, they both enjoyed them very much.

My table had a red wine (C√¥tes Du Rh√¥ne) which was delicious as well.

Overall, this is the best meal I had in Paris.

Thanks again to Bryan! Your excellent service made a great meal even better.", 'Casual, but mid-scale dining. My food was so yummy, my husband and I came back a second night. Try the duck. Friendly staff. Decent price. My husband ate the rump steak. He loved it. If you want it well done, be sure to say so. Even rare, he loved it.', "I've eaten here several times, everytime has been enjoyable. Always the same server too, he is kind and patient with my lack of French. Be sure to have the Salmon, no matter how its prepared, it is magnificent!!!", 'Very friendly and helpful staff, atmosphere is really good! Really recommend this place for a place to eat out or drink with friends', 'Our waiter Bryan was amazing, the food was superb. If you go the roasted duck is a must!']

['When you ask the boss to have extra cheese in a panini, with extra of course, he responds coldly "NO I DON'T"
Surprising for a sandwich shop...
In short, it doesn't make you want to go further in the experience with this merchant... NEXT', 'Very warm welcome, clean place,
small outdoor terrace, very good salads, the vinaigrette is a treat... Enjoy your meal üôÇ', 'Very friendly place, the owner is a good businessman, the atmosphere is pleasant', 'Good value for money. Great welcome from the team!', 'Fresh and good.']

Adresse: 28 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Jacques, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Excellent service, really nice coffee and breakfast, staff are friendly and helpful. Very convenient location, bus stop and RER right at the corner; Notre dame cathedral is within walking distance. Definitely will come back here in the future.', 'This place is incredibly convenient and serves great coffee. I highly recommend it.', "I used to come here to have delicious cr√™pes and galettes but they stopped making them in summer. The cr√™pes and palette distinguished them from all the other bistrots around. I can't imagine there is not enough demand for them. The Caesar salad was ok. Maybe I will come back in winter.", "REALLY GREAT!\nSuper nice service, warm, friendly--and fast & pro'.\nVery tasty food. Orignal dishes, classic dishes...", 'Excellent !!']

['Small authentic local place.
Menu has some appetizers and only few entrees of the day. But everything was tasty.
We love it more than standard tourist traps.
Very nice owner and waiters, who speak English.
Great value for money.', 'Everything is perfect here, the food is authentic, simple but delicious, the owners offer a lovely service too. I REALLY RECOMMEND!', 'Very old restaurant, in Paris that you can tast real French familial food , Very cheep and delicious. The owner of the  restaurant is a very nice French man and staff are friendly.', "Exceptional experience. It is recommended to try at least once if you are visiting Paris.

The service, the friendliness and the atmosphere are great. Today's menu is a must (the starter and the main dish and the desert as well).

Nice wine selection and good prices both for the food and for the drinks.", 'Wonderful little spot. The terrine and quiche are fabulous and the waiter was very jovial. Make sure you take cash with you as card is not accepted, which is written on the restaurant, too.']

['We‚Äôve had our breakfast here. Small tables but the breakfast(omlette and cheese platter) was so good. I would recommend here for people who look for price and quality balance. Service was adequate and the waiter can speak English.', 'Good food, big portions. We were there for brunch. The weather was gloomy and only a couple of tables were filled. The waitress was helpful and the service was great. My time there was great.', 'Happened to walk by this place and decided to have a seat and get a quick drink.

I got the freshly squeezed orange juice and have no complaints.

My partner got a cappuccino. He was almost finished with it when I noticed his cup had a lipstick stain on it. They served us a dirty cup with lipstick still on it!

In addition, it cost 10,50 euro for these two drinks. Pretty expensive compared to other places we‚Äôve been', 'We had a great lunch at Le Bouquet with probably the best Chips (fries) in France. Excellent meals, well served by friendly staff.
We will certainly be going back to Le Bouquet.', 'The waiter that was working this morning (February 10th) was so extremely rude. He wouldn‚Äôt let us sit inside, we had to sit outside. There was plenty enough room left. If he‚Äôs not the boss I recommend firing him. If he‚Äôs the boss I recommend firing himself. We totally left. Did not stay here. I can see this place is collecting bad reviews, it‚Äôs not for nothing.']

Adresse: 2 Av. du G√©n√©ral Leclerc, 75014 Paris, France
Reviews:
['üá´üá∑ ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS üá´üá∑
I‚Äôve been looking far and wide for a Ratatouille here in Paris and I finally found it here! And it was paired with a delicious Tuna Steak. Cannot describe how scrumptious this meal was and it wasn‚Äôt ridiculously priced (like a lot of the restaurants in the city). Would absolutely recommend this place.', 'My daughter and I have visited Paris every summer for the past three years. She fell in love with the city and this particular area of Paris has been our base each time. Cafe du Rendez-Vous has been on the list of must go places since we discovered it after a visit to The Catacombs. Delicious food with friendly staff and fabulous cappuccino.', 'The is a great looking place sat on the corner near a station however the service was terribly slow with a wait over 5 minutes when it wasn‚Äôt busy

Sadly the food we ordered was bad.  Ordered a chicken burger but got a chicken schnitzel squeezed within a millimetre of its life in a bun that was hard. Fries were cold and wet. Also ordered a Caesar Salad which looked ok but rather than being fresh chicken was also the chicken schnitzel

The Old Fashioned Hot Chocolate was great, different to what you would expect and a nice little bit experience', 'Enjoyed an afternoon coffee waiting for my reservation at the catacombs across the street. Great place to stop in and have a relaxing coffee or afternoon meal.', 'Had the mixed omelette,  orange and coffee option, Definitely worth it very nice']

['Definitely some of the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had! I just wished they would have given a pizza cutter to cut our slices instead of a regular knife, but I understand it‚Äôs a cultural thing. Service was great and fast! Highly recommend!', 'Discovered this gem after a trip to the catacombs. Our family enjoyed a delicious and inexpensive Sunday brunch. Copious amounts of food at a very reasonable price. Service was exceptional. Highly recommend.', 'Very good food, friendly service, the server spoke English.\nThe only downside is that the menu was only in French, so we had to use Google to translate.', 'The food was excellent üëç Our waiter was lovely. We enjoyed people watching and playing cards while enjoying a relaxing delicious meal with even better creme brulee for dessert!', 'For the area‚Äîright next to the catacombs\n‚Äîthis is a very good bet. Very friendly for tourists and no one is being ripped off here. Very good cheese plate, good beer selection and we drank some lovely wine. Better than some other similar options in the area.']

['I was there for a language exchange evening. I had reached there significantly earlier than the beginning of the event.

I had ordered a cheese platter. There was a LOT of cheese on that plate.

The owners are nice people and all in all I had a good evening. I would go again.', 'I acknowledge that this place is a nice in the sense that you can meet from time to time really polyglot people.  But apparently the Polyglot event organiser and barman have a behavior issue.', "Cool bar , they often organise cultural events , the thing that I didn't like that beer prices are really expensive compared to other bars", "I never write reviews unless I've had a really good or a really bad experience, and unfortunately this is the later. This place was racist af and really mean. DO NOT recommend if you are Asian-presenting!!

Ironically I came here for a language exchange and the bar owners were incredibly rude and racist towards me and 2 other Asians - one from Asia and one from France. You want receipts? They were condescending to me and another Asian woman when we tried to order.

But the most obvious was when my friend tried to pull a chair over to another table, and the management were furious! They were shouting in French like, 'no no no! what are you doing? you can't just do what you want, mister!' while legit 1 minute ago they stood by silently without complaint as the 2 white French people (man and a woman) from the same table we were at, pulled up their chairs to another table. Like wow, the obvious change in treatment for the same action just because we were Asian vs white was unbelievable. Terrible hot drink too. All around a bad time, don't let all their little flag garlands make you think they're accepting of everyone. Really disappointing to see this in Paris :(", 'This is one of the best Cafe Places in Paris. Really recommended. You will have a great time, great food and a lovely Paris view.']

['3 years of   regular customers of this shop but today it‚Äôs really disappointed  me and my mom      Staff don‚Äôt know  to Handel  customers  even     He take more money    With us     Even he don‚Äôt give us  our bill at last   Really disappointed', 'Perfect food, great service.', 'Prices are ok but its paris', 'Many shops all over paris', 'Correct']

['Belambra city Hotel Magendie in Paris is an excellent choice for anyone looking for convenience, comfort, and affordability in the heart of the city. The location is perfect, with easy connectivity to all major attractions via metro and bus, making it ideal for sightseeing. The hotel staff is friendly and attentive, always ensuring a smooth and pleasant stay. Rooms are spotless, and the overall cleanliness is impressive. Plus, with metro and bus stops just a short walk away, getting around is a breeze. For the price, the quality and service make this hotel an exceptional value for money. Highly recommended for a memorable Parisian experience!', 'I will back again sooon
Location : very quiet and 2 metro station very close and praisan neighborhood
Room : small and not modern but super clean and the bed is comfortable and very warm also. The bathroom warm
Staff : very very friendly all staff polite and helpful , don‚Äôt hesitate to ask them
Overall if u solo traveller and looking for Reasonable price with Nearby transportation this hotel perfect choice', 'I stayed here in July 2024 and I was honestly a bit worried after reading the reviews (but I booked very late and it was the only reasonably priced option other than some very dated and dusty looking hotels). But it was great, especially seen the price!! The room was small but modern, clean and welcoming, the breakfast was quite abundant and I really liked the position in a quiet neighborhood but still close to the heart of Paris - I could walk to notre dame in half hour. One of the few times when the google review doesn‚Äôt match the experience.', 'Overall: expensive for what it is. You‚Äôre better off finding a much nicer AirBnB even more central in Paris for the same price or spend a bit more to get a MUCH nicer hotel. Otherwise the location was pretty good, 5 minutes from metro and bus. Breakfast buffet was a low ok. The food itself wasn‚Äòt especially good or bad quality but there just wasn‚Äòt much choice. I know a lot of other people give it good reviews on here but I honestly think that‚Äôs because people don‚Äôt know that there are MANY better options for similar pricing out there.

Update: I forgot to write that the LOBBY STANK like molded tuna fish. It was BAD.

The positives:
-Good location

The negatives:
-Cleanliness (our bedsheets and curtains had stains)
-Room size. That is something nobody else talks about it seems but it was a really annoying issue as it made even just opening your suitcase difficult.
-Breakfast choice very small (basically just bread, eggs, cornflakes and a few jams, honey and such) and I expected more for such a relatively high priced hotel‚Ä¶
-Doors for the rooms were super thin, you could hear people in their rooms across the hall talking like they were in your room almost.
-High price for what you get‚Ä¶', "Forced me to pay the room at 1am even though it was paid for by a company that invited me for an interview. Even though I tried to explain the situation, they still made me pay, now who knows how many weeks I'll wait for a refund and the amount of trouble and time they have wasted for me and the company that invited me. Bathroom shower was also half broken."]

['Brilliant place for its creative twist on sushi by elevating the novelty ingredients (mango, brown rice, seaweed) into the classical sushi. There are great sushi with touch of local taste/heritage like the foie gras (goose liver). Haven on earth I must say üòãüòãüòãüç£üç±', "I usually order Planet Sushi Monge through Uber Eats, but since it's on the path home from my son's school, we decided to go inside and have our dinner there.  The sushi is fresh and delicious and Margeaux is an EXCELLENT server and manager.  We enjoy talking to her and she not only talks to me, she also talks to my son and asks him questions.  It almost feels like American service because Margaux is just as warm and friendly as an American!  Planet Sushi is also Kosher from what I have heard from friends.  Thanks Planet Sushi!
HIGHLY recommend : Dragon Roll
Fresh Cheese
Maki Nutella", 'I tried Planet Sushi yesterday... they messed up the order a bit, but the worse was the taste... or lack of taste... tasteless! Even the edamame was not that good! The only thing great was the miso soup. It is overpriced for what you get, not worth it... better supermarket sushi.', 'Food is good. But they ask you to wait outside for takeaways. Even if it‚Äôs raining outside. This was my last time picking up. From now on ordering and not tipping your delivery personnel‚Ä¶ if I am ordering again', 'Overpriced, pictures looked delicious, reality half the size. Service very inflexible and had a memory like Dory. Almost rude. Sushi tasted ok, absolutely nothing you‚Äôll remember..']

Adresse: 66 bis Av. des Gobelins, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['My personal favorite cinema of Paris is located close to the Place d‚ÄôItaly and offers more than 10 screens.

You can see the selection of movies that are running at this cinema (and others) in the application AlloCin√©.

Grab some popcorn a and off to cinema.', "Not a 5 star rating just because of their misleading website claiming handicap access which clearly isn't the case!
How is one supposed to know in advance that the film we want to see is in a hall that is not for handicapped people??
This is very disappointing indeed and had to see my mother struggle down the stairs and then even more stairs up to exit.
I wonder if this is even legal.", 'Professional, courteous staff, lovely clean "selles"... always a pleasure to see the "Big Screen" there. The UGC Unlimited pass a winner for any keen movie goer!', "Good cinema, recently renovated. Some of the halls are a bit too close to the exit and you can sometimes smell cigarettes smoke from outside. I don't mind but others might.", "It's a multi-hall movie theater. Watched Avengers Endgame in it, I remember a lady telling me to be quieter and a kid kicking the back of my seat. You can't reserve your spots in there though, when you buy a ticket you just enter the room and gotta find a free seat. So that's a bit inconvenient, especially with the big movies."]

["I had pizza, and it was pretty good. One of the hosts was pretty nice, but the other wasn't so nice. The prices were very reasonable, and I hope the staff will be more friendly when it comes to treating foreign customers better.", "The portions are quite large and can easily be shared by two people.

It's worth mentioning that the veal sauce is excellent and pairs well with bread, but the veal itself was a bit overcooked.

The tiramisu could have used a stronger coffee flavor.", 'The food is good and reasonably priced. The service is very friendly and attentive. Additionally, there is a lovely terrace, making it a perfect spot to enjoy during the summer.', "This was a restaurant full of amazing employees, very kind, great service but the food wasn't that great of a quality as it's price.
The platter with the 5 pastas was alright, 2 types of the pastas were overcooked and didn't taste good and the meat I ordered costs 25 euros which is not bad a price, but for the quality of it..not great.
It was extremely chewy and not cooked to what I had ordered which was medium/rare.
It was more medium/well-done.
Hope this helps and hope La Comedia betters their food quality.
Cheers.", "One of the best meals in Paris! Found
this place by accident while looking for a French restaurant to have dinner--but this was so delicious! There were no other Americans there so I'm guessing it is a local favorite. Highly recommend it!"]

Adresse: 30 Rue des cinq Diamants, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['6/5 stars for the service!
Everyone was friendly and treated us well.

The food is flavorful and authentic, and the atmosphere is perfect to accompany it.

Have in mind that they have a gap between the afternoon and lunch when they might not be open!', 'Fantastic restaurant in Butte aux Cailles. Basque food will never disappoint. Fair prices, quick service, what more do you need? I came several times in the past few years, and the quality of food has always been consistent.

The restaurant works with a fast turn around, so don‚Äôt expect to sit down for a chat much longer after your food is finished (they‚Äôll bring the bill as soon as you don‚Äôt say you don‚Äôt want dessert).

They take no reservations, so it‚Äôs a matter of luck (or patience) finding a table.', 'The food is delicious, portions are quite filling, good quality for the price. The waiters could be nicer, but overall good experience. Would recommend.
I had cassoulet and it was amazing, full of different types of meat.', "Cute French restaurant with good wine and tasty food. If you're interested to try French cuisine and want to do it at a not-so-expensive restaurant that also has a local tavern vibe go here. :)", 'Excellent lunch at Chez Gladines.
Potatoes are delicious and great atmosphere.
The service was very good.
Yannick really looked after us very well.
We will be back']

['Set up is a little different from American Starbucks. You select your sandwich from an open refrigerated section at the beginning of the line. At Starbucks in my city you have to order at the register and they retrieve a frozen one from the back of the store which gets zapped in a microwave for a minute or so. These sandwiches are fresher than US version and are toasted in an actual oven on parchment paper. So, if you are American, your wait time is just a little longer than you are used to but worth the wait. I ordered a ham, egg, and cheese muffin. The egg was cooked over easy so the yolk was runny. If you want a hard cooked egg, do not get this sandwich.  Cannot find Naked smoothies anywhere in Paris but finally found a delicious berry smoothie (in a bottle) here. Muffin sandwich and smoothie were about 9 euros. Crowded but quiet. Nobody in here was blasting video or music without ear buds or talking loudly on their phone - unlike US Starbucks. Very polite customers. My French is awful but I know enough to be polite - staff did not mind one bit, nobody rolled their eyes. üòä Professional and courteous staff.', 'I have enjoyed Starbucks every where for a long time y something that I really appreciated is its quality anywhere i go, to enjoy its products and service. My favorite is a pumking spice latte with pumking cake! Make feel the flavor of autum and see the colors of fall!', 'There was a guy doing a covid test inside the store. The person kept drinking from a reusable cup. I asked the store manager and he said its not forbidden to either do a test or stay inside the store and didnt do anything. They preferred people to leave instead of asking the guy to do so.', 'Service was bad. B√©n√©dicte in particular was unfriendly and didn‚Äôt even know what is a flat white. The place was unkept, dirty and not like other Starbucks. The terrace was full of trash (however I do also blame the customers as well)\n\nWe had gotten two drinks to take away then later found a fly in our coffee. So we return to inform them. Gave us a refund for that at least. No apology from anyone. As a whole, unpleasant experience. From service to product to ambiance.', 'Everything was terrible they cannot listen messed up my order. They messed up my name and everything do not go just stay clear!']

Adresse: 18-20 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Good, honest French food. Friendly family run operation. All dishes are homemade and feel like grand-m√®re made them.
Very popular, so can get noisy. Lovely all the same.', 'I don‚Äôt know if its my luck or its always like that. The steak was so chewy and hard to cut even with the knife, the fries and melted cheese were so good though. The ice cream was ok.', "I went for steak-frites and I wasn't disappointed. Great restaurant, very laid back and affordable. The staff is also very nice.", 'When I was young, some years ago üòä, la butte aux cailles used to be a trendy area of Paris for the youth... I don't know if it's still the case but for me at least the district has a lot of charm yet and this restaurant has some too. Service is fast and kind, food is nice, traditional, and white wines are enjoyable like the Chablis. I was very happy to get this back to the future "parenthesis".', "This place is a exceptional and represents a certain idea of French culture. It is located in top of the Butte aux Cailles on its main street.
The place itself has no frills but holds such a special atmosphere that you won't find many other places.
The servers are to the point. They have been here for a while and are not taking any nonsense. Personally, I find that it adds to the character of the restaurant.
The food is delicious, usually traditional, fares and served in good quantity. The prices are quite good.
This is one of my favorite places in the city but understand that some people may not find it to their taste. To these, I would suggest to come with open mind and enjoy!"]

["5 star experience at Mavrommatis, a Parisian institution. From the minute you arrive, you're welcomed at the door by the professional staff and greeted by all. You then take a look around and the wonderful, Mediterranean design of the restaurant. Comfortable, elegant, and exquisite.

The aptly priced 7 course menu flowed perfectly and was very season appropriate. We paired it with a wonderful Retsina; a great recommendation from the staff. Our favourites were the scallop ceviche with sea urchin, the homey artichoke soup, a perfectly cooked monkfish, and the desserts, especially the chocolate tart with passion fruit, wrapped up the evening delicately.

I'm certainly glad we didn't pass on the opportunity to eat here and will likely be returning when in Paris again. Thank you for the wonderful evening.", 'Exceptional and highly recommended! Service was attentive but not pretentious, food was right on point for the price, and the wine selection exceptional. Definitely get the wine pairing - worth it for the price. Make sure you book in advance and give them a call if you don‚Äôt find a table (I did). Loved that it was right off the metro. Cannot wait to be back!', 'A enjoyable experience. Use of traditional Greek ingredients with seasonal french produce, weaved to create harmonious dishes that please the palette. Every dish was a joy. We were a party of 4, we had the 5 course tasting menu with an extra dish (the octopus which was not part of the set menu). The tasting menu was too much in its own right.', 'Exceptional experience!
Unbelievable tasting menu, the staff were absolutely professional, welcoming and very attentive.
Great atmosphere, very romantic and minimalistic - just perfect.
Thank you for the unforgettable dinner in Paris‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Excellent dinner for the birthday for my father in law!! We all really enjoyed it. This restaurant takes the greek food to another level. We food the familiar greek savory in every dishes in very different ways!! Plus we never had such a big selection for the wine parings compare to other gastronomic restaurants. Highly recommended ~~']

['A really nice atmosphere along with the good food', 'An excellent find in this neighborhood. Wonderful dishes with great value, nice and fast service - a rare find in Paris. It‚Äôs a family run restaurant that has been there for more than 30 years. Traditional, hearty dishes from the Southwest made with fresh produce. We have frog legs (I love the French sense of adventure and creativity in cuisine) and Canard/Duck carrousel. A beautiful place for your weekend brunch üòòüòãüíñ', 'We have been coming to eat at Languedoc for 10 years and it doesn‚Äôt disappoint. It is really a hidden gem in Paris where you can get great, simple and fresh French dishes at a reasonable price. Highly recommended!', 'The food is good but the service is frankly awful. They asked me to remove my bags from an empty seat at an adjacent table. I had to put my purse on the floor. The other table remained empty all evening. They also never checked on us so we did not get to tell them that one of our dishes was overcooked. I will not return to this place where passive aggressive seems the modus operandi. Why pay to get abused? I can‚Äôt figure out why these people are in the hospitality business when they are ‚Äúaimables comme une porte de prison‚Äù (=as friendly as the gate of a jail).', 'Great little family-run restaurant with great food and wine options. Worth a stop if you‚Äôre looking for something away from the tourist spots.']

['Tipical small french cuisine restaurant. I had fois gras with brioche for starter, it was very well made, for main course veal with potato, very tender and juicy and for dessert souffle with flambe Grand Marnier, light and tasty also a bit of a show.', "Fantastic place, highly recommend!
Well cooked traditional French cuisine, great choice, fantastic service!

Big thanks to the charismatic Naim, who warmly welcomed us, helped us choose the wine (really good wine, recommend!) and recommended the dessert (the souffle is amazing).
Can't recommend enough!", 'Not the establishment it once was. Service despite the dress code is casual at best with little training and noticeable omissions. Dishes are hit & miss: the soup was good, pate is hard to get wrong, the ceviche was an absolute joke*, risotto was ok although lacked seasoning , scallops were ok, boar was ok but lacked depth in the sauce. The big profiterole was a highlight despite a sauce that had not been warmed enough so the consistency was very dense. Wine list overpriced for average wines with a few good options in the higher end of the spectrum (several hundred ‚Ç¨).

An average bistro with limited vegetarian options as always in Parisian bistros.

One of the rare places open on a Sunday during the festive period, not sure we‚Äôd go back with more choice in the area.

(*when you order ceviche on a menu you don‚Äôt expect chopped salad with bits of fish roughly chopped that is still bloody and a couple of fruit cubes on top. A fish salad at best and still that would‚Äôve been a disappointment).', 'We went as part of a group and had an incredible experience. We shared a perfect bottle of wine and enjoyed pork with noodles and the most perfect baked pear with crumble and ice cream. Service was speedy, attentive, and kind. We were well taken care of with happy bellies.', 'Located near Gobelin m√©tro station, this French restaurant serves traditional & local dishes. The set menu is good value for money and the waiter was pretty friendly! We used a smartbox and it was a good experience for a couple!']

Adresse: 21 Rue de la Coll√©giale, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
["This was the best meal we had in Paris hands down. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the wait staff was so attentive, personable , charming and nice and the food was 10 out of 10! The prices as well were extremely reasonable for the incredible quality of the food.

We had the pigs ear salad and foie gras for starters both were above our expectations. The foie gras was grilled which was new my husband and I and this may be our favorite new way of having foie gras it was crispy but also melted in your mouth. For entrees I got the duck breast and it was THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD! It was cooked to perfection and had the most gorgeous sear on the skin, sitting beautifully in the center of a semi glaze sauce, the best word to describe it is succulent! I don't think any duck I have in the future will compare, which is why I'll have to come back to Paris if only for this dish! The side I got was a pumpkin mash and it paired perfectly with the duck! My husband got a beef dish and it was spectacular as well, but he hailed my duck as king that night. For dessert my husband got a chocolate mouse which was rich and decadent. I got the floating island and the meringue just melted away in my mouth with the vanilla custard sauce and caramelly drizzle. I will forever be dreaming about this dessert as no dessert on the US will ever compare. Everything form start to finish was phenomenal.

There is nothing that will stop me from ensuring I eat at this restaurant whenever I am in Paris again! It was the highest of highlights. And to speak to how incredible it was, we met an archeologist when we first sat down who has been coming to Paris for 15 years for work twice a year and he ALWAYS eats at this restaurant because of how fantastic it is.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!", 'My daughter and I went to this place per Google reviews. You guys didn‚Äôt disappoint us. The food was delicious and service was efficient and good. The stewed veal belly was so tender and flavorful. We took the leftover home and made a great pasta dish with the veal and sauce. The chicken in mushroom sauce was also great! I almost wanted to lick the plate clean.', 'a very nice dining experience overall (thanks to the wonderful staff), but some dishes could be improved. We loved the welcoming staff and speed of service, as well as the freshness of the dishes. For that alone, we could come back anytime. That being said, the risotto (fregola sarda risotto) was devoid of any taste at all (really bland) and the raviole (pasta) on the half salted cod filled was consistently undercooked. I sent it back once, but it came back identical (undercooked). Mushy in the mouth and clearly not properly done - why innovate with pasta when the fish is so wonderfully done? The rest of the dishes were tasty and served with elegance (appetizers, snails "profiterole", gambas, deserts etc). At the end of the day, we hope to be back but will opt for more conservative "French" choices next time.', 'The culinary highlight of our trip to Paris. Some of the best food I have had in years. Friendly staff and cosy interiors make this place a must visit. The chefs must be magicians. The lamb was gorgeous and the beef in red wine sauce was divine, and the mashed potatoes and gratin went so well alongside them. Good wine list too.', 'This place is a must! I‚Äôm from USA originally, but have traveled over 40 countries and currently live in Brasil! I wanted traditional French food. My hotel recommended this place. I could not be any happier! Mushrooms, veal, duck, wow, the wine. I might just come back to Paris just to eat here again. Servers were awesome also! Spoke English well and really helpful! 10 stars if they would have let me']

Adresse: 58 Rue des cinq Diamants, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Not cheap, but really good. The home made pasta dishes are really delicious. The resto is very authentic and puts a lot of effort into derails, from food to interior and service. Decent options for vegetarians. Great views from the terrace too. Go by and enjoy!', 'Nice Italian place located in the heart of Butte-aux-Cailles, the area which assembles a young, trendy and festive Parisian population in its many small bars and restaurants.

Menu is simple and compact, it offers some Italian classics.

The antipasto we ordered surprisingly had German red pickled cabbage in it.

I really liked Linguine cacio e pepe. Pasta cooked al dente, great sauce.

Tagliolini alla crema di limone e rosmarino has distinct lemon zest flavour to it, which I found slightly unbalanced.

Pappardelle all‚Äôamatriciana looked really good.

Wine list is well organised and split into stylistic categories for easy navigation.

Overall impression is good, but nothing I would specially return for or recommend as a must visit.', 'Nice atmosphere and decent service. Mediocre main courses with small servings, inauthentic taste, pasta NOT Al dente but  undercooked. Sauce has no flavour. Wine was also poor. Maybe they could decant in advance?', "If you looking for a really good Italian restaurant you have to try it.
Walking distance from most hotels.
Really cozy and rustic and the staff spoke English, that's what made it for me, the gentleman that severed us was really welcoming and friendly.
Very helpful with explaining the menu to us what was in French and recommending some really nice meal, I had the sheep cheese and Black pepper pasta which was really nice.
The price of the meal was really Worth it with a tip to.
So if you up for a romantic night out or just a loan ranger go enjoy a really nice pasta.
You will have to make a reservation as it gets busy quickly we got lucky as we walked in at opening tome.
Hopes this helps", 'Got the grilled sausage with mashed potatoes and it was decent, filling enough for a lunch meal. Fortunately it was a nice day outside so we got to sit on the terrace right in the center of Butte- aux-Cailles, waiter was very nice.']

['Second time here, came back to this part of paris especially for this this restaurant. The two waitors that served us (blonde and the other dark haired) were amazing and i will 100% be back next time i am in Paris. The duck is amazing and super fast service!', 'We came for breakfast. Nice chilled atmosphere, in a beautiful part of the city. About as classically french as you could get for a breakfast cafe but probably a completely different place at night. Food was good but not brilliant as were the staff.', 'Amazing ceiling lamps, amazing leather-velvet sofas. Amazing space. This can only happen in Paris. The food and  coffees are good as every Paris coffee shop.', "it was a long search through my Google timeline to find this place again a year later because they make my favorite dessert, floating island and it's no longer easy to find in Paris.", 'Great service, nice portion sizes, very tasty and cooked to order. I had the duck, very nice presentation as well.']

Adresse: 20 Rue du P√®re Gu√©rin, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Great place. Very friendly hosts. Fast service. We ordered most of the starters and shared them. Really tasty food, well cooked and fresh. Would definitely recommend and go again .', 'Excellent friendly service and great food. Small so suggest to reserve before going.', 'Great authentic Mexican spot in Paris.
Staff are very courteous and nice, nice ambiance and delicious Mexican food. Good portions and good quality.', 'A truly amazing experience and a must have Mexican place !!ü§©ü§©
We went for dinner and chose to sit on terrasse. The owner and staff was very nice, adjusting and above all welcoming.
We were looking for vegetarian options and we had plenty of choices and owner also agreed to modify a little according to our request.
We ordered 2 entree, 1 main course and dessert.üòãüòã
While waiting for entree we were served with complimentary home fried nachos with little guacamole and a very spicy yet very yumm sauce.
For starters we chose to order crispy tacos (not available at all Mexican places).It was filled with salad, vegetables grilled to perfection with the right amount of sauce to keep it moist yet not soggy. I loved the crispy layer.
The second starter was Guacamole, which was served on a eatable chips bowl with layers of salad and guacamole. The texture and taste was heavenly, it contained right amount of lemon and spices.

I had such a nice Mexican after ages. While speaking to owner I came to know that she tries to taste everything and keen on quality.

Then comes our main course, we ordered Vegetarian Enchilada !! The presentation was really good. It had a portion of Caramelized crispy potatoes, a portion of Mexican rice (This could be improved, a little more spices and salt could have done better) and the best part the baked tortilla filled with grilled veggies and melted cheese all over.
We enjoyed it with spicy and salsa sauce.

For dessert we opted for dessert of the day which was a hot chocolate pie in middle of vanilla cream. We were full and very satisfied.
Thank you for good service and quality food. The prices were also average and the place is awesome on a nice street.
Will come back again to try other things. I am attaching a few photos of our dishes.', "Absolutely amazing Mexican food.  especially the orange flavored shrimp as a starter was incredible.  It gives a full Mexican feel with its taco flavor and bitterness.  For dessert, I recommend you to try tequila ice cream.  But don't drink it with the straw that comes with dessert üòÅ."]

Nom: La Taverne du Cap Vert et du Br√©sil
Reviews:
['Always a superb and memorable experience. Food wise and Brazilian thrill wise.
Love this family held restaurant. Very genuine, healthy, with excellent receipes.', 'I order take away... Too AMAZING.. INCROYABLE üòç

Also the owner leave me such a cute note. Obrigada‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®üáßüá∑', "One of my favourite restaurants in Paris. The food is always incredible, whatever you have on the menu. The service is brilliant. It's my yearly pilgrimage when I go home!", "Very tasty and unique food. There are several dishes you likely can't get anywhere else. Very nice outside seating as well. My mother said the gambas may have been s bit undercooked.", 'Excellent food. Brazilian feijoada was like homemade, brought me memories from family lunch. Service was excepcional, he explained the whole menu and even managed to do some changes for us. That was great, well done!']

['Friendly service, a hidden gem, and delicious cuisine at reasonable prices. Lucky to have found this restaurant on a late Thursday night when we had almost planned on skipping dinner.  A big thank you to Banoun and his team for custom making a vegetarian meal for us. He went above and beyond and made sure we go home happy. We highly recommend this place if you are visiting or a local.', "Superb friendly service and amazing food.

We visited late on a Thursday night in August and enjoyed it so much we returned on the Saturday after a disappointing experience at another restaurant in Paris.

My teenager and I were so impressed with our tomato basil pasta AND my husband's margarita pizza that when we returned we both had the pasta again and shared a pizza between us.

We highly recommend the desserts too, especially the chocolate ice cream and tirimisu.", '"C'est pas √† nous." Those were the words the cook said to me, without a hint of apology, after I discovered a clump of hair tangled in the Carbonara sauce and bacon I was eating last Thursday. I still can't believe it. What started as a simple lunch turned into a revolting experience. Needless to say, this is a place I cannot recommend to anyone.', "Ok. Is there better in Paris, is it a bit out of the way. Well yes but.....it's worth it.
Very friendly, food really good.

A negative point, ok here it is. The tiramisu could do with a little more coffee. But I love coffee so that could be explained. Don't let me put you off it. It's light, fluffy and in the heat we had was an ideal pudding.

We were in Paris 4 days and came back here for a second night as we had a bad experience elsewhere.

This place will not leave you disappointed, a little gem.

A big thanks to the restaurant we all left happy.

Steve and family. Ps it was my birthday on my second visit so we wanted something nice to end a good day.", "It's a fine pizza place, however with a name like Pizza Cesar, I was expecting to be WOWed by some aspect of the pizza, something that makes it obvious why the owner thought they should open another pizza spot in a neighborhood with plenty of pizza. There just isn't anything special about it.

The crust is what makes or breaks a pizza for me, and it was baked to perfection, however the taste was just meh. Maybe not enough salt, maybe not fresh yeast, I don't know but the crust treated like bland bread. The texture, I must remind you, was perfect, both in my calzone and my friend's normal pizza.

The toppings seemed fresh enough and good enough. The ham in my calzone couldn't conceal it's moist cold cuts nature sure to the liquid interior it was baked in, but I imagine it would be better on an open faced pie.

We also tried their salad, a Cesar salad. The dressing was house made but again surprisingly flavorless. Just some beige liquid at the bottom of my plate of lettuce. Nice croutons and hammered chicken, though. Overall skip salad here, and at ‚Ç¨15 it's more expensive than the pizza.

The baguette provided at the beginning was very subpar, just the normal 90 centime variety you'll find in every boulangerie. And it was served with black olives with a somewhat dried drained texture to them. I'm sure classic and many Italians love them but they were a bit funky for my palette."]

['Excellent place for dinner. The waiter provided very friendly service, the food arrived in good time and was delicious. The desserts were amazing, especially the tiramisu, which was sliced and served at the table. Very casual atmosphere, I recommend a visit!', 'The restaurant served delicious meals on large plates, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable. The staff provided excellent service, ensuring that all our needs were met and making us feel welcome and comfortable. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience.', "What a fantastic departure from the heavier food you can indulge in whilst traipsing around Paris

We had two killer salads and the ingredients were so fresh and crisp and tasty and uplifting

I think we had the Avocado Toast and the Salade du Negociant...both absolutely beautiful.  Too many fresh ingredients to list...I'll let the pictures to the talking

Super nice staff.  There was one gentlemen that greeted and waited on us...very talkative and friendly and welcoming", 'The only remarkable thing about this place is the kindness and professionalism of waiters.
Had steak for dinner and it was below average , the quality of meat wasn‚Äôt on the level of a French restaurant in this street .
May be its a good place to hangout and have drink and some appetizers with friends but couldn‚Äôt list it among visit again list !', "06/11
Really lovely place, the decor is retro and I love it, the location is central and near the metro! The waiters, are polite and efficient no snotty attitude here just hard working knowledgeable professionals. Went there twice both occasions were wonderful, first time was for drinks and a mixed platter in the evening (great value by the way with a good selection of charcuterie and cheeses very well presented) and second time was for lunch (goats cheese salad was generous and tasty, my mother devoured the chicken and little pasta parcels filled with creamy cheese, highly recommend both dishes). Service is fantastic, food tastes great! I will be returning when I'm back in Paris for sure 10/10!"]

Adresse: 2 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We had our breakfast here almost everyday of our trip in Paris! Really good baguettes, and very sweet people. They also have really good soup.', 'Beautiful bakery. Courteous and attentive staff. Great Viennese tuna sandwich and vegetable soup. Very popular.', 'Great bread and pastries! Bought this a month ago while I was in Paris and kept it in the freezer. Took it out this morning and voila! Still so good, quality is top notch! Hope to visit once back! Yum, yum!', 'Great, small bakery with a range of selections of baked goods including paste ties and baguettes. Where there on a Sunday, and they didn‚Äôt provide you with the option of making baguettes with cheese or ham. The line is long, but quick service. They sold pre-made sandwiches but the ones we got was very dry. Pro-tip: Bring your own cheese, buy a baguette and sit in the park next to the bakery and enjoy your breakfast.', 'Out of this world raspberry desert. Croissants with apples or chocolate were superb. Very clean store, very friendly professionals. Will be back. Delicious']

['It‚Äôs great. Best dumplings ever, incredible cheap price, kind people. We don‚Äôt have a common language (I just speak very little French) but they make a great effort an we get to understand each other even about my food allegies.', 'Very good food served in this restaurant. Dumplings are freshly handmade. Venue is simple. Staff is nice and friendly. Few seatings outside available.', 'I would only recommend the ravioli here which are made fresh and are plump. Just order a large plate of these for yourself and you will be happy. The other dishes such as the zhajiangmian were subpar and portions were small. Prices are good for the dumplings.', 'One of the best Chinese ravioli place in Paris. Original flavor from the north and reasonable price', 'A whole other level of traditional, homemade Chinese cuisine. Clean, family-friendly, not very expensive for Parisian standards, goes unnoticed but def worth a stop - well deserves its name!']

["I ordered a cappuccino and they tried to sell it for 6‚Ç¨ euros so I asked for the menu and it was 5‚Ç¨ so they tried to add an extra euro and thought I wouldn't notice because Im a foreigner. Even if they didn't try to fleece me, 5 euros for a cappuccino is insane.", 'Tourist trap! The waiter charged us 14‚Ç¨ for 2 beers (25cl) when te original price is 8,60‚Ç¨‚Ä¶ We complained about it and he paid us back the rest‚Ä¶not recommended', "I'm really bad at French\nIn spite of going straight to the bar and buying there charged 'salle' that is on the table, not 'comptain' that is on the bar. Will never go there again!! A pity because we are staying for 6 days and are accommodated just around the corner...", "Sometimes kitchen is close early and you don't get the food, but Bier is good from the Barrel. They have a big screen TV.", 'From the kitchen to the boss without forgetting the musicians, the whole staff of Les Jolies M√¥mes are simply my friends. As a Canadian in Paris, they have been my family far from home from the minute I opened their door. This place is a magnet as well as a haven for the traveller where they will be welcomed with openmindness, keen interest and benevolence. So full of warmth, humanity, interesting people that it can easily become addictive üòâ\nOne of these too rare bars where drinking a glass of wine feels like you took an ecstasy.']

["Nice and welcoming people. Food is good overall, the curry was delicious. I didn't like the dessert much (made with mango, sticky rice and milk) but then again, I'm not a huge fan of desserts in any Asian restaurants :)", "I have never been so well received in Paris! The hosts were the kindest. Oh, not to forget how tasty the dishes were. Definitely, I'll come back.", "Welcoming and helpful staff, delicious dishes. We had green mango salad, papaya salad, fish amok along with sticky rice, and liseron d'eau. Every thing was good.", 'Staffs are very attentive! Good cuisine, pleasant to have a weekend lunch for us. Thank you', 'Wow! Over any expectation. Make sure you get the brochettes and the fried rice.\nVery good service and atmosphere as well. 5 stars well deserved.']

Adresse: 14-16 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Loved this bar! Especially coco passion fruit shots! Great music as well as possibility to play darts. Very sovietic design.', 'Fantastic night out while staying in Paris for a few nights.
The owner was extremely friendly and welcoming and made sure I had a great evening.
The atmosphere was chilled and laid back with a large seating area outside and disco themed music playing all evening.', 'Good selection of beers. They should clean their beer conducts more often since the smell of the beer is not the freshest. Slow staff, mediocre decoration. Advantage is that the bar is quite big so you can find the place to sit down.', 'They always make sure you feel home ! Great place, genuinely nice owners and bartenders ! Very much recommended!
Make sure you try the signature house shot "ouarzazate"', 'Rude waiters. When they come to you, you don‚Äôt know if they are joking or arguing with you. It‚Äôs a bit unsettling for whoever is new in this place.
It‚Äôs not the case for every of them, but it‚Äôs the case for several of the waiters.

I don‚Äôt put a harsh 1 star, as the beer were ok, in a correct price. And also it‚Äôs a thing of Paris to have rude waiters. But still, I‚Äôd appreciate a bit more of effort.']

['Head chef trained at top French cuisine & open for decades! The food comes piping hot and fresh! Cooked very nicely on beautifully aesthetic dishes üòâ
Best French food with real savory flavor I have had in my many trips to France üá´üá∑
Now I see why the foie gras is so expensive and such a craze! Liver = melts like butter
The dessert was okay and pretty expensive but we got the pork knuckle, veal liver, and the beef dishes!', 'After spending a week in Paris paying 20‚Ç¨ for tiny portions, I expected the 34‚Ç¨ pricetag on the 3 course dinner to mean a small appetizer, a small main dish, and a small dessert. But oh my goodness was I wrong, the 3 course meal had HUGE portion sizes! I have not had to take out at a single restaurant in France before this meal. And it was delicious! The steak was cooked to perfection, and super tender. The mussel pastry for starter was super tasty and filled with seafood. And the final Panna Cotta dessert was super refreshing and fun to eat with popping bubbles! Alas if only I could read the special menu, there were other delicacies like tatare on it that were also very affordable. The owner of the place was also such a sweet and genuine lady. She handled the food with such care. If we were staying in Paris a couple more days, I would have definitely come back to try more items on the menu!', 'Delicious home cooked French food in a relaxed atmosphere. Great value for money and the service was very good. Plenty to choose from including the option of a 3 course set menu. Definitely recommended', "We were pleasantly surprised by the Virgule and a little bummed we hadn't found it sooner as we would have been happy to eat there more. üòä

It doesn't look flashy, and we got there quite early, so no one else was dining yet. But don't let this fool you! This place had some delicious food!! Even our kids enjoyed their meals.

The steak and salmon were cooked to perfection and beautifully plated, the snails were delicious, and the desserts were scrumptious.", 'Presented beautifully and the course was very filling. Came with sides of bread and potatoes for free. Fancy and delicious food but didn‚Äôt feel pretentious and was comfortable. Great for the price. My favorite was the wine soaked pear for dessert as well as the mussel pastry as an appetizer.']

['We loved the evening set menu here and the price is very reasonable for the portion size and the quality of the food. Couldn‚Äôt fault any of the dishes and everything came out quickly and hot. We‚Äôd love to come back again!', 'We enjoyed being there. It seems a bit pricy but the portions were so big. Service, food, atmosphere and quality totally worth it! you can find good ones from French cuisines. If I come France once again, I will definitely eat there!', 'Cozy place on a green corner, nice atmosphere and good service. The food is fresh and delicious, the tuna and veggies were perfectly cooked. Decent value for 20‚Ç¨ lunch menu. Great find.', "Such a cozy and lovely restaurant. I chose the simple menu written on the chalk board, but after my boyfriend's cassoulet arrived (ordered from the main menu), I immediately regretted my choice (although it was still delicious). Next time will go for the traditional menu!", 'This lovely reataurent has very anvient roots and serves excellent Basque food. Really lovely staff and great food.  I had the duck breast which was very tasty and the dessert was really great.']

Nom: La Bonne Heure (vegan and veggie seasonal cuisine)
Adresse: 72 Rue du Moulin des Pr√©s, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Delicious, and a very nice welcome by the chef. Highly recommend this place and will be sure to come again. Merci!', "Excellent home cooked vegan food, the chef was very enthusiastic about where all the ingredients came from. Simple and very tasty organic vegan food and drinks. 100% recommended. I'll be going back next time I'm in Paris.", 'Lovely place, lovely people.
The food was great, tasty and well cooked.
100% recommended.', 'Very welcoming couple
Locally sources vegan products, everything is in season, well presented and tasty', 'A lovely place! üòä On the menu are only seasonal vegetarian/vegan dishes, with locally grown veggies. Wonderful service (also in English, the French menu was helpfully translated for me). Lovely details on the walls and bookshelves. ‚ù§Ô∏è Would definitely recommend when in the area.']

Adresse: 7 Rue de la Coll√©giale, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
['I didn‚Äôt appreciate a lot the experience of going to this restaurant with my friends.

The food was fairly expensive for the given quantity and quality. I have eaten in an Ethiopian restaurant in Washington 1 year ago and there is a world of difference between the two experiences. Service wasn‚Äôt the fastest neither, it took the waitress around 30 minutes to bring us some water at the begging. I also think the quality of food was lesser than that of the other restaurant I tried.

The prices (some of them)  can be seen from the photo.', 'Great Ethiopian restaurant in Paris.
The food is great and the waiters/owner is very friendly and kind. I highly suggest the ‚Äúmenu‚Äù formula, especially if you want to try different dishes.', 'Great little restaurant serving super tasty and authentic Ethiopian cuisine. Friendly staff, great value for money, and excellent service. My taste buds were jumping with delight.', 'Really great restaurant. Try the ‚Äúassortiments‚Äù dish and it was perfect to discover this traditional restaurant.', 'It was a great experience. The food for all four of us came together in one big plate. it was tasty!']

["My first Chinese restaurant in Paris. Love it!
The restaurant runs by a lovely family. Been eating Chinese foods most of my life, I think this place is above standard. The food served quickly and I enjoyed every dish especially the crispy skin fried chicken, it looked so normal compared to others but the taste was outstanding.
The service was fast and organized when each of them really know what to do. I also like the atmosphere here it's contemporary and beautiful.
What I really love about this place is to see the family working tirelessly among the noises and demanding customers especially the daughter who I found she is the prettiest girl in Paris. Not Westurn girl who has blonde hair and model body but this Asian girl who is focused, hardworking and has a wonderful smile.
May your business prosper and may your family be healthier and wealthier.", "I was brought here by a friend.I don't have high expectations when I go to a Chinese restaurant, as they're usually all the same. It wasn't a busy time, so your mileage may vary.

This place was pretty peasant. The waiters had plenty of time for us, throwing jokes and being swift to clean the dishes. The food was good and felt authentic.

They have a small selection on wines on the menu although they display a C√¥te R√¥tie along with the cognac bottles :). They waiter suggested the Chinon and it was a good a good pick.", 'Great place to have diner with friends and family. Everything we had tried exceeded our expectations. However, the highlight was the caramelised duck. Its ideal for sharing. Once the skin is removed and served, the meat is cooked in two different ways.
Bonus : the atmosphere is really nice and the waiters are friendly.', "Chez Ly Village Tao-Tao offers a spacious venue that is suitable for hosting events and gatherings. The restaurant's ample seating and accommodating staff make it a convenient choice for large groups or special occasions. However, when it comes to the culinary offerings, there are some areas that leave room for improvement.

The dim sum at Chez Ly Village Tao-Tao didn't quite live up to expectations. While they were decently prepared, they lacked the special touch and distinct flavors that make dim sum truly exceptional. The variety of options was satisfactory, but they didn't leave a lasting impression or stand out among other dim sum establishments. If you're looking for an extraordinary dim sum experience, you may be better off exploring other options in the area.

The duck, although passable, didn't leave a lasting impression either. It fell somewhere in the middle, lacking the succulence and flavorful execution that would make it truly memorable. While it was adequately cooked, the flavors and overall presentation failed to leave a lasting impact. If you're specifically seeking a remarkable duck dish, you may want to consider other establishments that specialize in this particular delicacy.

On the positive side, the size and layout of Chez Ly Village Tao-Tao make it an ideal venue for events. Whether you're planning a corporate gathering or a private celebration, the restaurant's spaciousness and accommodating staff can cater to your needs. The attentive service and willingness to accommodate larger groups contribute to the overall positive experience when it comes to hosting events at this establishment.

In terms of ambiance, Chez Ly Village Tao-Tao offers a comfortable and pleasant setting. The decor is tasteful and creates a relaxed atmosphere. The staff members are courteous and attentive, ensuring that guests feel welcomed and taken care of throughout their visit.

In conclusion, Chez Ly Village Tao-Tao is a suitable venue for hosting events, thanks to its spaciousness and accommodating staff. However, the dim sum and duck dishes fell short of expectations in terms of flavor and execution. If you're seeking an exceptional dining experience, especially when it comes to dim sum and duck, you may want to explore other options in the area.", "Excellent food,  made me feel as if I'm back in Beijing. Definitely will go back there again."]

['A very nice place recommended by friends, the food, atmosphere and hospitality all top-notch! The duck was absolutely delicious!', 'Fantastic spot for authentic French food at a reasonable price. Their "Formula" menu, priced at about 22‚Ç¨, includes an appetizer, main dish and dessert (or cheese plate) - excellent value for the quality. The French onion soup was rich and cheesy, and the escargots were a standout with a beatiful garlic butter sauce. For the main course, the steak was perfectly cooked for medium rare, just as ordered, while duck, lamb and salmon were also flavourful and satisfying, clearly made with care.\n\nThe atmophere was cozy, and the waiter was friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed it so much that we ended up coming back twice, even though we were only in Paris for a few days. Would recommend!', 'Dinning at ‚ÄòAu Petit Bistrot‚Äô was a wonderful experience for my family and I. The cozy, nice, and friendly atmosphere made my experience amazing, the French cuisine was at its best! The staff at Au Petit Bistrot are exceptionally welcoming and attentive, making every guest feel valued and at home. Highly recommended!', 'The food was so good that there was nothing to photograph after dinner. Traditional french. The food was excellent, we had a set menu  2 days in a row. The atmosphere is great, mostly locals dining.', "Fantastically priced and brilliant service. I had the set menu of onion soup, steak and then the cheese to finish. Was all very delicious. I would heartily recommend this place to anyone in the vicinity. We also had a delicious half bottle of Riesling. What's not to love?"]

['Coco de mer is a beautiful restaurant in all areas. The food and cocktails are delicious and the atmosphere makes you feel like you have been transported on an island holiday to Seychelles. The service was friendly and attentive. My friends and I had a fantastic evening and will be back again very soon!', 'This place has an amazing seafood selection! The service is quick and attentive! The sea bass was very well cooked and maybe just a tiny bit under-seasoned! The octopus was perfect! The side of rice is a nice addition to the meal! Drinks are quite good too with the great amount of alcohol in them!', "Excellent. This looks simple, but don't underestimate, the quality of the food is just amazing. I had that sausage dish and it was a surprisingly fine composition of delicate flavours. Try and enjoy!", 'Absolutely beautiful food. I had the ceviche, coconut chicken curry and lime cheesecake. All of them were light, fresh,  and very flavourful. My husband was very happy with his choice (ceviche, octopus curry, fruit salad and mango mousse), too. Generous measures in the cocktails, and warm, welcoming service. Out of several very good meals we had in Paris, I think this was the best.', "Awesome restaurant, the fish was fresh and perfectly prepared in all of the dishes we ordered. We tried the ceviche, grilled cod, and octopus curry, and all were excellent. The rum punches were also very tasty. Service was friendly. We managed to get a table without a reservation but I would recommend having one, as ours was the only free one in the house on a Friday evening. I've never had food from Seychelles before but I think I'm going to pick up a cookbook, because we don't have this back home in Amsterdam."]

["It's always a pleasure to try international chains all over to seek any specific differences between various outlets.
Well, the KFC place d'Italie is an excellent KFC outlet with great food, good service and good atmosphere near the square.
You won't be disappointed.
Enjoy...", 'The best kfc I have beeen to in paris', 'i really like the food quality and service here. the whole staff was so nice and friendly, specially the woman named Severine.i would highly recommend this place', 'Be warned, this is what you get from this KFC. I talked to the manger and I got the impression that this is not a big deal! He did reimburse me 2 euros. I couldn‚Äôt care less about the money but he did not apologize until I inisisted. What annoys me most is his arrogant attitude. I wonder why French people think their country is going downhill!', "It's KFC... The chicken is better than in America but the lack of biscuits and macaroni and cheese will never not make me sad. 13 tenders for ‚Ç¨7 on Tuesdays is the only reason I'll ever go.

Original sauce is odd, basically 3 poivre sauce from Heinz in the store.

Am√©ricaine sauce is thousand island with a bit of BBQ in it.

The curry sauce is interesting and novel. I like it.

Imperial is a cheap sweet and sour knockoff.

Smoky BBQ is normal USA high fructose corn syrup BBQ sauce

Their moist towelettes are a joke ... But they do the job so... Appreciated."]

['This  CROUS restaurant suits me quite well, because of its location. However, you should not come there before 13:00. You risk standing in line for up to 40 minutes.\nBut that is not the reason why I write this. The reason is they serve green potatoes. Today was the second time. Potatoes turn green if they are stored in the sun. And this green corresponds to the content of a dangerous substance: Solanine. You can see Wikipedia and read about it, google don\'t like when I put a citation here.\nAnd I see "this green" for the second time. Please keep an eye on your products!', 'Nice ambience to spend time with friends and family', 'I go to this university restaurant nearly every week day and personally like it. There are always options to choose from, and the staff are nice people. I love pizza days, too. :)', "It's same as CROUS restaurants but the staff was quite friendly and helpful. And the menu was also good.", 'Cheap place to eat for students and its quality and quantity is quite good.']

['We had dinner here with a group of friends. Everything was extremely delicious, food was 10/10. It was a quiet night, so I don‚Äôt know how it is on a busy day, but Barbie (our waitress) served us really well. She explained us the whole menu and made suggestions on the wine and food. She did an amazing job and we loved our evening there. Would highly recommend to go if you‚Äôre looking for great food and expertise.', 'The food here is NEXT LEVEL.
