On the plus side, the service is attentive, and the atmosphere is pleasant. While I like the place, I don't see a compelling reason to return, especially with so many other cafes nearby to explore.", 'Frog legs were delicious definitely the highlight of our meal! We had one moody waiter which rushed us to order but luckily the waiter who served us after was very friendly and made our experience better.
Kids pizza was a very generous size and tasty the steak was bit chewy, beef bourguignon was very tender and falls apart', 'Had dinner here with family on a weekday. The restaurant was not busy, and we were seated quickly. The staff were friendly. The food was pretty good.', 'Very near to Eifel Tower. Very good vegetarian Pizza and excellent pasta ( very spicy). Thoroughly enjoyed.Initially though they said guests are welcome only with reservations, but later they did wonderful service. Really recommend this place', "Come in for our tea, brilliant restaurant with a lot of options. We walked a little further down the street from the eiffel tower (only a 10 minute walk) and noticed this restaurant offering a variety of things at a more pleasant price compared to the others down the street.
Didn't disappoint, service is great, everyone looked after us and was welcoming throughout. Recommended place to grab a bite to eat üëåüèº"]

Adresse: 50 Rue de la Croix Nivert, 75015 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Pretty bland, I'd consider this food maybe for drunk munchies but other than that the quality of the ingredients is sub-par, not to mention the bottles of Coke are from eastern Europe. Makes me wonder what lengths they'd go to save a penny...
I'd come here again only as a last resort for survival.
2 stars because I didn't suffer from food intoxication.", 'Pizza‚Äôs are really good for the price, came back two days in a row.
Staff translate menu for tourists, also made pizza with ingredients we asked for.', 'Friendly staff, good price, delicious pizza that was prepared quickly. We were pleasantly surprised.', 'awesome food just best pizza ever in my life', 'The staff was a 10/10 and the food was perfect']

Adresse: 19 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Warm, welcoming establishment with exceptional food and hospitality.  Our favorite restaurant of the trip.  The stuffed cabbage and duck were exceptional- savory and sweet.  The fig dessert was a perfect end to a lovely evening!', "We have lost count as to how many times we have dined at Le Florimond. Lori and I bring our family to Le Florimond when we are in Paris. This restaurant features home style french food. It's like eating at your French Grandma's house. Our favorites included Grandma's stuffed cabbage and the mille-feuille. Rather than try to choose a wine let Laurent do it for you. Laurent is the manager of the dining room and our friend. I have reservations about revealing Le Florimond to the masses, I don't want it to get so crowded by tourists that it looses its charm. Send our regards to Laurent and enjoy an authentic French dinner. We are once again on the way soon.", 'Such a neighborhood find! Delicious food and warm welcoming staff in a quaint French style!  Duck con fit and cabbage roll was superb!', "This is the most special restaurant we have ever gone to. It's everything. My husband surprised me and took me here for our 5th wedding anniversary, and we went for our 10th wedding anniversary and now this month, our 25th. We remember on our 5th thinking that the meal was the most special we had in Paris for the whole trip. On our 10th, we thought it was the most special meal we had up until that point, and on our 25th, it was no surprise to us that we saw they have a Michelin star. It is still the most special restaurant to us ever. Laurent and Pascal both go above and beyond to make their customers feel special. From the greeting to the delicious food they make for each guest. Incredible. If you are coming here just for a good dinner, or for a special event- you will not be disappointed. We do always make a reservation. We sat next to an owner of a boutique hotel chain when we came and they were as impressed as we were.
I am not sure if they take walk-ins, but don't leave it up to chance. This place is so special, you will want a reservation.", "I can't speak highly enough about my experience at Florimond restaurant in Paris. From the moment we stepped onto the charming little terrace, we were greeted with exceptional service and treated to a culinary journey that delighted our taste buds. The ambience was just perfect, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere.

What truly impressed me was their commitment to catering to special dietary needs. As someone with gluten and dairy restrictions, I often struggle to find suitable options when dining out. However, Florimond's team went above and beyond to ensure I had a memorable meal without compromising on flavor or quality. Their ability to adapt their dishes to be gluten-free and dairy-free was truly commendable.

I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to the entire team for their relentless efforts in finding solutions and providing an outstanding dining experience. Florimond is a true gem that deserves every bit of praise. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for superb service, delectable food, and a restaurant that goes the extra mile to accommodate dietary restrictions. Thank you, Florimond, for an unforgettable evening!

*The photos are of a previous visit, few months ago."]

Adresse: 42 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews: ["My husband and I needed to get some water and snacks while we were in town. It was located in a convenient spot by the metro and right next to my hotel. We don't speak French but the employee at the self checkout kindly helped us to complete our transaction. He was kind even though we didn't speak any French. The store was clean and a great option for people from out of town.", 'Expensive but very convenient. They work at night and have a separate section where you can heat your food, eat it and charge your phone.', 'Closed doors at 22:45 even though it‚Äôs meant to close at 23:00. Awful customer service just shook their head and refused to let anyone else in even though it‚Äôs opening hours still (even now writing this review!) Should not advertise false hours.', 'A great grocery store in the heart of Le √âcole Militaire district. Open pretty late and they stock a vast variety of things. Prices are very fair and the fruit is always delicious. Travel tip - Shop at grocery stores to cut down on unnecessary meals and water/soda costs.', "The store employees don't want to do their job at all. The person who moderates the use of self-service checkouts does not do his job. The terminals do not accept Apple Pay. When I wanted to go to another cash register to use a physical card, the manager pointedly blocked all the cash registers in front of me (3 cashes as minimum) so that I could not pay and showed me the door! The outrageous behavior of the employees is simply amazing. Very welcoming, dear Carrefour City!"]

['Benjamin is an incredible waiter!  We had a great experience with the ROYAL and our wine selection - Rol Valentin!  Great food & atmosphere.', 'The shrimp risotto was flavorful and delicious. My wife had the onion soup which she enjoyed as well. No issues ordering food or with the wait staff.', 'We saw rat running between our legs. Dish was so small for such price. Waited for server about 20min to take away empty dishes. I suggest red restaurant in the oppostite side, servings are super fast, delicious and perfect atmosphere.', 'Best restaurant in Paris! Best ever onion soup if they ever have duck on the menu get it!', 'Popped in for a late supper. Excellent omelette and french fries were delicious! Great busy atmosphere and service was good. Will visit again when next in Paris.']

['Second time here in 3 years. Such a perfect spot for great Italian food and atmosphere. A lovely small restaurant ‚Äúwhere everybody knows your name‚Äù, owner is sweet and salads, pasta pesto and pizza are magnificent. Had a tarte de framboise for dessert and it was magical.', "This resto came as a surprise for me... when i first tried it, it brought back good memories of my time in Italy. From then on, I frequented this place and would just pick the dish of the day as it was difficult to choose from the menu, everything was just buonissimo! Quite sad that some of the reviews mentioned thet the servers are rude... I dont think so, maybe it would be good to try dining here again and you'll get to know them better hehe.", 'Really great mom and pop shop with fantastic no frills Italian food.  This was a much needed respite from French food and was welcomed by my entire family.  We had the spaghetti bolognese, Rigatoni Sandro, Linguine Eggplant House special and two pizza Margherita.  Everything was so flavorful and packed with love and goodness.  The owner was warm and welcoming even with our non-existent French.  Check this place out, it is an oasis from the standard French fair at a reasonable price!  Thank you Pizza Sandro.', 'I think the comments here are bad due to the waiter which in my opinion is just an italian guy with a great sense of humor but I guess some people find him rude or arrogant. I loved the food pizza and pasta was delicious. The lunch here was actually one of the best things in paris. Dont be deceived by how the place looks the food and the service itself was great.', "Despite some awful comments I've read, today I had a wonderful time at Pizza Sandro. I went for the dish of the day: Tortellinis d'Autumno and it was delicious! The portion was very decent and  felt full quite quickly. Quite ashamed of not being able to finish my dish, the owner proposed me to take my leftovers with me and once I came home, I've found he included a big cup filled with Parmigiano in the bag. How nice!\n\nIf you're reading this comment and saw the bad ones, know one thing: people tend to be rude in Paris in general so do not take that into account. Right now, if you're looking for typical Italian food and fancy having a little trip in Italy when in Paris, go to Pizza Sandro! Grazie mille ragazzi!"]

Adresse: 24 Rue de la Croix Nivert, 75015 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Definitely a hidden gem. Food tastes authentic and really good, especially the curry g√† and canh chua t√¥m. The ingredients are surely fresh. We came in when there were not a lot of customers so it's really chill, and food was served relatively fast.", "Highly recommended!!! we were tourists to Paris and graving for Asian foods.  We looked up and found this restaurant with high rating. We decided to have lunch here and we were so glad we made a good decision.
We met the owner (Mr. Kiet) who is very charming and welcoming. He offered us free glasses of wine and a dish of fruits.  We ordered Vietnamese Sweet & Sour Shrimp soup and  Caramelized & Braised catfish. We couldn't believe how delicious the foods. The fish was so fresh and tender but tasty with the caramelized thicken sauce. The hot soup was refreshing with just enough sour and fresh smell of basil leaves.
The restaurant is artistic. It's decorated with hand-painted arts of ladies wearing traditional long dress (Ao dai) and some old towns of Vietnam.  Also, there is a karaoke and guitar for entertainment.
We appreciate this restaurant - the owner, the chef and waitress that made our days in Paris a joyful and lovely trip.", 'One of my favorite restaurants in Paris. Truly exquisite dishes, though they are a bit different than the ones served at more traditional restaurants. Nevertheless everything here is wonderful.', 'This restaurant was a true hidden gem! I was craving Pho in a huge way and thought we would give this place a a try. We actually ate there twice it was so good! We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food and the great service! The Pho was extremely flavourful! We tried a new dish to us G√† B√∫n Ch√† Gio and the owner came over to show us how to season the dish properly. The food came out very hot (temperature) the chilies were super hot too!', 'The food was delicious and freshly cooked , the staff really friendly and the prices are fair']

Adresse: 61 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75015 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Delicious onion soup, tuna, caesar salad, and cr√®me br√ªl√©e. The service was excellent and very quick! If I remember it correctly, our very friendly waitress‚Äô name was Fatou. The atmosphere and decoration are also great.', "Felt horrible in this restaurant, you are given an English menu with at least 70% less of the options with terrible American food such as chicken with bbq sauce. We come to Paris for a reason and it's to explore local food and culture, so it felt they were treating us as bad quality tourist, I even had to get the menu myself because the waiter didn't serve us in time.", 'I went today in restaurant with my boyfriend and it was a good experience. Service is very good and staff are friendly and fast, and english speaking and helpful.
Food is simple yet delicious.
We both had a bacon cheese burger with fries.
Location is good.', 'Had a great meal here, and their menu is decent with a wide range of selections at Paris standard price.

Our servers were all very friendly and happily spoke to us in English also chatting with us when we asked questions about the food and about Paris.

Our food was delicious and the portions were huge! Would recommend this place!', 'We loved our food here. We are considered foodies and had a hard time finding good food while in Europe. We were staying at the Art Eiffel hotel and the front desk guy suggested this place. I ordered the zinc burger and it was amazing. It honestly was the best burger I have ever had in my life!! I am american I have eaten many burgers. My daughter loved her sandwich as well. I tasted hers and it was ok but I guess everybody has different tastes. The prices are reasonable and the service was great.']

["Most of the dishes are already prepared, so you just pick what you prefer and they'll heat them up. I didn't try these ready-to-eat dish since I don't like the concept, but I  had the freshly cooked Vietnamese noodles (Ph√¥) which was good, rich in taste and quantity. My friends ordered the noodles with raviolis, which was good as well.", 'Cheap in euros compared to other restaurants, delicious, and good amount of serving. We eat here almost everyday during our trip.', 'The squid is my favorite! Although many similar restaurants serve this dish, the squid here is the best, in my opinion.', 'I‚Äôm touring here from USA, CALIFORNIA. THIs place is GOLD! Got pho, need noddle soup and chicken noodle soup, it is the food needed especially in March weather.

Venmo desde California- comida esta deliciosa! Las sopas bien deliciosas y buen cantidad.

10/10 - delicioso. DELICIOUS!!!', 'Good restaurant with perfect prises and delicious food. We bought menu for 12‚Ç¨ and it was amazing']

['Our group of four came here for dinner the other night and we ended up having the best time. Our waiter was funny and attentive, the decoration is well done, and the flavor of the dishes really surprised everyone. Everything we ate was good. Same goes for everything we drank: the Moroccan wine and mint tea. On top of that, we were there on a night they had a belly dancer performing. 10/10 atmosphere. I had to tell all my friends about this place.', 'This place is amazing ü§©
First Moroccan food experience for me and I really enjoy ü§©
Foods are very tasty and personnel is very helpful and sincere üëçüèª
They offer halal food, as I understand only duck is not halal but you can ask it. They will guide youüëçüèª
We ordered tajine d‚Äôagneau and couscous chicken. Both of them are very tasty üòã
Tajine‚Äôs lamb cooked well, there was no smell of lamb, they seasoned the lamb well üëçüèª
The sides of couscous is also very tasty, aubergine, potatoes, carrot cooked very good the sauce of them was impressive ü§© the grape was very tasty üòã  I really recommend. The couscous itself well enough to be full üëçüèª but please don‚Äôt hesitate to order second dish üòÅ
We also drink coffee, it was very hard but flavor makes the taste unique, I also recommend it, their coffee taste like Turkish coffee, you might need to add sugar üòÅ
You can also reserve table, keep in mind it might be hard to find a table without reservation.
The ambiance is very authentic as well, it is so easy to learn some Moroccan culture even staring the wall üòä', 'Been here twice now and we enjoyed it every time. The vibe is lovely and cozy. My partner grew up in morocco and this place felt like home for him. Service is great too, you can expect typical Moroccan warm and good service here.

We only visited in evening/weekend but we saw that they also have a nice lunch menu on weekdays for around 14‚Ç¨', 'We were looking to try something different in Paris and stumbled around this place. The vibe here is cozy. We loved the owner he personally came and explained the food as it was out friest time trying this cuisine. Loved the food we ordered. Must try!', 'Large portions, tasty food, great prices, no complaints. 10/10 would come again. Big up the tajine. Big up the pastries.']

['Good pizza in a fairly simple setting. The price is pretty fair but the service leaves something to be desired. We would frankly like to have a little more smile and desire to do well from the staff but without anything dramatic, a small 4 star or a big 3 star. Overall I recommend. The toilets are clean and spacious.', 'Good atmosphere and good pizza', '', '', '']

['Sadly I think this cute little hotel is permanently closed. I‚Äôve been watching it for the last 3-4 years, having stayed there in 2018.  There‚Äôs a plywood barrier all across the front and a keep out sign. It‚Äôs been that way for a couple of years. Too bad. We really enjoyed our stay and it‚Äôs very convenient.', 'Comfortable hotel in a very good location. Lovely area of Paris. Rooms are a bit tight but we were comfortable there for 3 nights.
Very comfortable bed and good water pressure in the shower. Bath tub is a good size considering the room size.
Elevator is tiny but adds to the charm of the place. Great view from the breakfast terrace. Hotel staff ready to assist when needed.
I would return to this one.', 'A nice hotel with pleasant and helpful staff who all spoke English. Good breakfast served on the sixth floor terrace with a view over the rooftops north towards the river. The hotels location is very good, being right next to the Metro line 12 which means you can get anywhere quite quickly. Only a 15/20 minute walk through the rive gauche and over the river to the Louvre. Would happily stay there again!', "Excellent price/quality ratio. Small hotel, good for people that need a quiet clean place to stay for a few nights. Excellent location, quick connection to the subway, within walking distance from most famous venues (Eiffel tower, Museum of Invalides, Arch of Triumph. The day I arrived a very nice woman was at the reception. She guided me on how to get quick to where I wanted to go - for business, for siteseeing and for the airport. I didn't try the breakfast there because I was in a hurry.
I would recommend this hotel to all people staying at Paris.", 'Only 1 plug in my room (in the bathroom!), thin walls and ceiling, so no quite night for me!
This hotel seemed old, but not the charming kind. Their online pictures probably date from years ago, which is misleading. This hotel needs renovation! Especially if the owner wants to charge 165‚Ç¨ per night, which is way too much for what you get. I have had much better hotels in Paris for this price.
Positive comments: the location of course the staff was friendly! I pity them for working in such a hotel...']

['I did not get my order as it should be ! Disgusting! Where are the crevette tempura ????', 'Order was partial but absolutely no way to contact them to get a partial refund: The listed phone number is a malfunctioning bot which will hang up on you. What a joke!', 'This one star goes for the guy who brought me my lunch in bicycle.\nI strongly suspect that the reviews on Google and Deliveroo are manipulated by friends supporting friends on social networks.\nI just ordered on Deliveroo one of the so called Menu. The sushi rice isn‚Äôt fresh, it tastes sticky and strange, indicating it‚Äôs been prepared many days ago. Customer service is lacking. I do not recommend this place at all.', "I am guesstimating it is 1‚Ç¨ of salmon for 21‚Ç¨ of rice (company margins). I wish this ratio was larger on salmon. I could not finish all this rice. The cheese cake isn't really one. Sweet speculoos milk cake would be a fitter name. Expect to barely taste the cheesiness.", 'Amazing sushi with good portions. Very informative and kind staff. We got the super salmon. Definitely recommend!']

['I was very excited to try out Arpege since it‚Äôs the first 3 star Michelin in Paris that focused mainly on vegetarian dishes. Over the years it has branched out to offering an additional dish of either fish or meat if you choose to do so.
This restaurant was a pleasant surprise honestly.  I love vegetables and I try to eat healthy but I don‚Äôt believe in compromising taste‚Ä¶ Arpege accomplished that and got me excited over vegetable dishes?!?! They were very creative and the culmination of taste was perfection.  Lots of dishes so you won‚Äôt be bored. I mean even my husband enjoyed it and he‚Äôs definitely more of your typical steak guy lol.
This Michelin restaurant is absolutely worth it, and we have been to a lot.
The chef did such a  phenomenal job on practically every dish; one dish I loved so much that it almost converted me to be completely vegetarian lol.', 'An amazing experience, The food was nothing short of extraordinary. Each dish offered a harmonious balance of flavors and textures, exquisitely plated with artistic flair. Every bite was a testament to the culinary expertise of the Chef. Emotional lunch. Thanks', 'I have been to some Michelin stars restaurant before and to be honest, the food was very average here. We didn‚Äôt have a unique experience. It was very veggies focused, only one fish dish and one lamb course, both very small. Doesn‚Äôt worth ‚Ç¨500 per person at all‚Ä¶ Also, the service wasn‚Äôt the best‚Ä¶', '**A Creative Plant-Based Journey with Some Pacing Issues**

My wife and I recently dined at Arpege, a 3-star Michelin restaurant that specializes in a plant-based menu, and as vegans, we were thrilled by the creativity and variety offered throughout the evening. The tasting menu was nothing short of spectacular ‚Äî each dish was an inventive, well-balanced experience, showcasing fresh, vibrant ingredients in ways that were both surprising and delightful. Every course felt like a culinary masterpiece, with bold flavors and beautiful presentations.

The service was impeccable throughout the night. The staff was warm, attentive, and knowledgeable, which added to the overall experience. They made us feel welcome and catered to every detail without being intrusive.

However, one area that fell short was the pacing of the meal. While we thoroughly enjoyed the first few courses, the dinner extended to 4 hours, with the last three courses taking over two hours to arrive. This long delay significantly affected the flow of the evening and left us feeling a bit restless by the end. We understand that fine dining often takes time, but the extended wait toward the latter half of the meal felt excessive.

Overall, the food and service were exceptional, but the timing issues did detract from the otherwise incredible experience. We would still recommend the restaurant to anyone looking for a top-tier plant-based dining experience, but hopefully, the pacing can be improved in the future.', 'The chef is amazing in being able to create surprising dishes that come from produce coming straight from his farm in Normandie. Each dish is so sophisticated combining textures and flavours you would never have produced yourself; the freshness of the ingredients comes through in every dish. The bread is freshly made in the restaurant; it looks countrified but it is actually soft on the inside and flavourful. I ordered the lunch set and it was filling without being excessive. I am now convinced that, in the right hands, a vegetarian approach can be as nutritious as a more traditional protein centric diet.']

['Charming spot at Place de Breteuil that perfectly captures the French atmosphere. The decor is elegant and inviting. Lovely to stay at the terrace.', "One of the best restaurants we went to in Paris.  The food here was excellent, from the starters to the main course to the dessert.  The maitre'd was funny and extremely helpful.  This will be our go-to dinner spot when we come back.\n\nNote to Americans: Parisian waiters will not hover at your table.  If you want something, you have to call one over.  For all the people talking about how slow the service is, be aware that this is a cultural thing, not a bad service thing", 'A warm summer night when you want to treat yourself to good traditional French food with a view? Choose the quiet terrace of Grand Bistro de Breteuil off the Invalides. A favorite in our family.', 'The bad reviews were from the old bistrot, this one just opened and is really nice', 'Great location. Great food. Great value.']

['The chicken itself had not such a good taste, only the sauce you add. The chicken pieces has a little grease. Meat was better. Too Expensive for the quality of food, you pay for the atmosphere and neighborhood.', 'Review of a tourist -
The location and setting is so serene yet stunning, it‚Äôs a great neighborhood option if you‚Äôre close to the Eiffel.
We ordered the sweet and sour chicken, stone tartare, coconut rice and veg curry and enjoyed all our our dishes. A true fusion of Asian and French. The banana chocolate rolls were also quite special. Portions are on the smaller side, food tastes fresh and light.', 'Nice and cosy restaurant.
The seats are comfortable and the food there is very tasty. They also have great cocktails. It would highly recommend ‚Äúles larmes du Tigre‚Äù which is one of my favorite dishes.', 'Always a pleasure to go back! Great dishes. We love the ‚Äúlarmes du tigre‚Äù and coconut-simmered pork. For dessert - chocolate cake and chocolate crispy rolls are delicious.', "Best food I've had in a long time, the pork was so we'll cooked and portion was fantastic. The coconut rice went so well with it.

Desert 10/10 as well as the service!"]

['My favourite breakfast/brunch place to go! They make the best cheesecake and every dish I tried over the years is healthy and absolutely delicious. The service is very quick and friendly as well. My French friends love this place as well. Will go here as often as I can.', 'Nice interior design, perfect for lunch or brunch. Lots of vege option. Nice, English speaking staff. Lunch sets can be soup with half sandwich or full sandwich with lemonade.', "It was a very good service, the staff could speak english and it was quite comfy to be... also the food was delicious, we will comeback surely.
The prices was also good for everything and we were really grateful bc they were really respectful and nice. We don't speak french too much so they were really nice to us... we have been discriminated a lot... but here was really wonderfully nice to us.
REALLY THANK YOU!!", "Le Pain Quotidien (LPQ) is a Belgium based bakery/eatery with a handful of branches around Paris including the LPQ on Rue de Varenne.  Opening hours are 8am to 8pm daily.

We stopped at this LPQ recently and had an expectedly good lunch. Service was polite, friendly and timely. Menu is pretty much the same as what we've found in Belgium LPQs. During our late lunch, we enjoyed the Buddha Bowl and Falafel Bowl salads, both of which were composed of fresh ingredients and tasted fresh and very good.

Overall, we enjoyed out lunch at this Le Pain Quotidien. It was exactly what we were looking for and perfectly met our expectations. This is a good place for those looking for light and healthy meals in casual, comfortable and communal environs.", 'The worst food experience I had in Paris in the last 3 days. Got attracted to the place by the good reviews and proximity. What a total disappointment for ‚Ç¨30....The shakshuka bowl contained an almost cold poached egg, wilted lettuce and the feta, pepper and tomato base was also cold, watery and tasted only if vinegar (they seemed to have gone over the top in adding vinegar to keep the poached egg from falling apart). The mini bowls of lentils and beetroot ‚Äòcaviar‚Äô (at around ‚Ç¨5 per tiny bowl) came with only one piece of bread between them and in dirty plates. Overall even one star is too much...']

Adresse: 74 Bd de la Tour-Maubourg, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews:
['The best food I had in Paris! Each dish was balanced in flavor and texture. The staff were so kind and fun!
Thank you for the experience!', 'This is the best meal I‚Äôve had in Paris! The food quality was superb. The offerings were simple but on point. Vegetarian and fish options were not an afterthought. They were perfect. Beautiful presentation, and best of all, the service! What more could I ask for? I will be back next time. I am in Paris.

An additional note. This restaurant is one block away from a busy corner and gives you a calm atmosphere of a quieter environment just one block away from the bustling city.', 'Indulged in a solo dining experience at a charming French restaurant after a long voyage and day of meetings. Started with a lovely glass of Chablis which suited the entire menu well. The foie gras, presented in substantial proportions alongside thoughtfully paired pickled and fresh vegetables, was great (I was craving fois gras). Then I had the duck, which came with a deep sauce and wonderfully cooked French vegetables, the kind you‚Äôre hoping for when visiting France. Finally the chocolate moulleux cake, with fresh ice cream which was as delicious as you‚Äôd expect after the quality of the first two courses. I sheepishly finished nearly every bite of every dish. Merci to the staff for their kind and attentive service. Definitely recommended.', 'Lovely experience on the recommendation of our hotel concierge. Four amazing courses, including a duck breast with unbelievable flavor.

Highly recommend.', 'We went 2 nights ago at Pasco restaurant. The food was amazing, everything we ordered perfectly cooked from appetizers till desserts. The service was great, the staff very warm and respectful. We enjoyed the dinner at Pasco. Highly recommend if you are staying at 7th Arrondissement.']

Adresse: 16 Av. de la Motte-Picquet, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews:
['It‚Äôs is pity that photos of classic dishes rarely look as good as those of modern ones. Yet the explosion of flavours that we experienced here last night reminded us that the constant race for what comes next is not always an automatic solution to providing the deep and intense pleasures that what came before can so often provide. Fantastic experience!', 'Got here at 8pm but somehow left at 10:50pm not because we were enjoying our time, because we were waiting for our food to arrive.

The bread, butter, cheese and desserts was good. However, we ordered the yellow wine chicken and we were left disappointed with our food. Considering we were paying ‚Ç¨39 for our food we expected the food to be more flavourful and the meat to not be so dry. The food was also relatively cold and considering we waited so long we expected it to be more fresh.', 'The cozy little restaurant has a great atmosphere and is a wonderful place to experience French cuisine. Both waitresses were very warm and provided excellent service and the dishes were delicious. However, make sure to book a table at least a day in advance! At least during my stay in Paris, they were very busy every day.', "Unfortunately, our experience at this restaurant wasn‚Äôt the greatest.

Firstly, we highly recommend making a dinner reservation; otherwise, you‚Äôll have a long wait for a table.

When my partner and I were seated, we found ourselves extremely close to our neighbors. The person seated inside had no way to get in and out without moving the table, which was very inconvenient and uncomfortable. It was also difficult to get the staff‚Äôs attention as they were extremely busy, and when we did, the service felt very rushed.

Food-wise, the escargot and foie gras tasted nice but weren‚Äôt amazing or refined. The veal kidney dishes are certainly not for everyone, especially foreigners, so make sure you know what you‚Äôre getting. The French fries that came with the main dish were cold by the time they reached the table and soon became inedible. Their famous souffl√© dessert, although light and fluffy, was too sweet for our liking, making us wonder why it's so popular.

Overall, we felt the experience wasn‚Äôt worth the price. If you do decide to go, make sure to make a reservation, specify your seating requirements, and be prepared for a busy and noisy environment, especially at dinner. Oh, and unless you‚Äôre willing to pay ‚Ç¨8 for a bottle of still water, just ask for tap water.", "If you are looking for an authentic taste of traditional French cuisine in a charming setting, it's the place to go."]

['We had an lovely experience at Pacha Hammam! We were a group of three friends, and every moment was delightful. Karima was absolutely fantastic‚Äîher facial and body massage were incredibly relaxing and professional. Sara was very helpful, and the gommage was superb, leaving our skin feeling rejuvenated. The lunch was also delicious, a perfect way to complete the experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a relaxing moment!', 'Came to this place last minute‚Äîand was extremely satisfied by my experience. It was just what I needed after a long day of walking around! Sherraz at the reception was so helpful, and the massage (by Karima) though only 15 minutes hit all my knots. I left relaxed, and ready to enjoy the rest of my stay in Paris! I will be back whenever I‚Äôm in this city again.', 'Highly recommend for the wonderful staff, cleanliness, excellent service and delicious food. This was my first hammam experience and I absolutely loved it. I can‚Äôt wait to go again. There is no reason to be self-conscious about being mostly naked around the other women. I felt very comfortable after about 10 minutes of getting used to the environment. Most women wore only bikini bottoms. I visited in May 2022 with a group of friends. Djiga and Faty were very welcoming. One person in our group spoke French, and the rest of us did not. Everyone very welcoming and patient with us. The jasmine tea before our service was delightful and set the tone for a tranquil and pampering experience. The welcome video was very helpful. The locker room was very comfortable and clean to change our clothes. The steam room, seating area, sauna and spa were excellent. The body scrub was fabulous. Thanks to Cherraz and Nadia for our massages which were very relaxing and refreshing. I bought a bottle of the massage oil to bring home with me because the experience was so wonderful. Lunch was incredibly fresh and delicious. It was some of the best tagine I ever ate. Kadiza and Nadia are amazing chefs. We spent 4 hours there and I enjoyed every minute. I can‚Äôt wait to go back.', 'I had the most relaxing day at Hammam! Karima took amazing care of me, guiding me around the spa, giving me an excellent hot stone and regular massage. She is so kind and so funny! All the staff here, from reception to food were lovely. The steam room had the most amazing essential oil steam and the sauna was great. I absolutely love the tagine they serve for lunch. I 100% recommend for a girls day or solo day in Paris', "Great experience! Faty at the reception was super nice and helpful, and the premises are beautiful. If you don't have a bathing suit, it was possible to get a one-time-use bikini bottom. If you also want something to wear on your chest, you should bring it from home.\n\nKarima gave me a great massage! The good was also really good, and it was a big portion. Overall a wonderful first Hammam experience for me :)"]

['I am a vegetarian which basically means I could only have a salad. I asked the waiter if the chef could make me something, and he suggested a veggie dish. I was pleasantly surprised by what he had prepared. It was delicious! My husband tried the mashed potatoes that were on my plate and went ga ga for them. He told the waiter they were excellent and about 5 mins later, the chef had sent out a bowl of them for my husband! The apple tart was amazing! Great experience!', "Textbook place. It's really an examplary old school place with technical excellence

Pate is the best I've had, very clean flavours and super well packed, it doesn't crumble at all. Texture was firm and harkens to hard jelly

Beef bourguignon was alright, it's very particular. The sauce is strong w wine and also chunky, it's really not for everyone. But beef was fine

Confit duck flavour was impeccable, not the most crispy but the fats had the proper strong caramelised aroma. Very good

And the dish that stunned: mille feuille pigeon. A dish that's a flex, the thinly sliced potatoes were superbly crispy and well caramelised, rare pigeon was tender and well charred too. Jus was thick. All around winner, this is a must try

Souffle was super fluffy, light, sweet and well crusted. Flavour was great, although it's really quite sweet

An institution not to be missed, get the pate, pigeon and souffle. They're expensive but for good reason, it's definitely value for money in terms of the technical precision as well as it translating to actual taste", 'Great beef bourguignon! Tasty, succulent and extremely tender! Taste like it‚Äôs been boiling on the stove for a week to get this flavour. One of the best in Paris after tasting so many! Veal chop is very tender and juicy but could do with a bit more seasoning. Fantastic Mille feuille! Crispy, delicate and just the right amount of sweetness. Probably one of the best in this restaurant class in Paris! Don‚Äôt order wine by the glass though as it‚Äôs not worth the money for the tiny glass you get. If there is a party of 2, get a bottle instead. At the end of the day and more importantly, will I go back to eat there again? Absolutely sans the small wines by the glass! Treat yourself to one of the best beef bourguignon meals in Paris! It‚Äôs a must-visit!', 'Small cosy restaurant that serves very good duck config and if you are there on Wed Lunch, there is a roasted lamp which is amazing. Staff is very warm and service oriented. Great experience overall.', 'We were a bit intimidated at first since this was the first restaurant we came to in Paris. A small restaurant with a lot of character. We soon felt right at ease and like we found a neighborhood gem. We started with the morel mushrooms and wow they were tasty. Wine was also good. I ordered the beef burignon with pasta and my husband got the confit duck. Both dishes were super delicious and filling. We had to end our meal with their famous grand marnier souffl√©, it is massive and delicious. They ended it all off with a fabulous tray of treats with an almond twill that was wonderful. Espresso was also great.']

['Great experience dinning here. Highly recommended when you are in Paris to try authentic french cuisines. The chef prepared special vegiterian dishes for us.', "EXCELLENT!!!
ENGLISH FRIENDLY
SHOUT OUT TO THE KITCHEN STAFF!

Food:
Prep area continuously cleaned, no cross contamination anywhere, kitchen was spotless, food was cooked precisely and in a timely manner, 5/5 steak (couples meal), great wine selection

Service:
Excellent! We didn't have a reservation and we were still able to be seated. The staff took care of us and gave great suggestions. Wine paring was also very well.

Atmosphere:
Think of fine dining and you have the right image in mind.

WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK", 'Some of the best food I‚Äôve had in Paris and the certainly the best and most kind serving experience. They made space for my family despite us not having a reservation and the restaurant being completely full. The food was absolutely amazing sith each dish we ordered better than the last. The staff were humorous and amiable.

Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in Paris and hungry!', "We visited this restaurant because it was highly recommended by our cab driver coming from the airport, and our Airbnb host, so we took it upon faith 2 different people, it must be good.

Well, they weren't wrong!!!  Wow, was it good.

Our first visit we had different plates and entr√©es, and all of which were incredible.  The escargots were extremely tasty, and their fried shrimp to die for.

My wife and I ordered the ribeye steak for 2, and others took there own individual plates, which each dish was incredible.

Their wines are fairly priced, and the creme brul√©, extremely delicious.

We were so impressed we reserved it immediately for our last night before leaving Paris.

Of course, equally the exact carbon copy of the first visit, they did not drop the ball, and were equally delicious and identical on the second visit.

I definitely recommend visiting this gem", 'Very good place with excellent service; the staff is very nice. The only problem is that the menu is quite limited, and sometimes they don‚Äôt hit the mark.']

['My wife and I (and our dog) recently stayed at the Thoumieux Hotel in Paris‚Äôs Seventh Arrondissement, and had a very nice experience.  From the outset, hotel staff were very pleasant and accommodating, to include hauling our luggage up to our room (note:  stairs only, no elevator).  The room was nicely furnished and comfortable, though you should note that a realtor might call the rooms ‚Äúcozy.‚Äù  Not a lot of space to stash thing like your luggage, so my wife used the drawers and I lived out of my suitcase.

Breakfast is available on the first floor, and their restaurant is on the ground floor.  As noted above, the hotel is pet-friendly, and they thoughtfully brought a dog bed to our room.  No extra charge for bringing a pet along, which was nice.

The area around the hotel is jam-packed with wonderful boulangeries and a range of restaurants.  We sampled several, in addition to the hotel restaurant.

Room rates were very reasonable, especially given the location near the Eiffel Tower.  I can heartily recommend the Thoumieux Hotel.', "We recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Thoumieux in Paris, and it was nothing short of magical! From the moment we stepped into the charming boutique hotel, we were greeted with warmth and exceptional service. A special shoutout to Jennifer at the front desk, who went above and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. Her friendliness and local recommendations made our trip even more memorable‚Äîshe's a gem! The decor is chic, blending modern elegance with classic Parisian flair, making the ambiance feel both luxurious and cozy.

One of the true highlights of our stay was meeting Ubu, the hotel's resident cat. Ubu adds such a delightful touch to the experience, wandering around like the true king of the hotel. His friendly and laid-back presence makes the hotel feel like home, and I found myself looking forward to our daily encounters. It's not every day you meet a cat with such personality!

The rooms were impeccably clean and stylish, with thoughtful amenities and a comfortable bed that made it hard to leave. The location is perfect for exploring the city, and the restaurant downstairs is a must-try‚Äîdelicious food with impeccable service.

Overall, Hotel Thoumieux exceeded all of our expectations. If you're looking for a unique Parisian experience with a touch of feline charm, this is the place to be!", "The location of the hotel is great.  The rooms were clean and spacious by European standards. We were 2 floors up from the street via a narrow staircase.  No elevator. That is also not uncommon and hotel staff did offer to assist with our bags. The front part of the main floor was under construction which spilled over into the reception area. Two small areas of concern.  1) We believed we had paid a rate that included breakfast. When I went to check it out in the morning for my wife and I, staff informed my we did not have breakfast included. My wife decided to stay in the room and get ready to leave. I ordered coffee and looked at news for about 30 minutes. At that time, the staff informed me they made a mistake and we did have breakfast included. It was too late for either my wife or I to enjoy it as we had to get to the airport. 2) They have a cat(s). The house cat was cute enough but I have an allergy and he/she obviously goes into guest rooms. I had to block the cat from entering the room with us each time. If you love cats, you might enjoy this but if you don't, beware.", "Pauline was super kind and helpful. She managed to provide us with a beautiful long table to celebrate our friend's wedding on a Friday night. Service was excellent, food was great and so were cocktails. They were also very accomodating to create a customized dessert (cakes) within the set menu to make the celebration even more special. Thank you Pauline & team! Music and atmosphere are great for the 10pm service.", 'We had a dinner at the restaurant. The decoration, athmosphere was romantic & chic. It is located in a street where you can see the Eiffel tower! Highly recommend']

['The place was nice! I wish the food would‚Äôve been better. The chicken was dry and had little taste.', 'Booked this because it was recommended on a bistro gastronomical list. This was VERY disappointing in both the food and especially service. On any times we had to repeat to the waiter who was just overwhelmed and completely lost. He forgot dishes and when we went to pay he didn‚Äôt remember at all what we ordered‚Ä¶. The dishes were extremely underwhelming , nothing special or tasty or different. I didn‚Äôt even finish my entrec√¥te . Conclusion: go somewhere else.', 'We went there on a quiet Sunday evening. Service was extremely nice, the barman (maybe the owner?) showed attention as we ate the bread, he brought some more without asking. The tatare we had was really delicious. Highly recommended!', 'We enjoyed our food but the restaurant was a little chilly. Yes, winter in Paris. It was a limited menu for lunch. The choices were all good, burger, chicken penne, pan roasted fish, and beef tartare. Service was excellent.', 'We loved this place! Such friendly and efficient service. Steak tartare was superb.']

['The best Cobb salad I‚Äôve ever had in my life. However they season & prepare the roasted chicken that comes on top the salad is beyond me. I will be coming back every time I visit Paris!', 'Nice place in the pockets of Monparnasse area, got a great location to do the famous sport of watching people in Paris as you sit back and enjoy your drink and food.
Staff were really nice, they had English menu which makes it easier, we tried their cheese platter and their burger which both was really nice', 'This Caf√© is overall great! Waiters are friendly and are willing to help.

Food is of good quality , especially for a Parisian Caf√©!
You also have several options depending on your needs and wants.

I personally enjoyed the Croque Madame (ham and cheese sandwich + egg). My friend told me the Rib steak was great and tender.
Fries are a really great added-value !

Thank you.', 'Friendly and very competent/fast staff, the food and wine was awesome!', 'Had an afternoon cocktail and selection of cheeses. Lovely and vibrant wait staff who helped us with the cheese selection and engaged in conversation. Would definitely return for a quick bite before visiting the local department stores.']

['The atmosphere was beautiful and intriguing while the service was warm and engaging. The cuisine was delightful with a playful wine list. What a delightful place to spend an evening. It is romantic, sophisticated yet relaxed and unassuming. We will be back!', 'One of my favorite restaurants in Paris! My wife and I come very often! The quality and taste of the food is immaculate! The Nems, the soup, the salmon and the steak are always what we normally get!', 'Came in for the desserts and coffee. The service and location were very good.

For the dessert we got the cheesecake and souffl√©. Both were OK but I didn‚Äôt enjoy the souffl√© as much as I enjoyed the cheesecake. I felt like the souffl√© was too light and was lacking flavors. As for the coffee, it was way below average.', 'Overall this experience was decent at best.

We went expecting a very good meal (seeing the prices) but were pretty let down by the food. We ordered the dim sum, the eggplant, and the avocado tuna.

The dim sum was our favorite, it was very very good, but it definitely did not bring enough to get filled up.

The tuna and eggplant were not as good, but still decent. The burrata tasted fresh and was runny on the inside but the eggplant wasn‚Äôt great.

Service was also subpar for the price as we had to wait a long time for everything (even water)

Overall a decent experience but not worth the price', 'Came for desert as I wanted to try the famous cheesecake and I was not disappointed, I loved it!!
On the phone the lady said that the restaurant is open from 9pm for ‚Äòtea time‚Äô which is deserts and drinks, i think this is a great idea.
I was not aware that the interior was going to be as beautiful as it was, I didn‚Äôt come for dinner as the menu didn‚Äôt grab me ( was a special night so I wanted to eat the most traditional French food elsewhere) however the interior made me wish I had eaten here, definitely coming back!
(The pricing must‚Äôve been incorrect on the menu though so do note although the cheesecake is ‚Ç¨12 on the menu, i was in fact charged ‚Ç¨14. I would not expect mistakes like this from an establishment like this)']

["It's a pity that the place can be ruined by the fact that the customers are not number one. The food was tasty and made from quality ingredients! The scallop portion could have been part of the appetizers by reducing the amount of mashed potatoes, but the taste is just right. The place is beautiful and cozy, but the staff was unprofessional. It was like in a fast food restaurant where food is served quickly and new customers take their place. Even the sommelier couldn't choose a wine for the dishes we had chosen. A very expensive place considering the price and quality.", "Found this gem last minute to eat on Christmas Eve.
Our young gentleman waiter was great. I think he was the waiter for the entire place as it filled up.
I tried foie gras for the first time here. It was great. I loved the fight jam it came with.
I had the entrec√¥te steak with bearnaise sauce (delicious).
My husband had the coquillets jambon with truffle (so creamy and delicious!!).

For dessert, I ordered the pavlova, my first ever. It was a perfect ending to my meal. It was light and not too sweet, just perfect. It's the only picture I took, too.", 'This restaurant has a wonderful neighborhood vibe that makes you feel right at home. The food is absolutely amazing‚Äîeach dish is crafted with care and bursting with flavor. It is a bit pricy, but the quality and experience make it well worth it. Definitely a spot to try!', 'Had a nice dinner one evening in June. It was very tasty! I ordered the mashed potatoes and peppered steak. YUMMY! Its located eight behind a beautiful church in a nice neighborhood. We will be back for sure.', "The food doesn't match its high price. Everything was quite bland and tasteless.
However, the atmosphere is 5 stars.
I would come back here for a drink."]

['Excellent authentic Japanese food at reasonable prices. The host was a very friendly Japanese lady whose service was very good. I would highly recommend this restaurant.', 'Superb Japanese meal, with excellent service at a very sensible price given the capital location.

We were very well looked after with our two small boys, that‚Äôs not what we‚Äôre used to in Paris!!', 'Very delicious, very kind, reasonable price
- sushi, ramen, udon, kyoja all were good.
I visited three times within my five-day stay.', 'Chirashi Salmon Avocado ü•ë .

üìå This is my favorite meal of all time.. salmon, avocado ü•ë and rice üçö mixed up with soy sauce and spicy sauce.. it‚Äôs ENORMOUS

üìåI always go there when I am craving Japanese food. It is fresh and very clean

üìå Dishes are huge and so good especially the shrimp tempura üòä .

üìå It is super cheap üí∞

.', 'California with Salmon and avocado came basically salmon-free. Chewy rice (if I wanted rice rolls could have bought a box of rice at local Carrefour), never again‚Ä¶']

['Important note: Chef and menu has changed to be an Argentinian restaurant (no longer French), but it is still very good. The entr√©es and mains were excellent. The beef dishes in particular were extremely generous (justifying the price) and a selection of Argentinian wines to accompany the meal were available by glass.', 'Amazing dinner and pleasant service. I must say the atmosphere was very lovely as well. I spent around 100 Euro for just myself but it was well worth it. I very highly recommend giving this Michelin Guide restaurant a try!', 'Best meal I had in my Paris Trip. English menu available so it is tourist friendly. The service is great and welcoming. The sea bass was excellent and the sour dough were chewy. Comfy place for chat and definitely worth the price. Highly recommend this place. Thank you for making my last night in Paris so pleasant.', 'This is one of my favourite places to go with my favourite people over 10 years since it was ‚Äú√âpi Dupin‚Äù. You can always have delicious, creative and refined dishes made of fresh and seasonal ingredients with an affordable menu price. Last time, I brought my small dog. The staff were so accommodating and friendly to my dog- an extra reason why I love this place!', 'The food was amazing. Chef really knows how to do creative cuisine! Can taste many layers of flavor and sauces in every dish.\nMy favorite one is the grilled octopus ü•∞\nFor the dessert cheese, you‚Äôll get incredibly large portion. Cheese lover don‚Äôt miss it.']

["Quiet restaurant. Well cooked food, almost to perfection, but unfortunately the flavour combinations didn't blend at times. We had the Langoustine Ravioles, perfectly cooked, the flavour profile of Parmesan, orange and avocado didn't work for me. The lobster couldn't have been better cokked or served, but the accompanying puree was a bit salty. Worth a visit.", 'What a way to end our Paris trip! The staff was excellent, the food and wine pairing even better. They were easily able to accommodate nut allergies without sacrificing quality one bit.', 'We wanted to try a Michelin restaurant during our visit to Paris and Auguste provided us with one of the most memorable highlights of our trip.

The lunch menu, for a Michelin starred restaurant, was an incredible value proposition (less than 50 euros per pax at the time of writing) and we even paid a little more to try their reccomended red mullet dish. The flavors and attention to detail shine through each of the three courses we had for lunch. Special mention to the sorbet, probably the best we have ever tried anywhere.

We would also like to commend the waiters for their excellent service and explanations on the dishes we tried.', 'The food was delicious, however I take issue with this restaurant‚Äôs practice of ‚Äúsegregation‚Äù which is surprising and disappointing to see in this day and age. Placing people of the same race in the same section doesn‚Äôt intimate inclusiveness and respect.

Edit: I changed from 2 stars to 1 because I just received threats from this restaurant‚Äôs owner. Also I added some photos as proof of my visit.', "A fine, affordable Michelin one-star restaurant. I made my reservation for the same day; I can't say why it's not packed. I had the prix fixe 5 course menu for 96 euros: frog leg soup (my first time having frog; tastes like chicken!), clam/calamari paella, monkfish, quail, then berry pavlova. The only course that could have been a little better was the monkfish. The fish was a touch overcooked, and the carrot sauces were bland. Otherwise a full-on recommendation"]

['We popped in around 9pm on a Wednesday and it was just us and the owner. He speaks excellent English, was very friendly, and the food was exquisite. I had the Duchess crepe and my wife had the Breton, both were served steaming hot with a scoop of delicious vanilla ice cream melting in the middle. These are next level crepes, not like what you get from street vendors, far superior. I also had the Cafe Li√©geois, so very good. I would bet everything on the menu is delicious.', 'We were walking from Louvre to the Eiffel Tower, and happened to be in this street around lunch time, so we went in this small restaurant in the heart of Paris. The owner of this place is such a friendly and energetic person, fluent in several languages and extremely endearing. The food is beyond description, you should just go there and try it! I recommend you to get cider, a galette (salty pancake) with small green salad and a cr√™pe (sweet pancake) as a desert. If you are coming with friends, get at least a bottle of cider and one small green salad is fine to be shared.', 'Stumbled upon this place before going to the Rodin Museum.  2 crepes, small salad, and 1/2 bottle of wine for 34 Euros.  The buckwheat crepes were outstanding.  The wine was good excellent although everyone else was having the cider.  Would definitely recommend.', 'Found this place while walking the streets of Paris. Now when ever I am back in Paris it will be a must stop. Both the buckwheat crepes and the sweet crepes were excellent. I had a duck and egg crepe. My wife had a breakfast on with egg, cheese, and bacon. We then shared a banana, Nutella, and ice cream crepe for dessert.', 'We were craving for crepes and found this in the area. I really lovedddd the simple but traditional French crepes. The crepes were chewy/gummy in a really good way and the toppings complimented them so well. We got the duchess and the one with pear and caramelized sugar/toffee. It was soo addictive! The owner was extremely nice and friendly. We were trying to find a grocery store to buy some essentials for my daughter n he helped us with that. There‚Äôs also wifi here!!!\n\nWill definitely return and highly recommend!']

['Food was ok by sushi standards. Service was severely lacking. Never received a drink. The servers never came back to ask if we needed anything else after the first time. The app was glitchy and everything was in French so it was difficult to navigate.', "Ordered through Uber eats and my edamame and crispy rice were cold, crispy rice was so hard I almost chipped a tooth. To pay $90 for an order and barely be able to eat it, then waste sake because you can't drink on an empty stomach was just such a sad experience for such an expensive delivery. They even charged extra for ginger and it was in packets not fresh!", 'We had a wonderful last night in Paris! No problem getting in with all our bags üòÖ and then the experience just got better and better! We had never been in a sushi bar, so the concept was new to us, but we quickly got the hang of it and started devouring dish after dish. As a vegan I found a couple suitable options, and had some mango for dessert as well.
Finally, we had a little chat with the employees about our travel plans, left a tip (remember to tip your serversüòâ), and got some little presents from the manager! Such a memorable night!

Would absolutely recommend going here during your stay in Paris :)', "As far as Japanese conveyor belt restaurants go, this one is not so bad at all. Good fresh offerings and a very efficient in and out in quick time if you're busy and want a quick meal.", 'Good quality, wish there is no sashimi without rice on the belt ;)']

['This is a hidden gem in Paris. If you are tired of the bars that have the most fashionable chairs and somewhat uptight servers / bartenders - then this is the place for you. The bartender is extremely chilled out and in no rush to sell you things. In that sense, the hospitality is very welcoming- you feel at home. The menu does not have a lot of offerings but even the limited ones - it‚Äôs great. The bar is better if you are a wine drinker since they have a limited connection sourced directly from the producers. This isn‚Äôt much of a whisky place. Yet, if that‚Äôs the reason stopping you- you are better off going that not. The vibe and ambience is great. I would encourage the owner to get a few more whisky bottles like Oban / laguvulin that are not very expensive and will add to a great collection. I ordered pizza bread as a starter. The dough was freshly prepared and it tasted lovely. Definitely worth a visit', 'Great Bar! Great atmosphere! Great manager in the place convince you to stay as long as possible!

The prices are really fair comparing to what we see normally in Paris!

We tried a Pizza 4 cheese beside our deink and it tasted perfect!

People here normally gather for beer drinking and sharing Pizzas! üçïüç∫', 'Harris is the best bartender ever! If you are near this bar then you should check it out. It‚Äôs a local bar, so it‚Äôs far from a tourist spot. Going there and interacting with the local customers and Harris made us feel like part of the local culture. We went back on our last night and Harris treated us so great, can‚Äôt say enough about how welcoming he is. Would recommend to anyone visiting Paris, especially if you are in this area.', 'Amazing place! Excellent service! A must stop if you are in the neighborhood. The staff is trop cool', "Probably the best bar in Paris. Cocktails are amazing, a very welcoming owner, great food (I recommend taking a cheese and meat platter or a calzone). Can't help but coming back every week. Merci Haris!"]

['The restaurant got a nice cozy interior. The service is good. The seafood pantries is rather fluffy and light. The chicken leg is stuffed with olives, it is rather tasty and not too greasy. The meat is tender.

The dessert is good, the roasted almonds are crispy and chunky, and the ice cream is smooth and creamy. We had a good time, thank you.', 'Really enjoyed our dinner here.
Good food and good service. We didn‚Äôt have a booking but were lucky we got the last table available.

We ordered the escargot and cream soup for starters and the Sirloin and the sea bream.
The sea bream‚Äôs exceptional.

Spent about 40 Euro per person.

Probably best to make a reservation if planning to dine here.

Visited in Jan 2025.', 'Amazing French cuisine! I would highly recommend! The waiters were very polite and welcoming! The only restaurant in Paris that we did not felt rushed to leave the table! We had a great time!', 'The new location is easy to find and inviting. Food was amazing! Staff was friendly and professional, and service was surprisingly fast. The prices are more than reasonable.', "I thought my memory was playing tricks with me because I couldn't find this restaurant listed at its original location. The pictures and other reviews assured me this is the place where I had a very delightful solo dinner during my trip to Paris. The servers were incredibly nice and gave me a couple of glasses of champagne on the house. The fish I ordered was perfectly cooked and the dessert was delicious! The location and setting is very cool  and unique. The place feels very old school French in a good way!"]

['Nicest staff I‚Äôve ever seen, great food, great show. Litteraly made an account to leave a review.', 'Absolutely amazing and great value for money. The tasting menu is so delicious and the teppanyaki was incredible. Lovely show and such kind and wonderful staff! Highly recommend!', "Food is excellent, but I would like to see a bit more quantity. The show is quite good with fire on onions, and lots of exciting throwing of meat into people's mouths. The decor is dark, and a little bit too sombre. The owner is incredibly nice. Expect to spend around 40 EUR per person including drinks.", 'The food is acceptable but I think a bit over priced. The show is really funny and a kind of fake for me who come from Asian and I had been to many teppan yaki places in Japan, Thailand and Singapore. I don‚Äôt like that restaurant rush you to finish dinner and accept new round of customers. This is not Teppan Yaki manner. I was disappointed that I didn‚Äôt find any Japanese in this restaurant and they didn‚Äôt offer fried rice at the end like it supposed to be. Overall, this is not authentic but I fon‚Äôt weather this might be consider good already for Paris?', "Amazing and great, the best service in Paris. Little bit expensive. But the for the quality it's worth it"]

['We came for lunch with our 3 children, whilst ordering one of our children changed their mind about what they wanted to eat, unfortunately the chef still prepared the meal they had decided to change from. When we tried to say it wasn‚Äôt what we had ordered, which he had actually made a note of, we were looked at with disgust as if we had caused the biggest problem and that it was our fault! My daughter and I had the Parisian salads - the tomatoes on our plates were brown, soft and had holes from worms or something similar being in them. Then when we left the cafe, we were literally chased down the road by the female owner shouting and running towards us, accusing us of not paying our bill, when we had in fact paid the bill with the grumpy chef‚Ä¶ utterly horrid place, bad food and bad service - AVOID', 'The owner is extremely disrespectful and rude! She gave us the biggest attitude and wouldn‚Äôt let me and my friend in‚Ä¶ She looked at us like we were rodents even though we just wanted to get a coffee and use the bathroom. I would recommend any other restaurant / coffee shop in Paris if you can! This was horrible! There is a coffee shop a little more down the road which was very pleasant and how it should be!', 'DISGUSTING!!the owner is extremly unfriendly, we asked to use the toilet in exchange for money and she just said ‚Äûno‚Äú without any explanation‚Ä¶i had to use the toilet really bad, so I asked again and she just said no and looked at us like two cockraoches. WHERE IS THE HUMANITY??\nI don‚Äòt know why she is so unhappy and rude but I feel genuenly sorry for a person like that and for all the people that have to endure her negative energy. DONT GO THERE!', 'One of the most beautiful little hidden cafe in Paris.', 'What a great little restaurant! The food is delicious and the welcome is very warm. Family run and just a great find in Paris at such reasonable prices! Excellent!']

['Friendly service, great pizza.\nWalked in with our luggage from a long flight into Paris, staff allowed us to keep our luggage inside the store while we enjoyed pizza on the side walk tables. Surprisingly many patrons eat pizza with a fork and a steak knife', 'Family-run Italian place with great food and wine collection. The pasta alle vongole was amazing. Excellent panna cotta for dessert!', 'Looking for an Italian cuisine in Saint Germaine de Pres - do not look no further. Great friendly atmosphere. Ideal for couples. Good value for money. Just be ready for 50 Euro/person and you will not be disappointed.', 'Service was good we had a reservation and table was ready for us. It was a 50th bday celebration so we all flew to Paris to celebrate. The appetizer of fried calamari came with these fried fish that no one at the table would eat. I mentioned to waitress since they insisted we needed 2 duo dishes to feed our party of 8. They were just gross. Our other pasta dishes were average. Overall just disappointed no small recognition of bday girls big 5O. Maybe not a tradition here but spending over $300 should have offered my friend a dessert with a candle .', 'This is a wonderful little gem just off the main road. My wife and I went in for dinner and couldn‚Äôt be happier with the experience and we got in just before the place really got busy. The staff was super nice and explained our questions on the menu as our French is still improving. Defiantly worth a visit and we would recommend it.']

['One of the Best beef dishes I have ever tasted..
The Arabica coffee desert is Amazing.

Very welcoming and super friendly staff.

Will come again for sure üëåüèª', 'Atmosphere and decor is fantastic. Great service. Food wise, overall very tasty, lobster bisque was a little salty but the chicken and desert was on point.', 'Needless to say, we‚Äôre really disappointed with all the dishes served. Nothing unique, nothing great and special about it. Very unexpected since we saw good ratings on this restaurant.

Ambience: 9/10
Service: 9/10
Food: 3.5/10
Wine: 9/10

We took the d√©gustation menu for dinner at 59‚Ç¨ per person, where the chef actually decides what to serve for the entire meal for all guests. (Which was a mistake to be frankly honest)  ‚Äî 2 petite versions of entr√©es, plats, and desserts at 59‚Ç¨ per person ~ not including the wine and drinks

The 2 entr√©es were sadly either under seasoned or blandly cold:

mushroom velout√© - tastes like a normal mushroom soup, lacks salt and taste.

Veau with pecorino - not really a pleasing dish, feels like i ate airplane food

Plats:
Fish with black rice risotto and black garlic- this is the most decent dish we had that night. Pretty good, but not wow.

Volaille with mais pur√©e and popcorn- this was a let-down. Most of our chicken was so dry, and the pur√©e was just ok. Sauce has lack of flavor.

Dessert:
Chocolate fondant with hazelnut ice cream- best thing about this dish: the ice cream

√éle flottante - we‚Äôve had better. Again nothing special.

The only reason why i put 2 stars is for the service. Pleasant servers and always smiling.

But overall, it did not compensate our taste, experience and expectations on this restaurant, especially for the price.

It was our first and sadly it will also be our last visit here.', 'The food was delicious and the price reasonable. The host was very attentive and prompt. Nice atmosphere. We will certainly return when in Paris again', 'Everything was wonderful. The food was even better than I had hoped (we read a lot of reviews so had high expectations)!! ["Last night dined at an incredible Lebanese restaurant. Reviews:
['The staff was very nice especially the guy with the shoulder length hair. He was very friendly and he speaks English. He was very friendly and genuine. The food was top-notch.
