Stopped in for breakfast and had a lovely meal.

üì∏ Click the photos to see what we ordered.', 'Atmosphere is really nice, but food‚Ä¶
Comparing with all EU countries it was just a disaster‚Ä¶
The view..3/10, like not a restaurant, but some Chinese cheap cafe..
Avocado toast- ü§Ø oily avocado..with huge pieces of avocado and very strange sauce üò≥
Tartar - the view of this item was weird ü§Ø
After starters the waitress asked to keep dirty knife and fork for the main dish üò≥üò≥üò≥ what???? We even didn‚Äôt have place to keep it.
It‚Äôs a Paris, are you kidding?!
The main course (fish of the day) - smell was awful and some places was not even well cooked üòî
We just left it
Sorry, but only water was OK
After dinner two of us had stomachache.

Sorry..but after owner reply it‚Äôs only 1 star.
1st I was not smiling to anyone, because I was sitting on my back to all on the restaurant corner, so sorry, but I didn‚Äôt see you.
Maybe in Paris now it‚Äôs OK - no one never asked ‚Äúhow was food, everything was tasty? ‚Äú
If you see these pictures and you are saying that This kind of view of the restaurant food is OK, then it‚Äôs really horrible thing.
In our country or even when we‚Äôve been we NEVER saw such a horrible serving dishes and taste as well.
We ve been in Paris 7 times and it was the worst restaurant in whole Paris, sorry.
My second one ‚≠êÔ∏è during 10 years of travelling and it means a lot.', 'Excellent place for brunch! Staff was very kind, professional and helpful. Food was spectacular.', 'I recently visited this restaurant and tried a few dishes. Starting with the burger, while the bun was unfortunately burnt, the meat was tender, and the sauce was delicious. However, I expected a higher quality cheddar to complement the flavors.

The Boeuf Bourguignon was fantastic! The meat and bacon were perfectly cooked, and the mushrooms and potatoes were well-mixed. The dish had a rich flavor from the wine sauce, which brought everything together beautifully.

The beer selection was outstanding‚Äîtruly flavorful. Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt say the same about the wine. Despite a variety of options, the wine I tried lacked taste and aroma, which was disappointing.

On the bright side, the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, and they spoke English, which made the experience even more comfortable.']

['Perfection. I‚Äôve never said this on google reviews but its a 10/5. So phenomenal that I don‚Äôt even have words to describe how delicious it was. Just do it if you can get a reservation', 'Great experience. A hidden jewel for the amateurs of wine and great meals. And the chief is really generous and funny.', 'Never disappoint with Hide‚Äôs dishes and wine selection. Super creative ris de veau', 'Wonderful food and service. Terrific wine list has some great discoveries even for an experienced wine enthusiast. Reservations are not always available due to high demand. Plan ahead.', 'It was my best meal in Paris so far.']

["From start to finish our visit to this restaurant was a disaster. The service from our waiter was the worst I have experienced anywhere in the world. She was rude, did not listen to our order, presented us, and others, with the wrong order, tried to charge us for another table's meal and had no idea how to fix the problem. On top of that, the food was inedible. The management of the restaurant offered us barely an apology.\nWe visited this restaurant previously and enjoyed it, hence our return. We will not make that mistake again.\nAvoid.", 'My fav so far! Amazing service and food was delish!  Thank you for a perfect end to my day. ü•∞', 'Terrible services and food. The flank steak/ butchers cut was tough and unseasoned. The service was very bad. I had to ask for salt & pepper multiple times. We asked for the bill twice and were only brought the bill because I asked the receptionist at the bar on our way out.', "Excellent camembert cheese platter was my first real introduction to French cheese and it was amazing. A great recommendation. The same goes for the ravioli. Simply put, the best I've ever had.", 'Happened by chance when I walked through this beautiful chic neighborhood with my daughter. Together deliciously eaten. Pasta oven dish and well baked entrecote. Price quality ratio is good for Paris and the neighborhood. Unfortunately the 6euro happy hour was for a beer and a cocktail per drink. A bit of a shame to attract customers.']

['This was THE WORST food I have ever eaten in Paris. The chicken burger served to me was shameful. The bread was old and falling apart,  and the chicken was frozen tenders stacked on top of each other . It was very expensive mcDonald‚Äôs style food . They took about  40 minutes to serve our food and still messed up the order. When I got what o actually ordered, I was appalled. They are taking advantage of tourists here with their terrible food and service  at very high prices!', 'It was extremely busy! Lots of tourists. We had steak tartar for lunch and pinot noir. One of the best steak tartare I ever had. I have so much respect how the waiters run the stairs up and down. Crazy!', 'I have been visiting Paris for Manet years and always stop by this place for lunch or a drink. Today was no different‚Ä¶I stopped for lunch with my 2 older teenage kids. Everything was as expected. Food is decent. The waiter asked me 4 times for a tip! I explained to him in English, Italian, French and finally Spanish that I understood that tip was not included and that I was NOT going to leave a tip unless the owner came to the table. He promptly finished the transaction. Will not be back. Sucks that they try to take advantage of tourist and put pressure on you. Plenty of better places to grab a bite or people watch.', 'I was excited to dine here with family. One of the waiters was cool, but it seemed evident to me that the other was being mocking. They tried to put an extra steak (like 40 euros) on my check. Overpriced water, I get it ‚Äî the area and all. But this was just not nice. Also, I noticed everyone upstairs spoke English ‚Äî not sure if a coincidence.', 'Had a lovely lunch here.  Got the daily special and enjoyed every bit of it.']

['Excellent experience the food is executed beautifully and menu is full of choices for every taste. The wine paring was very interesting and makes you discover unique wines. The atmosphere is a combination between very sophisticated in the dining room and very swanky vibe at the bar this makes Gaya very appealing for formal and less formal occasions.
One improvement point for me would be to have preset menu not just a la carte menu.', "Almost everything was perfect, I loved my main and dessert, the wine choices were phenomenal and my girlfriend adored every course, I couldn't stand my starter (cold Jelly and fish for ‚Ç¨48? No thank you), thankfully the rest was divine and the evening was wonderful", 'Very underwhelming experience. Staff is nice but something as basic as taking away an empty cocktail glass took nearly 20 mins and was done after we asked for it. Food is OK, we expected much better quality for the price. 5 prawns with green beans, a couple of edible flowers and tomato sauce was around ‚Ç¨60. I would have no problem paying that for a dish if it was not so basic in preparation. Fish for the same price had only onions on it paired with some sauce. Again, it was tasty, but it was definitely not the level of food we expected.', 'Incredible service, experience, and food. We had an amazing seafood experience for starters with some champagne and hope made bread with brown butter. Following, we had scallops, sea bass, and shrimp. WOW is all I can state. My favorite was the shrimp, it was incredible, slow cooked. Some amazing vanilla ice cream dessert and some apple pie. Incredible ü§åü§åüòÅ', '#67th in my Michelin Marathon in Paris
Forget about the fish! Judge on the results

It‚Äôs a fish restaurant. But you should not care. Yes you should, but you really should not. You should care because you‚Äôll have great fish and seafood dishes. I had sea urchin in a way in never had before. And this why you really should not care. Because the chef manages his dishes in a way that you forget it‚Äôs seafood or fish. It‚Äôs just great cuisine. I do think that the fact that it‚Äôs marketed as a seafood restaurant does not do it justice. Of course it is seafood. But it‚Äôs not the point.
Actually, the setting is perfectly adequate. Exterior: a deep blue and white. Interior: leather, club chairs, wood, bottles and magnificent black and white dedicated pictures everywhere (I could come back just for that!). Basically outside it does say sea but inside it‚Äôs more ‚Äúpaquebot‚Äù or luxurious yacht where you forget you‚Äôre in the middle of the ocean. You‚Äôre just surrounded by other wealthy passagers. Speaking of which, the lunch menu is of great value.
Interestingly you could spot the part of the staff who must have worked at the main restaurant and the one that did not. Nothing wrong there. But the one who must have worked in a 3 stars were obviously a notch above the rest.
You guess it. I had a very pleasant time and my guest too.
My experience: A few days after I realized that I did not remember this restaurant as a seafood one but just as a great experience and a place where I would have lunch with my darling
A very solid one star.

Update 2022: Came back a year after. Very consistent. I may admit that I preferred the first time but I would not account on the kitchen, more on the normal variations, as the lunch menu changes regularly. I always forget that the restaurant is a fish/seafood one, but I remember that I‚Äôm in a 3 stars chef one star restaurant. And It is still a very solid one star.']

['Very pink, beautiful and comfy place at Montparnasse. We stopped there only for drinks. Merci :)', 'Nice place, home cooked food. Nothing to be super excited about, but fine for a meal. We enjoyed our evening and would recommend. Really friendly, cheerful waitress. When you eat outside, the pigeons are a bit of a nuisance.", "Amazing food. Worth a visit but they should improve: Restroom didn't have soap to wash your hands. And customer service was slow in not over crowded place."]

["We were wanting to have seafood for lunch and saw this while walking around the area in Montparnasse. We had the oysters which we're so fresh and delicious! The restaurant was clean and had a good ambience. Overall a great experience and would recommend to anyone wanting to do seafood dining.", 'I was looking for sea food and a French ambiance. I got sea food and a semi-French ambiance - as far as I can tell ‚Ä¶ what does that mean: the food was really authentic, I got the mainsea food platter with lobster and added a side of fries. It‚Äôs a lot but it is great - the lobster was however mediocre - everything else was outstanding!\nAnyhow, I will come again.', 'Love this place. Good customer services. Their oysters absolutely delicious.', 'One of the best French seafood & oyster we‚Äôve ever tasted here in Paris! Price comparatively good in terms of quality and freshness!!!', 'Enjoyable lunch with good prices and fresh seafood; had the three fish tartars, mussles with cream, and oysters.']

['The ambiance of the place was pleasant, and the staff were incredibly friendly.

The food was served quickly, and the recommended dishes were spot on.

We tried the duck dish, which was absolutely perfect‚Äî10/10, incredibly flavorful and juicy.

The onion soup, also a 10/10 and highly recommended.

The flank steak had a delicious sauce and was enjoyable overall, but it was quite chewy inside, despite being cooked to a good medium level.

Apart from that, everything else we had was excellent.', 'What an amazing treasure in the heart of Rue Cler!  Cozy, welcoming, and wonderful, we felt right at home from the moment we arrived.  The staff was so helpful, spoke very good English (our French was not so good), and offered a variety of suggestions. The French onion soup, crouque monsieur and the tiramisu were all delicious.  The menu was very reasonably priced.  This  meal and the staff were one of the highlights of our Paris trip!  The experience left me wishing I lived around the corner and could visit frequently, it was that charming.  If you are nearby, you must stop in for a bite.  You will be glad you did!', 'The duck confit shepherd pie special was good but I did have to add more salt. The soup was decent but seemed chicken instead of a beef base. Disappointed by the beef bourgogne which I expected more of a stew style.', 'The food here is good overall. The escargot (half a dozen for ‚Ç¨16) is a little over priced as I‚Äôve had better value near the Arc de Triomphe, where a dozen costs only ‚Ç¨18. However, the onion soup here taste better', "TL;DR: This charming French bistro offers a delightful experience with well-executed classics, a cozy atmosphere, and attentive service

Quick Ratings:
Food: 4.5/5 - Classic French dishes executed with flair
Atmosphere: 4.5/5 - Cozy and inviting with a touch of Parisian charm
Service: 4.5/5 - Attentive, friendly, and efficient
Overall: 4.5/5 - A solid choice for authentic French bistro fare

Full Review: A Taste of Paris at La Petit Cler

This establishment brings a slice of Parisian bistro life to its location, offering classic French dishes in a charming, cozy setting. Its popularity is evident, with a bustling atmosphere especially around lunchtime.

The croque madame was elevated with exceptionally stretchy cheese and topped with a perfectly cooked sunny-side-up egg, the dish struck an ideal balance between richness and creaminess. A light leafy salad accompanied the croque, dressed in a punchy yet light vinaigrette that added a welcome freshness to cut through the richness of the main component.

To complement the meal, the Vitamine drink (a blend of carrot, ginger, and apple) offered a mellow and subtly sweet flavor profile with pleasant earthy undertones. This thoughtfully crafted beverage provided a perfect counterpoint to the richness of the croque madame.

The atmosphere is one of the strongest assets. The interior is tastefully designed with handsome dark woods providing a sophisticated backdrop to a light, bright space. This thoughtful contrast creates a warm and inviting ambiance. The cozy setting is further enhanced by street facing doors, which can be opened to blur the line between indoor and outdoor dining. This feature not only allows for excellent people-watching ‚Äì a quintessential Parisian pastime ‚Äì but also creates an airy feel when open. On pleasant days, it transforms the dining experience into something akin to a Parisian sidewalk caf√©. The inviting aromas wafting through the space further enhance the sensory experience, enticing both seated diners and passersby.

Service was a highlight, with staff being both attentive and friendly. The efficiency of service was noteworthy, especially considering the popularity during peak hours.

This bistro successfully captures the essence of French dining, from its menu offerings to its ambiance.

For those seeking an authentic French bistro experience, this establishment delivers. Whether you're in the mood for a leisurely lunch or a cozy dinner, it offers a delightful escape to Paris, if only for a meal. Just be prepared for a potentially busy atmosphere, especially during peak hours ‚Äì though the lively buzz only adds to the authentic bistro feel."]

['I feel the need to leave a review given all of the recent, poor reviews. Not only was the food delicious but the service was friendly and very good! We are so glad we came! We got the Brioche French Toast, two fried eggs, bacon, black coffee, and a flat white. Everything was wonderful. Don‚Äôt let the other reviews stop you from visiting this spot!

Also, if you are visiting with children, it‚Äôs worth noting that their bathroom has both a changing table and a training toilet seat making this spot unusually welcoming to kids!', 'Great coffee made by experienced baristas and they have a great brunch menu. Decor very modern and Parisian at the same time. Highly recommend.', 'In the area and looking for a coffee place for a quick coffee and breakfast. Coffee was good and so were the lemon cake and chia pudding. Nice cafe setting.', 'I want to write to sincerely show my gratitude of my experience at Coutume. I had a really exhausted morning but the food and hospitality here really cured me. The staff was really kind. My dinning experience was amazing. And thx again for making my day :) had one of my best coffee here', "A little cafe gem in Paris, particularly if you're after an Aussie brunch/latte style vibe. Coffee hits the spot (go double shot if you want a stronger coffee flavour) and the menu is broad enough to cater to your preferences.

Unfortunately I experienced a minor letdown in the service for a simple order (and those next to me didn't receive 1 of their 3 items), but I suspect this was a one-off circumstance that occurred during the Paralympic Games and not reflective of the everyday experience."]

['We had a such a good time here on a busy Saturday night (during the paralympics!) We were seated right away by a cheery staff member, soaked up the busy yet relaxed atmosphere, and then the servers had the good grace to humour our butchered French while we ordered some amazing onion soup and mains. The whole place had a really genuine feel and really made our evening.', 'We preferred the Bourguignon beef. It is served with mashed potatos in a bowl. I think it was one of my best food experiences in France. The meat was tender and I definitely felt the taste of the wine used for cooking. As a suggestion, the employees can be a bit more helpful and smiling towards the customers.', 'We had beef bourguignon and the roast chicken dish with a glass of red and white wine. Absolutely delicious. Was the perfect stop before heading to the Eiffel Tower. Would highly recommend!', 'Beautiful atmosphere,  the food is tasty weather breakfast or lunch. The service a bit slow however so if you are in a hurry time your schedule well.\n\nFollow me for more hidden gems around the world.', 'Great breakfast, the food was delicious, and good quality. The service was excellent and the ambience was nice. The service was quick and I was happy with the price/quality. I ordered the set breakfast for ‚Ç¨14 and was full for a long time. Their portion of juice could have been larger and the eggs were a little too greasy. Overall excellent breakfast and I would visit again.']

['Gluten free / sans gluten friendly

Had a wonderful lunch here with my hubby and another couple.   Small place that fills up.  Reservations are a must.  Just lovely dining areas.

Our server was lovely and super informative on the wines we had.   He took extra care of me due to my celiac.

Did let the restaurant know on our reservation that one of us had a gluten allergy.    They were amazing on letting me know what I can eat and that they had planned ahead for me ‚ù§Ô∏è I had special items ready for me.  Also items planned for me incase I wanted something that could not modified on the menu.

Had the chicken on the menu and a special dish that they created for me instead of the soup I asked for. Soup had bread in it.   I had a wonderful roasted tomato and herb sorbet.   It was to die for.

We will definitely be back here next time we are in Paris.', 'Terrific restaurant. We were fortunate to go with an international wine expert, and they were able to talk to him about everything, and we had 3 wonderful bottles with their great set menu. I assume they could do good recommendations even without the expertise, but for sure they have the place, the service, the food, and the bottles.', 'Incredible haute cuisine from a top chef & team. Attentive, detailed service & the open kitchen in the entrance is an excellent addition to the experience. A must visit in Paris for me and I will be returning. Complimentary small pre-starter dishes & coffee biscuits were the icing on the cake.', 'Cosy fine dining experience! The crew were so nice to explain about the dishes and to ensure that you are having a good time too (:', 'I was quite disappointing with my dinner at Garance. I visited in August 2018 and did not particularly enjoyed any of the 4 dishes on the menu (75‚Ç¨). It was not bad but something was always missing to make it good. There was no √† la carte option the night I visited. The explanation of the dishes in English was very incomplete and I did not completely understand what I was served. They could do better on service, plating, and taste.']

['The poached egg was delicious and the Baba rum came with a pour your own bottle.', 'This place is so amazing on so many levels, I was just blown away by the quality and taste of their food. Atmosphere is warm and simply amazing. Server was a really nice guy too!\n\nThank you for what you do.', 'This is a cozy traditional French neighborhood restaurant that is just wonderful. The food was delicious and cooked to perfection, the suggested wine pairing was perfect for our meal. Even if you are not in the neighborhood you will be please to make the trip for this cozy and special place.', 'Classic bistro food. I have tried over the years, the risotto, joue de Cochon and tajine D‚ÄôAgneau , all very good and highly recommend. Out of the desserts, the baba au rhum is nice and the giant profiterole stands out. Staff is nice and professional.', 'Nice service and fantastic food. Worth a visit for a dinner.']

Highly recommend for anyone looking for a true French dining experience!', 'Excellent authentic French bistro & perfect t for my friends first meal in Paris. The food quality is average, but the best feature of this caf√© is the stunning view of the Eiffel Tower from the outdoor seats. It‚Äôs worth a visit for the scenery alone.', 'I loved this cafe. The waiter was also really nice to us and the vibe of the place is very classic parisian. 100% recommend this place']

['I loved to shop in this supermarket while I am on vacation. I loved the Evian water and I almost drenched with the Evian water and it‚Äôs cheaper there when compared in Canada. Adresse: 7 Rue Barbet de Jouy, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews:
['AURIble !', 'Correct', "Exceptional! An administrative restaurant which offers very good cuisine worthy of a good Parisian restaurant! It's varied and tasty in a pleasant setting and with quality service.
This is the best administrative restaurant!", "Food generally tasty, however most of the waiters are unfriendly and serve you ridiculous portions..
It's tiring in the long run.
I don't recommend.", 'Friendly service people. However, the choice is limited, very limited for people with a meat-free diet, for example. They have a choice of fish and a predefined vegetable side dish. They are deprived of fries all year round because they are only reserved for grills.
A self-service system for side dishes would be welcome, this would allow the customer to compose their plate as they wish.
The vegetarian dishes and desserts are generally very well prepared.
Allergens and ingredients used in processed foods (sauces, soups, desserts, starters) are not mentioned anywhere.']

["I don't like to be too harsh for these kind of restaurants because they learn and it's kind of part of the game but I put only 2 stars because I tried other ones and it was the most disappointing one. ['Very good Neapolitan-style pizza. Pleasant staff. Good choice of wines. Small & cozy space.', 'Marvelous little family owned restaurant on a quiet street. ['Update: went back for a second time a few months later, officially my fav place to visit when in Paris! The food is amazing and the owner is so friendly and kind, would give it 6 stars if I could.

Oh my goodness! This place was amazing.

This felt like the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.
It‚Äôs small and doesn‚Äôt look like much but I read the reviews beforehand and knew more or less what to expect.
The service and the food is amazing, freshly prepared pizza and pasta üòç', 'Wow! What a great find. We stopped by on a cold rainy Wednesday night, and the host/chef/maybe owner was very welcoming. He spoke English well, provided great service, and made everything fresh. The food was amazing as well. My daughter was missing her favorite dish, baked ziti. She described it and the owner made something like it just for her. That is 10 star service. As we ate, we chatted with some locals at the neighboring table. They were surprised we found such a local favorite. So, beyond our great experience, I am sharing the opinion of locales (that the owner knew by name when they came in). It is exactly the place I wished I lived near. Cannot recommended enough. This place is a must go.', 'Fantastic pizzas and the owner was so friendly. You feel the passion he puts into his food, nice and cozy place you really dont want to miss it!', 'This pizzeria is amazing! The pizza is always delicious and the service is top-notch. The service manager is especially friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend giving this place a try!', 'We were visiting Paris and came across this quaint pizza house on one of our walks. We were greeted by the owner (I believe) who was really warm and welcoming. Within a few minutes of hearing the specials and placing our orders, we had our two pizzas!

The pizzas themselves were delicious. I ordered the special- margherita pizza with chorizo and my friend had another with ham, artichokes, mushrooms, olives and mozzarella. Both were so good we split halves! Overall, the service here is fantastic, the atmosphere is comfortable and the food is delicious! Stop by if you have the opportunity.']

['Their Christmas Eve diner charges ‚Ç¨220 per person. Given the price, I expect some amazing food. But it turns out to be just mediocre food. The foie gras and the wagyu beef is below average among the fine dinings. And you wait 30min for a mediocre dish, and another 30min for another mediocre one, and then another 30min, and then another 30min. There‚Äôs only disappointment but you have to wait. It‚Äôs not good dining experience at all.', 'Me and my girlfriend took her mom to the restaurant to celebrate her birthday. The service and experience was being overall good, but definitely not worth the price. But unfortunately the experience was somewhat ruined as I was eating the duck and I felt something very hard in the meat while chewing and turns out it was the bullet that was used to kill the duck! I tried to keep going and another one once again hitting my molar teeth. The waitress tried to apologise and sent additional truffles to my following dish but of course this does not compensate this unpleasant situation and the worse was that the chef never came to apologise. Overall I believe the restaurant is way to expensive for the food that was being offered and I would I would not recommend.', 'We went for the 7 course tasting menu.

It was an exceptional dining experience. Each course was expertly prepared and presented with a perfect balance of flavors and textures, making for a truly memorable culinary journey.

In addition, the service was top-notch, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who made us feel welcome and attended throughout the entire meal.', 'Had a faultless dining experience. The food was incredible!! Highly recommend.', 'Fairly priced no surprise Japanese French fusion. Loved the dessert. Very well balanced and I can have ten for the meal.. loved the wine recommended by the lady, paired well with earth tones of truffle and creamy pasta.']

['Great place to have family or business dinner for small group. The service and meals are fantastic. I enjoyed a lot my tagliatelle with truffles or the aged beef to share. The poached pear was delicious but great feedback on the chocolate souffl√© too!', 'Yesterday we arrived for our booking at 7.30. The food was great, and our waitress was wonderful. However, the entire experience was ruined by the shocking way we were treated at the end. Without any warning, we were handed the bill at around 8:45, despite just ordering more wine. Then, at 8:57, another staff member rudely told us we had 3 minutes to leave because they needed the table, even though we had already paid and tipped. We were forced to chug our drinks and leave abruptly. There was NO mention of any time limit in the booking confirmation. This kind of treatment is completely unacceptable and left a terrible impression. We will not be returning.', 'On the food:

- The tomato dish with mozzarella ice cream was innovative and perfectly executed.

- The duck was classic and I loved the sauce.

- The chocolate souffl√© was classic but done well. Piping hot and a sparing use of sugar.', 'Sat in the private room (table of 10) tucked away behind the main part and the kitchen. Very quiet. Excellent food, well presented and tasty. Great value for money.', 'Absolutely delicious dinner in a quiet street in Paris. Friendly service and delicious wines. All our courses were amazing plus there were amuse bouches as well. Highly recommend!']

['The restraunt mainly services the museum and has a variety of good dishes including burgers, salads sandwiches and some pasta, for a museum the price isn‚Äôt too exorbitant. The cashier and server were both kind in helping me pick and both spoke good English. I had a burger and it tasted good but was cold in the middle.', 'This cafeteria located inside the des Invalides complex offers diners several options.  As one enters, you line up cafeteria style.  You can grab your drinks then tell the server your choice as far as sandwich, dessert, or something from the hot bar (lasagne, noodles with meat sauce - the day we were there).  There are packages deals that provide a salad and drink with your meal, which makes it a bit more economical.  I went with the seasonal sandwich, which was excellent, a fresh salad, and a vanilla roll - all of which were very good, exceeding anything you could get at say a Subway.  The quality is good and the service is fast - an excellent choice for tourists visiting the grounds.', 'I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs with the bad reviews, I actually had the best sandwich of my life there and I wish I could remember what it was or what was in it üò´ it was in the box of sandwiches already made and it‚Äôs not on the menu. The staff were pleasant as well!', 'Good daily menus, Crepes, awesome Quiche, good prices. A nice Terrace avaliable  if not very hot in the Sommer...Staff could seem very rude at lunch hours (Super crowded) in the weekend but they are very friendly otherwise ... A food good choice in the heart of Paris if you visit des  Invalides or not...I recommend it!', 'Best turistic meal I got in Paris. Also good on a general scale. We got 2 quiches and a meat pie plus a couple of sweets and coffees.\nWaiters speaking "enough" english for the task. Clean place. Very pleasant during my visit.']

['This hotel is a must ! The service is the best I have ever encountered : respectful, generous and amazingly nice.
Location is perfect. I will come back for also the restaurant, a drink and a caf√©. They also have an intimate terrace. Thank you !', "This is such an amazing hotel, having traveled to Paris a few times, this is by far my favorite hotel. The service is incredible,  every single staff member we engaged with were extremely friendly and so helpful for any questions we had. For me the outstanding factor was housekeeping,  and their immaculate cleaning, and making sure every single amenity is replaced every day. Every day when we returned back to the hotel the room was spotless.  Such a great location too, you almost have the best of both worlds (location and peace and quiet). I truly would highly recommend this hotel, and personally I'll be staying here again when we come back.", 'Wow. This hotel is just perfection. I had read about it online, and so when looking for a hotel on the left bank, I remembered hearing amazing things.

First, the location is spectacular. Right in the heart of the left bank within walking distance to anything your heart desires - restaurants, shopping, bars, grocery stores, late night eats - everything!

What truly stood out was the exceptional level of service and attention to detail. Pschemick (I absolutely butchered the spelling of his name!) was an incredible host, bringing up our luggage, showing us to our room and all the amenities, helping us with our cabs, and always greeting us with a smile.

Upone arrival to our gorgeous suite, we were greeted with a bottle of champagne (!!) and La Dur√©e macarons which was absolutely so unexpected and just lovely. Talk about exception service!!

The room we stayed was beautifully decorated, well-appointed, comfortable, and laid out perfectly for two people. We loved the sitting room, the bathrooms (toilette separate from the shower) - especially the shower/bath combo, the furniture, the beds - literally everything.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough to anyone wanting a beautiful hotel on the left bank. This will absolutely be our go-to hotel whenever we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Paris.

STAY HERE AND ENJOY!!!', 'Prepare to be wow‚Äôd! Our hotel experience was wonderful here. The front desk service was impeccable. The room size and furnishings were wonderful. The neighborhood feels safe and was beautiful in the spring. I would stay here time and time again and plan on telling anyone who may visit to stay here as well! I am attaching photos of gorgeous floral arrangements and how spacious the marble bathroom was. WOW!!', 'Absolutely top notch. I had to move to the right bank as I had pre-booked another hotel, and I am really sorry I had to leave the Montalembert. The staff are marvelous, the hotel is lovely, the location is superb! They even gave me a birthday treat and I don‚Äôt think I had told anyone at the hotel that it was my birthday. At my new hotel, I mentioned it was my birthday, and they were like, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs nice.‚Äù From now on:  ONLY the  Montalembert. The best!!']

['Staying at this hotel for one night was an interesting experience. While the room was spacious by Parisian standards, the tiny toilet, uncomfortable shower, and very narrow corridors made our stay less comfortable. Additionally, the breakfast area was quite small, and the staff did not seem particularly welcoming.

The decoration was distinctly Parisian, which added a charming touch, but the busyness of the room‚Äôs design might feel overwhelming for those seeking to relax after a hectic day. However, the best aspects were the excellent location, which was convenient and easily accessible, and the comfortable bed, which ensured a good night‚Äôs sleep.', 'I am writing this review a couple of months after my stay here. I keep thinking about how wonderful it was. From the moment my fianc√©e and I walked in, we were treated so kindly and noticed how beautiful the place is. The receptionist that we saw for most of our stay made sure that we had a great time and knew everything that we needed to know. She also allowed us to keep our bags there until check in time since our flight was so early. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and the aesthetic of them is great. There are drinks, breakfast, and it is in a great location. I can‚Äôt think of a way that I would make my experience better. Thank you to the staff ‚ô°', 'We enjoyed a gorgeous stay at this pleasant and very friendly hotel. The location is wonderful, the team were very helpful, the quaint room was really comfortable and breakfast was great.
We will return.', 'Unbeatable location, and very quiet area. Around the clock reception which is helpful and makes you feel safe and accommodated. The staff are incredibly sweet, feels like staying with family.', 'Great Location, But Disappointing Service

I recently stayed at this hotel and booked my room the same day, which was a great deal for the area. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of St. Germain de Pres and the 6th arrondissement, which is my favorite part of Paris. Opening the window to a quintessential Parisian view was delightful, with the added charm of hearing French songs from the street below in the afternoons‚Äîlike something out of a movie.

However, the experience was marred by poor service at the front desk. While most of the staff were polite and professional, the woman at the front desk during our stay was incredibly disrespectful and unprofessional. Upon arrival, she explained things in a very impolite manner, repeatedly insisting on knowing our entire schedule, including when we planned to wake up, have breakfast, and leave the room. Despite our reassurances that we would follow the hotel‚Äôs timing, she continued to insist on its importance.

Our room was another issue‚Äîwe received two shampoos but no shower gel. When my girlfriend asked for one, the receptionist initially refused to believe us, questioning our word and insisting that the staff never make such mistakes. Eventually, she sent someone to check, and we were proven right, but the interaction left a bad taste.

The following morning, I chose to fill out the breakfast order form and bring it directly to the front desk. The same receptionist looked at the form with clear disgust and even showed it to the cleaning lady, laughing together. When I confronted her about it, she criticized how I filled out the form and suggested, ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you have breakfast in the restaurant so it‚Äôs easier?‚Äù‚Äîwhich is not something you say to a guest. When our breakfast finally arrived, it was incorrect, and when we called to address the issue, she blamed me for filling out the form ‚Äúwrong.‚Äù

When my girlfriend called to inform them that our order was completely wrong, this same person started arguing in an extremely informal manner (like a teenager), insisting that it was my fault because I had filled out the form incorrectly‚Äîeven though she had asked me to redo it with her! My girlfriend pointed out that regardless, this is not the way to speak to customers, and that the essence of her job is not to argue or pass judgment, let alone blame the guests. In response, the receptionist claimed that there were four people in front of her who could attest that she wasn‚Äôt being disrespectful, all while verbally attacking my girlfriend with her rapid speech and lack of professionalism. Where are we now? A playground argument? Shocked by such vulgarity and unprofessionalism, my girlfriend decided to hang up. It was truly a shocking and unpleasant experience for her to feel so attacked in this situation.

This level of unprofessionalism is unacceptable, especially at a hotel of this caliber. Hotel staff should be courteous and focused on finding solutions in a polite manner. Unfortunately, this was not our experience here.']

Adresse: 5 Rue du Pr√© aux Clercs, 75007 Paris, France
Reviews:
["We stayed here for 4 nights during our anniversary trip to France. From start to finish, there was nothing more we could have asked for. Upon checking in, we were greeted with a personal note, complimentary champagne, macarons, and an upgrade to a Junior Suite. We had THREE Parisian style windows in our spacious, lovely room. Upon arrival, we were offered use of the spa to freshen up, which was a really nice touch after a long flight from New York. We did not eat at the restaurant downstairs, but it looked delicious. The cocktail bar was excellent and provided a nice hub to meet with friends for a drink. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. A small, but simple touch were the hotel provided umbrellas that really came in handy on a rainy day. The hotel is located in a peaceful part of Saint Germain that is close to the action, but discreetly tucked away. Everything about this hotel is impressive and we can't wait to return. Thank you to everyone who took such excellent care of us!", 'My husband and I enjoyed a lovely stay here for our first time in Paris. The location was perfect, the neighborhood was really nice and we were able to walk to a lot of things or easily take the metro.

We were upgraded to a junior suite through FH&R and our room was huge and very comfortable with a separate living room area and two bathrooms.

Service was good, the staff was extremely friendly and courteous.

The bar was absolutely exceptional. We ended up bringing friends over and they were floored by the cocktails. The tarot card experience they had was really fun and creative.', 'We were at another 5* hotel in the same area and we totally hated the room, so we switched for the last two nights to Pavillon Faubourg and it saved the Paris portion of our trip.  The room as spacious and bright, very clean and quiet.  The staff were very kind and helpful with our hotel transfer (offered breakfast the first morning before our room was ready) and with transportation to the airport.  The bar (James Joyce) was great!  We went both nights.  Excellent wine and small plates.  Fun cocktails based on Tarot cards!  Very engaging staff made it an utter delight.  The location speaks for itself and is on the near side of the left bank.  The breakfast was all you could need and I had to guard against eating too much.  We have now stayed in five hotels in Paris and this is our new go-to one.  Highly recommended.', 'I had a wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel.  The rooms, lounge, bar, restaurant are all five star.  The staff were all helpful and went out of their way with any concerns I had.  The concierge was a great help assisting me with events.  The location was perfect.  Close to main boulevard of shops and restaurants.  Highly recommend.', 'The hotel is beautifully situated accessible to a lot of cool places. The hotel staff was very accommodating to our needs. We had some issues with our air conditioning but they are working on getting that fixed. I had a great conversation with the general manager Benjamin and was impressed by his level of care and attention.']

['The location is the best thing about this hotel! It‚Äôs within 5 minutes to the Luxembourg station and the Pantheon, and 10 minutes to the river front. The front desk is very helpful as well.\nHowever, housekeeping has been very inconsistent. Sometimes they just took away the dirty towel on the floor without replacing with new ones. The filling of the pillows also had a dirty smell, which puffed out occasionally. I would have much preferred to have one clean pillow than the four pillows with mixed cleanliness. There was also some long hairs that belonged to a different ethnicity from me in the bed the first night, which was quite an unpleasant surprise.', 'The location was great, probably the best thing about it. The staff were really nice and helpful. I ended up getting a really good rate, so I don‚Äôt feel like I can expect a lot especially in the heart of Paris. It was clean. There wasn‚Äôt a view except to a crevice in the rooftop, could see into other rooms although there was construction going on in them. It seemed like they tried to be as convenient as possible by not starting drilling until after 930 or 10 am. We did smell strong paint fumes one day, luckily we were on our way out for the day. The breakfast is really good, it was about $27 euros for 2 people but we really enjoyed it. The WiFi worked but kept dropping a lot, it was more of an issue for my kid who plays games on his iPad in the evenings. There was no bath, only a shower that was really odd. You have to be very careful to point the shower head towards a wall or you can flood the whole room. Overall I‚Äôd stay here again for a short period but next time I would upgrade to a better room with a view and hopefully a better bathroom.', 'They are not coffee artists at all. They have served the coffee more than full and the coffee plate was full of coffee which ruined my clothes. I‚Äôve not enjoyed anything', "Rooms are tiny for what you pay, although very clean. There was no/little soundproofing so you can hear everything, including dogs barking 3 doors down. Couldn't move in the bathroom at all, but it was adequate. Shower was great - hot with excellent pressure. Great location - very accessible to the lanes in St Germain and the Seine.", 'Great hotel. Love the interior design. It‚Äôs new, clean, and functional. The location is perfect, in a quiet street in Latin quarter. The cafe downstairs is perfect, food and beverages are wonderful day starters. Got my 7-day stay at the half price hope I‚Äôll have the good luck again in the future.']

Adresse: 13 Rue de l'Ancienne Com√©die, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews:
['I highly recommend this restaurant! It was a planned stop as part of my walk through Paris, and I came here specifically to have lunch at this historic place and see Napoleon‚Äôs hat. I strongly recommend trying the dishes from the historical section of the menu - without a doubt, you must try the calf‚Äôs head. It‚Äôs one of those rare moments when you feel like crying with happiness over a plate, and the taste stays with you for the life. The staff were incredibly friendly, and the service was warm and welcoming. I‚Äôm already planning to come back!', '4,3/5 Le Procope is a truly charming restaurant, often said to be the oldest in Paris. Legend has it that Napoleon himself was a frequent visitor here, and you can even see his hat on display. Given its long history, the restaurant is filled with fascinating memorabilia and photos, adding to its unique character.

The service was excellent, with very polite staff, though the speed could use some improvement. It took about an hour for our dishes to arrive. We ordered escargot, beef stew, and tartare. While the tartare didn‚Äôt quite meet our expectations, earning it a 4/5, the service deserved a solid 4.5/5.

The atmosphere, however, was absolutely exceptional and fully deserving of a perfect 5/5. Overall, I was very pleased with the experience. It‚Äôs an authentic and unique spot I‚Äôd highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris.', 'Lovely experience celebrating our daughter‚Äôs birthday on our last night in Paris.
Escargot, Langoustine Ravioli, Braised Beef Cheeks, Sweetbread Vol Au Vent were superb! (Our daughter had the Steak Frites and of course had to try a Glac√©, which was citrus and delicious). Service was very professional, which suited the high end style of the restaurant. Would definitely recommend for a special occasion when in Paris.', 'I made a reservation to make sure we would be dinning here. The table location was good and the restaurant decoration too. The food was amazing, The dauphin ravioli starter was the most delicious part of our whole meal however, I would not order dessert again as it was not for my taste even though looked very nice, didn‚Äôt worth the flavour. Make sure when ordering water to ask for tap water. Great experience overall.', 'This is what simple ingredients done well  is all about!
Food here was delicious - French onion soup was one of the nicer ones we had in Paris. The fish ceviche starter was so refreshing just fresh and zesty.
Their take on sea bream pie was simple and delicious. Beef bourguignon and the mash potato...simply divine.
Do note that you will definitely need a reservation to dine here. There was still a crowd by the time we finished our meal - which was around 1030pm. This shows you how popular this place is!']

['The restaurant offers an outstanding dining experience. The atmosphere is inviting and stylish, making it perfect for a special evening or a relaxed lunch. The food is exquisite, featuring a menu of creative and delicious dishes. Every bite reflects the high quality and freshness of the ingredients. The service is top-notch ‚Äì the staff is friendly, attentive, and well-versed in the menu. Overall, it‚Äôs an excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy exceptional cuisine and perfect service.', 'The ambience was amazing, with a live piano and singer when we were there. Giving a lot of jazz vibes. Food was amazing, I recommend the truffle bruschetta, it‚Äôs a must! Sadly the pasta was a bit bland and overcooked to my taste, and the dessert also is quite okay. But overall, it‚Äôs a good experience.', 'This place is amazing!  As a solo diner they accommodated me with a table in the bar on two separate nights.  The hostess was so kind and sweet and could see that I didn‚Äôt want to be put off in the back of the restaurant somewhere.  The food was some of the best I‚Äôve ever had and the service was also impeccable.  I will return for sure next time I am in Paris.  Oh, and the piano was the icing on the cake, such a great vibe!', 'This place has perfect cozy,classy ambience. I tried truff√© risotto and it was great. They also have live piano. I would definitely go back.', 'Ideal spot for a date night as a couple or amongst good friends\nCharming restaurant offering live music and delicious food. Booked table online using The Fork for an evening meal. Restaurant was very busy on arrival so glad to have booked. Staff were pleasant and we were quickly seated. We ordered arancini and courgette fritters followed by ordered the risotto of the day, a langoustine vodka cr√®me pasta and clam pasta. All the food was delicious, however the risotto, arancini and langoutine pasta were particularly exceptional. During dinner there was a variety of live music ranging from Jazz singing and piano playing which created a charming atmosphere. The restaurant itself was beautifully decorated and provided a chic feel. I would most definitely return and recommend to anyone looking for a good Italian restaurant.']

['Incredible people from all over the world! Staff very friendly and helpful, atmosphere for all the rugby games was great!! A must visit for any rugby fan!!', 'Everything is great here, I was welcomed so well by a long-haired guy (octavius I think) during a quiet night even though I always come when it‚Äôs crowded. It‚Äôs a must ! I swear ! I‚Äôve been living here for a year and after having been going everywhere, this is the only place that feels like home even if it‚Äôs ur first time.', 'Excellent bar, with great music !!', 'Nice little pub, happy hour from 6 to 8 if I remember correctly, with pints starting at 5‚Ç¨.', 'Full house last Friday weekend for the Rugby World Cup semi final.']

['Ideal place to organize Meetings and seminar, must be pre-Booked.', 'So so.', 'Great brunch and top notch service!', 'the brunch is generous with quality products. the buffet is restocked regularly which allows customers arriving after 1:30 p.m. to be able to enjoy all the sweet products, pastries, drinks... the service is impeccable, no false notes... the room lacks charm and heat for a 5‚≠êÔ∏è... the price of ‚Ç¨68 is a bit\nexcessive but by looking carefully on the net you can find a reduction which allows you to return to a correct price..\non the other hand, a real rant for this employee contribution (obligatory 5% tip)... is the service not included in France..??.  this is very limited for an establishment of your category... .. Where does this fashion of making tipping obligatory come from... .. US derivatives or just a way to increase the average basket per customer / the Olympic Games effect... .. but this new line on the addition leaves me perplexed...', "It is not the first time that we have come, the first was already very far away, on the other hand it was the first time with two 6 year old children, the brunch did not disappoint us, equal to the 1st time even if it had increased the quality of the brunch and the service deserves this award. On the other hand, don't go there with children, my 6-year-old granddaughters have small appetites and really enjoyed helping themselves, they didn't spoil anything but didn't eat much either, children and the price for the children's brunch surprised me because if I hadn't asked for it I was charged the adult price and after observation a 30% reduction which made the child price very expensive compared to what they ate.."]

['Such great sandwiches! There bread is made fresh and you quality was fantastic. The roast beef was something special. Best sandwich we had on our trip.', 'Worst panino ever!
I have chosen the In√®s, with Walnuts, chives, ricotta and speck.
The speck was cut so thick that was impossibile to eat, one bite and I took of the panino the entire slice and it was very difficult to cut with the teeth, even a bad scene to see honestly. The walnuts pieces were big and I found a leftover from a shell and almost broke a teeth. Chives made not sense. For 9 euro ? Crazy of me ! Next time what about a nice thin slice of speck, ricotta cheese, walnuts in small pieces, a touch of olive olive and Pepper and chives ? Come on,let me say wow to that sandwich! Make it with love. 9 euro is a lot', 'Great selection of ingredients for vegans. I picked the Oliva sandwich and I can‚Äôt complain. Beautiful composition of flavors!

The service was very charming and the area upstairs had a nice canteen flair üòç', '10/10. Superb sandwich / salad spot at great prices including meal option of a cake and drink. Meat / veggie / fish options. Can fill a water bottle at the fountain. Don‚Äôt forget to write on the bathroom door in chalk before you leave.', 'Best restaurant if you follow intermittent fasting you can have your balanced salad of the day and on with your day in Paris.
Very healthy choice of salads and they offer the best apple crumble and tiramisu. All this at a very good price. Amazing restaurant if you want to stay at a low budget.
Amazing!!! Will definitely use again.']

['We visited this restaurant on a Friday evening and had to wait 1.5 hours to be seated, which shows how popular it is. Once we got our table, it was quite tight‚Äîthe table had to be pulled out so we could slide onto the bench, and the seating was definitely cozy. The atmosphere was lively, but it was very loud, making it hard to have a relaxed conversation.

The food was good, but not exceptional. The salad had a sharp mustard flavor, which we enjoyed, but it might not be to everyone‚Äôs taste. The steak was cooked perfectly, and the fries were fantastic‚Äîcrispy and flavorful. However, the sauce didn‚Äôt live up to the hype; it was fine, but nothing special. The portions were generous, and the price-performance ratio was great.

The service was nice‚Äîthe waitresses had a lot to do but stayed friendly and efficient throughout, which added a positive note to the experience.

That being said, after waiting so long, the meal didn‚Äôt feel worth it. It was a good, standard meal that you could easily get somewhere else without the long wait and the uncomfortable, loud atmosphere. If you‚Äôre curious to try it, go ahead, but don‚Äôt expect anything extraordinary or worth the hype.', 'We waited 2 1/2 hours to get seated - but it was totally worth it. The service was excellent, even though the waitress had a lot to do - she was quite friendly and hospitable. The food was excellent as well. Very much enjoyed the salad, bread,  steak, house wine. Get there early.', 'Waited 1.5 hours in line on a Thursday night at around 8 p.m.. This place is worth it! The steak is buttery and the sauce is amazing. A lot of tourists and one downside is you get a lot of fries and not a ton of steak but either way I was happy and full after!', 'The worst service I have ever experienced. Although the restaurant opens at 6:30pm we started waiting in line at 6pm. We got inside by 7:40pm and until then we had to wait in the rain. When we finally got in the staff started talking to us in French and even though we clarified that we don‚Äôt speak French they kept talking in French. Even water wasn‚Äôt served to us. Food as okay but nothing special. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend, simply a waste of time. I‚Äôd recommend trying out other nearby restaurants since the taste is in them is better. Hygiene was also an issue as our forks and plates weren‚Äôt properly cleaned.  The place is small for its demand, they can easily expand since they have more than enough customers for what they deserve. Also the pricing is average for what you get but little more expensive compared to other restaurants.', 'We went back to the restaurant after we had failed to dine in a night before.

Arrived 1 hour before the restaurant opens for dinner and we were the first in the queue.

Not as good as what the internet has shown and a bit overhyped for me. I think La Vache in Hong Kong is much better than this.']

['It was an interesting experience to try the kushiage concept (Japanese deep fried food on a stick). We took the 58‚Ç¨ menu to have the sashimi, sushi and palate cleanser on top of the basic 48‚Ç¨ menu. The frying technique was good, crispy, no soggy (except the scallop). But not much flavors lingering in my mind though, or maybe we are too used to french dishes which always pair the main ingredients with the sauce to elevate the flavors. In any case, worth a try for the concept.
Ps: we really liked their green mustard', 'It was good but did not keep up to our expectations. The service was super friendly and fast. We ordered the menu with the extra sashimi. All in all, you get plenty of small dishes. They are good but miss richness in flavor. On the other hand, the sauce given to the fried sticks, tasted like a very salty Worcestershire sauce not fitting in my opinion.', 'We tried 58 euro menu.

1 more sashimi and Chazuke than the 48 euro menu.

15 different fried meat, vegetables and seafood.

Try the Sake there to pair the fried food, it will give you some fresh feeling.

The price is very reasonable for Paris. Recommend people who like the fried food to visit, but not a place for good sushi or sashimi.', 'One of the best meals we had in Paris! The set menu was extremely thoughtful, service was wonderful, and the attention to details elevates the whole experience. The decor was very homely and comfortable, but the food and service is gourmet.', 'Intimate, unique Japanese restaurant with a great tasting menu presented on beautiful ceramics. A bit variety of stimulating flavor profiles, presented in a very kind way (and very affordable to my personal opinion). Highly recommend.']

['I had an amazing Saturday evening at the Frog and Prince with friends, and it was perfect from start to finish! The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were friendly and attentive. We started with fantastic cocktails at the bar, where the barman really knew their crafted beers.', 'They tried to overcharge us twice.
1. They tried to tell us that they changed their prices on that day but the menu was not updated yet.
2. They tried to make us pay the night price 30 minutes before the cut-off.', "Lacking in service, but the best food compared to other Frog's.

This Frog, lacked in service in comparison to others. We entered and had to wait for a bit, including waiting for the manager to speak to an employee before serving a table (of which there were a few available). The floors were noticeably sticky as well, with a stale beer/  light vomit smell.
The food however, was the best I've had compared to other chains. I'm not only taking about the temperature but also the actual taste. It's strange how the same exact dish can taste so different in the same chain. The only thing I would say is that the mac and cheese side for one dish, was piping hot, whereas the other one was stone cold.", 'Cool atmosphere and great service, waitress Viktoria was very kind and told me everything about the menu. The Frogtastic burger was amazing!!! Was really nice experience and definitely will come back', 'As a profesional MMA fighter, I was looking for a nice experience in my free day in Paris, because on Saturdays I can drink and dance with my coach‚Äôs permission.
And there, I found this Bar, it was like an oasis between drunk people and olympic things. First of all, the workers (specially Franceska, who served me and my girlfriend nice cocktails), and then, the DJ was amazing too!!
It was my best night experience in Paris!!
Totally recomended']

['Les √âditeurs in Paris offers a lovely atmosphere with its beautiful, charming Parisian decor‚Äîperfect for a cozy meal. The service is great, with friendly and human interactions that made us feel welcome.

As for the food, it was good overall. The seared tuna, cheese burger, chicken cooking were well-executed. However, the fries were a letdown‚Äîthey were too hard and not very enjoyable. The mocktails were fine.

Overall, it‚Äôs a nice spot with good food and a fantastic ambiance.', 'Great spot in Paris, easy to engage with and typical brasserie/bistro style food. It‚Äôs not pushing any culinary boundaries, but it‚Äôs not trying to. Good comfort food in the heart of the City. Staff were fantastic with my English speaking family.', 'Rated compared to brasserie restaurants.  Les Editeurs is one of my favorite spots in Paris for a nice, low key meal or a drink. Wonderful decor and book theme inside, with dining areas on the main level and upstairs. Mixture of business meals and social meals going on in the lively atmosphere.

Food is very good, and keeps me coming back each time I visit Paris. Atmosphere is unique.  Highly recommended.', 'The server/waiter Steve is a consummate professional.  He responded kindly to a line travelled with bad French and made the visit one of the best experiences in Paris.  His wine recommendation was on target for the fixes led menu also.  The environment is great for someone who likes the intellectual atmosphere of the left bank.  The food is fresh and taste fantastic as well.  It is a must revisit spot for me at least!', 'What a quaint place! They seated us right away and were more attentive than expected (we were told that‚Äôs not a thing in Paris). The food was delicious! I had the special with caponata, Seabass and cr√®me br√ªl√©e‚Äîwhich was so light and creamy. My husband had the best chicken club sandwich and fries that put ‚Äúchips‚Äù to shame!']

["Very good food in a very nice,  trendy spot. I'll certainly return. Prices reflect the atmosphere, but I was happy with the service and they served excellent pizza.  The tomato sauce was particularly a highlight of our pizzas. I would recommend and i will return", "I recently had the pleasure of dining at Pizza Chic, and I must say, it was truly unforgettable! The chef was not only adorable but also incredibly talented. His cooking is simply fantastic!

The Aurora pizza was really good, but the Babbini was truly special ‚Äì a must-try! The flavors, the presentation, everything was just perfect.

I really appreciate the chef's passion and dedication to his craft. It's evident in every dish that comes out of his kitchen.

If you're a pizza lover like me, or just looking for a great dining experience, Pizza Chic is a must-visit! Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

Rating: 5/5 stars", "I'm not usually a fan of Pizzas in Paris, they're usually more bread than toppings, but here they were generous with their toppings, and they were flavourful. We took the Truffle pizza and the margarita pizza and an octopus carpacio as a starter. It was all good. The staff was mostly friendly, but they didn't have an English menu. So I had to translate for friend. We were sharing and the chef was nice enough to cut both pizzas in half on each plate so each of us had both types of pizza in one plate without having to bother cutting it ourselves. Their tiramisu was also really good it was a good balance of sweetness, mild coffee and creaminess without being too much, It was enough to be shared between two persons.

The ambiance was good but the place was a little tight, so wheelchair accessibility is not the best.", 'Dining alone, I was looking for a cosy place, not too crowded, with women already seated. Pizza Chic exceeded my expectations with a nice cocktail, delicious, delicately flavored Pizza Norma, and pistachio gelato that tasted freshly homemade. The wait staff was friendly and prompt, and I spent a comfortable evening out on my own.', 'This restaurant has good food traditional French. Friendly staff and it is located in a good place, I will definitely use again when in Paris.
It closes couple hours during the day 14:00 till 18:00 which makes it a bit not practical if you are tight in your schedule, but good restaurant all round.']

["Dining at L'Atelier de Jo√´l Robuchon was one of the best culinary experiences of my life and an absolute must when visiting Paris! From the moment we arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive, making the entire experience feel special.
The food was simply exceptional. Each dish was a masterpiece of flavor and presentation, with small portions that allowed us to savor and appreciate the intricate craftsmanship behind each bite. The highlight for me was the passion fruit sorbet--it was, without a doubt, one of the best things I've ever tasted in my life!
We were seated at the bar-like counter, which gave us a front-row view of the chefs in action. Watching the precision and artistry in the open kitchen added an extra layer of excitement to the meal. The ambiance was intimate and elegant, perfect for celebrating a special occasion or indulging in a luxurious treat.
A word of advice: reservations are essential, and you'll want to book several months in advance to secure a spot at this highly sought-after establishment. Trust me, it's worth every bit of the planning.
If you're in Paris and looking for an unforgettable dining experience, L'Atelier de Jo√´l Robuchon is an absolute must. I can't wait to return!", 'We went here for our anniversary and did the tasting menu. The food itself was beautiful and tasty except for the scallops - gritty and overdone. The staff were friendly and professional overall, but a note on service; was good at first but then kind of fell off badly. We waited between courses for almost an hour at one point. There must have been  problem in the kitchen. No explanation and completely unapologetic. For a meal that was quite expensive it was a bit of a disappointment. 3.5/5', 'Not sure why this location has recently lost its Michelin star when it is at least at par if not better with its peers in Paris √âtoile or Tokyo. Ambiance and decor of this establishment resemble a chic bar and the concept allows for tasting many creative and classic dishes that can be served in smaller portions. Service is attentive, professional and on the casual side (read: amicable and personable).', 'First time at the atelier and it was excellent. The attentiveness of the staff, the quality of the preparation, and timing was all just spot on. The tasting menu was varied and an experience itself. We did admittedly go for the lunch service which is perhaps less time pressured than dinner, but the negative comments are not justified - nothing like that in our experience. Recommended.', "All I can say us the food and it's flavors are what I am paying for. You must try it! I don't really like the ambiance nor how the restaurant looks but the food is why I was here! Although I did't like how we all were sitting in the bar and not on a regular table. The food and staff are the main assets of this restaurant!  :-)"]

['My favorite place in Paris for dinner with friends. Full of joy and happiness.
With an amazing service, chef and entertainment.
You will love this very Parisian Art Deco restaurant.
I recommend you the Omelette Norv√©gienne for dessert.', 'Awesome restaurant, great setting and atmosphere. Food was very good and reasonably priced (¬£55pp for an aperitif, starter, main, dessert and a wine) and service was exceptional.', 'This place is a rare pearl (literally) in Paris. Good is really good, the place is beautiful, and the service is impeccable. The only BUT is that they only have one vegan/vegetarian option and is not WOW! Is good tho but not at the same level as the other dishes.
The love night party is fun, unique and charming! Super recommended!', 'This was one of my favourite restaurants during my Paris trip. The interior is stunning, open, airy and inviting filled with plants. It‚Äôs a French fusion restaurant with touches of Asian and Japanese flavours. Reservations are a must here as it‚Äôs a very busy restaurant especially during nights. The service is impeccable honestly one of the best we‚Äôve experience in Paris. The waiter is very attentive, friendly and overall makes you feel like you‚Äôre lifelong friends.

We had a party of 4 and ordered quite a few dishes to try out. The salmon dishes were all amazing, fish was fresh and of quality. Two of my favourite was definitely the poke bowl and scallops. Every dish has dynamic flavouring, however the only one that was lacklustre was the dish. We felt it was a little bland and lacking in complexity. The desserts were all amazing as well, not too sweet and the perfect ending. I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place!', 'Great experience!
The atmosphere is mostly cozy, though occasionally marred by loud music and wait times during busy hours. Don‚Äôt forget to book before.

While the food presentation and taste are commendable, it is a bit pricey (around ‚Ç¨80-100 per person). But worth a visit for a distinct Parisian experience!']

['We had always wanted to dine at another female Michelin Chef‚Äôs (our other experience was with Pic in Singapore and London) so we really looked forward to Marsan. Lovely restaurant with impeccable service by a team led by Dimitri and the dishes were both beautifully presented as well as delicious. The Asian ingredients were interesting and the wine pairing introduced us to wines and vineyards we didn‚Äôt know before. We look forward to returning eventually for the Chef‚Äôs Table if we could find enough friends to join in.', "Delicious meal, the carrots and agrumes mousseline coming with the lobster is to die for. The bred ice cream was surprising and fantastic as well. A stunning meal overall and a good three hours lunch.
Service was excellent and it's very nice to be welcomed by the team when arriving. Perfect for great occasions.", 'We went to Marsan the other day for lunch. Honestly we were not aware that the restaurant had two stars so we were very impressed by the welcome and the introduction to the kitchen. Ordered the menu, rather than the 6 or 9 course option. Even then, between the amuse bouches and the after meal additions, we felt that we actually did have a 9 course meal. The texture, the combinations and the breadth of offerings showed a lot of attention to detail. I highly recommend for the whole experience.', 'First time dining at Marsan was worth-it ! The team offered excellent dishes with refined French charm. The pacing was well managed as well as the wine recommendation from the sommelier. We had fun chatting with him and the team. Eventhough it took 3 times to ask for more butter, we love the food !', "We booked ‚ÄúChef's table‚Äù for 3 persons, Fantastic relax and enjoy meals with company,
üíúüáπüá≠üá©üá∞üá∏üá™We loves to sitting the behind the scenes work,I promise you it's worth every extra Euro to watch this top level kitchen at work. There is something special about seeing your dishes crafted from start to finish in this tight ship of a kitchen.
The service was impeccable and the food was truly a unique experience.
Come see for yourself whether this restaurant deserves its 2 Michelin stars!
And The surprising association between chocolate and confit pimiento del Piquillo...
Colombian chocolate from Nicolas Berger as a creur,
walnut biscuit and praline, chipotle condiment, chocolate/chipotle sorbet, crispy arlettes
Desert: I really enjoy this menu because it‚Äôs very good in mixing
üòçüòçThe combination of chocolate and candied pimiento del Piquillo..Creamy Colombian chocolate, biscuit and praline
with nuts, chocolate/chipotle sorbet and crispy arlettes.."]

['Very nice and cozy place to chill and have a hot drink. Quiet, peaceful love the place.
Wish the place was slightly bigger.. but that‚Äôs ok.
ü§ó', 'Starbucks is a globally recognized coffeehouse chain known for its wide variety of coffee drinks, teas, and snacks. The inviting atmosphere makes it a popular spot for both casual meetings and studying.

The menu features classic favorites like the Caff√® Latte, Caramel Macchiato, and seasonal offerings such as the Pumpkin Spice Latte. Their commitment to quality is evident in their use of premium Arabica beans and artisanal brewing methods.

While the ambiance can vary by location, most stores offer comfortable seating and free Wi-Fi, making it a convenient choice for those looking to relax or work. However, during peak hours, it can get quite crowded, leading to longer wait times for drinks.

Overall, Starbucks provides a reliable coffee experience with a friendly vibe, perfect for coffee lovers on the go.', 'I have been there,  partly because I want to use toilet first of all, and partly to escape from cold weather.  I was notified that i cannot use toilet because the toilet was broken. They said keep saying sorry. But there was two toilet,  1 for men and 1 for ladies. It is very hard to believe that 2 toilet were broken down at the same time. If 1 was broken, they must arrange unisex toilet temporarily.  However, my friend suspected that their excuse was intended  for people staying short time in the Cafe in cold weather.  I had never such a terrible experience.  We usually go to cafes to use toilet in Europe.  It was bad experience to me and these things will damage world wide Starbucks cafe image, i am sure.', 'Drinks bang but I‚Äôve never been more humiliated in my life. Worker was absolute jokes but still made fun of my French which really hit my ego.', 'I have milk allergy (dairy). I asked for coconut milk, it was mentionned on the label of my cup (and no cream). Nevertheless, I saw the barista pouring milk from a blue box which looked like the one they design for cow milk. I asked her if it was coconut milk, she said yes. When I tasted it, after few sips bc of all the sugar, I noticed it wasn‚Äôt coconut milk but cow milk. I got really sick 30 minutes later, which confirmed the intoxication. She could have said she forgot it was coconut milk ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

However, I looked at other comments and most of them say the staff doesn‚Äôt care to follow the real recipes. Nice.']

Adresse: 41 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Food was yummy but what really ruined the experience was the service! The server we had for the night was rushing us throughout the entire meal! Rushed us in taking our orders, not giving us time to properly look at the menu and somewhat forcing us to order certain things (and not in a subtle ‚ÄúI recommend this‚Äù). And when we were starting to prepare for the next course, she would take plates off the table even though we weren‚Äôt done! I had to tell her to put back our foie gras because there was still a tiny bit left that I didn‚Äôt want to go to waste! Disappointed because this restaurant came highly recommended and the food was good. But service is a huge part of the experience and for the money we paid, it sure left a bad taste in our mouths.', 'Our visit to Allard was deeply disappointing, and we left feeling frustrated and let down. For a restaurant with such a reputation and fine dining aspirations, our experience was far from acceptable.

First, we were seated in a very small nook, side by side, rather than facing each other. The table was so cramped that we couldn‚Äôt even get out without the waitress physically lifting the table to let us through, which disturbed guests at neighboring tables. This arrangement was uncomfortable and completely inappropriate for a fine dining establishment.

The main course we ordered was the duck (‚Ç¨55 on the menu, "for sharing 2 persons"). When the bill came, we were shocked to find that we had been charged ‚Ç¨110‚Äîdouble the listed price. This lack of clarity in the menu felt misleading, and for a restaurant of this caliber, it‚Äôs simply unacceptable.

As for the food, it was just average, certainly not worth the exorbitant price we paid. With all these issues combined, we cannot recommend Allard and will certainly never return. A fine dining experience should feel special, but this one fell far short of expectations.', 'Absolutely divine experience, from the minute we walked in we knew we were in for an absolute treat! The atmosphere, the food, the wine and the staff were all beyond expectation. Definitely an experience we will talk about and a meal we will dream about until our next visit to Paris !', 'One of the best French restaurants in Paris! Been here 4 times and it was the best every time! I spent 2 birthdays there. They always make my day by taking an extra step and putting up with my attempts on French.', 'Allard is a classic Parisian bistro that brings a taste of traditional French cooking to life. Located in the picturesque Latin Quarter, the restaurant boasts a cozy, intimate setting with vintage decor and a relaxed, warm ambiance. The menu is rooted in French culinary traditions, featuring comforting dishes like sole meuni√®re, roasted duck, and hearty stews. The service is attentive and the wine list offers excellent pairings to complement the meal. Perfect for those looking to experience the true essence of French gastronomy in a timeless setting.']

['A multi screen cinema showing the latest  movies in French. Different sizes, some rooms are nice enough but some are rather small and uncomfortable. One would expect better but cinemas in Paris are rarely much better!', "Average cinema experience with room for improvement

UGC Danton in Paris offers a standard cinema experience. The cinema is clean and comfortable, but there is nothing particularly special about it. The staff are friendly but could be more attentive. Visitors are more likely to experience a decent movie-watching experience with nothing particularly memorable about it.

What makes UGC Danton special is its location. It's conveniently located in the heart of the city, making it easily accessible to locals and tourists alike. However, for each star lacking, there are areas where UGC Danton can improve. One star is deducted for the lack of unique features and amenities that would make the cinema stand out from its competitors. Another star is deducted for the quality of the snacks and drinks, which could be improved. Lastly, another star is deducted for the lack of innovation in the overall cinema experience.

To improve the cinema experience, UGC Danton could consider offering more premium amenities like reclining seats, a better selection of snacks, and more engaging pre-show entertainment. Additionally, they could consider offering special discounts or promotions to attract more customers.

Overall, while UGC Danton is an average cinema, there is certainly room for improvement. If you're looking for a simple cinema experience without any frills, UGC Danton is a good choice. However, for those seeking a more elevated cinema experience, there are better options available.", 'Very well run establishment, very kind helpful team running the place . We witnessed the support and assistance offered to a handicapped person in need of help; very immediate response to needs, going as far as to  help them into the theatre,  find the right seat comfortably , unrushed, and without pressure‚Ä¶
Venue was well kept, the temperatures as one would hope, the bathrooms clean (paper towel would be a plus), and the clientele matched : they found a wallet and left it at the box office to be recuperated by us about an hour later much to our surprise and delight.. thank you for restoring our faith in the kindness of strangers‚Ä¶.  We were there to see screening of Yesterday - how fitting!
