Thank You, look forward to visiting you again soon', "A great experience. Bored at night in Paris? No way! Go visit the cinema, have a drink. Take some chips or popcorn. Clean seats, cosy seats. Great sound and screen. Don't pass the opportunity to see that movie you needed to see!", "Small seats, do not come here if you're tall. Seats aren't numbered so you have to come early and sit through almost 20 minutes of commercials"]

Adresse: 51 Quai des Grands Augustins, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Everything was great overall! The food was excellent‚ÄîI especially loved the caviar pasta, which was absolutely the best, and the steak, which was a solid 10/10. However, I didn‚Äôt enjoy the sole meuni√®re; it didn‚Äôt meet my expectations. The French fries were amazing, and I hope they stay on the menu forever because I‚Äôd love to have them again. This has become my favorite restaurant in Paris this time, and I can‚Äôt wait to return again and again. The mashed potatoes were very good, the truffle pasta was perfect, and the lobster pasta was equally incredible. The service was also very good, making the experience even better.‚Äù', 'Lap√©rouse is an unforgettable culinary experience that seamlessly blends history, elegance, and refined gastronomy. The intimate atmosphere and charming decor, with its private salons exuding mystery and romance, transport you to another era‚Äîa time of exquisite taste and the art of living.

The menu is a true culinary masterpiece. Each dish is impeccably presented, with every plate resembling a work of art. The flavors are just as impressive‚Äîbalanced, refined, and crafted from the finest ingredients. The service is impeccable, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who make you feel truly special throughout the evening.

Whether you‚Äôre celebrating a special occasion or simply indulging in an exceptional dining experience, Lap√©rouse is a place that will leave a lasting impression. Highly recommended for those seeking an extraordinary blend of history, ambiance, and gastronomy.', 'This place is a true unique experience . The building inside is as if from a different era. So romantic and mysterious. The service is excellent and the atmosphere feels as if you are in a different age. Definetely a unique experience.
Wellington was incredible, lobster pasta so and so. Nevertheless overall this truly worths it. Choufle chocolate was the best I had in my life. It is expensive of course..', "By far most romantic dining experience in Paris. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è The venue was elegant and beautiful, steeped in history, with a charming staff. We dined on the third floor in a spacious room offering stunning views of the river. The food was excellent, and the waiters were attentive. We arrived early to enjoy a drink in the exquisite downstairs bar, enjoying the delicious French Kiss champagne cocktail. The entire evening was incredibly romantic, making for a truly special night in Paris as we soaked in the ambiance of the city's historic dining experience. You can make your reservation on their website which requires a credit card to secure your reservation.  It was an amazing way to spend our last evening in Paris.  We enjoyed reading the history of the restaurant as it was established in the 1700s.  A memory we will forever cherish.", 'Only outstanding part of dinner was the dessert (creme brulee and chocolate souflee). Pricing is not at all good for the quality of food, escargots were bad, truffle pasta was average, caviar with mashed potatoes is a dont, only plate that was average was the steak au poivre but not the beef wellington, that was bad as well. The most annoying part was that their wine menu is infinite and we asked the sommelier some recommendations  and he only suggested ‚Ç¨2,000+ bottles, this place is becoming a tourist trap']

['What i would consider as an undiscovered gem, the Parisiens know it well, but not many others do! An excellent atmosphere in what is a great jazz club. The music varies, and when we visited, it was with a Christmas theme. The choice of food is limited but very well done. Always very much worth a visit.', 'We had a very special evening here! The host was wonderful, kind, and enthusiastic.

They had a three jazz musicians ( a pianist, an upright bass player, and a singer) I was a little surprised when they started speaking and singing in classic American songs.

Overall the atmosphere was cozy, romantic, but not stuffy!', 'We wanted to come to restaurant for dinner today. We searched the restaurant website, facebook, instagram, there is nothing saying it is closed. We tried to call before arriving a few times, no one answered the phone. We arrived in the The restaurant anyway, because it says open on Google. The restaurant was closed and there is no signs that it is closed and will open when?', 'Everyone in our group who chose the duck main course raved about it. Waitstaff particularly pleasant and efficient. Plus the jazz vocals by Leslie Lewis with Gerard Hagen on piano contributed to a happy mood.', 'had a very lovely time here. ambience was great and food was delicious. have to book at least 2-3 weeks before because it gets full! worth it!!

to note, there is an extra charge of 5‚Ç¨ per person on top of the food/drinks']

Adresse: 4 Rue des Grands Augustins, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We absolutely loved our dining experience! The food was not just delicious, but also super creative and full of inspiration. Every course was a delight! The service was outstanding; they really went above and beyond. Even when my wife arrived quite late, they were so accommodating and let her order a main course. Plus, my six-year-old twin boys felt like little princes the whole time! It was such a wonderful experience for our family!', "True to it's Michelin star, this restaurant delivers exquisite dishes on a surprise (not printed) 5 or 7-dish menu based on the freshest ingredients. The chef added s lot of citrus notes to the current menu, which made it light and interesting. Short, but confident wine list. Warm service. Reservation is a must. Very highly recommended", 'After a warm welcome into an artistic space, we enjoyed fresh delights from both the land and sea.  After the amuse bouche, I chose the lobster entree and fish plat for myself and the risotto and venison for her.  We shared the apple and chocolate desserts.  Service was extremely helpful in choosing wines and controlling the pace of the meal.  No false notes here.  The only regret I have is not choosing the five course lunch!  üòïüò≠üòÇüôèüèºü•Çüåü', "One of the best meals I've ever had! We ordered a 5-course and 7-course tasting menu -- both were fantastic and at a really great price. A must have French fine dining experience in Paris!", 'Amazing cooking on the fish and meat. Lunch is a great deal for Michelin and was not too busy. They kept giving us more bread which was nice. I really liked the desserts, not too sweet and nice tart apple flavor for mine. Service in English or French.']

['We walked in for dinner on a Thursday evening without a reservation and were warmly welcomed. The service was excellent, attentive, and friendly. The restaurant itself is charming, embodying everything you‚Äôd hope for in a classic Parisian dining experience. The food was outstanding and offered great value for the price. The extensive wine list catered to all tastes and budgets, making it easy to find the perfect pairing for our meal.', 'I was in Paris for 2 nights and both nights I wanted to have dinner at this restaurant! Without a doubt the best restaurant we have ever been to!
The food was incredibly tasty and the service was amazing!! We were treated with great affection, including my 1-year-old baby.', 'I had a dinner here with my parents and they really loved the experience.
The decoration was very pretty and the desserts were quite good.
I especially enjoyed the profiteroles.', 'Such a stunning French style decoration absolutely beautiful. The food is really great and the drinks also. The service is very welcoming and friendly. The atmosphere is super nice. We had a very great lunch moment.', 'Had our final dinner in Paris here at the end of our trip. The art nouveau decor is beautiful, our waiter was attentive and engaged. The food was delicious! Husband had the duck and I had the beef tartare and both were wonderful! We had the chocolate cake, coffee and mini desserts. The coffee and mini desserts were the perfect amount of dessert after a hearty meal. Would recommend!']

['Good service and great atmosphere.
The onion soup was good, the steak was a little too chewy.
The pigeons do walk in around the restaurant.
At one point, it flew around my food so I didn‚Äôt feel quite comfortable finishing my food..', 'A place in Paris where you can have onion soup‚Ä¶ but not the others. Onion soup was good, but the salmon dish had a fishy smell and a very unpleasant texture, making me question its freshness. It was not edible without squeezing lemon on it- a lot. We hardly finished it‚Ä¶
There are a lot of artificial flowers, so it looks great for Instagram photos.', 'Croissant was not crispy.  Chocolate was too sweet. Cream br√ªl√©e was not bad and not too sweet. The atmosphere and service were not bad.  Just to go for experiencing the coffee time in France. So many people lined up, waited for around 10 mins.', 'Great choice for a casual dinner in Montpasse. Generous cocktail pours and classic French bistro food. Solid preparation. Attentive service. Good atmosphere with lots of terrace dining.', 'Cute caf√© in the 6th with a nice terrace. Sunday brunch is pretty good, offering several combos or ‚Äú√† la carte‚Äù options.

Big downside is the quality of service. Staff are overwhelmed and very inefficient.']

Adresse: 4 Pl. Saint-Germain des Pr√©s, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Crowded with very good vibe and amazing service. Food is average but the waitresses as very very cool. Each of them wearing the dress or outfit they choose themselves to show the character. I loved being there. It‚Äôs not about food though it‚Äôs more about lifestyle.', 'We visit evening and while eating the food there where many flies on food and in the restaurant. Flies on food ! The manager say you eat from the food and he dont care on flies.   He did not see fit to even apologize and only blamed that we ate the food when the portions were half full. During the argument flies fly in front of the manager and on the food while being completely ignored.', 'We stumbled to this place by accident after failing to make reservation for lunch. The food was very average. The place is beautiful, but I wasn‚Äôt impressed with the food.', 'I loved my meal which was Le Tigre and my wife had the morel pasta which was great as well. We also tried the nems. The ambiance is nice, great for a date.', 'Premium restaurant with amazing foods and deserts. Excellent services.']

Adresse: 16 Rue des Quatre Vents, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews:
['My best place in Paris to catch a Bills or NFL game. Great poutine and burgers, and very friendly staff.', 'A great pub in a very accessible location for English speakers to feel at home in the heart of Paris. The food is great, drinks are well priced, and the service is always great! We‚Äôve been coming here for years now and always have a great time.', 'Dear Moose Management Team,

I hope this message finds you well. I recently had the pleasure of dining at Moose tonight to watch my Chicago Bears play (I am visiting from Atlanta in America and really wanted to see my team play).

I wanted to take a moment to highlight the exceptional service provided by one of your staff members.

Donatella assisted/served me and my wife. She went above and beyond to ensure our experience was truly memorable. Her attentiveness, professionalism, and warm demeanor made a significant impression on us. In a city known for its hospitality, she truly stood out as an exemplary representative of your establishment.

Please extend my sincerest thanks to her and let her know how much her kindness and dedication were appreciated. It‚Äôs clear she takes great pride in her work, and it made all the difference in our visit.

I look forward to visiting Moose again in the future and will certainly recommend it to others. Thank you for fostering such a welcoming and high-quality dining experience.

Warm regards,

Derrick Hardy', 'The poutine and the burger really provided energy for us to face the hell-like match and witness the victory ! Nice atmosphere, TV on every wall.', 'This space was great ! The manager James was amazingly accommodating to make sure we were seated at the table closest to watch the Eagles game. Our server Donna was equally great. Attentive and friendly. I definitely recommend this place']

['Absolutely amazing atmosphere, coupled with quality food & service! The restaurant feels like it‚Äôs in a whole different world and has the feel of Paris but at the same time, very secluded but doesn‚Äôt feel disconnected at all. The inside of the boutique store & restaurant has a very elite New York vibe, which I personally loved very much and it felt like the best of both worlds (Paris & NYC).
Went here for my birthday lunch & honestly it was one of the best dining experiences I have had here in Paris.

The staff & food were both top notch & I would definitely recommend everyone to try out this place!', "It was a perfect and unique experience. The staff are friendly and cheerful. The decoration and ambiance are very nice. The food, especially the hamburger, was fantastic. The salmon was very good. I liked the alcoholic cocktails. If you're going to Paris, you should definitely try this place", 'The food and atmosphere at Ralph‚Äôs are excellent, and the service is great. However, my experience was ruined when the waiter loudly insisted we had to tip (minimum 10%), drawing attention from other tables. It was uncomfortable and unnecessary. While the food deserves five stars, this incident left a bad impression.', 'The place is super relaxing. We tried the mini lobster rolls, it was good but I prefer if the bread was softer. Burger was amazing, fresh salads inside and testy, wish if there was another option of fries (slim cut). Overall a great experience.', 'Came for the lovely location and ambiance. We were sat at a table, and it took awhile to place our order with the waiter. The service was not as pleasant as expected. I understand that it was busy during lunch time, but not coming to check up on the table is not the best. The salad was very good but we don‚Äôt recommend the cheeseburger. Very short staffed']

Adresse: 28 Rue des Grands Augustins, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We visited specifically to try the frog legs and because of the high reviews. The restaurant offers a nice dining atmosphere‚Äîquiet and slightly reminiscent of fine dining‚Äîwhich explains the higher prices. The garlic frog legs were delicious, and the service was excellent and attentive. A special mention to the sole waitress managing the entire floor; it must have been hectic for her, but she did an amazing job.', 'A friend highly recommended this place, and I‚Äôm so glad they did! The food was absolutely incredible, and the service was great.  The frog legs were especially crispy and delicious. I‚Äôll definitely be back!', 'Unfortunately, my visit to this restaurant was a big disappointment, especially given the higher price range. When prices like that are charged, you expect a better standard. The frog legs in garlic sauce were dry and tasteless, and the basil rice seemed careless. The frog burger was okay, but the fries were just not that great. I was especially disappointed by the price of 7‚Ç¨ for a 0.33L Coca-Cola, which I found to be ridiculously overpriced.\n\nThe cleanliness of the restaurant also left a lot to be desired.', 'We had a lovely dinner there, and it was lovely to have a real Parisian Bistro experience. We felt like we had been transported back in time. The French onion soup was delicious! The staff were friendly and attentive but didn‚Äôt rush us. We would highly recommend.', 'Amazing experience. I had the frog burger and it was delicious and like nothing I‚Äôve ever had before. The waitress was friendly and aided the wonderful meal. The atmosphere was perfect such a relaxing lunch.']

['Appetiser, starter, and dessert are good, sashimi is fresh and tasty. The main course - that‚Äôs the star of the show. Had white fish and baby duck for plat, both are cooked to perfect tenderness with a lightly charred flavours, coupled with unique sauce and side dishes.
Do book in advance.', 'recommend the Salmon Tartare (fine delicate) and grilled white Fish (cod)
the best not to be missed is tiramisu with toasted black sesame which has a very fine delicate taste that beats French desserts ü§´

the wagyu beef was a bit tough', 'This is another difficult review to write.  Azabu has a lot of things going for it, staff are wonderful, the venue is great and the ambiance is perfect, especially when you're dining outside on a nice night.  However....Azabu puts themselves on the upper end of the scale with their pricing.  An average "menu" will cost you 45‚Ç¨ without refreshments.  With just two glasses, you are likely walking out of dinner paying north of 60 euros.  Having said that, the expectations is the food will be like everything else, wonderful.  Unfortunately we didn't find the food to be anything beyond mediocre.  The starters while being presented perfectly, were lacking any real character.  The "amuse bouche" was also just flat.  Two of us had the Wagyu beef and honestly, it was either overcooked and too chewy.  Finally the dessert which was a green tea cake was dry.  I am not going to advise others to avoid the place, it seems there are a lot of positive reviews and we could have been there when the chef wasn't having his best day.  For me though I won't return as the pricing was far too high for food of this quality.', 'A largely women-run homestyle teppanyaki shop where every dish is elegant and tastes delicious. The menu features daily specials so you have a variety of fresh fish, pork, beef, and vegetable options to choose from. Something for everyone here and the quality of the dishes is very high. Even the humble chawanmushi was the best I‚Äôve had with a subtle shiitake flavor. The kind of place I would go to again and again and again if I lived in Paris!', 'Japan in Paris. The food brought me back in Japan, the taste is very close to Japan cuisine and without western influences. Friendly stuff and lovely atmosphere.']

["Sunday Brunch at Don-K offers a nice atmosphere, generous buffet, and a great show. The price is reasonable for a memorable moment at one of Paris' legendary caf√© theaters.", 'Excellent spectacle !', 'Cabaret', 'S Collaro imbuvable', 'Cozy place, ideal for those nostalgic for the humor of the 80s like their andouillette see photo üòÇü§£.
For service a little smile would be desirable.
Please remember to take ‚Ç¨2 per person for the cloakroom.
The kitchen is good, the only criticism is a menu of 76 with many dishes subject to supplement.
In conclusion, a mythical place that must be visited without waiting for nirvana.']

['We had starters and two main with some white and red wine, it‚Äôs nice overall.

The scallops with yuzu sauce are delightful, the mayonnaise has yuzu flavour that made it perfect dip with everything. Although we all know starter of scallops are never a bad idea, but this is out of imagination. I highly recommend try it without hesitation. Tuna mixed with ham might be a bit disappointing with less surprised, but it‚Äôs still an okay starter. The sides was trying to make it unfamiliar familiar somehow.

The pork belly and polenta are pretty good, tender and melty, and crispy skin provides different texture that makes the main not too boring. Pulled rabbit is quite good as well. The last time I tried elsewhere was a little bit tough and salty, however this time I had good impression on rabbit. Pumpkin pur√©e is sweet, and if pair the pur√©e with rabbit, the taste worth trying at least once.', 'Amazing and talented chef! The dishes are so good. The team and service are kind, attentive, and the atmosphere is good during lunch and dinner. It was so good so we immediately made a reservation for another day during the same vacation. I love this place!!!', 'We had a great meal at this restaurant. Great flavours. See our pics for the food. Only thing (that isn‚Äôt a negative), the menu isn‚Äôt super kid friendly for under 10yr old. So it was a great adult meal ü§£üòÇ', 'We had a wonderful time at Fish La Boissonnerie last night with a friend: I had come here many many years ago and the quality and service is intact. Always better to book in advance as the place was packed, and the menu has a diverse range of starters and mains that can make most people happy. The dishes are very well cooked, even though the tuna did seem a bit overcooked, and the wine list is also fantastic. Will surely come back!', 'Pork belly dish is amazing! The skin is crispy while the meat is tender and juicy. The polenta with cheese and confit were so creamy and just plain decadent. My family had this meal 4 times. It is that good!']

['The place is not big enough for the number of customers. Many clients are stuck with their heads in their computers for hours and do not let new customers enjoy a drink sitted. Starbucks should find bigger spots near Saint Michel and not allow toilets use to non customers. Not an easy district to manage a Starbucks.', 'William is a polite and friendly staff. He was very helpful when ordering. He speaks many languages. Thank you for everything.', 'I have never written a review before, but this place deserves one. I asked the staff before I ordered, if I can stay here for a couple of hours. They told me that I could. However, they forgot to mention that the bathroom is not working. It turns out, it has been out of order for at least 3 weeks now. I asked if I could wash my hands somewhere, they told me they could not help me. There is no air conditioning, there is no window to open, the air upstairs is suffocatingly warm and humid. Might be ok for a short stop, but I would definitely not recommend it for staying for more than half an hour.', 'Small branch with separate seating area in the upper floor.

Good and quick service.

I had chai latte which tasted so good.', 'Expensive and cold filtered coffee. The staff was friendly and the place was nice to rest before going to the airport.']

['Best Pizza Ever! We stopped over for lunch and had one margarita and one perchutto fungi named Reine (which was Devine!)
Also, insalata valeria was fresh and full of taste.
Alongside came cold Metor draft beer which was also delightful.
The tiramisu left me speech less. Wow!
More over, the view from the outer sitting is pleasing and cool.
Very recommended!!', 'Very satisfying Italian cuisine with a lot of choice. The service was a bit slow but the pleasant atmosphere compensates that so it‚Äôs overall a nice place to have lunch or dinner.', 'Food was delicious, lots of flavor, good portions. Staff was very friendly. Definitely recommend.', 'The perfect place to host large parties. The service and food were excellent!', 'Very good Italian place. Delicious Aperol Spritz, pizza and pastas!
Affordable prices for the location.
Recommend this place over the main street around the corner. Good service.']

['We love this tiny gem of a restaurant and have been visiting it for years. The owner, Sudat, is warm and welcoming, the service is friendly and the cuisine is outstanding - it is consistently delicious Indian food. The Jingas  Madras (shrimp) and the Murg Tikka Masala (Chicken) are our favorites. There is a reason Ravi has been in business for 40 years - it never disappoints.', 'The atmosphere was cozy, the service warm and friendly and the food was amazing, this lovely little restaurant was right across the street from the apartment we‚Äôre staying at so we decided to give it a try and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. We had the butter chicken, the chicken vindaloo, aloo ghobi, saffron rice and some stiff generously poured whiskey and cola.', 'The worst Indian restaurant in my life!!!!\nSurprisingly to say it... an Indian restaurant with tasteless food!!!  All the vegetables were frozen...! the curry and spices in the food were inexistent.. moreover... the curry sauce was basically water with salt. I do not believe how can this be called a " Indian restaurant" ... or a "restaurant" at all. Worst experience in a long... long time traveling!!!', 'You have to feel bad for the sole staff member responsible for seating, serving and finalising your bill.\nWe walked in and there were 6 people in the restaurant. We got roti fairly quickly but it was probably 10-15 mins before we saw a menu and about 20 mins before we saw a drink. Food was good, though one of the samosas could not be cut: we had to bite it open. We had to remind the waiter that we were waiting for cheese naan. At the end of the meal, we had to remind the waiter after ten minutes that we were waiting on change. It was a tasty meal but the owner/manager is not doing himself any favours by having only one staff member', "I really doesn't understand the reviews. The food is pretty average and far from the taste of India."]

Adresse: 36 Rue Monsieur le Prince, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ["Was looking for a not too expensive cous cous dinner, but in a restaurant. Wasn't disappointed. No need for starters or dessert cos we were stuffed just from the cous cous & tagine. Excellent night out.", 'Great Moroccan food. Very authentic flavours. Great chicken tagine, couscous and lamb shoulder. Snails were good too. Mint tea was great. Excellent service.', 'Very good Moroccan food. Lunch is a great value.  We had the couscous with chicken and beef and the chicken , both delicious. The mix pastries for desert are good and the mint tea is a both yummy (sweet) and a bit of a show.\n\nThey are open for lunch even though Google says they are not.  Call or make a reservation.', "Nice place with Moroccan food. The first day we arrived without a reservation which is often required here. Had a little weird experience where it took some time after coming in for someone to talk to us or even acknowledge our presence. We made an online reservation for the next day and came back. We were greeted friendly and had a lovely dinner. We had a mixed starter plate to share which was delicious. For the main course we had the lamb shoulder and a tajine with chicken. Both were good but quite large, we probably would have had enough sharing one of those dished after the starter plate. Do visit, but it's recommended to make a reservation.", 'This was an authentic Moroccan restaurant that did not disappoint in both flavors, portions and service. Our table shared many appetizers and all were amazing - especially the Briouats aux ch√®vre (in picture). I had the fish tagine with olives, peas, and tomatoes. It was amazingly flavorful.']

Adresse: 53 Rue Notre Dame des Champs, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Affordable bar & eatery to hang out either before or after a film or theatre. Cool area too. Cinema screens aren‚Äôt particularly large however good enough for films that are no longer in the larger cinemas. They could have installed better seats‚Ä¶', 'A unique and hidden gem in the heart of Paris Luxembourg Gardens with an array of theatre plays all days of the week. A must see with a friendly cafe to enjoy the day.', 'Best Cordon Bleu and Salad Ever üôèüèæ\U0001faf6üèæüß°üíú', "Don't go there unless you want to be suffocated in their tiny cinema rooms - there is no ventilation in there. It was unbearable even in winter, hard to imagine what kind of hell there during the summer months.", 'Cool theater with a bookstore, restaurant, and streetside bar.']

['Food tasted authentic.  Ordered sate, nasi goreng, and ayam betutu. They were all good.  Sambal terasi was my favorite. Gorengan starter also great to share. Service was also great. If you plan to come with more people, I suggest you to make reservation before you come.', 'Good food, good service.\nWe had a nice evening !', 'Very nice. Very caring service. Enjoyed the food.', '1 weeks ago I was in this restaurant with my friends, taste of Rendang so authentic, service and ambience I felt like in Indonesia. The price so reasonable as well in the city center of Paris France. For sure I will be back again to this restaurant as long I‚Äôm in Paris', 'Stepping in is like being transported to Indonesia, the music and scents are marvelous. The staff were so welcoming and efficient ! The food was delicious and portion was good. We loved the sambal! We would definitely return!']

['We were a bigger group of 10 people and the server managed to find us a spot in the restaurant. We had almost all of the dishes in their fixed 33 euro menu. We really liked all of the food, especially the duck and onion soup. As a tip, the beef comes medium-rare or maybe even rare, so let the server know when you order if you want it more cooked.', "If you wanna know what is the salt, please visit and order the shrimp linguine.
Too salty to eat, 3 tables couldnt eat it, but the chief didn't admit his fault.
The manager made a discount 20% for only that dish, but I paid for it about 15 euros.
But the onion soup is tasty. I upload the picture finished eating.", 'Pefect spot for a fine dining around lovely small streets of Saint Germain. Deserves the price.', 'Second year in a row for New Years Eve dinner with French family.  Great location.  Food/service/price just right.', 'The place is neat, very well located near some of the most important points of interest in Paris and we were satisfied about food quality and service. The staff is really kind and welcoming. Prices maybe a little above average']

['Very good authentic Italian food. Cosy ambience is very chich and the service is fantastic. Carlos was great and took care of us. The place has a lot of repeating customers. One the best Italian in Paris and a must visit. Venue changed often.', 'Italian food in Paris to perfection! What a cute little place, perfect for lunch. Dive into Italy with meals created to perfection! The carpaccio was simple and therefore exquisite, made with only the freshest ingredients. The pasta, wow‚Äîhomemade with truffle, an absolute delight! I would come back every week!', 'Feel like I arrived Italy when I stepped in! Delicious food with great hospitality, this was really an amazing experience!', 'Stopped in on a Sunday night on my own without a reservation and was kindly greeted .
Friendly staff who were happy to explain elements of the menu. Menu included today‚Äôs date and looking at previous reviews on Google it seems to change regularly depending on fresh ingredients. I ordered a lamb ragu pasta and the food was hot, pasta was homemade and delicious and sauce was hugely flavourful. Service was also very quick and the servers were helpful and welcoming. Prices very reasonable considering the quality of the food.
Lovely location down quiet street, with terrace and indoor tables. Lots of people seem to make reservations especially for the terrace so probably best to book in advance if wanting to sit on the terrace.
Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice spot to eat! Thank you for your hospitality, I will definitely be back with friends!', 'A beautiful Italian restaurant. The lamb chops were perfect! The fresh greens were really nice to eat on a summer evening. The panna cotta was quite good. The interiors are very warm and beautiful. The staff was very friendly even when busy.']

['Phenomenal experience all around! The food was excellently spiced and absolutely delicious. The drinks were equally impressive, and everything was priced just right. The setting is extremely picturesque, making it the perfect spot for a memorable meal. The staff was wonderful, adding to an already fantastic experience. Highly recommended!', 'Cocktails are still excellent, but the food has not improved. We did not like the fish beignets. They were underwhelming in taste.  We loved the live music. Good service depends on the server you get.

REVIEW FROM 4 YEARS AGO (4 stars review): excellent cocktails; the appetizers were a little underwhelming, except the pastels.', 'Fantastic drinks with tasty and extensive non-alcoholic options in a delightful setting! I ordered the Madinina and it was so good.

Looking forward to come back for food & music.', 'We ended our last day in France here, and it did not disappoint.  The food was wonderful, as always I would like a tad more spice, but the flavors were near perfect.  The service was impeccable, especially since it was crowded and one server was running all the tables from what I could see and remained friendly and helpful.  The atmosphere was something wanted to see my entire trip in the country.  A love gypsy jazz band doing what they do.  Highly recommend.', 'Go see jazz at this place! Ask the server for rum recommendations. Don‚Äôt sleep on the food.

The servers here were friendly and very helpful in navigating the drink menu. We decided to have a little food whilst listening to the fantastic music and I‚Äôm so glad we did. The whole place has a tiki or island feel and the very well done. It‚Äôs super unique to find such a fun bar like this.']

['We loved our evening at Marco Polo.  When we visited Paris last year we were not able to get a reservation so I‚Äôm super happy that we did this time.  Everyone was so kind.  Luca and Adriano took great care of us.  They were just the nicest people.  And the food was amazing.  I will eat here everytime we visit Paris!!  I think this is my new favorite restaurant here!', 'Nice place to eat and really friendly and funny employees! We had a great dinner there without having a reservation:) when we come back to Paris, we will go there for sure again :)', 'This place is so quiet and romantic, we loved it!! The service, the pastas, the overall atmosphere inside the restaurant, everything was unbelievable!! I highly recommend it!', 'Had lunch there yesterday. Lovely place with excellent food. Hubby had costada milanese, it was delicious, as was my pasta al Sarda. Waitstaff were attentive and fun, and the Chef greeted us, and spoke to us several times during the meal. Overall amazing lunch, best so far mid week of our 8 day stay. We will go back again before heading home. Mille gratzie a Renato!', 'We had the most divine lunch here last weekend and the best ever bottarga pasta. It was stunning! Our waitress was lovely and the owner is fabulous. Such a huge character and passionate about making his guests experience the best it can be.']

['Great dining experience here. The sole was probably the best fish I‚Äôve ever had. The fig dessert was also great. They gave us free bread and radishes which I really liked.', 'They are currently on the 2024 Michelin guide so make a reservation as the restaurant gets quite crowded. Service is really friendly and staff are very helpful. Food is as good as any seafood restaurant in the area. Worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the area.', 'This restaurant offers an exceptional seafood experience, with standout dishes like perfectly cooked Dover sole. The fresh seafood, inviting ambiance, and relaxed music create a memorable dining atmosphere. The attentive service and well-curated wine list add to the charm. A top choice for seafood lovers in the city.', 'A solid Michelin guide restaurant.
What‚Äôs interesting? The history, the location and the Bib factor.
What‚Äôs a Bib? It‚Äôs a Michelin category for great price/value ratio. The menu is clearly a great deal, with excellent product. Not high gastronomy like the other restaurant I did (I‚Äôm specialized in Michelin stars - follow me for the reviews and updates of every single Michelin star in Paris‚Ä¶ and more) but it‚Äôs clearly well crafted and the chef can be proud. The service was super nice as well.

But let‚Äôs add to that the location: right in front of the Odeon theater, next door to the most famous French publishing house and with walls covered with famous patrons. And the most famous of all, Cocteau, simply did the plates.

Oh‚Ä¶ by the way it‚Äôs a fish restaurant but it shouldn‚Äôt be of consideration because (not only you can have meat) it‚Äôs good.', 'Wonderful lunch with a perfect view to the square in front of Odeon theatre. Great food and perfect service. Not cheap but not overpriced given the location and the quality. Offer even on Sunday a lunch menu, which I did not take though.']

['This restaurant is an institution that‚Äôs true, hence I was keen for a girlfriend‚Äôs lunch for two. However as time progresses service can fade a little here, unless they know you.
I Was back here in this area of Cluny after a while and was taken aback by the manager Malik who truly complained about why I won‚Äôt give his restaurant a great rating. The reason being I want to be true to my reviews and here the food and service is average seriously. The mussels moules were without any taste..and the fries not made fresh. I hope when back I get to eat a really fresh meal malik. Merci √† la prochaine', "Stopped by for lunch on my lunch own and the staff were super friendly and accommodating of my efforts to speak only in french, breaking Parisian stereotypes! Perhaps the best french onion I've had! Full of spices and flavour.", 'My wife and I were celebrating our honeymoon together in Paris at Le Balzar. The food and drinks was delicious and plentiful. The atmosphere was so romantic. The service from Kelly was perfect and he was able to recommend cuisines perfect for our special night. Kelly really got to know us and plan something special for us. Knowing someone who can speak English really help helped us out.', 'We had a very lovely meal here. French service is usually a bit scruffy but here it was delightful, with a smile, jokes and a wonderful atmosphere.

We will be back.

All the love from Germany üíï', 'I arrived at Paris CDG airport at 630am after two days of travel, I was tired and flat... by 830 I was sitting at a table in the sun, with an amazing simple breakfast looking at beautiful buildings and laughing with amazing staff who very generously put up with my terrible French.

A fresh, simple breakfast, in an amazing atmosphere, with friendly people. I looked it over beautiful old buildings and interesting people coming and going  I was reminded why I love Paris and was renewed. That is the kind of experience that should be rewarded with five stars.']

["We had this dinner cruise on the Seine booked well in advance.
The ride was smooth, and the pace was perfect (boat and service). Dinner was delicious. All the options were perfect. I ordered the lamb (highly suggest), and the others ordered the steak (just as delicious. They wished they had what I did, though).
I'm not a cheesecake cake person but chose to get the lemon cheesecake....BEST choice!! It was so delicious and light.
I only took photos of the 1st course that we ordered and my dessert.
There was a slight chill while seated (after Christmas), but it wasn't uncomfortable.
We got a lot of great photos and passed the Eiffel Tower just as it sparkled at 10 pm.
Thank you to the captain and crew for a great experience!", "I've booked a dinner cruise to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, and it was the best decision! I'm so glad I picked this one over other cruises that offer the same..Le Calife is so classy, elegant and cozy. The jazz music playing in the background (not live), the wooden boat, the design..I felt like I'm in old French movie. I loved the atmosphere.

We sat in the terrace and we had the menu Royal. The food was AMAZING. I couldn't stop talking about how good everyone was.

The staff was very kind and attentive and the views were beautiful!
Thank you so much for everything, I highly recommend it and I will definitely go there again.", "Exceptional dinner cruise on the Seine. We enjoyed the food, the atmosphere, the service, and the magical setting. One of the top three things I've ever done on vacation. They even did a little birthday celebration at the end that we didn't expect.
We had a glass of champagne waiting for us as we sat down, had a whole bottle of wine for the night. It is a full 3-course meal. What a wonderful eat in Paris. If you want to see the top highlights of Paris while eating an amazing dinner, go here.

The entire tour takes about 2 hours from start to finish and we got to see the Eiffel Tower when it was lit up and sparkling at the top of the hour which was near the finale of the boat cruise.", 'FANTASTIC LIFETIME MEMORY

we specifically choose this dinner cruise as opposed to many other larger cruises due to its intimate setting, outstanding reviews and of course value for money

We were not disappointed.  Love the quaint salon style dining, the OUTSTANDING service and of course the magnificent meal.

The scenes the cruise offered us were spectacular.

Loved it. A total highlight of our trip to Paris.', 'This dinner cruise was the highlight of our trip. The boat is the nicest dinner cruise boat that you will see on the Seine, and the service and food are excellent. This can be a wonderful dinner for a family, as it was ours...or a great option for a romantic date. People dressed smart casual for the dinner cruise, and it left the dock at 845pm, returning around 11pm. It is suitable for pre teens, and very well behaved elementary school kids. Loved it!']

["The line was out the door, so I'd recommend a reservation (via the fork). The crepes were delicious. We had one savory and one sweet crepe. The savory had chicken and cheese, and the sweet had pears and whipped cream. The staff was a little overwhelmed with so many people and it took some time for our food to come out. We were seated downstairs and the space is very tight with next to no space between tables.", 'These crepes were a miracle for my sweets craving this evening. So delicious! I asked for extra whipped cream on my caramel crepe and the staff delivered! We sat outside and were enjoying our time in the middle of a very classic parisian street', 'Had a great meal here. We had a variety of crepes with ice cream. The favorite one was Crepes Suzette with Grand marnier. Presentation was superb. Cappuccino were also very good. My husband got caffeinated and I got decaf. Service was very friendly. Nice to sit down and enjoy dessert', 'Friendly service, cozy store with delicious crepes. There is also English on the menu, so there were no problems with ordering.

The crepes are so soft! I ordered a classic crepe with chocolate sauce and it was rich, smooth and not too sweet. A simple yet delicious treat!', 'Lovely place with excellent quality crepes. We really enjoyed the savory and sweet offerings. The staff are friendly and service is really quick.

Three crepes and a drink was sufficient enough for our dinner, shared between two. But we had been eating all day so three may not be sufficient for all.

Prices are more than the average street vendor but the quality is better.

Side note, the restaurant is in a cool, little alley that seems to be popular with local residents. Great vibe in the area!']

['5/5 - An excellent restaurant!  Pretty busy, but I did not have trouble getting a table (just lucky?).  I did see a couple of people get turned away, so best to have a reservation or get there early.  My server was fantastic - he was attentive and polite.  The food was top notch - one of the better meals I had in Paris.  Highly recommend.', 'This small street is so cute and full of people! It was so hard finding a table but we were lucky with this restaurant. The food was excellent and also the service. Our server was super nice and recommended good wines', 'I have no idea how this place doesn‚Äôt have more stars. Everything was perfect. The French onion soup was so tasty and perfect for a cold December evening. The slow cooked beef was tender and delicious. The hot chocolate is homemade; it was so chocolately and actually hot. Service was so delightful. I will be coming back here the next time I visit Paris.', 'The staff is friendly and atmosphere was really cozy. Despite all these positive things, I have to say that the food was mediocre. Unfortunately, I would not dine here again.', "The Relais Odeon was the first place where I tried escargots (snails) üêå and it remains one of the best. If you're in the area, it's definitely worth stopping by just to sample them (assuming they're on the menu).
Their main dishes are also good: palreon de boeuf and tartare de boeuf were delicious and we left the place satisfied. It's defo a nice stopover for traditional French cuisine.
The dessert, caramelized lemon tartlet, was a cherry on top to the already great experience.

Taking into account the location and food quality, the prices are reasonable."]

Nom: Au P√®re Louis (Bar √† Vins Paris - Saint Germain des Pr√©s Paris 6)
Adresse: 38 Rue Monsieur le Prince, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We walked over to this place for dinner.  Old quaint building on the corner with a small bar up front.  Very nice atmosphere with old low beams and crooked floors. We sat upstairs.  We had snails and a roasted Camembert for starters. Both were good.  For mains she had the white bean and pork cassoulet that was huge and packed with flavor. I had homemade sausage from the Basque region of Spain with potatoes and veg. Really nice.  Amazing flavors. Great selection of local wines. The service was great and the food came out hot and timed perfectly. Definitely recommend checking it out.  Get a reservation they book up fast.', 'I can‚Äôt say enough nice things about this place, the food and drinks, and its staff. We were visiting Paris from New York, and I did a lot of research to pick out this restaurant based in its Google Reviews and character. We spent several hours sitting in the bar area, where we were assisted by a lovely female server who earnestly wanted us to have a good time. When a couple with a table near us left their spot, we asked if we could move to that table. She said yes, and I started to gather my water bottles, glasses, and glasses of whiskey to move it over myself. She stopped us by saying ‚Äúno please, let me - please go sit down at the new table. This is my job and I‚Äôm happy to help.‚Äù We were blown away by this simple act of kindness and service.

The good times continued through a round of appetizers including bone marrow (perfectly cooked and succulent) and Camembert. We followed it with the rack of lamb cooked a perfect medium rare on a bed of vegetables. We ended the night with a bottle of wine (recommended from our server who once again went out of her way to make sure we tasted and enjoyed her wine recommendation before pouring our glasses) and, and had a delicious dessert called the Floating Island.

I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. Our evening was memorable thanks to the excellent service and delicious food. We‚Äôll be back next time we‚Äôre in Paris!', 'Amazing service for a large group in their dining room. Food was delicious! Steak perfectly cooked and cr√®me br√ªl√©e not too sweet.', 'Escargot are really to die for! Also stew and french onion soup were excellent. Best meal we‚Äôve had in Paris!', 'The food is amazing, the service is great and the atmosphere is super nice.']

['Simple, traditional yet modern re-interpreted food that never disappoints.
This restaurant it‚Äôs my new to go place in Paris.

The waiter was really good very knowledgeable and professional but funny at the same time and he really make us feeling welcomed and looked after.

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt say the same thing about the lady with short hair who welcomed us at the door.
We arrived earlier because we wanted to have some drinks at the bar as we have been told that the cocktail really worth it, however the lady rejected us very rudely saying we arrived too early and pointing the time on the iPad!

Honestly we could have spent more money by drinking at the bar.

Apart from this little aspect the restaurant is amazing, very cozy and intimate and the vibe it‚Äôs super cool', "Sublime

First things first, you need to book as you won't get in otherwise. It's small, almost cozy and extremely popular

It's lovely :
The service is extremely friendly, very helpful and attentive, and they also make great cocktails üòÅ

The food while 'simple' (nothing snob, nothing to complicated) is just perfect. From the starters to the dessert it was lovely. I don't actually think I've ever eaten a meal more enjoyable.

We ate at the bar/counter. Not bad at all it gives you an overview of the restaurant and gives you a chance to chat with the guys behind who again are really friendly.

So, a great restaurant, great food, everything is fresh and therefore takes time to be cooked. Go and enjoy it, you won't regret it.", 'Amazing place for foodies. Great food, atmosphere, cocktails. All cocktails barman-girl was preparing looked great and tasty, very professional! Place to come back for sure!
I think i had one of the best aubergines in my life!', 'We are Americans on vacation in Paris, and were recommended this restaurant by so many people, we thought we had to go.  I wish we had skipped it - it was a waste of a meal in Paris.

Here is what we had and my thoughts:
Margarita - tasted like motor oil
Old Fashioned - very good
Scallops - how can you make scallops taste like nothing?
Burger - it was the most whatever burger. A good burger is easy to find and a great burger seems more elusive. This was an okay burger.

We didn‚Äôt stay for dessert so as not to waste more time there.

The restaurant looks cool and was mostly full of Americans. I‚Äôm good,  don‚Äôt need to go back.', 'nothing but praise for the wonderful meal we had here! each dish was excellent and the service was great. has a romantic atmosphere too so perfect for date nights']

['All the foods & wine was so good, I highly recommend their Tuna Steak & Escargot. But on top, all the servers and bartenders was super friendly and sweet. Will be back when I‚Äôm in Paris!', 'A lovely dinner with the best Parisian Service. The steak was a bit dry, but everything else was the best we had in Paris. The tuna steak with the pepper sauce is something I will think about until I return.', 'I had a lovely experience with the food, thoroughly enjoying the champagne, beef tartare, and chocolate mousse, finished with an espresso. Each dish was beautifully prepared and tasted excellent. However, I felt there was some room for improvement in the service. I‚Äôd like to acknowledge that some staff members are clearly professional and kind, though my server on this occasion left me a bit disappointed.

For instance, when I requested radishes with my starter, I was informed they were out of season. However, I later noticed that another table was served radishes, which left me wondering if there had been a misunderstanding or if my request was overlooked. Additionally, after asking for tap water, it was never brought to the table. I had planned to order dessert, but it seemed as though the server expected me to finish my meal quickly, despite it being only 2 pm (with lunch service continuing until 2:30 pm and I started lunch over 1pm). Despite my table server, the gentleman waiter who found my table (I walked in) was very nice and professional. Thank the gentleman.

While these details may seem minor, they impacted my experience. Nonetheless, the food was excellent, and I hope this feedback helps in fine-tuning what is otherwise a wonderful dining atmosphere', "Classic Parisian bistro featuring old world charm and the perfect bistro menu.  Extremely popular with locals so reservations, even for lunch, is a must.  The ma√Ætre d' can be rude but the wait staff are excellent as is the food.  All in all, worth a visit.", 'This is a quintessential French bistrot, from the waiters to the decor to the cuisine. We had several of our favourite French dishes here: Duck Confit, Beef Tartare and Calf liver. Bring your joie de vivre and enjoy!']

Adresse: 10 Rue de l'Ancienne Com√©die, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The coffee was good but only paper cups so if mouth feel is important get your coffee elsewhere. Croissant was very good. Only 6 tiny stools to sit facing the wall. Only one guy working trying to manage both counters and he was fairly snippy (admittedly my French isn‚Äôt great but I get there). The baguette feels right but I won‚Äôt be trying it for another hour. Probably not going back with the other choices available. I went because the hotel listed this as one of the 4 in the area that are particularly good. Well maybe the baguette will redeem them.', 'The absolute best boulangerie in Paris. I‚Äôve gone to so many and nothing compares to the range of options of this one.', "Amazing bread, amazing pastries and the best service I've had in Paris!", 'I liked this place very much. Super delicious pastry and nice service. Also offers sandwiches and salads. Good prices.', 'Patisserie bolongerie, chain of boutique stores around Paris with great french pastries and artizinal sourdough breads. Loved the apricot basil tart but others seemed not less appetizing. The breads looked great; a great source for a baguette or any other bread you fancy. Worth the stop!']

['I did not find an option to delete the comment, which I wrote  here to the wrong Castle. Sorry. Just edited.\nThe bad one is the Castel Caf√© close to the Eiffel tower. It is so bad that it is affecting other places with the same name :)', 'Not allowed in with white sneakers - as 1,85m blond model - rethink your choices, maybe \U0001faf6üèº but yes, anything but the horror of white sneakers in the club! üíï', 'You have to go to downstairs to experience the night club of this place. Just amazing! The decorations are exquisite while the lighting is perfectly adjusted. The bar, the stage are so artistic. If you have time to drop by the road here. This place is a must visit.', 'Castel is an extremely exclusive and well known restaurant/members only club. The restaurant is good, but the ambiance is what makes it. They have a club downstairs that has amazing parisien vibes and there is beautiful art on every wall.', 'didn t stay that long... didn t have to pay anything so have no idea about the cost. (afterparty "l\'amour est une f√™te") the place is historic, the question if it should be modernized... i say maybe only as far as air quality and cleanliness goes, a deep cleanse of some kind? the service was fantastic and the atmosphere of the fumoir s nice. the food was lovely, i hope the cook has some natural light and air in the kitchen :-)']

['Delicious brunch incl Cocktails üç∏ in a cosy atmosphere. Parisien pricesüò≥, but value for money üëå', 'Loved the experience! Great ambiance, cast was very nice, food is simply amazing. I had the chance of enjoying a great diner followed by a movie screen.', "A bit overhyped and hard to get in to. Nice drinks in the bar. Really messy dancefloor later in the night with spilled drinks everywhere. Doesn't live up to the hype. It's more like a regular night club, but a bit darker and a few floors down. If you miss it - don't worry. If you do it you're probably gonna have a nice time. :)", 'Good atmosphere and that‚Äôs what you go for - one server was fab and was was awful - hit and miss from my experience. Food was not good, truffle chicken inedible, like rubber. Seasonal veg sides entirely uncooked\n\nFun crowd and live music was good', 'Customer experience amazing from food to music, cocktails and decoration üëåüëå']

['Agree with other reviews-a cozy spot sans tourists. Garlicky onion soup, house made bread, salad and a glass of wine sitting by the windows and the heater was a perfect lunch after an hour wait to enter Ste. Chapelle and walking around the just reopened Notre Dame. The server was very pleasant and wanted to get our order in ‚Äúbefore the chef flies away.‚Äù', 'The cozy atmosphere and wonderful service made this dining experience a true highlight to our trip.  The food was delicious and fresh.  It was a hearty, homemade French meal. My husband had baked fish and I had a ratatouille quiche. This did not feel like a space where many tourists visit.  It was a wonderful find for us and gave us a chance to experience French cuisine not too far from our hotel. The server and chef were gracious.  It is a place we hope to return to someday.', 'Dropped by this quaint place during our son‚Äôs birthday. We were all tired from walking around the whole day, but there server really made us feel welcome, traditional French cuisine which was fantastic. They even gave us free slices of cake to celebrate our son‚Äôs birthday.\nCame back the next day to have more food and dessert :)', "needed a warm place to retreat from the cold after visiting Shakespeare & Co. and stumbled upon this lovely restaurant. had tea while waiting for dinner service which only starts at 7pm. they have wifi if you need it. it's a beautiful, elegant and quaint space. i love that it's dimly lit, gives you a very 80s-restaurant -n french-movies ambience, along with the framed artwork and shelved books. ordered croquettes de camembert (most divine), daube de b≈ìuf (which comes with tagliatelle) and the salad that comes with cheese. they were all delicious. the waitstaff were warm and friendly.", 'A really bad experience overall. The food was awful and the servers were rude. Do not recommend, you can find much better!']

Adresse: 1 Rue des Foss√©s Saint-Bernard, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We came to see an exhibit about fragrances and the history of them. It was such a unique and immersive experience! The building is also beautiful so be sure to give yourself time to roam.', 'The building alone is worth the visit. The temporary exhibitions (Palestine, Jean Genet) were brilliant, with lots of information to read.

It seems both exhibitions were mixed with the permanent ones. With signage not always clear (should we take the stairs or lift...), it was sometimes confusing. Not a problem since everything was great, but a bit annoying at times.

The bookstore has lots of choices to deepen the subjects...', 'A truly immersive and educational experience. This place is such a gem, I learned so much in 2 hours, about the Arabic culture and also about Baghdad, a temporary exhibition enhanced by Ubisofts Assassin‚Äôs Creed Videogames graphics and story telling.
My biggest takeaway was ‚Äúwhat countries are part of the Arab world‚Äù. Voila, excellent idea to come here when in Paris', "Really liked the temporary exhibitions, especially the one about Samarkand textiles and jewelry. The permanent exhibition seems to have interesting exhibits, but lack storyline or proper explanations, so it's not as educational and enjoyable as it could have been.", 'Overall a great place to be as there‚Äôs plenty of history there like the ancient sculpture of god ‚ÄúAl-Lat‚Äù (Photo attached). You can also view Paris from the top of this building which is free to access but the view is not as good as from Montmartre. The architecture of the building is very interesting because there are metallic motifs on the building making a facade (inspired from Arab culture) that move like a camera‚Äôs diaphragm to control the amount of light coming in. Plus, you gotta be very careful once inside specially near the open artefacts, art pieces and installations.']

['Great little Mexican restaurant in Paris.  I have ate here many times over 10+ years.  Usually everything is really good, last night I would consider it good.  Chips, salsa, and guacamole were my favorite.  Steak tonight was not as good as remembered, was chewy and not tender.  Soup was good.  Kids did not find many things they liked.  Margaritas were good.  Would try again to see if it was an off night.', 'I went for the first time, absolutely everything was delicious!! Great authentic Mexican food, hard to find food like this in Paris .
The Margaritas were excellent too. My favourite dish was the one with Cochinita Pibil, amazing flavour . Will be back for sure !', 'If I could rate with 6 stars, I definitely would. As a Mexican in Paris, this restaurant really made me feel at home. The dishes are genuinely Mexican, delicious and the right amount of spicy. Totally certified Mexican if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Mexican cuisine!', 'Awesome Mexican restaurant with friendly staff. I get the feeling that the food is very authentic. The salsa that comes with the chips are really tasty! A good sign for a Mexican restaurant üòã

I had the Mole and it was fantastic. Deep chocolatey and coffee flavors.

For dessert I had the Tres Leches with mango whipped cream. Very delicious!

Be sure to get some tequila cocktail or mezcal while your here ;)', 'Fabulous authentic Mexican.  This is not Tex Mex or an American or French version.  Deep flavors and spices.  Delicious tamales, sauce was amazing.  Mole great.   Margaritas good, service very nice and friendly.  Will definitely return!']

['My wife and I had a wonderful lunch at Benoit during our recent stay in Paris.  The service was attentive and the food was delicious.  The cassoulet and tenderloin were both particularly excellent.  The Michelin Star here felt very warranted, and we both agreed that Benoit offered a great value for our money.  Be sure to make a reservation, as they were not accommodating walk-ins while we were dining.  We will definitely return on future trips to Paris!', 'Excellent restaurant. I must say, if one is in Paris and would like to have the best version of classical French dishes, then this is the place. The lunch menu for 42‚Ç¨ is a steal and overall a lovely experience.', 'Nice atmosphere and service. Delicate cuisine. Tried my ever first escargots in my life and it was quite unique and satisfying. The lunch combo was an adequate choice for a great meal. The parisian flan was also beautiful ending. We were also served with plenty of small French desserts which tastes wonderful.\n\nI recommend this place for a great meal. Remember to make a reservation first.', 'Overall, the flavors were okay, but the dishes were pretty standard for a bistro. Compared to other bistros, the prices were much higher. However, the service was genuinely quite good.', 'Intimate setting and service, dainty decorations, good food, pretty place. Couple of normal diet and vegetarian both had full lunch menu and were satisfied. Only complaint is the ice cream was too sour and bitter to have more than a taste of. But, the chocolate mouse and other small treats were very good.']

['Great place to get compose-it-yourself salad at the foot of the Tour St Jacques. Lots of ingredients to choose from to put on top of a self selected base.', "After walking for a whole day, I walked into this cafe because of yelp review. And it is great. Great cheese cake. They don't have English menu but the waitress was very helpful with the translation.", 'We came here by the reciews from yelp and it was what we were expecting to be. Amazing coffee and most important the best server we met in Paris ,Valentine. She was very politr and kind ,gavr ys the best service', "You pick a base (variety of salads, baguette  pizza or flatbread), then you pick your toppings. It's all kinds of things you'd expect at a salad bar. My salad was big and filling, and exactly how I wanted.", 'Salon du th√©. Cosy place, very nice selection of tea. Good variety of desserts, cakes, salads, soups and drinks.']

Adresse: 10 Rue de la Montagne Ste Genevi√®ve, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['It was the BEST experience! The sumo wrestling was so much fun and the atmosphere was incredible. 10/10 RECOMMEND!!', "The sumo ring is fun. But it's very crowded and the place is not very big. 6‚Ç¨ per sumo battle, but we had to wait for a long time.", "I honestly don't know what else you could want out of a wrestling bar. I won, if that's important. (It is to me). Utterly fantastique.", 'Small bar with good music. However it gets crowded and there is not a lot of space between the tables and the bar. Very expensive also..', 'Great fun for a great price!! Only $5 per person for a fun fight!!']

['What a great restaurant! The best meal in Paris. We felt like we were in Italy. The pizza is fantastic. The pasta was fabulous. The desserts were just WOW. Excellent service. Thank you to Antonio and Valentino for a memorable evening. We will be back one day.', 'Excellent Neapolitan-style pizza, with prompt and very friendly service.', 'I loved this place, I came here to share dinner with someone very dear to me, and we absolutely loved the food. Good quality products and the service is also amazing! Thank you for making our night very special.\nWe had lemoncello and they even offered us another free round!', 'Soooo gooood. Pizza dough is soft and chewy. Pizza named CRU??? was sooo good, perfect combination with jambom and rocket. Staffs were so nice and lovely. Would def come back.', "The best pizza I've ever eaten in Paris! The products are really high quality and the pizza is really Italian style! The owners are really kind and professional in their work, Together with their staff. The restaurant is very welcoming, I also recommend the desserts which are really delicious! When I return to Paris, I will definitely have to go back! See you soon!!"]

["Known for their truffle menu, and although we didn't pick that, we enjoyed the set meal that we picked.

The complimentary bread with truffle butter was a good starting point. Among the appetizers, the eggplant stood out for me, showcasing cooking techniques and out of the ordinary flavours. Of the two mains we had, preferred the steak. It's better than what we had from a Michelin-starred restaurant few days before. The prawn main needed a little more finesse, one piece isn't as refined as the others. They gave free lasagna topped with bone marrow. Loved it and it needed to go in their main menu.

Dessert came in a wide variety, but my personal favorite is the complimentary truffle ice cream. A bit hesitant at first but it was very delicious.

Service is excellent. Each dish is described in detail which sets the tone for each dish. A small hiccup at the beginning because the table is a bit dusty, might be an exhaust issue. Still complimented the chef before leaving because what a great meal that was.", 'Amazing restaurant with high attention to detail. Wonderful food with focus on truffle flavour.

We visited there in June 2024.  It was my wife, 8 year old daughter and myself. We were warmly greeted and they had read our requests very well so that was already a great start due to any dietary requirements.

The menu is unique and they had also prepared something i.e had nice choices for my little one.

I would highly recommend this restaurant which is different as the truffle aspect to me personally was really nice. We enjoyed it a lot!

Thanks to the Chef for popping at our table and being so warm. Wonderful team of people and all the best wishes.', 'Brilliant place with delicious food, knowledgeable and friendly service and outstanding wine list.
Location is great for cosy/discreet gathering with private room also available.', 'Wonderful service and experience! We felt very lucky to enjoy this restaurant. The chef was so nice and very experienced.', 'Incredible experience in the Fall of 2018 during the Ryder Cup. Food was world class. Service was world class. We don‚Äôt drink, but we could tell wine selections were world class. I can‚Äôt wait to go back. Working towards it.']

['This place is a fantastic choice for simple yet delicious food! It‚Äôs especially perfect on Sunday mornings, where you‚Äôll find a mix of American families and tourists enjoying their breakfast and creating a lively and welcoming atmosphere. The vibes here are genuinely great, and the staff adds to the experience with their friendliness and attentiveness. True to its advertising, this diner perfectly captures the essence of an authentic American-style experience. The coffee stands out as exceptional, and the desserts are equally satisfying, adding a sweet touch to the meal. Overall, my visit was thoroughly enjoyable, and I‚Äôm already looking forward to coming back again!', 'I ate there this afternoon, and honestly, it was very, very, very, very good. I highly recommend it! It‚Äôs affordable, the staff is excellent, super welcoming, and very kind. I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars! I need to move to the US i like this place', 'Typical American diner in the 5th. There aren‚Äôt a lot of places like this one in Paris. You‚Äôll find all your American diner classics and great brunch options on weekends such as pancakes, eggs any style, smoothies, etc.

I had the newly added ‚ÄúEggs Benedict‚Äù, kinda disappointed but they were still pretty good.
Gets really crowed on weekends, you‚Äôll have to wait in line after 11am.

I recommend going there around 9-10am to get a table since they don‚Äôt take reservations.', 'American approved! 100% AUTHENTIC food, decor, and service. Bottomless coffee and pancakes were a hit but everything was delicious! I went here with some non-American friends and it was such a fun cultural experience for them!

They are so authentic that they also asks for tips at the end so keep this in mind. We had such a good time that we didn‚Äôt mind tipping our lovely waitress who confirmed the tips go directly to her.

10/10 recommend and I will be back!', 'Great experience and food at this diner.  Service was a dream and the food was excellent!  Would highly recommend to anyone in Paris.']

['Amazing Argentinean beef. You can actually taste that the beef is real argentiean beef.\nFriendly stuff.\nFair prices.', "The first restaurant me and my GF went to in France and it was a great experience. Great food and good service. My gf loved the vegetable and couldn't stop thinking about them the rest of the trip. They speak French and Spanish here and also English", "The food is good, we have been there several times, we really wanted to eat since we are regular customers, normally the schedule shows that it is continuous, but to our surprise they told us that the kitchen was closed, that they opened at 5 pm, it's a shame, they should change the schedule that it shows on Google", 'Liked it. The weekday lunch is great value and during dinner the Argentinian fair is good and reasonably priced. Can get super busy though.', 'Cafe del sur tries to be an Argentine Parrilla and to some extent succeeds.  The food can be very good on some days and a bit less so on others.  But the service is always friendly, the empanadas are delicious,  and it is very good value. I do not know many restaurants in Paris where you are sure to leave full without breaking the bank.']

['Visited this place 2 times, because my friend and me really love it.

Snails were delicious, not classical one, without the shell. Cheese souse in it was super good.

Also we  took salads for lunch - portions were huge and we really enjoyed it. Stuff is very friendly (not perfect English, but we were able to understand each other)

Really recommend!', 'We ordered the grilled rib steak with herbs and the duck with mushrooms. The duck was really good and tasty, but the grilled rib steak was the worst experience ever. The meat tasted rotten and we told the waiter. He offered to give a new steak, but unfortunately it tasted exactly the same, like rotten meat. We asked him if he tried and he said that he did and the taste was normal. In our opinion it had nothing normal tasted like rotten meat, no type of sauce had that kind of taste. The taste came from inside the meat. We ended up spitting out the bite that we took because it was really bad.', "The veal dish was absolutely gorgeous. The portions are massive and a good selection of wines. Very polite staff, barely any tourists, you're surrounded by the locals in the middle of Paris. Highly recommend!!", 'Close to Notre Dame, just 8 min of walking distance in a picturesque district of Paris. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food is simply great! Homemade dishes, large portions and the prices are reasonable. 1 bottle of wine, two seconds courses, one cutter of cheese, ham and sausages - 70‚Ç¨ for two people. Excellent quality and good value for money.', 'We had dinner there with my wife and kids. Amazing service and the food was delicious.
First time trying snails, they were good, with a really good/spicy sauce, and we got Escalope de veau montagnarde as main course. Portions were big. Easily to share.']

Adresse: 28 Rue Saint-Louis en l'√éle, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We ate here in NYE 2024.  The set menu was four courses and delicious.  High quality, beautifully presented, and reasonably priced.  We might not have chosen the specific courses in our own, but it was an opportunity to try authentic French cuisine. The service was impeccable but not stuffy or pretentious.  The restaurant is on a beautiful street on Ille St Louis.  Highly recommend.', 'A cute place in st.louis my sister went to before and decided to return together. We all enjoyed the dinner very much, friendly services and great dishes. The whole place smelled like truffle (which I love but not for some other people). Had an artichoke salad and duck fillets. Really well cooked and seasoned. Highly recommend.', "We've been there on a Friday evening for dinner. The food was delicious. We ordered the food of the day option and a vegetable plate, both are recommendable. The service was fantastic, very fast and friendly.", 'The perfect authentic French dinner on our final night in Paris! Located in the same street we were staying in and easily accessible, the Ma√Ætre d was beautifully helpful and attentive.\nL‚ÄôOrangerie Paris ISL is now on our Paris list! ‚öúÔ∏è', 'Classic. Chic. Great food. The service was excellent and friendly. Whether solo, family, group or couple... this lovely charming place is worth a visit.\nOver Christmas they had a nice set menu that will leave you satisfied and full.']

['Stopped by on a rainy day after visiting the Notre Dame virtual show. Le Zimmer is my usual spot when I am in Paris Center. No surprise, good food (French with some Asian dishes). Efficient staff.', 'Nice place for brunch. Took longer than expected to be served. I ordered scrambled eggs but was served fried eggs, and it then took a long time to receive the replacement. However, to give due credit, eggs were scrambled perfectly.', 'Very nice waiter and outdoor dining was pleasant. We had a drink and ice cream. Thank you for the friendly service!', "Traditional french food, good taste and presentation. Cooking standard is little different than what usually ordered in North America, we ordered medium rare but it's more like rare to my taste.", 'Very stylish place. Good food. Fine ambiance. Friendly service.']

['Great food (the chicken liver salad and the chicken absolutely delicious). Staff super friendly, polite and engaging. Service was excellent. Atmosphere was awsome too, the fireplace, the wine and a restaurant fully booked with people who looked happy (guaranteed the good food and wine contributed a lot) is what made a Monday diner special. Highly recommend. Oh and it is not expensive at all for what you get!', 'This place really rocked. If in Paris you need to check out this Michelin Star restaurant. They had a very affordable set menu, but  the sky was the limit too. Everything homemade to order. I had a salad with fresh cooked chicken livers. Have never seen that before. It was awesome. That was just the starter of course.', 'A very wonderful restaurant! All the food was delicious, and they had a huge selection of wines! The service was great and the atmosphere is very cozy and quiet, with an actual fireplace. I recommend very much!', 'Close to Notredame, across the riverside, we found this lovely real French restaurant, grilled chicken house specialties, enormous wine list, foie and cheese, beautiful desserts, big fireplace and amazing staff.  A great recommendation when going to Paris.', 'Absolutely excellent restaurant as mentioned in the Michelin Guide.  Walked in off the street around 9 PM on a Saturday (Google showed "as busy as it gets") and was seated quickly.  Waitstaff was lovely, service was excellent, and the food was delicious.  Will definitely return next time I\'m in Paris!\n\nI had the Filet de rascasse grill√© (grilled fillet of red scorpionfish).']

['Classic French place very close to the Eiffel Tower. Everything was good.  I had the terrine and the house specialty beef. Rustic. Delicious. Exactly what I wanted. We split the dessert. Also amazing.', "The atmosphere is very cute!!! They let us go down to the wine cellar to pick our own bottle of wine. Staff didn't speak much english but they really tried with us as English speaking tourists. But the food was very disappointing. The beef cheeks were not great, the soup was good but bland, and the chicken was just okay. Wouldn't come back for dinner but maybe drinks if that's an option.", 'Best dinner and location EVER! Service was great, food was amazing and it is such a cute place. Apparently it is the oldest restaurant in Paris. Highly recommend. Especially, in the spring when the wisteria in front of the building is in full bloom.', 'STAY AWAY! The man running it today, I don‚Äôt know if he was the owner or not, was terribly rude to my table and another table. We wanted our bill so we could pay. He said he was busy busy and couldn‚Äôt get to us. I watched him go over and straighten tea cups that didn‚Äôt need straightened. It made no sense that he was purposely avoiding giving us our bill. It seemed as if he was trying to prove a point. It would have made more sense to get us out so more guests could be sat. He told two women at the table next to us that they needed to hurry and make a decision. By the way, it took 30 minutes for anyone to take our order. We were the first ones there for lunch. We were charged $20 for a very mediocre bowl of onion soup. The listed price was $12. I didn‚Äôt realize that happened until I asked my husband later. The steak was bland and a little tough. Tiny portions of mashed potatoes and saut√©ed mushrooms.  There are DOZENS of nearby restaurants where you can have a pleasant and delicious meal. Choose wisely.  If you want the ambiance of seeing the oldest house in Paris, take a photo and keep on walking. Also, I make lots of Google reviews, so please do not think that I‚Äôm only reviewing this place because I‚Äôm unhappy with it. I report the good, the  bad, and the  ugly. Lunch today was truly disappointing!', "My favourite restaurant in Paris. It is located on the √Æle de la cit√© in Paris, about 3 minutes walking distance away from Notre Dame cathedral in a quiet small street.

A very romantic place perfect for dates. It can be a bit pricey but believe me, the experience is worth it, from the interior design to the food (of course) and also all of the staff.

The building dates back to 1512 and was turned into the restaurant Au Vieux Paris d‚ÄôArcole in 1723.

It is one of the oldest restaurants in the city and specializes in typical French dishes.

My husband had the coufidou d‚ÄôAubrac and he was so delighted by it that he took a literal bow for it and almost started to cry because it was so good. I also tried it and I can absolutely understand his reaction honestly.

He worked as a cook and is the embodiment of the foodie, just like me.
