This time I had my beloved escargots and they were perfect and I also had a not so typical French carpaccio though I wanted to eat something else but I didn't want to eat too many calories that evening.

We also had a big tuna pat√© and freshly baked baguette.

Both of us had Aperol Spritz which were perfect and later we also had a white wine with a friend.

We had a seat on the upper floor which is my favourite because of its luxurious burgundy red and gold interior. The plates are all antique and the cutlery contains beautiful Laguiole knives.

On the ground floor there's a wine bar where you can also get small meals.

The gar√ßons, the cooks and the owner are true characters and always very warm and open-hearted and funny and you immediately feel very much at home there. Sometimes the owner also sings along the Italian arias that are played there.

There's also a piano which is free to use and I played it this time.

The outside area is always very prettily decorated. In spring wisteria is blooming all over the outer walls."]

Nom: University Restaurant Cuvier Crous De Paris
Reviews: ['The best cost-effectiveness if you‚Äôre a member of crous.', "Unfortunately, I found a staple in one of my lunches here. The quality in general is not great, but it has standard Crous prices. I get that they have to serve hundreds of people every day, but I really don't know how a staple got in the food?", 'Everything is over cooked..\nWhat can i say..The food is relatively eatable ..', 'There are people jumping the line everyday!', "How surprised we were to discover that it was strawberry jam and not chocolate in this donut! However, it is decorated with packages of appetizing chocolate! 3rd time I've been fooled... take responsibility for your choices more proudly...\nOtherwise it‚Äôs not bad and not expensive! (Sometimes a little dry)"]

['We went for dinner and the food was amazing! The meat was so good and the desert was great. It was such a cute little French restaurant. The French onion soup was not traditional but even better than it usually is.', "So many things that went wrong with our visit today:
1. We were sat at our table, and upon ordering, were told that we had to leave. We were annoyed and after standing, he then promptly that there was a spare table we could sit at.
2. Service took SUPER long, from entering the restaurant to receiving our food took about 1.5 hours, and we were considered one of the quick ones. Most others took 2 hours. There were only 3 people serving a full restaurant. You could tell most people were impatient that their food hasn't come too.
3. Food was mediocre, and portions were small. Not worth the wait.", "Perfect dinner with this perfect restaurant in Paris. Outside the restaurant looks ordinary,does not look grandeur but don't judge the book by its cover as they say,you have to try and  dine.  Staff are friendly,professionals and most of all the foods are sumptuous down to desserts too! Definitely recommended if you are going to be in central Paris. I had a fantastic and unforgettable dinner with family (7 of us with a child) and they love the food. My nephew,Carl search this place and It was worthwhile trip to the restaurant. Tip: in the picture was the wine they offered and it tasted so good we had 2 bottles! and the price was affordable. It tastes slightly sweet white wine so if you are not into sweet,dry white wine then it's not for you. I had steak and it went well,too. Thank you,we will definitely go back whenever we are in Paris! ü§óüíïMerci!", 'This was a hit & miss type of place. They opened at 7.30 pm but were not prepared when we arrived for our booking. The decor is dated, dusty eclectic. The service was very selective. If you were the 2 young girls on the other table, you got much attention, but we got minimal. My partner got the sea scallop flan & suckling pig & he was happy. The gnocchi, salmon & vegetable tajine were okay. The house red was rough. We left on a flat feeling.', 'This restaurant was a cute and quaint place with good food and service. It was in a lovely area to go out in afterwards. My scallop and artichoke dish was AMAZING and the flavours were outstanding. It was slightly on the more expensive end but good for a night out.']

['‚Ä¶ Very nice Sports Bar, where one can stop and have a quick drink/beer/cider! They also serve sandwiches ü•™ on the side! Seat inside and outside! Friend-lii service‚Ä¶', 'Good music and ambiance, Guinness was not good', 'Great cocktails with a good price during happy hour.', 'Heard very nice things about it before, first time for me tonight. Good Guinness, prices are really affordable for Paris, bartender Guillaume was tending alone and doing an brilliant job. Very clean and welcoming place. Will come back. Cheers!', 'Nice bar with a pleasant playlist of rock music. Waiters and waitresses are very nice and joyful, insuring that you will have a good time in this bar. Moreover there is a cellar, which offers two different atmospheres for the same bar. Main perk of this place : there is free wifi! The code is written on the boards on the walls and this is very enjoyable. Nice colorful lighting and very beautiful neighborhood (near Pantheon and ENS).']

['This restaurant was excellent. Phenomenal vegan food! We had the French onion soup, the beef bourguignon and a chocolate cake with custard.
It was our cuisine highlight while on holiday in Paris. Highly recommend!', 'Had an unforgettable meal here while taking a short visit in Paris. The atmosphere was friendly and the restaurant service was very welcoming and professional. The food was outstandingly. We enjoyed the French Onion soup, Artichoke Pate as appetizers. The dinner special featured multiple enticing vegan proteins including house made sausage. The seitan stew with mushrooms and red wine was to die for- so good! The potatoes au gratin was presented beautifully. Meal paired with a delicious red wine.', 'Tremendous first class service! We enjoy the vegan life and were excited to come to this restaurant. All the food is vegan and tasty. The fresh French take on vegan cuisine was much appreciated. We had a butternut squash soup with crusty bread and a mushroom pate adorned with petit onions and pickles. Both were wonderful. The soup was simple, but heartwarming given it was cold outside. The mushroom pate was one of my favorites. I really enjoyed the texture and savoriness of this particular dish!  We also enjoyed the vegan roast with peppercorn sauce. That sauce was amazing and the stuffing was tasty. However, the vegan stew consisted of a seitan that became too moist by the time it was served to us. That said, the sauce and stew itself was perfectly seasoned. We used our leftover bread to sop up some of the stew. We were so stuffed, that we could not even order dessert sadly. overall, a very good experience, but will come with even empty your stomach to enjoy all the other options on their menu.', "The onion soup was very good.
The rest of the dishes are mediocre, the hummus, artichoke, seaweed and mushroom pate are pretty bad. The bourginion was alright.
The plating needs some work as well.

Overall, it's nice to have a vegan restaurant but they need to try a little harder", 'Cozy and down to earth restaurant offering all traditional French dishes. The buckwheat crepe with mushrooms, leeks and veggies was delicious. The mains came with a decent amount of salad as well. The french onion soup was good just a bit salty.']

Adresse: 18 Rue de la B√ªcherie, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['A lovely little find tucked in a small street not far from The Seine and Notre-Dame. The food we ordered was delicious and filling, my husband had the avocado and mango starter and raved about it. For mains we had l‚Äôassiette berbere and l‚Äôassiette zen, both were very good. But I‚Äôm reserving the best praise for my dessert which was the apple pie/tartin. It was a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth apples served with a chantilly cream. So good!', 'One of the best meals of our recent trip to Paris. Really unique menu blending veg/vegan options with a French twist.\n\nReasonably priced, amazing vibe and great location. Even my non-vegan family members really enjoyed it.', 'we had a delicious meal of faux gras, dauphinois and a gal√®tte, all the food was flavourful and satisfying. the dauphinois was the best dish we tried. the wine was also good. everything was well priced for the quality and the server was really lovely. one of the best vegan places in paris.', "It's a very cozy place to find good vegan food. I was looking for food while I strolled on the streets of Paris around Norte Dame, and found it. The girl working there was Indian too, but was friendly and knew French too! Great experience!", "What a lovely little spot. Great value weekday lunch menu and a real treat to eat at France's oldest veggie restaurant. The staff were really attentive and the food was delicious!"]

Adresse: 12 Rue de l'H√¥tel Colbert, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Truly exceptional. The chef's concept was a welcome surprise, different from many Michelin star restaurants. The menu is seasonal of course and the overall experience is worth writing about. The wine pairing was well worth it, varying between wine and sake.  We left thoroughly amused, satiated without being overly full, and only a little bit tipsy. We sat in the mineral lounge, which I preferred. Highly recommend.", 'Excellent dining experiencewith the fusion of French and Japanese cuisine being exceptionally well-executed. Every dish was cooked and seasoned to perfection. My personal favourites were the lobster soup and the pork. The lobster soup had a rich, robust flavour, and the hint of spiciness added a wonderful depth to the dish. The pork was incredibly tender and cooked to perfection. Their wine pairing was also good as well.

The staff were very professional, offering detailed explanations of the menu. The interactive element of guessing the ingredients in each dish was also unique and interesting, adding an engaging twist to the meal. Even though sometimes can be challenging. They also took the time to thoroughly explain the restaurant‚Äôs sustainability concept, from reusing broken plates to utilising every part of the ingredients to minimise food waste.

The basement seating area is nice, but the only downside is the lack of mobile signal or Wi-Fi, which we were informed before being seated. While I understand the restaurant‚Äôs aim to encourage guests to focus on the food, it would still be better to have internet access downstairs.

Overall, it‚Äôs a good restaurant and definitely worth a special visit when you‚Äôre in Paris, especially if you‚Äôre a fan of Japanese cuisine but are looking to try something new. I would recommend it!', 'An exceptional experience! The restaurant is intimate and the service is personable and very professional. The flavors are complex and interesting, and unique among the many restaurants in Paris.', 'Don‚Äôt miss this unique dining experience. The service was especially interactive because you are not told the dishes in advance and get to discuss flavors between courses. Perfect to celebrate a special occasion. Highly recommend wine/sake pairing as well as sitting in the ‚Äúcave‚Äù!', 'Omakase at its best. Nice people, creative, well executed food, nicely presented. Some dishes are spectacular. Only personal drawback: Uninspired bar-something piano music in the background that does not make any sense. But this place deserves a visit. The wine and sake  pairing also worked well.

Update Fall 2024: In six months, prices were raised significantly. Prices just turned
From from fair to borderline expensive. This i had to lower the rating to four stars.']

['Perfect dinner to break up the French food.  Light and fresh. Friendly staff and very fresh ingredients.  Sake was very special.  Seemed like a custom experience.  I did not care for salad, but everything else was over the top.  Fried chicken appetizer to the fresh mango dessert.  Waygu from Japan was better than Australia.  Kid friendly and happy we came.', 'We had a wonderful meal with great service from both wait staff and our chef! When visiting Paris this is a must try spot!', 'A friendly welcome, a hearty and fine meal made from good quality ingredients, a cook who cooks the food in front of you while ensuring the show.\nThe tasting menu at 62e and other take 72‚Ç¨ set menu is very good.\nI highly recommend this establishment.', 'We love the volume of the course menu. However we felt the food was served a little bit fast.', 'Very nice restaurant with an amazing service. Maybe one of the best teppanyaki restaurants i have ever tried in Paris!']

['Second time in this place, this time weekend and it was just wonderful. Ambiance, live singing and piano, delicious food and drinks, friendly staff. This is a place for people who love live singing and edgy panache atmosphere. We were lucky to have different performers and everyone is so talented. This place is for people with a soul ü•∞ who appreciate warmth ams passion vibes. I always make reservations to guarantee immediate availability. Gets really busy after 9pm.', 'Great place to enjoy your weekends! The band is really good, everyone is dancing, and the atmosphere is a perfect 5/5.', "Food was OK, nothing extraordinary, the food arrived a bit cold, but the taste was there..\nWe didn't know beforehand, which show it will be so I would advise to check before booking. The atmosphere was good, it became very festive and dancing started late in the night :)", 'My French husband came to visit feeling depressed. This is the bar from his university years and he loves going to the piano bar there. He attempted to kill himself coming back druged and blacked out from there. He explained he had been attacked by the bouncer for no reason and received extremely bad treatment from the personnel working there... Only one nice lady working there took his defense. We are in the process of suing this place for what happened.', 'Such an INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE. Do not sleep on this. Remarkable live performances, authentic French food, & in such an awesome location!!! Would come here every single time I visit. Great service too. 100% recommend if you want to experience a real French night out‚Ä¶. Not touristy at all.']

Adresse: 13 Rue de la Harpe, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Very friendly and welcoming\nService was fast\nFood was also very good with a lot of flavour. Ginger tea was good and fresh.', 'Excellent Indian food. I lived in Mumbai for 5 months and also am an avid Indian foodie! I first came here 21 years ago & now I‚Äôm back in Paris I made sure to find it! Excellent food! The palak paneer is excellent and I remember the butter chicken was incredible too! I had the prix fixe menu with salmon tikka!', 'Lovely meal! Great service! The best indian restaurant in Paris!!! I‚Äôve never had such great service! As you can see from the photo the table and view is wonderful!', 'Lovely ambiance, atmosphere, and food. Everything was super delicious and the service was very hostile and he helped us to choose our menu as it was our first visit.Totally recommended!', 'The most authentic Indian place I have been to. It‚Äôs amazing and the service is the best.']

Adresse: 3 Rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Probably my favorite meal in my 4-day stay in Paris ü§ç

We were a group of 16 and given a private room in their wine cellar which was BEAUTIFUL. It was a set course where I opted for the beef tartare, monkfish, then apple crumble.

The starter that stood out to us was the ricotta‚Äîso rich and flavorful! The monkfish was DELICIOUS! So well cooked. There was also veal and risotto which my family loved as well. The apple crumble was a very large serving, probably good for 2-3 people.

Special thank you to Siam, our waiter, who was very attentive with my large family and made our experience extra memorable!', 'Came to the restaurant without a booking and waited a bit for a table, wow it was so worth it! One of the best meals I had in Paris. Right in the heart of Le Marais - veal steak au poivre with the crispiest roast potatoes, pistachio choux bun with homemade pear ice cream and a delicious glass of rose from Bandol! The staff are efficient and accommodating, great service from them thank you. Would come again in my next trip to beautiful Paris!', "I recently dined at Jaja restaurant in Paris and had a fantastic experience. From the moment we walked in, the ambiance was inviting and the service was impeccable. The highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the mussels starter. They were cooked to perfection, tender and flavorful, with a delicious broth that had us dipping our bread until the last drop.

For the main course, I had the veal, which was simply outstanding. It was perfectly cooked, tender, and bursting with flavor. The accompanying sides complemented the dish beautifully, making each bite a delight. The portion sizes were generous, and the presentation was exquisite.

The wine selection was also impressive, and the staff was knowledgeable in helping us choose the perfect pairing for our meal. The attention to detail and the quality of the ingredients were evident in every dish we tried.

Jaja offers a delightful dining experience with a menu that caters to a variety of tastes. The combination of excellent food, warm atmosphere, and top-notch service made for a memorable evening. I highly recommend Jaja to anyone looking for a great meal in Paris. It's definitely worth a visit!

Rating: 9/10", 'Great food, wonderful service and a lovely ambiance!
We had a delicious meal here. The food arrived quick (but not too fast). The servers were very friendly. And the portions were large.
Lots of crunchy (very tasty) green peas with both my appetizer and my main course, the chef probably loves them too üòÑ
The pavlova was amazing! Definitely would recommend this place.', 'Everything was good, especially the dessert! I was not satisfied with their medium rare so I asked for a new one and their service was professional. But the quality of the meat was not 5stars so I would try different menu next time']

['I shop car for around the world because I love the pricing and assortment. This is a good store too. See the video.', "Today I made a purchase at a store and paid in cash.  After that:
- the cashier didn‚Äôt give me my change
- she detained me and demanded that I show her the content of my bag
- after that, she forced me to stay while they looked at the camera footage - apparently believing that I was a thief
- when the camera showed that they were mistaken, I asked her to apologize.  She refused.
It turns out that this store:
- my money was stolen (change from purchase)
- my right to inviolability of property and privacy of identity (they rummaged through my things without the police or adequate official procedures) was violated
- they did not show basic politeness.
I don't think this is appropriate behavior for a business dealing with people.  I believe that this violates international human rights standards. I intend to file a complaint against you", 'Just re-opened as Carrefour City. Much brighter, has bulk foods, and more ready to eat options than before.', "At 22.50 cashiers were already counting money, you couldn't pay in cash, only card.  A security character forces us to charge ourselves while he denies entry to other consumers.  In bad manners he takes away a product from me which begins to shake, and logically the interior breaks.  Finally after asking for explanations he insults me.  I am a tourist and I do not speak your language.", "A bit of a bigger selection than others, but prepare being racially profiled. I'm a regular citizen in the area, and the staff will stand behind you while you pay and go through your bag. A part of me wanted to think they were doing it to everyone out of precaution, but I realised it's only towards people of darker skin...

After my first experience a few months ago I stopped going. Today I went again for the first time and the same thing happened to me again. It's infuriating, disrespectful and discriminative."]

['I felt inspired to leave a review because of how I felt at Zig Zag Cafe. From the moment I walked in, Hacene greeted us with a warm and friendly smile. The staff made me feel right at home, providing prompt service and genuine hospitality throughout the evening.\n\nThe ambiance was cozy and charming. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a relaxed evening with friends or a romantic night out.', 'The service was good. However the food was average and a simple tea was 5.90 euros. Quite expensive. The chicken burger was so so. Falafel sauce had no taste', 'The staff was kind with us and spoke english with us after noticing that we were tourists. The food was tasty, fair price, and a nice view on the street. It‚Äôs near Phanteon so it‚Äôs kinda full, we found a place without reservation. The tables are very close to each other, it‚Äôs a bit too closely, i barely had place to sit down and to eat. Overall i can recommend this place', 'Was told card machine was working having explicitly asked at forefront. Machine not working then made to feel like a criminal.  Would not go again. Fin', 'Fantastic Ap√©ro Jazz 5x‚≠êÔ∏è!  Nice service and ambiance, the Nachos de luxe were very tasty. Good wine and IPA bear.']

['Fantastic food and fast service', 'quality, variety, service', "Don't stop at this store, they are quick, they don't even look at you. I hadn't read the reviews before, too bad for me.
But I must say that it is the copy-pasted text response from customer service to less favorable reviews that surprises me. It shows Jeff de Brujes‚Äô appreciation for the customers, copy and paste.", 'We used to buy chocolates in this shop every year for Christmas and on every occasion but our last visit will definitely be the last. We got it (as often) for almost 200 euros and as always no commercial gesture, not even a small chocolate offered. In addition, limited choice and unpleasant reception most of the time.', 'I have been running a hotel in the area for almost 10 years and I have been purchasing from this store for all that time and I can say without hesitation that I have never been disappointed: neither by the availability, nor by the quality, nor by the friendliness of the managers. They have just renovated their shop, which makes it even more pleasant.
I no longer buy chocolates except from them.
I highly recommend to everyone.
Best wishes
Celine']

Adresse: 28 Rue Vieille du Temple, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews: ["It's one of my favourite places in Paris! The most delicious food, every dish has its unique taste. The bistro has everything made in-house, which is fantastic! Warm and comforting ambience. And the service is superb. A must visit! 5 stars!", 'No better place to sit down for a humble bowl of onion soup and a glass of red wine in between shopping and strolling through beautiful Paris. The soup was light, the cheese on top hearty and rich in flavor. All I could have wished for.', 'Service is excellent by local standards. The bread they serve is fantastic. We got a couple orders of duck and they nailed getting the skin cooked nicely. The onion soup is amazing. Portions are big, even for Americans, so come with a big appetite.', "This bistro makes all homemade dishes and is the equivalent of Paris Farm-to-table. They use French procured ingredients from within a km distance (sorry, can't remember). You do not need a reservation or booking (but if you have a large group you can call ahead for courtesy, which we did). The soup de l'oignon (Americans call this French onion soup) was authentic and phenomenal with the compte cheese (that just kept giving delicious pulls!). On a street called little treasure, this place was certainly a gem. The service was also good.\nNote: there were two vegetarians with us, who knowingly agreed to have the soup made with chicken broth, however it was possible to have it made with an alternative. I think it's okay since we might have held up the group). Every single person was silent as we ate this soup, even the guide, for a while. We would all recommend returning and trying other menu items.", 'I‚Äôve been thrice to this restaurant on this trip and  the food is made with quality fresh ingredients - fantastic. If you go in the summer you cannot miss the tangy tomato tarte tartin which is jammy and sweet and sour at the same time. The french onion soup is made from chicken bones and is light and clear. The foie gras was creamy and  rich too. Service was great. We were served by Dmitri who was efficient and friendly. The second visit we were served by a very sweet Sri Lankan man. Super helpful person. A must visit.']

['Best sandwich we had in Paris. We had the ham & cheese baguette and it was absolutely delicious!! Open quite late and still had food available before closing. Reasonable price. Great service too. Thank you!', 'Lovely place! Nice service and delicious cappuccino and croissants! ü•ê üíï', "My first visit here was just for a baguette and chocolate eclairs. Both were so good. Surprised the baguette was warm since I bought it in the afternoon but so glad it was,  as it was probably the best I've had. Crunchy outside and light inside. Add beurre aux sel de mar and it's all you need. There's another EK just up the street that serves good coffee and some different food items than the other store.", 'Eric Kayser is a Parisian boulangerie which branches scattered around the city including this place on Rue Monge. This is solid bakery with high quality bread products and good coffee. Opening hours are 7.30am to 8pm daily (closed on Mondays)

We stopped here one early morning during a recent trip to Paris for croissants, pain du chocolat and coffee and found everything to be very good. The breads were flaky with soft, fluffy layers, much nicer texture than what we found at other places during this particular trip. Espressos also tasted very good.

Note, there was only a few bar side stool seats at this Eric Kayser. Otherwise, just take-away order counter where the various bread, pastries and other products are on display.

Would happily revisit this bakery again. It was the best place we found for morning coffee and croissants this time around in Paris.', 'Baguette, chocolad chad and pain au chocolat were delicious. They have plant based milk. Staff was very friendly and spoke english.']

Adresse: 3 Rue des Grands Degr√©s, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Great choice for a date night. The mashed potatoes are to die for, the ambiance is romantic, and the service was really good. Recommended if you are looking for an authentic french cuisine experience.', 'Very nice bistro ! Authentic French cuisine with real flavours. The service is very enjoyable. Definitely recommended!', 'A really nice and popular French restaurant that is nearby the Notre Dame. I am glad we have reserved in advance on Fork, it was full house on a weekday lunch time. The lamb I had was great, but I guessed we all agreed we like the chocolate tiramisu most, and the duck least.', 'Superb food from this tiny restaurant across the river from Notre Dame. Service was excellent, food was delicious, wine list very well chosen. Cosy! Totally recommended üëå', 'One of our favorite meals in Paris. We dined in the room in the cellar. Our waitress was excellent, patient, and helpful, making great wine recommendations. The food was delicious. We had entrees, mains, and a dessert, sharing back and forth. Everything was great - interesting and well seasoned. Fantastic experience.']

['Small hidden  gem japanese restaurant  in the marais. Everything  was delicious.  Service with their staff, especially  with Jean  are helpful. Ramen  tastes wonderful. Well recommended.', "It's a good small Japanese themed restaurant in Paris. We ordered the Arc en ciel, Dragon, and Shake California rolls.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience. The food tasted really good, and we were served with a smile. I recommend this restaurant.", 'Best service!! Excellent option for sushi! Great place for a date. Would at a little soup or a salade to side given the prices‚Ä¶ though', 'Small japanese restaurant and the food were amazing. Highly recommend this restaurant. The service are good and quick.', 'Small restaurant next to the main street. A friend suggested a quick dinner here and it ended up a very good experience.\n\nWould try more next time!']

Adresse: Place du Pantheon, 2 Pl. du Panth√©on, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
["If you are a Brit, Canuck, or anywhere in between, this is the place for you!  Did my best to speak French but the head bartender was as 'English' as me!
Fish-n-chips are an excellent choice if hungry. Cheesecake is awesome.
A great Pub atmosphere.
You gotta eat here in Paris!!", 'Stopped in for the English Breakfast on the weekend and it was delicious, with large portions for a reasonable price. I spent a few years in England, and it feels like a proper British pub. Highly recommend to check out the full English breakfast on the weekends.', 'Nice place to make a pit-stop; it‚Äôs a self service pub with decent choices of beer and pretty ok food choices too. Had better burgers but I guess it‚Äôs a matter of individual taste :)

Prices: We had 2 beers, 2 burgers (cheddar burger) and 1 cappuccino for 41‚Ç¨.', 'Amazing beers and the great atmosphere. It can be a little bit hard to find a table (or any place to sit at all) depending on what time you arrive. Also, I was a bit disappointed to hear at 22:05 that the kitchen closed at 22h. I only left because I couldn‚Äôt order anything to eat. Anyway, I still recommend it for the great beer options!', 'Happened across the pub on a walkabout and felt very comfortable as soon as we walked in the door. Extremely helpful, friendly and fun staff. Was there for about 9hrs on the Saturday and then for a fair few hours on the sunday. Food was amazing, good drink selection available and i honestly cannot praise the staff enough, it was an amazing experience and such a fun couple of days that we will be back üòÅ

Thank you bombardier staff, you were awesome! ü§òüèªüçª']

['We really enjoyed their branch in Brussels. When we saw it in Paris, we wanted to try it right away. Fresh products, delicious and diverse. This time, instead of breakfast, we chose the menu of the day and were pleased. Although the staff made us feel a little nervous, it can be ignored for the food.', 'Very cute little cafe- the decor was nice, clean and open space. The service was great we were served by Radia she was so nice and accommodating and Sylvie gave us great shopping recommendations. Great service!!  The cafe offers gluten free options and loads of vegan choices as well as an English menu. The food was good but a little pricey.', 'We visited 1 week ago, overall experience was so-so. We went inside to have a look on all the pastries and to chose what to order but we were pushed out to sit and read the menu instead. The service was a little bit rushed. We did not enjoy much our first breakfast in Paris.', 'Sylvie provided outstanding service at Le Pain Quotidien. She was welcoming, attentive, and made great recommendations. Her friendly attitude and attention to detail made my visit a pleasure. Thank you, Sylvie, for such a wonderful experience‚ÄîI look forward to returning!', 'Servers both very sweet and attentive, both good English (which is ideal as my French is poor) I found this place by looking for gluten free options in Paris.

The breads texture and taste was impressively like regular bread and the dessert was incredible and light. The wine (bogey) was also great. If it wasn‚Äôt my last day I would have went back.

All the best and highly recommend

(Just noticed I left my review for the one in London, not Paris üòÇ here‚Äôs the Paris one)']

['I come to Black Dog since 2005 to enjoy great steaks ü•© in a unique atmosphere. The lomo is simply fantastic, the potatoes are delicious, specifically combined with the plate of 6 sauces. I enjoy myself every time.

Generally I come here for celebrations. I had my first date with my wife here, celebrated birthdays, promotions, basically all milestones. I brought family, friends and coworkers. Black Dog and the delicious steaks have become synonymous with good times in my life.

I love the variety of people eating here. You can find everything from metal heads to families and business men in this restaurant. Everyone enjoying a great meal!

I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough. I will be back, order my lomo erectus and have a great time. Again and again üôÇ', 'Wonderful bar and restaurant with a metal music theme! The staff is absolutely charming and exceptionally accommodating! The food is phenomenal and highly recommend everything on the menu! Some of the best steaks we have had in France! Not to be missed!', 'Nice vibe, seems to attract the ‚Äúright‚Äù crowd, meaning that people seems fresh and enjoying the vibe while letting other folks be.

Music is kind of low in volume. Also during the night they went from black metal
And other metal styles to techno out of the sudden which was visibly annoying to everyone but whoever switched the music üòÇ', 'If you like death metal, you have to eat dinner here or grab a beer here. In fact, everyone should.

I‚Äôm actually not a death metal fan but came as an open minded adventurous person. This place is the real deal and THE FOOD WAS AMAZING.

If this was a common jazz bar the line for the food would be wrapped around the street, and/or reservations would be booked out for months. It‚Äôs a secret gem in Paris.

Now, I have to say, it is still a secret because it is a *legit* death metal bar and restaurant. If you want to blend in wear all black and maybe spend a few months growing out a thick beard. (Pro tip: Grab a Shining t-shirt). It‚Äôs worth it!!

Meat was tender not fatty. The meat was imported from Argentina. The dipping sauce was flawless with the slightest hint of spice (not too much). The potatoes were the best, most potatoey, yellow potatoes I‚Äôve ever had.  There isn‚Äôt a near second I‚Äôm considering, I just know it was the best potatoes I‚Äôve ever eaten in my life. The dish I ordered was called ‚Äúthe threesome‚Äù on the English menu.

I. am. stunned.  Absolutely excellent.', "Very awesome bar! Cool decoration, good music and good beer.

Edit: In light of their response, perhaps we had a misunderstanding. Still leaving the original text below, and I'll add that the bar was very welcoming.

Fairly certain me and my girlfriend got kicked out of the restaurant section though, so maybe not a very tourist friendly place (we were obviously dressed as tourists, and we speak no French; never expected to stumble on this place). YMMV."]

Adresse: 8 Rue de l'Ecole Polytechnique, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The food is delicious, offering authentic Ethiopian flavors that stand out. However, the service quality could be improved to enhance the overall dining experience.', 'If you want authentic  Ethiopian cuisine in Paris, you must come here.  It is a very small place, so getting a seat for a larger group can be challenging, and the service can be a bit slow, so be patient & but the food will make up for it!!! If you want the authentic dark injera/bread (made with Teff), you have to ask for it because they only make it on request, but it is well worth the upcharge! In a word, the food is absolutely "Delicious"!!!', 'Absolutely fantastic food, lovely staff and the atmosphere?! Just gorgeous, 5/5', 'Never had Ethiopian food before but I am now fully in love with it!\nAs a vegetarian I feel so welcomed here, each of the dish is just absolutely delicious, the portion is perfect for me as a woman too, I even ordered the traditional cake, yum! The cream and coconut go so well together.\nThe owners are so friendly and lovely, I wish more people can come visit cause they are amazing! ( but yeah since they are already quite popular pls make a reservation before coming)', 'If you‚Äôre an aficionado of Ethiopian Cuisine like I am, you don‚Äôt wanna miss Godjo in Rue de l‚Äô√âcole Polytechnique, not far from Le Panth√©on. Jonas will treat you to some of the best specialties such as Doro Wot, Ketfo or Ye Beg Alicha. If you are more on the veggie side, then you might consider a Messer Wot or a Beyayenetu! Make sure you come on my behalf. You will be greeted as a friend!']

['I was disappointed from my experience at this restaurant.
Most of the waiters speak only Spanish, no French no English it was hard to communicate. The service was slow.
We ordered tapas and paella, we waited around 45mins for the tapas to be served.
The tapas are overpriced and small, the tastiest ones were the jamon iberico and the chorizo, I didn‚Äôt like the croquettas. The paella itself was good.
The Sangria tasted like soda.

We went a Friday night, it gets so crowded that you need to shout to have a conversation.', 'Very nice place, great atmosphere, and very friendly staff. The food was good but they can be better.', "traveling in Paris for more than a week...enough for Parisien cuisine ?
why not Spanish ?
the Restaurant located in the street full of bar and restaurant.
can't compare to eating in Spain, but very acceptable in Paris.
delicious tapas and paella, octopus salad....enjoying  Spanish foods in Paris.
Staff is very busy...need more patience to waiting order like other Parisien Restaurant, when they ready they will came to you...üòÑ", "Great service, fast and friendly. Speaking Spanish was an absolute plus. Very tasty food. Conveniently located. I'd take Spanish food over Parisian food without blinking.", 'The food is way overpriced. As they did not have an english menu, we had to translate the whole thing on google. We ordered bread with guacamole which did not mention meat on it on the menu and it came toped with meat. When we voiced our displeasure, they did not offer to bring something else or remove it. The paella was average at best. Almost no vegetarian options.']

["Cr√™perie Beaubourg is a nice restaurant, old-fashioned and cozy, good to enjoy a traditional Breton meal.
Few steps from center du pompidour, with a beautiful view on fountain de stravinsky.
The menu is centered around galette de sarrasin, made from buckwheat flour, and crepes.
If you're a vegetarian, you'll be pleased to find many options.
And no meal at a creperie is complete without a glass of cider.", "Our friend who is from Paris told us we couldn't go to Paris without going to his favorite creperie, this place. Just wow! He was right, this place was so delicious and the best crepes we've ever had. We each ordered one savory and one sweet crepe, as recommended by our friend,  and had some beers to go with our meal. We loved everything about this place from the outdoor seating to the service to the food. We had a wonderful time and will come back when we visit again. Highly recommended!!", 'The perfect place for a classic French cr√™pes with view on the Stravinsky Fountain. The very reasonably priced menu cannot be beat, with a savoury cr√™pe (galette) compl√™te, cider, and a cr√™pe beurre-sucre (butter and sugar) for dessert ‚Äì the child menu comes with a nutella cr√™pe. The galette is made to perfection, with a crispy exterior and soft, spongy interior in a paper-thin pancake. The sweet cr√™pe is thin but stretchy, allowing for a high nutella to square unit cr√™pe ratio. They now have a caf√©/th√©/chocolat gourmand with three assorted cr√™pes!', 'Superb place for the atmosphere and food! Their crepes are amazing, and facing a great the Stravinski fountain and Le Pompidou is lovely.', 'Nice outdoor location in front of the Pompidou Museum and fountain. Food was very good. Service was so-so. They served us the wrong wine and then gave us a warm bottle.']

Adresse: 2 Pl. de la Contrescarpe, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
['My favorite cafe during our most recent trip to Paris! We stayed a block away and I went every day. Wonderful wine menu and they were so kind with our small children. They had coloring sheets and markers, as well as high chairs and let us bring our stroller in. Highly recommend this gem!', 'French fries and blond beer 1664 pint was very good, it came with a lemon in glass (we also liked the aromatic flavor). But I didn‚Äôt like the cafe gourmand, because deserts didn‚Äôt satisfy me in terms of taste. Oh and they offer some popcorn with drinks which is nice.

Overall I think it‚Äôs a nice caf√© to meet with friends for a few drinks and to enjoy the atmosphere of Place de la Contrescape. btw happy hour from 17h to 19h!', "Such a gorgeous bistro facing onto the square (that's actually roundüòâ), we sat outside and watched the evening's passing parade. Wonderful service, all the staff were very friendly and had excellent English. Great value for money, ordered wine (generous serving), a cheese and meats board (with complimentary top up of bread) and escargot (stunning flavours).
Definitely recommend", 'We came here before the pandemic many times. I believe the ownership has changed since then.  The menu is very basic French brasserie. The food was just ok. The tartare was very big and tasty. We enjoyed the ambiance of the square.', 'I have lots of great memories associated with this cafe and the streets nearby: this is where I stayed when I first visited Paris in 2009 as a tourist. Some of the best people-watching in the area is at this cafe. Order the hot chocolate on a cold day. :-)']

['Very kind and quick service, 8.30euro mojito is legit, the big water bottle super appreciated in the heatwave too - great people watching spot with a lowkey vibe and techno music in le marais and a great rest spot in a LGBTQ safe area üåà', "Soupe √† l'oignon ! Nothing more delicious than a soup a l'oignon after a visit to the Pinault Association museum, situated across the street, specially when it is cold and raining outside.", 'The minimum order for paying by card is 5 euros. They don‚Äôt let you know first
I step in just for a black coffee, when i want to pay, they say at least 5 euros order or you have to pay 5 by card.
Kind of weird tho', 'It was snowing, cold and wet outside when we stumbled upon this cafe which is comfortable and cosy.  We ordered coffee, chocholate and omelette. All were nice. The waiter and cashier were friendly as well.', 'Avoid this place!!

Visited this place with a friend yesterday and I immediately needed to use the bathroom. Since I‚Äôm pregnant I need to use the restroom more frequently. The waiter, before I had returned to our table, accused me to my friend of using the bathroom with no intention of buying anything. His attitude was very hostile and almost a bit aggressive. It made us uncomfortable and kind of wanting to leave. He then proceeded to stand at our table to wait for us to order, staring us down. I asked for another minute to decide but he just kept staring at us, making us even more uncomfortable. To make him leave us alone for a bit to decide we order a coffee to start with and my friend asked for a glass of tapwater. He then said, loudly, ‚Äúdo you think I should work for free?‚Äù and went on to trash talk us to the table next to us (probably not knowing my friend speaks french). They just looked confused at him. At this point we felt very ill-treated and wanted to leave. He brought us a watery coffee and a small glass of water, asking us to pay immediately (which he didn‚Äôt ask anyone else) as if he suspected us not to pay.

Made us feel really unwelcome and uncomfortable, will not return and do not recommend at all.']

['We have arrived earlier. Staff speaks English. Beer is reasonable.  The location privileged. We asked Nachos which we liked. The amount of source could be larger. If you are In Paris I recommend the place.', 'The Long Hop is the quintessential local + international pub. The vibe is just right for casual dinning and drinking with any crowd.

It‚Äôs not only centrally located, but also positioned nicely in a cozy off-corner spot with view on the grassy Place Maubert, without loud traffic.

Quick drink service at the bar, great prices, cool staff, pool table inside. Huge seating area inside and out, with terrace + sidewalk area making it great for outdoor drinks and charming interior nice for a relaxed but quality dinner.

Hard to go wrong here, been many times!', 'Stopped here for a happy hour pint and it turned into 2. Great patio. Excellent beer selection. Very lively location with fantastic people watching. I did not have any food here so cannot speak to that but if you are wandering Paris and get thirsty this is a great place to pop in.', "Nice place and nice bar, there are TV screens inside and outside, the bad thing is that if you want to have a coffee and you don't have cash you can't pay with a card. Because they don't accept less than 10 euros and that really annoys a lot of people.
I think the d√©cor is acceptable and you can feel comfortable inside, there is a darkness, I don't know if it's the d√©cor or they turn off the lights to save energy.", 'Late on a Sunday night, this was the best place to have a cold beer and relax for a few minutes before going back to the hotel. They play all the big sporting events on TVs (including American football!). The long hop beer (French lager) was awesome. Definitely recommend!']

['Nice little place with friendly staff.  They were very accommodating to us as we only speak English. An English menu was provided to us after we were seated which was very helpful.  The food was excellent overall and was priced well.', 'This restaurant was our favorite from our trip to Paris. It has such a unique and intimate cozy atmosphere with delicious food and the owners are very friendly. We cannot wait to go back!', 'So fun, highlight of our very full trip, just so cozy and throw back, food delish. Great prices all around.  Band was to vacation Thursday so we caught them on Tuesday!  Top notch!  Yummy!', "This was our last restaurant in France after touring the country for 10 days. On the balance of what we've tried and eaten (including three 1-Star restaurants), this probably ranks in the top 5, comfortably.", 'Very good food and wine, staff was friendly and helpful.']

['Delicious Italian food and great atmosphere. The staff was accommodating and attentive. When we said we would be sharing dishes, they brought pasta already split in two dishes. We will definitely come back next time we‚Äôre in Paris!', 'Their food and service quality were exceptional! The ambiance enhances the whole dining experience.. I cannot wait to come back! üß°', 'I highly recommend this restaurant. The ambiance is amazing. And The staff members were welcoming and helpful. The food was authentic and tasteful. I had the fried shrimps on a bed of chopped vegetables, the shrimp was excellent but I found the taste was too vinegary coz the capers are pickled already so high acidity and salt, then they also added pickled apples. So I suggest either the apples of the capers. Or they could replace the capers with green black peppers that are green n fresh. We also had the fish that was beautifully presented, opened and stuffed with the vegetables. Same thing the olives in their were picked so they were high on salt and acidity and that strong flavor was dominant over the delicious sea bass and the delicate vegetables. I also had a special dessert for the first time in my life I had eggplants for dessert !!!! Yes it was made into jam with orange peel and a ball of ricotta cheese to balance it off, very sweet but good.', 'The restaurant was happy to accommodate a booking for 8 people. We enjoyed a lovely evening with excellent service and delicious food. The standout was the friendly and welcoming staff. Definitely recommended. Cheers!', "My wife and I and two friends had a lovely dinner recently at L'Enoteca.  I enjoyed the veal, my wife had a wonderful pasta, and our friends had two different fish selections.  All the dishes were fresh and flavorful.  The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was comfortable.  The restaurant is near our apartment, so we definitely will be back.  Great job team!"]

Adresse: 51 Rue de la Harpe, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews:
["We've been visiting this jazz club for several years now. Earlier this month, we lucked out and were there for the late Sunday night jam session. We had a blast! The music was fabulous, the crowd enthusiastic, the staff as welcoming as ever. It feels like a real slice of Paris life.", "The waitress, the food, the wine, the live jazz, the atmosphere....what can I say....AMAZING! My favorite part beyond the music was the intimacy of the restaurant/jazz bar. The service was quick. I could see the man in the kitchen working diligently to get everyone's orders out hot and  fresh. The waitress had great recommendations for a snack and wine.", 'There a live concert by a duo who were really great. The concert was free but for the drinks, which were reasonable. The staff were kind and, it seems, really good to the musicians!', 'We came to Monk for a late dinner and since it was pouring rain outside we decided to take a table deep inside the restaurant. From our table we could see the water running down the cobblestone street and hear the thunders but we were warm and protected from the wind and cold.

We had the hamburger without the cheese and beef tab with French fries. Both portions were big enough to satisfy the strong appetite. The beef was very tender and juicy. It was served with a tiny dish with caramelized onions and a small garden salad.

The service was quick and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The prices are reasonable too.

It was interesting to hear Freddy Mercury, Queens, The Weekend and Ariana Grande as a background music in France.

We also ordered a warm chocolate dessert with a vanilla ice cream, but couldn‚Äôt finish it. It was very good, only we overestimated our abilities. üòä

We had our very late dinner and when we left around 11:00 pm and there were still people in the restaurant.

I definitely recommend you to try this place.', 'We came here for drinks with some friends on Saturday night and we were pleasantly surprised when we saw there was live music. Very cozy and vibrant place. Even though we missed the happy hour, prices for the wine list were very decent for Paris standards. For beer lovers, they have an extensive selection of draught and international beer. The waiter was very attentive and nice to us.']

Adresse: 7 Rue du Cardinal Lemoine, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: ['What a wonderful place to stumble upon after cabaret! Beatrice and Bruno welcomed us, talked to us about wine and cheese, selected a delicious cheese plate and wine to accompany it. I would love to come back, well worth a visit.', 'I came for the wine and left with a great conversation with the staff. This little gem I thought would be crowded in lunch time but was lovely and quiet for my lunchtime visit. The owners know wine and are very open to discussing at length for your deeper knowledge. It‚Äôs a superb place to dine alone or with a group. Highly recommend! Magnifique !', 'The best ever \U0001faf6\nLovely people, food and wine, everything delicious üòã', "Great wine, great food and owner is very polite. Amazing experienceü§ó don't skip this place.", "American Review üá∫üá≤ - Great fabulous selection of wine. Nice staff. HOWEVER, it is NOT a wine bar üö´, as the Google description says. ü§£ I felt bad cause we got a little scolded when we didn't order food and tried to pay. We were waiting for the show to open down the street. So üôà don't make the same embarrassing mistake we did."]

Adresse: 13 Rue des Lavandi√®res Sainte-Opportune, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews:
['A small French bistro with an attractive rustic space.  Excellent vibe and very pleasant service.  The food was good but not great.  The most interesting aspect of this place is that there is no wine list.  The waiter who I presume is the owner simply asks if you prefer a lighter or more full bodied wine.  We started with a lighter wine and were presented with a generic Burgundy and for a more full bodied wine we were given a basic Rh√¥ne‚Äînone of which were inexpensive and appeared to be natural wines.  Personally, I prefer to choose my own wine from a list‚Äîa list that has a variety of wines not just natural.', 'This place is just amazing.  Great service, very patient to let you try as many wines until you find what you want. Great suggestions.
And the food is just so so good. From fish to amazing beef. I‚Äôve been there a few times, recommended to friends and everyone loves it.
The menu always change. The planche mixte is delicious', 'A very high praise for a very good place. We were greeted, seated and served quickly for their set lunch menu. Their knowledge of wine was excellent and they enjoy picking the wine to your tastes. My preferred red was 3rd taste in, my partners was guessed first time.

Service was excellent, warm and inviting by all servers and excellent English speaking staff.', 'Terrific meal last night amongst wine bottles and cozy warm seasonal French food. Despite the odd wine selection process (read - the server chooses first and then you approve) overall it was an experience I highly recommend', 'Amazing experience with delicious food!
Very nice and friendly people! Loved it! ‚ù§Ô∏è']

Adresse: 1 Rue du Pont Louis-Philippe, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['This was our first time managing to get a reservation and it will not be our last!! The food was fantastic! The service staff were impeccable and the atmosphere is reminiscent of a romantic movie scene! Would recommend setting a reservation at least two months in advance. We were a group of 6 adults and no one was disappointed with their meal choices! This restaurant is being added to our list of dining events every time we are in Paris! Definitely recommend!', 'We walked in (3 ppl) and managed to get a table for drinks and light lunch and we were so happy we did!

First of all this place is incredibly uniquely decorated- very old school classy, red carpet and vintage silver pieces. It‚Äôs amazing.

We had the cheese plate and some other snacks along with drinks, all tasted incredible. 11/10 would recommend.', 'I highly recommend this beautiful Parisian jewel. A friend recommended it and I‚Äôm very glad he did. The atmosphere is out of a movie with lots of locals, delicious food and a lovely staff. Walking distance from Notre Dame but slightly off the beaten path, this is a place for visitors who don‚Äôt want to be surrounded by tourists.', 'I am sorry to give this restaurant less than 5 starts, but I have to. At first I wanted to give 3 - only because of the host.
The food was very good, nice wines, the restaurant is gorgeous, but the host was so unpleasant.
We walked in around 7pm and asked for a table. He went inside to ‚Äúcheck‚Äù if there are free tables and told us that everything is reserved and he sit us outside. We were fine with the outdoor table, it was a very nice evening, but the funny thing is that he kept sitting all the tourists who came after us outside, keeping the restaurant inside empty the whole night.
Not sure if those are the directions that he was following or what, but really didn‚Äôt make us feel welcome. With his attitude he made us feel like we don‚Äôt belong there. The scene with him ‚Äúchecking‚Äù the tables inside was so unnecessary‚Ä¶
Other than that, everything was very good and would recommend this restaurant to everybody.', 'I will be dreaming of these scrambled eggs for a very long time. This breakfast was exactly what we needed before a long day of exploring Paris. The inside of the building is spectacularly beautiful. We will definitely return the next time we are in the city.']

['The beautiful, boutique, elegant hotel at an excellent address in Paris. If you are looking for a cozy, intimate place with a touch of charm and history, this is the right hotel. A burning fire in the fireplace completes the very pleasant atmosphere in the cold months. Pleasant staff, always willing to help. Thank you for a pleasant stay.', 'Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of Paris - fairly close to Notre Dame.

From the moment we arrived, we were greeted on the street to help with luggage, was able to take a shower/change clothes in their spa after our red eye flight.

Staff was fantastic and helped us with any needs - from showing us around the property and in our room to helping with restaurant options.

The room was so beautiful and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.

The location was in a high-end part of town close to most things.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming going to Paris.', 'My husband and I had a lovely week at Pavilion de la Reine. It was our first time staying there and we really enjoyed our great room and the delicious breakfast each morning! The staff was wonderful and so accommodating! We will definitely stay again in the future. And of course Paris was lovely even in the rain!', 'The Concierge made reservations in advance of our visit for the major site we wished to see. Anything we needed at the hotel was sent to our room immediately. The large lounge was delightful for relaxation and meals when we chose to stay in - car service arrived quickly to get to our dinner reservations and rooms were cleaned beautifully every day of our stay. I would return with pleasure.', 'My wife and I stayed at Pavillon de la Reine on our final night in Paris, the perfect way to end a celebration of our 40th wedding anniversary. This is a stunning gem set on an interior courtyard off the beautiful Place de Voges. Everything was perfect: an attentive and highly professional staff, beautifully appointed and comfortable rooms, a sumptuous breakfast. It exceeded our expectations in every way. Highly recommended!']

['Chocolate mousse. That‚Äôs it! That‚Äôs all you have to order. However the duck and mussels were also pretty tasty! And the service was great. Being seated at the bar, we had an excellent time being entertained by the bartender. It does get pretty busy though so reservations are highly recommended. We were just lucky that we got a seat at the bar on a Tuesday night at 9 pm.', 'The menu is only in French, but if you have any questions, the staff can easily help you in English.
Like everyone says, you definitely need a reservation; otherwise, you‚Äôll only have a chance to get a table after 10 PM. Another option is to stop by the day before and book a spot for the following days ‚Äî that usually works too.
The seared duck breast was crispy and delicious, and the potato sides were amazing.
A lot of people ordered the mussels, and they were great! The pesto on top was perfect for dipping bread.
The only downside is that it gets really crowded, and the seating is super tight.

Still, it‚Äôs definitely worth a try!', "It's one of the best restaurants I've been to. We had ratatouille, duck breast, and the heavenly chocolate mousse. Everything was super delicious and amazing.
I highly recommend making reservations as it gets super busy, and the waiting time could be over an hour.", 'By far the best restaurant we ate at in Paris.
Tucked away on a quiet street in Les Marais, Chez Janou was everything we‚Äôd hoped for.
Very busy restaurant and you‚Äôll not get a table for dinner without booking.
We had the 10pm sitting and where worried the restaurant may be quiet but not all all. Every table full and the bar in full swing.
Cozy and bistro like with a really amazing atmosphere.
I believe our server was Mariana and a complete star. So welcoming and fun to speak with.
She found out it was my partners birthday and out came the shots.
I don‚Äôt even need to tell you how good the food is, but I promise you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
Just try and leave room for desert because the chocolate mouse is not to be missed.
Thank you for an amazing evening and we wish you all the best for the future.', 'We arrived at 12pm on a Thursday in Nov 2024 without reservation and got a table without waiting.

Our server spoke English and we managed to order smoothly. They provided lunch menu but we went for a la cart. Both items were really really delicious! Highly recommend.

I can only give the atmosphere 3 stars as the table was way too small and it was too packed between tables. Coming here in Nov with big coats was a bit hard to fit in such a small table. Having said that, the decoration was cute!

Service was completely fine! Our server was nice and spoke good English. We are non French but were treated properly.']

['We were at the cartoon Moanna. There was a 30 minute commercial where they drank alcohol, girls kissed girls, commercials for aggressive films for adults. ü•¥ And you with a 6 year old child. Not normal.', 'Great set of cinemas in my neighborhood which plays first run films. Screens are very good, and several are large. The theatre is clean and friendly and close to places to get a drink or a bite to eat before or after the film.', 'The lady selling the tickets was nice.', 'House of Gucci here is in french language! Totally disappointed such a wasting my time and ticket, The cinema should present clearly to customer that this English movie is voice over in french.', 'Rude staff especially with families and kids. No air conditionning in the summer (stale smell).\nWould not recommend this place.']

Adresse: 12 Pl. de la Bastille, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
['The best healthy food restaurant in the area

Everything freshly cut which is insane tasty

Great selection of juices too

Little hard to read the card it looks like a wife formule haha ‚òÄÔ∏èüíú', 'Very yummy breakfast. I ordered the brunch and I was not disappointed at all! Everything was super delicious. Really good value.', 'A nice cafe close to Bastille metro station- perfect if you want to drink your coffee and look at the passers-by. The food is fresh and tasty, we had fruit salad and some shrimps curry. The waiting time can be a bit longer on weekends as they have a lot of clients, but nothing extreme.', 'Perfect, nothing to add!
The food is amazing, the service is friendly, the vibe is cool and I came back also with my kids, it is FANTASTIC', 'Usually this is one of the best references to be sure to have great food. This time unfortunately fried chips were cold (definitely not fresh) and the pancake as well.']

["Good food. Nice outdoor space. Authentic live music and one of the best mojitos I've ever had. Staff were friendly and it was a large menu.", 'Great place, kind smiling people.
Prices are perfect! Totally not expensive, especially not considering this is in the middle of Paris!
Like all Cuban places, very lively!
The live band was really great, we enjoyed celebrating our birthday here.', 'Being in Paris for the Olympic Games, I had the pleasure to find Cuba Compagnie Caf√© Restaurant to dine in many times.
I heartily recommend it to everybody to dine at this restaurant.
Food, cocktails, service, music, and atmosphere are great!
I will miss Cuba Compagnie but I will come back 100%!', 'Fantastic Cuban restaurant that serves great food! We had tapas of fried plantains, chipirones & torreznos with wine and beer. The restaurant has such great character with a great bar and nice wall decor. The one part of outdoor seating has sand which added to its ambiance. They also had a DJ playing great salsa music! Highly recommended!', 'Wonderful place, beautiful decor, tasty food, authentic music and great service (Thank you Ashish!)']

Adresse: Gare de Lyon, Pl. Louis Armand hall 1, 75012 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Absolutely excellent we took the first meal because we had somewhere to be 45 minutes for the calve lamb at your table. Was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend. OMG and the desert to die for :) Light delicious refreshing, not too sweet full of fruit to clean the pallet', 'Excellent cuisine, very friendly staff who all spoke fluent English, great environment!
My wife enjoyed delicious tender lamb and I enjoyed tender duck or canard. (I empathize ‚Äútender‚Äù because both lamb and duck at other restaurants are cooked too long which makes them very tough.)
My wife and I look forward to coming back again next year.

Update: one month later, I asked my wife, ‚ÄúWhich restaurant was the best?‚Äù She quickly replied, ‚ÄúTrain Bleu.‚Äù I agree. This is significant because we enjoyed excellent cuisine at four or five other famous restaurants.', 'Le Train Bleu is a feast for the eyes more than the palate. The food is adequate‚Äîsatisfying but not memorable. If you‚Äôre coming solely for a culinary experience, you might leave underwhelmed. However, the real star here is the stunning decor and breathtaking ambiance, which make the visit absolutely worthwhile.

We had the pastry-wrapped sea bass for two. The presentation was gorgeous, and the table-side theater of cutting it up added a touch of drama to the experience. That said, the taste was a bit monotone, with the filling having a seafood pungency that was slightly overpowering, even for me as an avid seafood eater.

The grandeur of the space, with its opulent ceilings and historic charm, is truly something to behold. It does get very busy, so making a reservation is essential to secure your spot in this iconic setting. Go for the atmosphere, and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.', 'A must in Paris for its atmosphere, evoking good old times.

The service is really disappointing. By the pint of view of the waiters you need to spend over ‚Ç¨100 in beverages, otherwise they‚Äôll offer you a very low-quality service.

Regarding the food, it was good but nothing special for which to say ‚Äòthe best‚Äô.', 'It is a must in Paris. The food is not that that great but the setting is amazing and the service is amazing. Definitely recommend. We had the 5 course meal for about 120 euros each plus the alcohol.']

['Amazing food! I overate here and left happy, such wonderful entrees I never tasted before. Thank you!', '1- really good atmosphere, you can feel some privacy
2- the entry is good but a bit expensive (22‚Ç¨).
3- the main plates were delicious but it is not enough to be full.
4-  the araki is authentic and turkish, but again a bit expensive (9‚Ç¨) for 4cl.
5- kunaife: the last time i bought from that place was really good. This time was not good, no cheese inside it and the upper layer is somehow burned and hard.
Overall, for 75‚Ç¨ you can have a good turkish experience for two person.', 'Great restaurant, everything is home made ! Humus and soujouk are crazy, not expensive at all and the Turkish atmosphere make you travel on the Bosphore', 'Had dinner here. We booked through The Fork/La Fourchette app. Restaurant was featured. Excellent food. The restaurant design is nice too. Will recommend to friends.', 'I was really disappointed.. even though the meat was not that bad, the quantity was ridiculous. We all finished our plates and were still hungry. The tea was transparant and did not taste anything like tea. To conclude overpriced for nothing']

['Dont get fool by the looks of the food.The food did not live up to the hype although the presentation of the food was nice only the scallops and lagoustine was ok not worth the price. The pigeon sauce was extremely salty. The service was ok not anything special not worth anything near one thousand euros. This restaurant summarize the whole michelin industry of being a big SCAM. Pairing of flavors is subpar especially the weird pairing of oysters and a earthy watercress sauce.', 'Classic haute French cuisine at its best in a beautiful setting inside the Marais. One of my favourite restaurants in Paris and hope will never lose its three Michelin stars because the guide tends to penalize classic cuisine in favour of anything ‚Äúcreative‚Äù. Here the portions are generous, the presentation classic, and execution is perfect. Service is traditional. A great culinary experience.', "Bonjour!
I‚Äòm writing to you regarding dinner experience last night.
Aside from the food, the service was very disappointing last night. Since we were sitting next to real flowers, I understand there could be bugs. Throughout the meal, a bug flew around the table,bugging us around the whole time, and eventually sitting on the rim of my wine glass. However, when I informed the server, he just waved my wine glass to flick the bug away and went straight back to work. There was no change of glass or apology. I‚Äôm not sure that was the proper way of service of the three-starred restaurant. My partner changed his water glass because it smelled fishy, but the new glass still smelled fishy. I visited some of Michelin restaurants in different countries and even in Paris, but this kind of service and response was shocking for me. I believe a three-star restaurant is not just a place to come for food, but a place to experience the overall service and atmosphere. I don't know how far my reviews will go or the service team will listen, but I'm writing this because I hope it will help you run your restaurant in the future. I‚Äôm writing this long because I want other potential customers who will be visiting your restaurant from abroad to experience a better service.
Thank you for reading my comments so far.
Hope I can get a lot better experience next time I visit L'Ambroisie.", 'We were really looking forward to eating at L'Ambroisie however neither food nor service lived up to our expectations. The captans were patronizing and condescending - on one occasion the captain didn't like the way I cut foie gras, so he literally wrestled the silver wear out of my hands so he could cut it himself; multiple times, when asking how our dish was, he would say:"That's because I recommended it."
Food was also neither traditional French nor very creative. Simply boring.
I suspect, because we attended a dinner during the Olympic games, they assumed that we weren't the food connoisseurs  and could be treated as novices.', "I had trouble finding a lot of information out about L'Ambroisie for English speakers/Americans. I found a few blogs and Reddit posts, but nothing solid, so I wanted to write down what to expect.

Treat this like gambling. The money is already spent. you will spend a few hundred Euro per person. That's just the name of the game. You'll enjoy it a lot better if you don't do the math while you eat.

Dress code. I went in November. Every guy had at least a sport coat, button down, nice slacks, and nice shoes. Every woman had a nice sweater or dress. I saw a few posts that said people sometimes show up dressed down, that was not my experience. Dress up, you're going to a nice dinner.

The restaurant was very quiet until all of the tables were sat and having conversations.

There is not an English menu and it changes sometimes. So be ready to ask some questions, the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable with any questions we had.

Every course is expected to be an order for each. In America, we will share an appetizer or dessert, that's not the experience at L'Ambroisie. You both order an appetizer, you both order a cheese course, you both order a dessert.

When you enter, you will be asked if you have a reservation and if you have a coat, someone will take it. You'll then be shown your table where everyone will have their chair pulled out and pushed in for them.

L'Ambroisie does not do cocktails but has one of the most expansive wine lists I've ever seen. Use the sommelier, she was excellent. She knew what we had chosen for our mains and based off of the type of wine we said we normally drink, she picked a lovely bottle for us.

Come hungry. The starters are huge and could be mains on their own. You'll want a starter, you'll want a main, and you'll likely want the cheese course after dinner and dessert.

I had lobster, my partner has scallops in a nice curry sauce.

When you order the cheese course, a huge tray of some of the best cheeses will come to your table. You'll be visited by the cheese monger who will ask about preferences and suggest some cheeses and will cut it at the table for you.

Plan on taking your time. You're there for the full experience. You'll likely be eating for two hours. Overall, great experience."]

['Had a great dinner at this place. Rigatoni alla Norma (veggie) was superb and also the roast chicken. Tiramisu topped it up. And a surprise visit by a local cat at the end :)', "We've been looking for places like this during our stay in Paris, and it was introduced to us by locals. The interior and the food are very French. We loved the atmosphere and enjoyed the dishes. The smell of Andouillettes sausage that my husband tried I will remember forever (lol!)
The service was slow, but it worked out well for us, because we had enough time to talk to our cousin we haven't seen for 7 years", "Great casual place to meet up with friends, have a few drinks, and eat authentic french food at reasonable prices in downtown Paris.
The atmosphere and decor is very cozy and the service is amazing. Very friendly staff who would attend to you quickly. Reservations are not allowed and the place is usually very crowded so be prepared for some waiting time.
Food is decent but not the best that I've tasted.", 'Such an amazing place. The servers were serving with absolutely big smile even after ao much rush. That was something i notices so well and made me to write this review.
Ambience was so nice too. One recommendation would be to increase the no of veggie items on the menu. 5 stars for the place.', 'My friend and I went out of an event late in the evening and were lucky enough to find this brasserie with kitchen still open. The ambient is quite comfy and food was tasty. Service is prompt and kind. I think is a good place to go if you‚Äôre around Bastille and you look for some classic French food. Prices are pretty affordable.']

Adresse: 29 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Very bad , very small space.They didn't understand a simple customization.  I ordered a Frappuccino with extra shot of Espresso and a donut. They didnot even give the basic minimum as in a tray for me to carry them.  No attention to the customer.", 'Toilet seems permanently closed, Grande Latte consistently under-filled,  usually about 3/4 full then foam, Latte is not Cappuccino! Generally very dirty place, front door has been broken for months! Good music though!', 'Granted we arrived here while the Paris Marathon was taking place, but the place was so dirty.

We sat outside as inside was full and someone came out and cleared the tables full.of rubbish after about 10 mins.

The tables were not wiped and were very grubby.

I stood in a long queue to use the toilet, which was also very dirty. Water and paper all over the floor.

I am sure the staff were under pressure, but I can only comment on what I saw and it was well below a Starbucks standard.

Coffee was good.', 'They let us borrow the toilet without buying. So kindüòä', "I came to take my morning coffee Monday through Friday for the week 18-22 December. The service was excellent Monday and Tuesday morning but Wednesday, Thursday and Friday the employers were not that kind and fast. The coffee is okay but on Wednesday and Friday the portion was slightly smaller than usual which made me a bit disappointed. I will try another shop but I will still visit a couple of times to see if it changes. I don't know what happened after Tuesday."]

["I've been coming here for over 10 years, once a year (if I can help it), usually around Christmas. It's one of my favourite restaurants.

Both the Raclette and Fondue are to die for. I especially recommend the Abondance Raclette.

The Raclette is basically all you can eat. You get half a wheel of cheese between two people, and we have never managed to finish it.

The cheese wheel gets attached to a metal frame and a heater melts the cheese slowly into a plate, where you can bring it into your plate to eat with ham, pickles and potatoes.

The fondue has a bit more kick thanks to the alcohol, but you get less of it and less things to eat with it (just bread). Very good but still better for people with slightly smaller appetites. If you're going in a group you could always have it and then steal some Raclette from the others too.

A word of advice: Do not go here on a warm summer's day in the evening, as you will not be able to sleep most of the night from all the cheese üòÜ. Best to go here for lunch or early-ish dinner in the winter and go for a walk.", 'Great fondue, the portion is quite big! The staff is friendly. The place is quite crowded even on a Wednesday night, so make sure you make a reservation in advance. Reservations are by phone only!', 'Good fondue and friendly staff. It was not too busy here on a weekend lunch however I think the decor could be a bit nicer. The portion is quite big and we could not finish all the food so side dishes are not required!', 'Amazing Raclette traditional, awesome fondue with mushrooms, very kind with humour and helpful waiters, nice wine.', "A great experience. The food here is excellent, portion sizes are big, and we struggled to eat it all. Service was great, it was a bank holiday weekend in France, and we didn't make a reservation, but the staff still got us a table  as soon as they could.  At the weekend, please make a reservation."]

Adresse: 31 Rue de la Cerisaie, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Still good but has fallen back a step. Between my daughter and myself we‚Äôve eaten here five times in the last seven years. It is one of our go to restaurants in Paris. We love the atmosphere and the food has always been good. Our most recent visit on a Monday night was a little disappointing. Two reasons for the dissatisfaction. First, the tall thin bartender/hostess was not friendly or welcoming. I‚Äôm quite comfortable pairing and ordering wine, but I will often ask for suggestions from the wait staff. She was either unable or disinterested in helping and reacted negatively when I didn‚Äôt want the most expensive bottle. Second issue was that the one thing two of us came here for was the burger and they were ‚Äúout.‚Äù Not sure how you can be ‚Äúout‚Äù of hamburger and buns - you‚Äôre within blocks of dozens of butcher shops and bakeries. Seems a lack of effort on management‚Äôs part. Other than that, the young man serving us was friendly and good at his job. We would return, but suggest that the restaurant is doing itself no favors by having this young woman as their hostess.', 'Quaint, intimate atmosphere. We went upstairs for a more Parisian or homie feel. I had the lamb (I wasn‚Äôt asked how I wanted it cooked, so it was a bit dry for my taste, but was still tasteful), it came with some delicious potatoes. The mushroom risotto with duck was very delicious. The cr√®me br√ªl√©e was very good too.', 'The quality of food has gone one step back. I ordered the cheese plater, three the same cheeses were on the plate. It has become too touristy‚Ä¶. Not as it used to be‚Ä¶', 'Fantastic authentic little French restaurant. It was right outside our hotel and always busy so we gave it a try. Inside is cosy and the staff were very friendly. We had the special of the day which was mushroom risotto with chicken and it was incredible, one of our favourite meals. Would highly recommend', 'Found another hidden gem in the streets of Paris. Not so far from Bastille, but distant enough to leave all the commotion and tourists on the Bastille circle/round about.

The place is rather cozy with a cool ambience, the service is warm and the food absolutely delicious.
