Me and my friends all took a filet of the bar, a fish with silky white meat with a buttery texture. I think we finished it quite fast üòÅ. The accompanied potato pur√©e was silky and smooth on the palate and almost disappeared in my mouth.

I did not take the dessert, but my friends did. And oh boy the fruit ice creams were just perfect. I am definitely going again, and this time will get the dessert all by myself.

Highly recommended.']

['Late night. Hungry. So we stopped in off street without reservations.  We were seated immediately!

Prompt service.  Food was good. Not stellar, but it hit the spot.

Highlight was the Dolcetto. Very good and good price.

Rocket salad also good.

Contemplating dessert as I write this.', 'The pizza at this restaurant was excellent - the crust was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful.

The Caprese salad was also delicious, with ripe tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and a tangy balsamic vinaigrette. Finally, the gnocchi was melt-in-your-mouth tender and had a rich, savory sauce that was perfectly balanced. Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for tasty Italian food.

Amazing Panna Cotta!!!

One downfall is that they do not take Amex (American Express).', 'This Italian family restaurant offers an authentic and cozy dining experience. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the staff is friendly. The food is delicious, with fresh pasta, wood-fired pizzas, and flavorful antipasti. The quality is top-notch, and the prices are reasonable. Perfect for a family dinner or a casual night out. Highly recommended!', 'As others has written this is a very nice Italian restaurant with helpful staff and good food. It‚Äôs a little pricey and (though this isn‚Äôt so unusual for Paris) there were no high-chairs for our son, but we had a really excellent meal and will hope to return!', 'Nice atmosphere and ambiance. Italian restaurant and staff. I had pizza verdura which was delicious and I had Panna cotta for dessert which was absolutely delicious and the coulis was fresh pressed strawberries.']

["I found this place while looking for a good Full English Breakfast in Paris. Spoiler alert: instead of finding an English breakfast, I found an American one.

The products don't exactly match the UK ones 100%, but I shouldn't have expected that anyway. The food was good and full of calories ‚Äî as it should be! ;) The burger and desserts were also nice, and the restaurant has a great American vibe. If that's what you like, you should definitely visit.", 'Plenty of us love (or need) a protein-laden breakfast; for this, I head to Craig Carlson's Breakfast in America. This time I visited the BIA in le Marais & chose the brunch offering called CC's Mess: scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheddar, avocado, peppers, potatoes, and (I opted out of these two) onions & mushrooms. They kindly complied with my request for salsa.

It comes with toast & they very kindly heated the butter for me because I love melted butter on my toast. It's paired with a medium-sized stack of pancakes; I asked for blueberries (myrtilles) to be added ("On the side is a big thing for you." When Harry Met Sally) & it was delish.

Lovely & perfect. And just like home. Yum!

As for the atmosphere, it's that classic cozy American diner feel with a lovely addition of jazz standard stylings of songs like Green Day's "Wake Me When September Ends", The Smiths' "There Is a Light That Never Goes Out", & Gnarls Barkley's "Crazy".', 'A small but very welcoming place to have American dinner.
A very fluke that our waiter forgot my milk for my coffee but totally understandable as the place was really busy and he was on his own I believe.
Overall our family would highly recommend this place if your looking for  English speaking breakfast and have a usual American breakfast', 'We went to a small, charming breakfast place with our baby. The staff was polite, friendly, and helpful. However, the prices were a bit high for some items. We had asked for coffee, and they brought it with milk. They also refilled the second cup for free. I think it was a nice gesture of good service to refill the coffee twice.', 'Potatoes were crispy, eggs scrambled perfectly, the banana french toast was delicioussss. Much needed breakfast satisfaction.']

["Best meal I've eaten in Paris in 20 years. Honest! I had Venison in a delicious amazingly tasty bourdelais sauce. So yummy. My partner nearly fell off his chair when he tried it. We also ate dauphinoise potatoes, rabbit, girolles, leeks vinaigrette, tarte tatin.  Everything tasted delicious. The waitress was super and spoke English even though I did try in French! The restaurant is what I'd describe as proper old school french in a good way. Highly recommend you try Chez Paul. EPIC - can't wait to return \U0001fa75üëèüèΩüòÅ", 'I recently dined at Paul Chez restaurant in Paris and had an exceptional experience. The food was truly remarkable, showcasing the rich flavors of French cuisine. I started with the beef tartar, which was fresh, expertly seasoned, and presented beautifully. It set a high bar for the rest of the meal.

For my main course, I opted for the steak, and it did not disappoint. The steak was cooked to perfection‚Äîtender, juicy, and full of flavor. The accompanying sides complemented the dish well, enhancing the overall dining experience.

The wine selection at Paul Chez was also impressive. Our server recommended a wonderful red wine that paired perfectly with both the tartar and the steak, adding an extra dimension to our meal.

The ambiance of the restaurant was charming and cozy, making it a perfect spot for a relaxed dinner. The service was attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant and memorable evening.

One minor downside was that the dessert menu was somewhat limited, but given the quality of the main dishes, this was a minor flaw.

Overall, Paul Chez offers excellent food and a delightful dining experience. I highly recommend it for anyone visiting Paris.

Rating: 8.5/10', 'Very French restaurant as my French friend said.
Very good food.
Good atmosphere, super busy service.
I recommend to call in advance to make sure you have seats.', 'It was wonderful to have a nice dinner with. Potato was really tasty, so hard to finish all food you have ordered.  I think 4 person - 2 starter / 3 main dishes / 2 dessert / 1~2 bottle of wine to share would be perfect and enough. For sure, foods in here is wonderful.', 'Favorite restaurant in Paris! I‚Äôve been 3 times and I cannot recommend this place enough. The escargots and the pepper steak are a must. Great service, especially from the nice lady.']

["An authentic and family restaurant, with excellent French cuisine at a very reasonable price. The service is very attentive and helpful! Without a doubt, a great option to eat and spend a wonderful evening in Paris. (don't forget to try their duck... simply spectacular!)", 'This restaurant is such a lovely place for dinner. The owner also be the waitress is so friendly and helpful, even though with tourists. The menu is simple but every dish has its own signature with an unbelievable cheap price. Really really highly recommend.\nP.s: the capacity is quite small so dont come so late after the opening time.', 'Small restaurant with French home made food and attentive service. We have been a group of 5 people, the waitress treated us very friendly and showed a lot of patience. The food was absolutely delicious. They offer combination of starters, main courses and a desserts. Thank you, we had a wonderful evening.', 'What a lovely place to dine. The food was superb and the staff where very patient with my French.', "What a great find! Food was delicious (the duck was amazing, as was the chocolate gateaux) and the staff were super helpful with my lack of French language skills. I'll be back next time I'm in the area. What you see is what you get... a nice traditional Parisian bistro."]

['The European restaurant opposite Gare de Lyon disappoints with a mediocre dining experience. Despite a large menu, the quality of the food leaves much to be desired. French fries were served burnt, and the rest of the dishes were unremarkable‚Äîcertainly not worth the high prices. Service was limited and lacked attentiveness, making the overall experience underwhelming. For its location, you‚Äôd expect better quality, value, and hospitality. Would not recommend.', 'Nice Mediterranean style restaurant right across from Gate de Lyon. Food is freshly made as expected and flavorful.
Ordered the mushroom salad which for me was so so and then followed by Sea bream and spinach with coriander sauce...lovely!
Pricing is reasonable for center of Paris and plenty of seating too. Enjoy!', "I was intrigued by the old school decor and the seafood counter that was on display. So I decided to pop in and give it a try.

It took a long while before we were served with our mains. We ordered the sea bream, duck confit and hanger steak. All 3 items were overcooked and came up super dry.

We then ordered the chocolate mousse for dessert. The texture of it felt odd, almost powdery to a certain extent.

Despite the crazy amount of people dining there, it was certainly misleading. I'd give it a miss...", 'Stopped by on a Saturday evening at this popular, pricey touristic restaurant just across the street from the Lyon Train station with our 7pm reservation and unfortunately, the highlight of our evening was getting seated immediately upon arrival.  After being seated, we waited more than 20 mins before water was placed on our table and menus distributed despite seeing others being taken care of who arrived after we did.   Overall, the service was absolutely terrible because we always had to ask for things and when food was finally delivered, the menu items that should be delivered hot were lukewarm at best, certainly because our server didn't care enough to be sure to deliver our hot plates as soon as they were made available by the kitchen.  To make things worse, one of our orders was completely missed so my wife had to wait 15 more minutes before here andouillette was delivered to the table.  When it came time to clear the table of plates before desert, one plate was left and wasn't picked up until after he delivered the deserts.

The French onion soup (Traditionnelle gratinee a l'oignon parisienne) was served hot and was tasty and delicious with just the right amount of tasty cheese and one large crouton.   The Salade de champignons a la cr√®me et graines de coriandre was served cold and was also tasty.

The Noix de Saint-Jacques plancha were cooked properly and were also tasty but unfortunately were served lukewarm as were all our "hot‚Äù plates.  The Belle sole meuniere is the most expensive item on the menu and was perfectly cooked and quite tasty but again unfortunately was served lukewarm like the rest of our plates.

Desserts were very good but not really a great value given their price.

Overall, we were not at all pleased with our visit to this pricey popular touristic restaurant mainly because the service was terrible.  Management here must devote more time and attention to the quality of the service provided if they want to justify their high prices.  We will not be back.', 'The food was great and yet not too expensive. The seafood was so fresh. We dined once and went back twice.']

Adresse: 2 Pl. du March√© Sainte-Catherine, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Amazing french restaurant with all the typical food items on the menu. The restaurant is placed at a small market like square with many other small restaurants. Lovely to sit outside! We had the mussels and fries and a creme brulee for desert. Would come again!', 'AWFUL EXPERIENCE, DESPICABLE PLACE.
I made a reservation  through Google, for which I received the CONFIRMATION.
When we arrived, a very nasty man asked unpolitely when did we make the reservation. When my husband said it was today he said: oh no, we cannot receive you, reservation must be done in advance.
Until when is this going to happen and they still say the service is non stop and there are at least 5 tables available.
Never again!!! Run away from this place!!!', "This place is so good!  The food was spot on - French onion soup was so delicious.  Their housemate foie gras pate was amazing - we ate there twice and got it both times.  We've had the duck breast - cooked to perfection, Moules Frites - huge bowl and the fries were so so crispy, Deviled Eggs - my friend liked them!  The owners were so friendly and nice, they didn't rush us and just let people enjoy their time slowly.  Definitely coming here again the next time I'm in Paris!", 'We had lunch here and it was absolutely delicious - and a bargain, too. Service was super nice as well. Will definitely come back.', 'We where shopping in the area and felt like a lunch with some typical French dishes. The onion soup was superb, escargot where great & service was excellent. The mussels where ok‚Ä¶ all in all happy for a quick French lunch!']

['Finally a sympathetic bar but with a so so DJ. Don't worry the ambiance is excellent and staffs very nice and definitely, I like the lights and decorations. Prices are "normal" for what you get and quality is above average.
You can go there whenever you want! Happy hour until 23:00. Now it's my 2nd favourite bar in Paris!', 'A very aesthetically pleasing venue with a great queer atmosphere.
The music is fantastic, and the cocktails are excellent.
Highly recommended.
The guy at the door was very kind.', 'Very good prices during the happy hour. You can have a quick drink at a reasonable price', 'First time here was 8 years ago when visiting Paris and had to come back when I returned to the city. Delicious cocktails, great 90s/early 2000s music and fantastic service. Highly recommend. Happy hour prices are dynamite and late night atmosphere is something to experience.', 'The best 1L draught beer I‚Äôve had in a while, thanks to the DJ for the job perfectly done and to the manager for being welcoming & cool']

['We had one of their special dishes of the day, risotto with mushroom and truffle oil and it did not disappoint! Also the vegan (halloumi) burger with sweet potato fries was delicious', 'This was a nice surprise to find for breakfast. We got the special of the day. Which consists of avo toast , coffee and juice , and granola. Oh my God. The granola bowl had the best yogurt I have ever had. The smell and taste of the Chantilly cream was to live for.', 'We went on a Sunday, they had a brunch formula for 26‚Ç¨ but we ended up having a burger instead, good one, the meat was fresh and double fried potatoes', 'Loved the place! Went on a sunny day and ate on the terrace. Food and service were great. It was quite a busy day but we did not wait long to get the food. Kudos to the staff and the cook.', 'Best Cafe/Bistro we have been so far in Paris (visited Paris many times). Delicious and balanced food- we had avacado toasts with various toppings. Deserts are also yummy, especially tramisu‚ù§Ô∏è We will for sure come back.']

["We had a great time. The restaurant is cozy, has a classic and rustic feel. The service was so friendly and good. We had the beef fillet and grilled salmon, with the mashed potatoes which were sooooo good!! A glass of wine and two desserts, and the price was really fare. The cr√®me br√ªle was one of the best we've had. Really a wonderful French experience and we would definitely come back.", 'We had lunch in this place while walking around Paris. There is a 49 euro formule for entree/plat/dessert. We both ordered the house specialties, escargots as entree and the house tartar. The tartar is really good, perfectly spiced and mixed. This is the real tartar following the original recipe with minched meat, capers, onions, olives and lot of sauces. I don‚Äôt understand the negative comments, maybe they were expecting an Italian battuta that is cut and spiced differently. As dessert we got the berthillon glaces, good as expected. Definitely we had a good lunch at this place, with a good service and good prices.', 'Ma Bourgogne is a great spot for a classic meal. The onion soup was rich and flavorful, the steaks were cooked just right, and the wine hit the spot. Richard, our server, made it better with his friendly demeanor, great banter, and impeccable service‚Äîhe really knows how to make you feel at home. Perfect for anyone looking for good food and relaxed vibe in Paris.', 'A typical sidewalk cafe with lovely food excellent service, good wine. The salads are quite substantial, and for two of us, a salad each and one salmon dish was more than enough. So of course we also had a Tart Tatin :-)', 'We tried the steak tartar and it was superb. Also the foie gras y very recommended. The price is not low but the quality deserves it.']

['If you‚Äôre in Paris and craving a truly exceptional seafood experience, this restaurant should be at the top of your list. Nestled in a charming corner of the city, the ambiance here is both elegant and inviting, blending classic Parisian decor with a modern touch. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring that each guest is well taken care of without being intrusive. Especially a waitress Imane, she made my day!

The seafood offerings are nothing short of spectacular. Starting with an impeccably fresh oyster platter, each shell boasts a delicate, briny sweetness that transports you straight to the coast. The lobster and king crab are cooked to perfection, and the subtle seasoning enhances rather than masks the natural flavors. You must truly try shrimps with garlic!

Overall, this restaurant is more than just a meal; it‚Äôs an experience that combines Parisian charm with the finest seafood, making it a must-visit for any seafood lover in the city. Highly recommended!', "Let's start with staff, everyone was great... especially, the Lady Bosses 5 ü§© service!  The food was undoubtedly delicious & presentation made it more appealing/appetizing.  Not the largest environment, but the atmosphere was electrifying...  Originally sat @ a table then a pleasant moment at the bar, ending the evening in fashion...  Merci beaucoup a' tous... üëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ", 'After visiting several museums nearby we stopped for lunch as I looked it up before. The staff were incredibly nice and friendly and also the food was outstanding, very fresh fish of very high quality. A nice bottle of Chablis and a crem caramel to finish it off, everything was top notch, loved it', 'A beautifully appointed restaurant specialising in seafood that is divine! All our meals were beautiful with a depth of layers that you could see and taste. The cocktails were delicious too and the service was also wonderful.', 'Our evening today was made fabulous by the 3 ladies managing the service at this  restaurant. BOSS WOMEN is all I can say!!!
The food is excellent . This place is a must try in Paris if you are a seafood lover. A true hidden gem. The people here make your dining an experience and less just a dinner at another restaurant. It takes a lot for me to be impressed but today these ladies have made my day and have given me a fantastic culinary experience combined with expectational service. Complements to the chef and I think Michelin need to try this place']

Adresse: 4, Boulevard Richard Lenoir, Pl. de la Bastille, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Tragic food poisoning after visiting this restaurant. Me and my girlfriend had been vomiting for 3-4 days now. We also found around 50 flies in the bathroom. Looked like it was not cleaned for weeks. Smelled terrible too. Ver dirty and nasty place. So sad we had to go down with food poisoning for so long', "Very friendly service. Don't speak French well but they were very helpful. The taste for the fries better than in the States.", 'Beware food poisoning! My husband had the wedges with bacon & cheese topping along with the 280 burger - he said the bacon topping in particular didn‚Äôt taste great and was not properly heated, plus the burger also below standard. Sure enough a few hours later he has been vomiting repeatedly and it is definitely this McDonalds meal that has made him ill. Would not recommend eating here under ANY circumstances until cooking and hygiene practices are investigated.', "Be careful, this store has rude and violent employees! The store's location on Google indicates that it closes at 2 am. We arrived at 00:50, our order was ready at 01:05 and they wouldn't let us sit down to eat, even though the store would be open for almost one hour. The security guard and the store manager were extremely rude and violent! The McDonald's office should fire and replace all of them, as they are not fit to work with the public.", 'Absolutely not polite personnel, we were waiting really long']

['Very disappointing experience because this place was so well rated.  We had two different kinds of pie (quiche) - both over cooked.  Then we still wanted to try our luck with the delicious looking desserts but that was equally disappointing.
The flan had zero vanilla taste.
The signature lemon Mareng cake did not have a good taste.  And the Normand cake was very simple.
Only giving two stars for the very friendly staff.', 'üòãThe food is simply unforgettable. Their menu, prepared daily, is rooted in fresh, seasonal ingredients, and you can taste the care in every bite. The lemon tart is a standout ‚Äì perfectly balanced with a tangy yet creamy filling and a buttery crust. Equally impressive is the fig and pistachio tart, which combines earthy and sweet flavors in a way that feels indulgent but not overpowering. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for savory or sweet, their offerings are a delicious mix of both.

üåáThis place is a true gem in the heart of the Marais. Inspired by ‚ÄúAlice in Wonderland,‚Äù the decor is a delightful blend of vintage finds and bohemian flair. The mismatched furniture, old posters, and whimsical mural make it cozy, inviting, and perfect for a relaxed meal or afternoon tea. It‚Äôs the kind of spot where you can lose track of time, soaking in the unique ambiance.

üë®‍üç≥The staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. They provided great recommendations and ensured a smooth and pleasant experience throughout the visit.

üí∞Considering the quality of the food and the unique ambiance, the pricing feels reasonable. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a treat that combines delicious flavors with a memorable setting.', 'We waited around 1h in line to get a seat and definitely worth it!
The place is a very cozy tea house with a large number of seating places, the water was friendly and we didn‚Äôt have problems speaking English.
We ordered two pies and a tea. Everything was very delicious! The products were fresh, the aroma and taste of the tea were delightful.', "Came here as I saw it hyped up on IG and wanted to see for myself. All I can say is you should definitely come. The prices are c'est cher but I couldn't fault the cakes we tried and the staff were lovely, the dim lit atmosphere and locals just filling up the place was great. So many cakes to choose from - we went for lemon meringue, the best I've had and huge (enough for 2) and the tarte tatin, which was also the best I've had and they warmed it up. So good. If you love cakes and pies then you have to try.", 'To be honest, it does not match the recommendations that people made. Maybe it was my taste, but I dont think the Tarte Citron was worth to try. It was too sweet and the taste had nothing special. So did other cakes.

It was my first time and maybe last time to visit for cakes. However, the brunch was ok.']

["It's probably the best dinner I had during my stay in Paris! Traditional French dishes, everything was delicious.  Personnel was friendly and helpful. I would definitely visit again if I'm back in town!", 'Really popular restaurant serving typical French cuisine. Make a reservation or you will be disappointed. The Prix Fixe four course menu was good value and the food was really tasty. The dining room has an atmosphere and a buzz about it. The staff were friendly even though the were really busy. Great dinner would definitely go again.', 'A very authentic French restaurant! You know a place is authentic (and old school) when you order p√¢t√© de campagne, they would provide you with a jar of Cornichons! The staff and owner are all very friendly. They have a special menu everyday so make sure to ask for that. The standard baguette that they provide is also fresh and warm.', "Fabulous! A friendly, personal and high quality restaurant without any pretentious elements. The food is great, authentic french cuisine with large or even oversized portions. The staff are friendly and engaging and appropriately attentive.\nWe had aperitif, starter, main course, cheese course and dessert all for a very reasonable fixed price (47E). I can't recall a better value meal in Paris.", 'Overtoasted baguettes - way too crunchy. Terrine and steak were alright. Fries were good. Coq au vin had good sauce but dry chicken. Wine was ok.. Expected a bit more from the reviews.']

['A stone‚Äôs throw from Place de Vosges, and all of the wonderful shops in the Bastille area. Our meals were beautifully presented and tasty. The onion soup and fried goat cheese salad were wonderful French classics.The lamb dish is a specialty and was delicious. The cod dish was also delicious. Don‚Äôt forget dessert‚Äî our favorite was the chocolate mousse.', 'The service was phenomenal. The server provided great advice on wines, spoke English, and was super attentive. The food was just OK.  The apple desert sounded great and looked interesting. It wasn‚Äôt great though. The atmosphere was really cool/quaint and they had air conditioning.', 'Happiest meal I had during my travel to Paris. Ribeye steak, wine, potatoes, and shrimp.. each dish was just perfect and could taste the freshness of each ingredient. I still cannot believe we found this restaurant by chance. I can guarantee you will walk out happily.', 'Love love loved this restaurant. One of the highlights of Paris for me! Must try the chefs steak, pate, escargots. Beautiful meal and no frills which suits my palate. Neighborhood gorgeous as well, with bars that are amazing surrounding the area for a post meal aperitif.', 'Like everyone says, the service was indeed superb. Food was on point. The veal and French onion soup are divine. Will go back!']

Adresse: 67 Bd de la Bastille, 75012 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The party was good, I just dont like the vestier staff are not that professional, my Bag is get wet and he didnt explain what happened, and not saying sorry. Thank you', "Lovely setting, steps from Bastille but hidden away by the canal. Drinks and service are below average (flat industrial beers, awful coffee, etc.) and obnoxiously overpriced. Don't even think about ordering the food. In short, so much potential wasted. I keep hoping one day the place will be bought out by a team that cares and does something worthy of the location. In the meantime, it's a nice place to hang out on a sunny afternoon during the week (when it's not too busy) and enjoy the scenery, but keep your expectations in check.", 'So I can‚Äôt recommend this place as we were waiting for the waiter too long,we were waiting for the bread and the butter for oysters too long. And we ate all bread because our main dishes were cooking about 30-40 minutes.. what I find too long ... Even my rissotto was not bad I think that the service for restaurant is very important. It‚Äôs half of your success. I hope it was just not a lucky day for us.', 'Had such a great night! The atmosphere is really chill, the service very nice, efficient and the food was top quality ! Had a burrata, pizza with fresh ingredients and a delicious tiramisu like I have not tasted for a long time ! Really recommend it :))', 'The location was nice but the cocktails were not. Sugar syrup with a shot of alcohol. Hardly drinkable. And for 10 euros. Service was nice though.']

Adresse: 1-3 Pl. de la Bastille, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We were visiting Paris after Italy (not a great place for customer service (Italy)).

Asked the lovely staff girl if we can use their toilets as we couldnt find any public bathroom near by and she was so welcoming to let us use it. Guess what! Ended up we had a meal each and enjoyed our dinner in beautiful Paris restaurant with the great view and wait staff were all polite and helpful. Anyone visiting Paris! Please please, give yourself favor and enjoy the food and drinks. Love from Australia.', 'A truly exceptional dining experience! The food was outstanding, with unique flavors and fresh ingredients that elevated every dish. The service was impeccable, with the staff being polite, A special thank you to Vicky the amazing director, for her invaluable help and flawless organization. Her dedication was evident in every detail, making our experience truly unforgettable. We will definitely be back!', 'Caf√© Fran√ßais is a charming establishment that embodies the essence of Parisian caf√© culture. Located in a vibrant area, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for people-watching while enjoying a delicious meal or a cup of coffee. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with traditional d√©cor that transports you to a different time.

The menu offers a delightful selection of French classics, including croissants, tartines, and hearty main dishes. The breakfast options are particularly noteworthy, with fresh ingredients that create a satisfying start to the day.

Service is typically friendly and efficient, enhancing the overall dining experience. Whether you‚Äôre stopping in for a leisurely brunch, a quick lunch, or an evening drink, Caf√© Fran√ßais delivers a delightful experience that captures the spirit of Paris.', 'It is a wonderful full service restaurant within 4 minutes walk from Opera Bastille. We had two hours before the show, but the service was so fast that we were finished within am hour. The portions were quite small, but looked exquisite, and we did not feel hungry after the meal.', 'I had a very positive experience. Food is fresh beautifully prepared and tasty.  They have a great selection of drinks and wines.  But I think the most important element for me is the service: they truly are friendly, welcoming, accommodating, super curious.sit in. The corner and watch the word parade before you. I highly recommend this restaurant.']

Adresse: 6 Pl. du March√© Sainte-Catherine, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['the pasta i got was very good, along with one of the best p*rnstar martinis ive ever had. however the place was quite cramped with uncomfortable tables.', 'We came here twice during our stay in Paris because we liked it that much. The food was great and it has a really nice atmosphere close to a small square.', "We stop in this cozy bar for desserts and cocktails üçπüç∏ because in the lovely square the atmosphere was just gorgeous. Well decorated, nice service (they'll try to speak in English even if you speak fluent french which is not nice, don't know why they believe it is). I'd hesitate to sit there once again, but who knows...", 'A cheerful, noisy and unpretentious place. Took me back to my student days.  My mojito looked like a health drink, but it was the real thing. The truffle risotto was very satisfying.  Service was good, an easy place to be.', "Very nice place, good food, webhad the cheesburger,l (with great sweet potatoes chips), kinoa plate, pasta and greek salad, all were delicious.
Service is good and quick (it waste lunch, place wasn't too busy), and our Malagashi waitress was very nice :)
Set in a nice small Marais square.
Only drawbacks are not having a menu in English, and that tables are small/not enough room."]

['Went there with some friends. It was fun at the beginning. Drinks are way too expensive. The club is nothing special.
Not to mention the rude security. After I have been there for 4 hours, the new security told me that I had to put my small bag in the wardrobe for which you have to pay of course. I told the security that I had been there for 4 hours and nobody told me anything. In addition, I specified that I had some medicine in the bag that I needed to keep with me.
Complete disregard, rude and disrespectful! Not to mention that some other girls
kept their bags which were twice the size as mine and the security didn‚Äôt say anything. Apparently they have preferences!
I didn‚Äôt want to keep my bag for a fashion statement but for serious personal reasons which apparently are less valuable to them than money!!! My bag was smaller than a pochette and didn‚Äôt hurt anybody.', 'I absolutely love this spot on saturdays. The music is a good mix of kompa, zouk, coup√©-d√©cal√©, afrobeats, and the latest french/rap hits. I have been there a couple of times and had a lof of fun. The crowd is diverse. The servers are nice and craft delicious cocktails. The lady at the coat check is very nice and agreable. Come as you wish and enjoy your night!', 'excellent music, though not many people for some reason, unfortunately you HAVE TO use the cloak room service even when the place is empty and it costs 2eur', "Cool venue ! Not the best sound depending where you're sitting. Show up early if you want good seats to a show.", 'Very good music and space to dance.']

Adresse: 40 Bd de la Bastille, 75012 Paris, France
Reviews:
['During Saturday rainy afternoon, seeking for foodie restaurants and yes, Chez Papa just coincidentally in-front of our eyesight. The taste of the foods swipe away the heavy and disappointment mood. The restaurant owner and waiter were very friendly and great service mindsets.', 'Recommended by my Airbnb host, and it was the very first restaurant we tried in Paris. Friendly staff, awesome food, and reasonable prices. Very casual and neighborly too. Don‚Äôt need to worry about whether you underdressed.', '- Cuisine: Specializes in hearty Basque and Southwest French dishes (e.g., ‚Äúconfit de canard‚Äù, ‚Äúaiguillette de canard avec sauce de p√™che‚Äù).
- Atmosphere: Casual, warm, French bistro vibe.
- Portions: Generous servings, authentic regional flavors.
- Location: Situated in the Bastille area.
- Service: It was a busy Friday night, the service was fast, but they were not always around the table if we needed something.', 'Excellent! They have menus in English if you ask for them, waitstaff was very patient and nice. Any of the food cooked in and served in a Dutch oven pot is DELICIOUS highly recommend! The ‚Äúsalade‚Äù is more like a food bowl with lots of toppings of food rather than a typical English salad. The free table bread and tap water are also great on top of your meal.', "Chez Papa - the restaurant offered confit duck. It's superb. Very tender delicious, complete w foie gras, duck breast. W potatoes and breads. Of course w white wine. However, it's very warm in the restaurant....otherwise it's recommended for it's delicious confit"]

['Restaurant we recommend by a friend from Paris. We weren‚Äôt let down at all!
Small and cozy family run restaurant.
We were the only guests at the time we got in. The owner was very welcoming and friendly and had made this an unique experience.
Food was also very good! The couscous we delicious and could have served two people.

Go there if you want to feel among friends and have good food.', 'A very homey and welcoming family-own restaurant that left me with a warm feeling inside, both literally and figuratively.

The owners felt very thoughtful. I ate here three times over the course of three days! On the first day, I had the veal special, which came in a cast iron skillet. On Friday, they have an amazing couscous special. On Monday, I had the dorade special!

üî•üòç‚ù§Ô∏è‍üî•

The fondant au chocolat pictured was amazing.

The establishment seems very unassuming from the outside. The attention to detail when it comes to the food and service were amazing!

Demba.', 'Such a lovely restaurant! My duck breast was perfect.

Hidden gem not far away from the city center!', 'We had one of our best meals we ever had in this place. Proper French cuisine. Everything was superb even the salad. Service friendly. Wine was also great. Highly recommended
Try the set menus at 24 pounds', "This is an excellent restaurant that clearly demonstrates love and attention to HOMEMADE food. Don't be fooled by its modest appearance and simple menu. Everything from the starters to the dessert and coffee was superb! The menu is short, but all the dishes we ordered were impressive in taste and freshness. Definitely go for a set menu (many variations). Our stew set came with complimentary salad and tagliatelle. I had planned to eat a salad but ended up gorging 3 courses including beef and foie gras! Even the complimentary meringue that comes with coffee is homemade. Service was great and jovial. Will definitely return!"]

Adresse: 24 Rue des Francs Bourgeois, 75003 Paris, France
Reviews:
["The orange crepe was the best! We came here twice during our stay just for this orange crepe. It was fresh and nicely chewy, and it's so much better with extra whipped cream.
They also had English menu.
However the waiter suggested us to leave at first because apparently the kitchen was busy and it'd take 30-45 mins for us to get our food, in fact it only took 5-10 mins to get our orders which was weird.", 'We visited Cr√™perie Suzette during the Olympics weekend and loved every moment. The freshly cooked cr√™pes, available in all sorts, were delightful. It‚Äôs a must-visit spot, and the surrounding neighborhood is equally charming and worth exploring while in Paris!', 'Visited three times during my one week stay in Paris. Absolutely amazing cr√™pes! Their house caramel sauce is magnifique. Definitely will return next time i will be in Paris!', 'We came here with a reason to eat crepe suzette but how much we were disappointed.
It wasn‚Äôt a crepe suzette it was simple crepe with fired liquor and the first crepe wasn‚Äôt cooked properly we asked to change it. It was changed . Thanks for it. But unfortunately our expectations were much higher

Cider was really tasty!', 'very good cr√™pes, available for both dining in and takeout.']

["If you want a french restaurant near Lyon station, don't hesitate reservation here strongly recommend. Manager was so nice explaining about served dishes and warm greeting. But not crowded yet. Bill was quickly checked included discount. I felt like a michelins or hotels restaurants. Thanks to service, my first meet in French was memorable.", 'Really nice place. Good food, waiter is really paying attention to you and try to make you enjoy your lunch/dinner. I had some fish and it was well prepared/cooked. Wine were great too. Definitely worth it', "I've been visiting Paris for years but never been A La Fr√©gate before... Excellent food, better than expected, excellent service and people. Far from the crowed area is an excellent place for have rest , relax and quality food of course !!!", "Great meal üëå & hands down best service I've ever had anywhere. I loved my meal. My wife disliked her appetizer, so they brought out another for her that she liked very much. You can tell the owner is passionate about his business and we had a sense he was genuine about making us happy customers!", 'First time in Paris and I have been invited for dinner there. Owner was very generous, kind and passion about his work. I ate tuna tartar and main dish and both of them was perfect. Definitely suggest to go and have you dinner there.']

['One of my favorite places in Paris. This little Italian place has a lot of entr√©es that I love : the vegetable plate, the eggplant parmagianno, the beef carpaccio‚Ä¶ (they change the menu once in a while so you get to experience new ones every time you‚Äôre there.)
As for the pizza i always get the truffle pizza i love that its kinda spicy.
They also have a great wine collection.
And the tiramisu‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs love.
I heavily recommend it.', 'Had the best lunch here! Excellent service, food was outstanding, and the picante oil can‚Äôt be beat! We had the prosciutto e bufala which was excellent, and one of the pizza specials which was called pizza chic with shaved cured pork, rosemary and arugula‚Äîalso excellent. Our daughter had the margherita and loved it. Highly recommend getting the picante oil to drizzle on top! Just the right amount of heat!', 'Very good experience walking in off the street. They serve food continuously, so no break between lunch and dinner. The broccoli anti pasta was intentionally served cold but was full of flavor. The ricotta pizza was delicious. Don‚Äôt forget to ask for the picante oil. Would definitely go back.', 'Cute little place, somewhat crowded but we were seated right away. The pizza was very good, and I found a new favorite beer. Prices were moderate. I would go again.', 'Authentic Italian cooking and quality pizzas, absolutely stunning! üëå']

Adresse: M√©tro Saint-Paul Ligne 1, 4 Rue de Rivoli, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The restaurant is beautiful, atmosphere is amazing for a cute brunch spot . The details are pretty and everything is PINK. The service was okay not the best . Our waitress was great and friendly and patient w us , however the hostess seen a bit annoyed with us since we didn‚Äôt know the language.', 'Service is slow but waiters are friendly. Beautiful picturesque restaurant . They have breakfast specials which we ordered. Juice was fresh!', 'We had a wonderful time during happy hour! The Porn-star martini was amazing, and the pizza, along with the atmosphere, was fantastic. We really enjoyed ourselves.', 'While in Paris you must experience La Favorite! Fantastic food, great atmosphere. The service is amazing and the servers are fantastic. Nicolas was our server two separate times and he was amazing! Funny, very kind to us and he speaks 3 languages which was lovely! French, English & Spanish.\n\nThe hot pink latte is a must! Also try their pizza and cr√®me br√ªl√©e! You will not be disappointed.', 'I looooved this place! The staff were Allstars. Incredible customer service, very welcoming and catering. I‚Äôm not very good with names but there was a tall bald guy who had on a white shirt and my waiter had on all black with a tattoo under his upper right arm. For reference, I came on September 7th around 12:30pm. They were so sweet and very kind, they really made my experience worthwhile. They even took some photos for me which were Instagram worthy lol. The food was pretty good coming from a picky eater. I left there very happy and satisfied. I highly recommend La Favorite Paris.']

["I had a good feeling about this place and it's safe to say it was well worth the try. We chose this place to have dinner on New Year's Eve and the food was delicious, the staff had a vibrant energy and we had an amazing time. Also, as I discussed with a waiter, the pop music contributed to the not-too-serious and fun atmosphere. Will definitely visit again once I return to Paris!", 'Been coming here for years and noticed a few changes, mostly great. I like the more casual vibe now: gone are the white tablecloths and the white plates: I love the less stuffy mood and the granny-style plates. Much of the menu remains as it was however I do wish there was a salad option offered as an entree. My meal was delicious as always, although was surprised to find an inedible piece of gristle in my otherwise perfect entrec√¥te.', 'For our introduction to French cuisine, we chose this restaurant as our first stop. It‚Äôs one of the few places that open before 12:00 PM. The atmosphere is very authentic, with a pleasant vibe and friendly staff. We ordered two coffees and the braised beef, which was the main reason we came. Overall, the food was tasty, but nothing extraordinary that we‚Äôd want to try again. The total bill for two people came to 63 euros, which is an average price for Paris. Overall, we would recommend visiting this place.', 'Wonderful second visit.  All meals were great but I do recommend the beef bourguignon which I have had both times.  Fantastic value and charming atmosphere.', 'Visited during a week day and the atmosphere is perfect. The terrine was great and the beef bourguignon was even better. Great service as well!']

["It's a wonderful place to hang out with friends and enjoy delicious tapas and paella. The paella portion was really huge; it was meant for two portions, but we couldn't finish it all. It was one of the best paellas I've ever had. They have a really delicious cocktail list, and I especially enjoyed one called the Valencia. It's very refreshing and tasty. All the staff were very nice and friendly, and the restaurant was packed with people, even on Sunday. I had a great time there. I would definitely come back!", "Although we preferred French cuisine in Paris, we came here because we couldn't make a last minute reservation. We're glad we did. Everything was really delicious. The number of employees was low, we sometimes waited a little to order, but they were all very nice!", 'I visited this restaurant after returning from a trip to Barcelona. The atmosphere and appearance looked good. However, the servers were not knowledgeable about the menu and could not answer our questions about the dishes. The bread was of extremely poor quality (we\'re in France, aren\'t we?); it was cold and had an unpleasant odor. The dish with canned tuna somehow managed to make the tuna smell bad. The octopus had no flavor at all. The potatoes in the tortilla were dry and lacked the juiciness this menu is supposed to have. When we inquired about the source of their bread, we were told it came from a "special supplier", but frankly, even mass-produced bread would have tasted better.', "The food was good, and the atmosphere was fine. I would have given it 5 stars if the waitress hadn't come to our table, with the restaurant completely empty, to tell us to speak more quietly because she couldn't hear the phone. Indecent, it was supposed to be a super pleasant lunch, but we simply left.", 'Food is very good, we love all what we ordered.\nFried calamar, potatoes and coquetas are amazing!! but the drink is so expensive..']

Adresse: 15 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews: ["we appreciated the very nice service from the staff and the food is fine and at the price it's a very  good value, but it's typical Parisian small restaurant,  tables too close together and unfortunately the staff has to run back-and-forth around you which just makes for an unpleasant experience, it's tiring and not restful.", 'The fish is very fresh, tofu was cooked and served in a very delicious way, I think the best that I‚Äôve tried. Big glass of rose', "Simple and delicious, well priced. The salad was a great deal for a simple and healthy lunch. There's lots of all-you-can-eat sushi nearby, but if you don't want that much food, this is a much better deal :)\nIn a nice area with good shopping nearby!", 'This place was amazing, sushi is my FAVOURITE food and I‚Äôve eaten them hundreds of times and these were part of the best ! People were really nice, the place was cute, everything was perfect !', 'We were craving sushis this place was the closest to us and it completely satisfied us. Service was very quick, prices are affordable, and everything was tasty and well made. It was not the best sushis I had since I prefer it with less rice (which is almost impossible to find in most places). The Dragon roll was very tasty but not enough for a single person as a main dish.']

['Absolutely fantastic cocktails, especially their best seller, the jamrock Crusta.\nThe vegetarian burger is also better than most places in Paris.', 'Good vegetarian options, including very tasty veggie meatballs. Meatballs also very tasty with a Thai flavour. Good, friendly service, offering to translate to English when needed! Great beer and wine :)', 'Excellent cocktails (best barmaid in the world 2017), very good meatballs and fries. The tartare specials are also nice.', 'Really burger and equally amazing cocktails. Not the cheapest but worth every euro!!!', 'Fantastic cocktails!!! And, Mido‚Äôs Meatballs were incredible 5*']

['I wanted to love it, I‚Äôve been waiting for months to get a table to end up disappointed.

The food quality is good, yet no dish was memorable. Portions are severely small, wine pairings make no sense and overall we left with an impression of missing food. Also very vegetable forward dishes with some seafood then mixed with offal. Verry bizarre combination.

Nico from Indiana was amazing. Incredible wine pairings and explanation of the menu and background for dishes. What a lovely individual.

Atmosphere is fine, with the view of the chefs working.

Our bill for a dinner for three plus a bottle of wine was around 490‚Ç¨.', 'Septime did not disappoint, although we did not have much time to wait.

My husband and I walked in Monday afternoon and were able to secure the last 2 seats in the restaurant.

The presentation, flavors, ingredients, atmosphere‚Ä¶ Septime has it all in spades. Very friendly and not overly attentive service.

Great experience. Bravo.', 'I‚Äôm quite surprised how this restaurant got the fame that they have. It certainly is wonderful in a million ways but also quite unpretentious and normal for the paranoid ranking geeks.

The atmosphere is very casual and service is very friendly bordering on informal but never careless.

The dishes in the set menu are subtle and gentle with most tastes requiring some love of balance and clean taste to be appreciated.

Be it the comte butter with brioche, salmon with sour greens sauce or salad with almond mushroom (play on saut√©) sauce, there‚Äôs nothing here to impress directly but, in a sense removes formality and decorum to make you see what balance and impeccable technique can achieve.

Then there is a more risque dish like potato risotto. The sauce would make any risotto amazing but it works so beautifully with the undercooked potato that it makes perfect sense for you to experiment with potatoes more at home. On the other hand, you may just think that the undercooked potato is nothing to get excited about and hate the dish.

It‚Äôs a special place for a reasonably prepared foodie and its informal atmosphere, at least to me, makes it easier to enjoy the chefs craft.', 'Well we got so lucky getting walked in spot I btw tried a month before arriving. Anyway the food were all fabulous. None of dishes we  are not like. They are focusing on the taste more than decoration. If u get a spot. U should visit here.‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Managed to secure a booking for when they opened a month in advance and what a treat it was. We were two couples plus my 12 year old son and so enjoyed this meal. We did the wine pairing and the service was excellent in explaining the history of the wine and notes. The servers for food were slightly more aloof at first but warmed to us after the first dish and we asked questions and were excited for the food. Overall an exceptional meal and experience. Walked away sated and overjoyed!!']

Adresse: 12 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
['The decor was very nice and the food was delicious! All the sushi is freshly prepared (you can see the sushi chef from your table) and I tried Unagi for the first time here! Very impressed! (also the free fruit salad at the end was a nice touch)', 'Nice Japanese restaurant close to Bastille. I suggested the sashimi dish I took. Alongside  there was also a stater. At the end they also gave us a desert on the house. 100% recommended, overall I ate a lot at a good price!', 'Ordered the sashimi
The fish weren‚Äôt good. Not very fresh.
Even the white rice wasn‚Äôt fresh‚Ä¶
The staff were kind and sweet.', 'Nice Asian food, warm welcome, good and fast service üçÄ kitchen is on the front office üëçüèºüëçüèº', 'If you are looking for a great sushi restaurant with fresh fish and affordable pricing, this is the place to be! Right outside of Bastille metrostation.']

["We've had the best time in this place! The owner is such a sweet man who's very willing to take time to explain things about wine and food culture. It was a lovely experience!", 'Known for their good breakfasts, this brasserie also serves excellent bier, now having a Chti blonde petit. Here in the hip Le Marais area, entry of Place de Vosges', "Wonderful, unpretentious, great tasting food. You won't be sorry you stopped here. Service was good, prices very reasonable.", 'Came to try to famous aligot and it was pretty good but honestly not my favorite. I think the texture is strange, but that was more of a personal struggle. Wish there had been more sausage and less aligot on the plate. Flies in the restaurant were a bit annoying.', 'My favourite breakfast in Paris since I was a child. The waitress always treats me like a princess! Much love always!']

['A traditional French restaurant which offers classification dishes, it‚Äôs small but very cosy. It seems like people dining there are the regular one and they know each other. A gentleman on the next table chatted with us. It was from him that we knew the owner (who is still working in the restaurant) is over 80 years ago. The owner and the staff are all extremely friendly even they don‚Äôt really speak English. There is no English menu available but you can always find a way to order and communicate with them. You get a small class of bubble as a welcome drink once seated. I think this place deserves more rating.', 'Best fois gras in Paris! If I come back to Paris, this restaurant will be one of the reasons. Chef and servers are not fluent in English, but they are humorous and willing to listen to customers. Wines are very affordable. For the dessert, I recommend a chocolate mousse. cash only.', 'Absolutely amazing little gem. We loved our food and the snails, veal, rabbit and ice cream were to die for. We got the raisins with the vanilla ice cream and that was delish! Pls don‚Äôt double dip your spoons in the raisins as it‚Äôs shared with everyone. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough', 'If You are looking for genuine french kitchen, This is perfect place. Everything is really traditional and good quality. Enjoy!', 'Delicious food, delightful hosts, and well-decorated restaurant made for a wonderful lunch. Prices are definitely reasonable when quantity and quality are factored in (but they are definitely more expensive than what you can find in the neighborhood these days). The "plats du jour" are definitely recommended. No wonder it has been featured in the Michelin guide for so long! Don\'t skip on the "tarte aux poireaux" for starters and on the homemade vanilla ice cream for dessert!']

Nom: Cr√™perie bretonne, fleurie... de l'√©pouse du marin
Reviews: ["This place is an absolute gem of a find! You have to go here and try all the delicious food they have! We had both sweet and salty crepes and we could not stop talking about how good they were! The staff of the restaurant were also fantastic, kind and welcoming. If you are ever in Paris, come to this place! I can't wait to go again üòç", 'A fantastic place - the food was delicious, the service outstanding, an overall very authentic experience, not touristy at all.', "It's worth the rave. Crepes are so good, both sweet and savory options are worth trying. Coffee portions are a bit small but worth it. Staff is friendly and kind. The staff try their best to accommodate to your needs.", 'Simply amazing. I loved it, the place is petit, cozy and charming and the waiter was very kind. Galettes and cr√™pes are delicious and they taste just like the ones in Bretagne (even better!)', 'Cozy place and super friendly service. Delicious crepe and infusion tea.']

['Basic French brasserie but executes their dishes well. We had the lunch menu where you can get a set meal with protein, carbs, salad, and a dessert all for around 20 euros or less -- as of Nov 2024.

We sat outside and there were only a few people with us but the waiting staff was always attentive and checked on us every few minutes. Special mention to Claudio for being an excellent waiter and host! The best! Highly recommended for a quick meal near Gar Lyon station!', 'Beautiful restaurant but food was average except the chicken burger. It was a bit hard to order in English, but the staffs were friendly and tried their best to serve us.', 'We arrived Paris train station at very late night, and quai 33 was the only restaurant that could provide food for us at that time. Thank you so much for proving yummy food and warm smiles and service to us at such late night! ‚ò∫Ô∏èü•∞', 'Great place. Definitely recommend the duck. Waiter super kind and nice even when going out. Also got some kind of pave, was nice, but again, duck is out of this world.', 'The food is good. It is closed to my hotel in Paris, Gare de Lyon, I just jumped in since it has a good corner exposure but turn out it was a great experience.

I agree with all comment here saying that the service attitude is much better than French culture, the servers were welcome and very nice.']

['Cute restaurant with a cosy welcoming atmosphere. The service was friendly and helpful and we had a lovely meal.  The cheeseburger was excellent quality and cooked perfectly. Truffle linguine was amazing and a delicious chocolate mousse to finish.  Recommend', 'It was amazing, especially the cr√®me brule and the bavete!! Good service and nice atmosphere. Perfect dining ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'I loved everything about this place. My wife and I stopped in at 10 after a long day of traveling. The service was warm and helpful, the food was great, and the Saturday vibe just right.', 'Great, unassuming bistro just as you would want / expect in Paris.

Food was spot on and wines well priced.

We walked in on a Saturday evening at 6pm for a drink and left at 11 after many drinks and food.

V V good', 'Really friendly, one of the tastier French onion soups we‚Äôve had in Paris. Lovely place to stop for a soup and fries for lunch. Would recommend.']

Adresse: 10-12 Pl. de la Bastille, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
['I started with the escargot, which was absolutely delightful‚Äîrich, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. For the main dish, I enjoyed mussels paired with crispy French fries, and everything was simply delicious. The flavors were well-balanced and truly satisfying.

What made the experience even better was the service. My server was incredibly polite and friendly, making me feel welcomed throughout my visit. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a great meal in a warm atmosphere!', 'I‚Äôve had a few pizzas in my day, and the Falstaff was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôd definitely stop here again.', 'Very friendly staff, delicious food and cozy local üíØ', 'Our waitress was Aiida, not only is she pleasant and such a beautiful soul, she is also very well informed about the menu. We had a lovely time and I‚Äôm super full from the food, thanks to Aiida ‚ô•Ô∏è', 'It was very good, we had tahirer as a waiter he was very chill and nice to us Americans. They were fast and got us everything we needed. Would recommend for breakfast lunch or dinner.
Very English speakers friendly as well.']

Adresse: 35 Rue de la Roquette, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews: ["Great pizza made in front of you, business owned by two nice brothers, very hard workers, they never close!!! Open everyday until late. I would recommend the Carnaval pizza, my favorite. It's a great quality/price pizzeria and warm staff. Thanks!", "My husband ordered here! Should have read the comments; pizza came cold and incorrect, and so did my pasta! When we called about the order they refused to correct the order! Don't waste your time, worst customer service in Paris.", "Such a great little place. A really good selection of yummy pizza and a really friendly staff. If you don't try the Costa Viola pizza, you've wasted a visit-- Parma ham and parmesan cheese with arugula: so good.", 'Sensational Pizza!!! Easy online order, delivered to door within 30 minutes!', 'Service top.\nPain excellent. üëå']

Adresse: 138 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Antoine, 75012 Paris, France
Reviews:
["We stayed at a hostel, Auberge, very close to Le 138 and thus used it as our primary place to go out. Ordering is very easy using a QR-code on the table and the servers bring the drinks and food to you. The server we encountered seemed quite stressed and annoyed which wasn't very appealing. That said, the drinks were cheap and the bar is open 24/7 for both drinks and food - very nice option for going during the evening and  night!", 'The food is okay-ish and the drinks are fine as well. They have a QR code based menu and you need to fill out forms on your phone to pay for your order. Every time.
The bar is quite ugly and dark inside, the tables are super small. There is always a queue to get access to the restrooms and the toilets are ugly as well...', 'Prices are good and atmosphere too. The QR-based ordering system is infuriating and unnecessarily complicated. Why do I need to fill out my first and last name, email address every time I want to order a drink? My friend didn‚Äôt have Apple Pay so he was also forced to fill out all his card details for every single drink.', 'This restaurant probably does not like American and Canadian tourism to spend money in this bar restaurant, we arrived in Paris this August 21 in the evening, and we had a hotel near the Gare Lyon , me and my wife went to walk in the streets very late in the evening, after a long walk we were hungry and at 2 am not much was open and we passed this bar restaurant open all night and we decided to stop at the terrace to order a pizza. 2 gentlemen who were waiting near the entrance, I asked them if it was possible to eat, and they refused us entry and the right to go eat in this restaurant as the only excuse that we were not well dressed enough to sit down, because I had a sporty outfit, basketball Chicago hat a typically American look...

I can understand for a 3-star restaurant, or a select bar, but for a vulgar classic bar restaurant, what a snobbery these Parisians are. I m 50 years old, this is the first time in my life life that I was refused to eat in a restaurant.. After seeing a police officer the next day I asked the question of refusal to serve a client to eat and replied that it was illegal..

So dear friend stay away from restaurants with incompetent and rude staff.', 'Honest prices and a nice atmosphere for place opened all days and nights, some niche coach to enjoy a cheap and nice wine']

Adresse: 33 Rue des Deux Ponts, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We were nicely greeted by what seemed like the owner of the restaurant and the waitstaff. We ordered two bottles of Pinot Noir which were delicious. We ordered the French onion soup and the scallop tartar which was the special, both were yummy. Then we ordered the steak tartare, and another special which was the fish and carrots the mushroom pasta and the steak ribs. We were told the steak ribs was sold out which was fine so we went with the crock Monsour. The steak tartare was under seasoned and lacked many classic ingredients. The Crock monsuir egg was completely raw however was yummy. The linguine was extremely under-seasoned and lacked flavour and the fish special with the carrots was honestly inedible. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was lovely but a miss from us.', 'Les Fous is beautiful inside, exactly what you want from a French brasserie. We enjoyed our meal, however they were understaffed, so we had several long waits. The menu is traditional French.

French Onion soup was lovely. The entrecote was disappointing. Steak tartare was very good. Wine list was excellent and the wait staff were lovely, they just needed one more staff member.', 'Go! If your experience was like ours you, will love it. The menu changes often and is on chalkboard in French and English. Our server Jean was our friendly and knowledgeable guide through this delightful meal. It was the perfect meal for our last night in Paris.', 'I arrived at this establishment upon the recommendation of a close acquaintance, with the intention of indulging in a delightful dinner featuring cake. The venue itself, as well as its concept and decor, exude a remarkable level of creativity. Although the menu was concise, it offered an array of excellent options complemented by a select assortment of impressive wines. Furthermore, the atmosphere encapsulated a sense of tradition, and naturally, the location was impeccable.', 'An absolute gem of a restaurant with world class food, world class service and the perfect ambiance for a Parisienne spot.

The sea bass was exceptional as were the escargot, bone marrow and pate. And the prices were very good considering the quality of the food.

Best restaurant we‚Äôve ever eaten at on our Paris visits.

Most HIGHLY recommended!']

['Delicious Thai restaurant with many authentic meals. The staff (also Thai) was very kind to us which makes our dishes taste even better.\nWe would certainly be back here as soon as we have the chance.', 'Perhaps in order to adapt to the tastes of local people, the dishes are no longer authentic Thai, but a bit casual. The key is that they lack the warm service unique to Thais, and are so indifferent that we really don‚Äôt want to stay another minute. Maybe it‚Äôs because we drank drinks elsewhere and didn‚Äôt order drinks?', 'As some said, food no longer really tastes authentic ‚Ä¶ also the portions are ridiculously small which doesn‚Äôt reflect the Thai generosity and love for food ! So it isn‚Äôt bad but wouldn‚Äôt recommend :(', 'Very expensive. Small portion. Bad customer service. They were standing close into my chair and looking at my food. Their card reader had problem and the food was not good either', 'If this Thai restaurant is not 5 star , no other Thai I tried can deserve 5 star‚Ä¶ extremely tasty‚Ä¶ I will come back tomorrow‚Ä¶..']

['I ordered the spring roll and lemongrass chicken . The spring roll is okay .

The lemongrass chicken comes with a big plate . The chicken does not seems fresh and no taste. There are a lot of oil in the dish .

If you like large portion of food, this place is not bad. The quality is questionable.

I tried the bathroom and it is so old and dirty. I am glad I did not go to the bathroom before the food . Or else , I will lose my appetite', 'Great Vietnamese restaurant, full of locals. Great quality and fair prices for huge dishes. Love the beef noodles and shrimp bobun ‚ù§Ô∏è lovely staff and cozy ambiance. Perfect in couple or with friends.', 'Food was pretty good, spring rolls were nice. Beef was quite dry and over cooked.', "Tasty pho; very good value for money. And, there's a queue for a reason :).
Friendly staff; the service is fast and the menu is varied.
If too busy, takeaway is also an option.
The place is very small, but it is worth the wait.", 'Very cozy environment with very helpful staff.
Kitchen is so good, highly recommended.']

['My friend and I ate here without making a reservation. We were seated promptly. The restaurant was not super busy, but is not far from a tourististy spot in Paris (Le tour Eiffel). Clean and pretty inside. They have menus in both FR and EN. The server didn\'t really speak English well, but that\'s okay because I ordered for us in French. But, he could get by. We first had the Mix de Brushetta (Brushetta Mix). She had Prosecco. Perrier 33mL for me. The Brushetta was good, but we weren\'t expecting the cured raw salmon as a "topping." However, it was tasty. The toppi gs are described in either menu, so you should ask as they might change. We ordered separate meals, but tasted each other\'s. My meal came out incorrectly so I had to wait. She had pizza, which was just okay. She removed a few pepperonis for me to taste a bite while I waited. First they brought out this huge bowl of twisty pasta with ham (Coquillettes du Jambon, Comt√© √† la Truffe), which looked good, but I don\'t eat meat. I didn\'t have a chance to take a photo b/c I didn\'t let the server leave it. When I correct meal came, I had the Ravioli Ricotta E Spinaci (Rav w/ Ricotta & Spinach), which was DELICIOUS! My friend was so jealous. It came out hot and looked like a smaller bowl, but we were both surprised by the amount. It kept giving, and she kept dipping her pizza in my sauce. It really was quite good. The British guy next to us chatted with us and let me try his Tiramisu, which was great. Clean and crisp, with the taste of espresso but not overpowering and not overly sweet. And her Panna Cotta was good also, smooth, chilled, not too sweet. But my Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e was very good. The sugar was thin and not burnt, also smooth. And I tasted all the vanilla, with the visible beans. I highly recommend the Ravioli.', 'Love their pizzas and the relaxing vibe here.  The aubergine one was my favourite and surprisingly super yummy.  Came back another day for the spicy chorizo one which was also very good.  Don‚Äôt eat cheese but forgot to ask not to have cheese when ordering at 2nd visit but the gentleman who served the pizza to me was very kind and immediately returned the pizza to kitchen without question when I told him that and brought me a new one without cheese 15minutes later.  Will definitely come back next time in Paris.\nHighly recommended for everyone who wants a slice of good pizza üçï (espresso is very good too)', 'Amazing place to get a quick bite after a long day of travel as this is right next to the train station. Plating and presentation is a big deal here. You get the fancy feel at a very reasonable price. If you are staying at the hotel above the restaurant you also get a 20% discount. You do have to pay for water. The Spaghetti was a little bland. However the ravioli was amazing. There are only a few vegetarian options.', "The service was very unprofessional.  I saw people seated after us eat and leave before we got our meals. I eventually had to get up and pay for my meal at the register.  The manager was not concerned with why I was taking this action.  I had half a pizza and requested a box for my pizza.  They took it back and brought it back to me poorly wrapped in aluminum foil.  I just left it at the table and left.  My guest and I just happen to be the only black people there.  I have good reason to believe this restaurant don't appreciate people of color.  I will never go there agin.", 'Friendly, quick service with excellent food.']

['Today we went to have lunch there and Sharabone was the nicest person in the world (: We were with our suitcase and with our friend and she was very helpful (:', 'I liked the options of vegetarian food and the service was super sweet! She was very supportive and spoke perfect English. The food was very good and fresh.', "We stopped here after our flight from Spain, the food was amazing and Sharabon, Ahsan, Mann were the nicest servers ever!!! We'll come back for sure!!", 'The staff is really respectful and helpful ! Honestly best service I ever got in a Subway in France thanks to the staff', 'One of the best Subway, they put a lot of ingredients in the food. The place is clean surprisingly. And the manager was very kind to us.']

['Terrible French fries. Very greasy.   Said it was how they make them.  Very stale baguette came with quiche. Chicken sandwich was good', "The service was friendly, fast efficient and professional. The location, especially the proximity to the cimeti√®re du P√®re-Lachaise, is excellent. The atmosphere was good. The food and drink was tasty and very good value for money. I gave 0 stars for the rooms, as we only ate and drank in L'ami Justin and did not stay at the Hotel Obododo.", 'no idea why this is listed as a hotel, its a very cozy lunchroom with retro interior. staff was super friendly and cheesecake was excellent.', 'We stopped here after visiting Cemetery. It was just a quick coffee and desert spot. Service was good. Espresso was good creme br√ªl√©e was okay. Good for quick rest but wouldn‚Äôt be make a trip here, unless in the neighborhood.', 'TL;DR: Ripoff - ask the price of cakes in advance. Mediocre service.\n\nWe went there after a visit to P√®re La-Chaise cemetery on a cold day. The coffee was cheap, although one of them arrived only 2/3 full. Since the price for the coffee seemed reasonable, I decided to order a slice of cake without asking the price. Boy, was that a surprise‚Ä¶ 7‚Ç¨ for just a thin slice!! The biggest ripoff of my life.']

['Was the first restaurant we went to in Paris. The server was really nice and he constantly checked in. We didn‚Äôt book so we sat at the bar. The food was also pretty good. We had foie gras to start. It seemed frozen so a bit hard but it came with confiture so it was still tasty. For mains we had a chicken dish and a lobster ravioli. They were both pretty unique and good and the mashed potatoes that came with it was especially good. The dessert French toast was the best and the millefeuille was also okay. Would go back!', 'A fantastic evening here, starting with the perfect American style Hendricks dirty martini! Friendly staff helped make the evening easier for us by conversing in English. Excellent appetizers and the entrees were amazing! We managed to save room for dessert, glad we did. Surprisingly reasonably priced. Worth every Euro! Highly recommend reservations. Merci pour cette soir√©e m√©morable!', 'Amazing, amazing dinner in Paris. The whole experience was a dream! Cannot recommend the Ravioli and the Pain Perdu enough!!!', 'Celebrated my husbands birthday here. Lovely lovely lovely restaurant to look at. The table snacks, what even are they? They are too good. I‚Äôm sure everything on the menu is incredible but this is the best burger in Paris! Have it with a glass of wine. voila.', 'Great little restaurant for a leisurely lunch. The mussels are pretty much a must; enjoy the delicious broth with the bread they bring you. Book ahead for a  noon or 12:15pm seating to secure a good table - space is limited.']

["Quite original menu and that is why i wanted to try it out. The portion of the main dish is too small to be honest. for 29 euros, even considering the design and good ingredient, the portion is too small. The dessert rick cake is great, i didn't take a photo which is a pity. The bread is not to the quality of a high-level restaurant which is a pity as the service and ambiance are at good level. For 2 people with entry/main/dessert + one glass of wine, more than 110 euros is a bit expensive for what we had especially on the quantity . btw: We did get a burger in macdo after this....", 'Really good bistro with good wines and friendly staff. Beautiful cozy restaurant. We had the terrine, trout gravlax, carrot salad, scallops, cheese and chocolate mousse and all were great. My favorite maybe the terrine but hard to choose.', "Two visits already, one for lunch and the other for dinner. L'√âbauchoir is a very nice place with a welcoming and friendly staff. Food is awesome and menu regularly changes to stick to seasonal ingredients. Atmosphere can be noisy but that's the sign of a successfully crowded place. Will definitely come back again.", 'We enjoyed a fabulous dinner at this Parisian bistro, from the exquisite entr√©e to the decadent dessert. Every dish was beautifully prepared and bursting with flavor. The elegant ambiance and attentive service made the experience unforgettable. A true culinary delight!', 'Waw! This was extraordinary good! From starters, to main, to desserts, all deliciously good. For main I took the dish with deer. This was by far the best deer I ever ate, nicely presented on a beautiful arranged plate.

Personnel was incredibly kind, and once they‚Äôve noticed you speak English they will automatically switch to English to help you. Most kind. Five full stars, well deserved.

Loved this place üíõ']
['Very good choices of chocolate‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Best chocolates I‚Äôve ever had üòã', 'Very helpful and friendly staff', 'Excellent !!', 'Top']

['I was only in Paris for a short time and found everything I hoped for in this quaint, cozy, friendly and DELICIOUS establishment. I tried the escargot, bone marrow, lamb and squid. It was incredibile! I highly recommend this place! 10/10', 'Authentic and traditional French restaurant
Have great food and English speaking server.
Lobster is nice and canard has a unique and chewy taste. Overall is great and would come back again.', 'Nice food, good service and reasonable price. A very popular local restaurant. Excellent! Came back again for the third time!', "Delicious french experience.
Everything is perfect but the place is a little small. The owner is so friendly and will greet you warmly.
All items we had were delicious (check the pictures!!) and prices are very fair.
Don't forget to take your omelette norv√©gienne for desert !", 'Lively little restaurant. The staff speaks very good English and recommended the wine well. The place is busy and hard to get a table without reservation. The canard is very good.']

['Larosoir really impressed me! The food was absolutely delicious, packed with flavor and beautifully presented. The setting was nice and cozy. While the prices are generally reasonable, getting an entr√©e, main, and dessert altogether can feel a bit on the pricier side. Still, for the quality of the experience, it‚Äôs definitely worth considering.', 'Quite big portion for regular Asian. For me the dish is better with a bit of salt and pepper. 1 salad and 1 steak should be fine for 2 person. They offer free drinking water.', 'Excellent place to sit on the patio and enjoy a fantastic meal. Started with croque-monsieur on brushetta followed by a salad Cesar and croque-monsieur, salad. All with a paname barge du canal IPA to wash it down.', 'Food was very acceptable but evening ruined by an arrogant waiter who treated me with no respect and hurried me out as quickly as he could. Brought me the wrong wine (small I ordered large) and stood over me to insist I paid the bill before I‚Äôd finished my drink. I won‚Äôt be going back based purely on that waiter. Stunned you actually employ someone like that who ensures no repeat business from people like me.', 'Lovely place under the arches of the Promenade Plantee. Good value, very friendly service and lovely food. The fried goats cheese is amazing. And so is the cr√®me camarel!']

['I found this treasure while walking and has been an incredible find! I ordered the traditional couscous marrocain that was served beautifully with delicate flavors paired with a full of character morrocan wine! The service? Amazing.', 'This is my first time eating Moroccan food. I was so happy with this meal at this restaurant.  The food is tasty, I really love it. Really want to go back to this restaurant.', "Really good food and huge portions. There's a set meal for 1 pax as well as 2 pax. We chose the latter and it was honestly too much for us! Starters  consisted of 6 small dishes as well as their bread (which was SO good we asked for more!), all with a distinct unique taste (personally liked the carrot salad as well as the aubergines). We chose the lamb tagine as well as the chicken couscous.. Both were super flavourful and so tender.. dessert was a choice of either oranges with pistachios and some herbs drizzled on top, as well as Moroccan sweets (a bit too sweet for me but it was good). Staff were really friendly and the overall vibes of the place was fantastic.", 'Really lovely place, nicely decorated, great food, very nice service, very close to Metro 8.
