['This is one of my favorite restaurants in Paris. Been coming here since 2016 and the food is amazing. Went again tonight and the staff was so friendly and helpful. Let us sit inside to avoid the rain just before opening. Every thing we ate was delicious!', 'This place is so underrated. Some of the best vegetarian Thai food we have ever had and this is coming from someone that has travelled the world including Thailand. Make sure to get the eggplant stir fry shown in the receipt I posted. It will blow your mind. The Tom kha soup and red curry also great! I can‚Äôt say enough about the ambience of the restaurant. White table service at the price of a normal restaurant. Just a great memorable meal in Paris. Amazing location as well!\n\nUpdate: went a second time few days later. While sitting we saw another couple walk in and say ‚Äúwe were here yesterday‚Äù.', 'Ambience was good. It is at a walkable distance from arc de triomphe. There was quite a variety of veg options.', 'Absolutely amazing Asian restaurant in Paris!You definitely have to try it!The food was so good also they have a great vegetarian menu.For the dessert me and my friend got mango sticky rice which was the best mango sticky rice i have had in Paris.Everything prices reasonably and the service was on point.', 'Another cosy & nice  Asian restaurant we were visiting in Paris. The staff are friendly and really helpful. You should come!']

['I really enjoyed the show. The dancers were really professional and you could feel their passion for their job!! Drinks are expensive but there is a Happy Hour until 11 pm with 50% off the usual prices for the drinks.', 'Its highly recommended strip club . My partner and I went here last night to celebrate in advance his birthday . It is our first time to go to this kind of club and we can say we both enjoyed our night. The guy who welcomed and assist us is very nice and polite . The dancers are really good and professional.  We enjoy the table dance with Mika üòâ she is pretty. And respectful.  This is sure that we will come back . üòâ', 'I went there with my husband Saturday night. We paid 100‚Ç¨ for entrance and got two drinks free (they called it champagne, but in my opinion it was more like lemonade with water). Dancers never got up on pylon, they were ‚Äúdancing‚Äù just in front of it in lazy way like they didn‚Äôt sleep last month at all((( We watched 5 of them, each are not very fresh, 40+, not sporty.. some girls were wearing protection masks ü§¶üèª\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏è Just imagine: They were walking in the club in underwear and masks‚Ä¶ looks very funny and absurd.\nThere is nothing to see for this kind of price. We both didn‚Äôt like this place‚Ä¶ Bad quality of dance show.', 'Got drugged. They can‚Äôt pretend that they didn‚Äôt. We had high hopes, we did our research and thought this was a safe and fun club. Unfortunately for them we have to leave this review. Beautiful place, beautiful girls, would have spent more time and money but we didn‚Äôt appreciate the unprofessional behavior.', 'Highly recommend! Went there for my bachelorette party (they dont have male dancers but we enjoyed the beautiful girls dancing on stage and private dances just the same)\nHad a BLAST AND wont forget my night anytime soon!']

['This breakfast was everything I needed, the scrambled eggs were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. Pairing the smoked salmon with the eggs, and pickled red onion was delightful. I‚Äôll be thinking of this simple yet refined breakfast for ages. The cafe au lait was great, and was exactly what I needed on this cold winter day. Highly recommend and will be back soon', 'Was looking for a place for lunch after visiting the shopping street of Champ Elysees. This shop was within walking distance with a great view of the Arc de Triomphe. Ordered the salmon for myself and it was perfectly cooked! They will ask you how well done you like it and I took it in the true Parisian way - a little pink. Salmon was flavourful and garnish was cooked well too. Husband ordered the duck and it came with a nice side of potatoes that were fresh! Crisp on the outside and soft inside. Lovely experience! Asif was our server and he was awesome! Helpful, amiable and he gave us such a pleasant experience.', 'The dining experience was exceptional, with delicious food that truly showcased the flavors of French cuisine. , was the impeccable service provided by Ahmed. He was attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure that our meal was memorable. Thank you, Ahmed, for making our visit special!', 'We had breakfast at this restaurant and it was delicious. The black coffee here is amazing. The location is great you can see the arc de triomphe from your table. We loved the service and everything about this place. Highly recommended :)', 'It was really perfect. The brunch was gorgeous. Emy was really great, she make us fell so comfortable. For sure one of the best meals in Paris with a amazing waitress.']

['Delectable tasting and authentic Moroccan food. I would eat here again. Had the lamb and vegetables tajine. Be careful though it is very, very hot. Also had the pastries, which were not that great. Little expensive but worth it if you appreciate fine food.', "The restaurant's space is cozy, but the flavors are exceptional. I had the Moroccan harira soup, vegetable tajine with lamb, and couscous with lamb. The service is excellent and the prices are high", 'The friendliest place with the tastiest Moroccan couscous! The lamb was cooked to perfection and the flavors were exquisite. We will definitely come again on our next visit to Paris.', 'I never had Moroccan food tasted like this even in the Moroccan\nI recommend every one coming to Paris to come and eat in this restaurant fantastic food fantastic atmosphere fantastic service', 'One of the best places to eat genuine Moroccan food in Paris.\nGreat food ... great service ... great hospitality']

['The best lamb shank we have ever tasted. Tender, silky, off the bone. A little pricey,  but  worthed every euro. Veneh made us felt welcome right from the start', 'Absolutely awful. The prices are ridiculous. They charged me 10 euro a kebbe and 18 a shawarma. For two of us it ended up being 78 euros and we hardly had anything. My friend didn‚Äôt even have a sandwich. I have never ever seen this before as it used to be great. I will never go back. I used to always go there and raced anout the place. Never again. The service was awful. Just dropped a pile of plates on my table and left it there. The food was terrible and so overpriced.  I will never set foot there again. Thanks for ruining what used to be one of my favourite places in Paris to go to. Shame.', 'Cozy Lebanese restaurant serves best falafel sandwich and chicken shawarma. Humus,  Tabboula and Batata Harra were so yummy as well.', 'Authentic little place near Arc de Triomphe / Champs-Elys√©es, chicken kebabs in crispy Lebanese flatbread, baked aubergines and salad - simple, quick, friendly, the way it should be. The atmosphere is simple but clean. Recommended.', "Absolutely incredible. Best baklava I've ever had."]

['‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Dining at LA MAISON DU CAVIAR was an exceptional experience, made even more memorable by the incredible hospitality of the manager, Angele. From the moment we arrived, Angele greeted us with her beautiful and professional presence, instantly making us feel welcomed. Her short hair perfectly complements her eyes, adding to the charm of her warm demeanor. Throughout our visit, Angele ensured that we were comfortable and relaxed, making the evening truly enjoyable. The attention to detail and care we received was second to none. I highly recommend this restaurant, not only for its exquisite cuisine but also for the outstanding service provided by Angele.', 'Had a fantastic time at the restaurant! The staff was over polite and helpful, something rare for Paris!! People kept coming all night and the restaurant was full but still service and food quality stayed exceptional.
Third time at the restaurant and for sure not the last.', 'I recently dined at La Maison du Caviar, and it was exceptional experience from start to finish. The ambience is warm and inviting, with cozy decor that makes you feel welcoming.
The menu offers a fantastic selection of dishes with quality ingredients and presentation while drinks selection provides amazing quality selection including champagne.
The service was impeccable. The staffs were very attentive particularly Younes who was amazing with his knowledge and customer service. In addition, from the moment I walked in, I was warmly greeted by a beautiful Angele the manager, who made me feel immediately welcome. she was also attentive, friendly and incredibly amazing with her personalize service by kept checking on me ensuring I had the best service.
overall, La Maison du Caviar is a gem. If you are looking for a restaurant that will provide you a quality foods and phenomenal customer service, this restaurant is highly recommended and I will definitely be returning soon.', 'I visit Paris often, but never miss a chance to visit this place. Always a wonderful experience with service, gives a little cheeky laugh which creates me the wish to always come back here. The food is delicious with a little inspiration of the eastern Europe, which makes it all so compatible with my favourite caviar! And they have the best choices when it comes to caviar! Will be looking forward to come back next Paris Fashion Week ', 'Super cuisine, excellent service, and a nice compliment - pickles, which were great. I recommend the establishment, the main thing is to book in advance!']

['We just ordered a delivery from this restaurant.
The prices are very high for the food portions !! I understand that good produce costs money but here it‚Äôs outrageous if you compare the prices to the portions sizes!!
The lamb kebab portion is 10 tiny pieces hardly enough for 1 person for 30 euros !!
Baklava is 11 euros for 8 smallest pieces I have ever seen and I lived long enough in Gulf countries to know the difference !!
I included the photos of everything mentioned above that I took in comparison with a pair of glasses to prove the tiny portion size .
I don‚Äôt recommend this restaurant.', "Excellent dishes but small. Beautiful authentic interior. Frequented by Lebanese, so it's genuinely good food.", 'Food is no doubt delicious. Service is also incredible and welcoming with Mr. Adnan.
However, it‚Äôs quite pricey!! We ordered 3 appetizers, 1 main dish, and 2 coke for ‚Ç¨90!!!', 'OVERALL.
Authentic Lebanese cuisines with great savoir-faire.
If you‚Äôre looking to taste Lebanese cuisine or you‚Äôre looking to enjoy a typical Lebanese culinary experience, this is definitely the place to go!

AMBIANCE.
Calm and Mediterranean. The place has lots of intimate places where to sit and it is quite calm and comfortable.

FOOD.
Absolutely delightful typical Lebanese dishes. From the Salads to the Mezzes and Dishes : everything is so savoury. You can feel the high qualitative ingredients and savoir-faire when tasted.
Our best recommendations :
- Tabouli
- Kafta (amazing)
- Kebbe
- Rakakat
- Labne bi toum
- And so on: everything is so tasteful!

They also have menus depending on the experience you‚Äôre looking for.

SERVICE.
People there are really helpful and they have this special attention towards the guest.

PRICES.
To be honest, this place is largely on the expensive side generally speaking. Quality and authenticity make it understandable though.

Thank you for this experience!', 'Authentic and delicious. Hummus and tabouli are fire, I felt like I was back in Lebanon. Kibbeh nayeh was excellent, as well as the desserts. The ŸÖŸÑŸàÿÆŸäÿß was not as flavorful as I would have liked but everything else was super delicious and flavorful.']

Nom: Les Salons de l'H√¥tel des Arts et M√©tiers
Reviews:
['4 of us visited.
this place shows classics of french cuisine.
good servers, good and classic atmosphere.
all dishes were good enough thus no comments for each dishes.

I went there at 7pm in the summer, thus no one else was in the restaurant.
It was a little bit awkward to have french meal with 4 customers and 4 servers in the hall.

just go after 8pm :)', 'What a place!
Attending a conference, followed by a business lunch at the A&M Restaurant.
Really enjoyed the time here, as I never expected to find a relaxing garden right in the centre of Paris.', 'A delicious meal in an amazing building. I was speechless when I saw the upstair room. Clearly a place to visit :)', 'Very nice terrace and excellent food. Service a bit so-so with some mix ups with the orders and so on.', "The wonderful restaurant, Les Arts, is housed inside here. If you don't know better, you get the feeling that you have to be a member of some club to enter, but you don't. It's open to the public, though reservations are recommended. It's not that pricey, either, and in the summer the garden dining is one of the best in the city."]

["The Bedford Hotel Paris offers a delightful experience that combines comfort, convenience, and a touch of history. Here‚Äôs a professional and positive review highlighting the various aspects of this charming hotel:
Reception and Service
Upon arrival, guests are greeted by a friendly and efficient reception team. The check-in process is quick, ensuring that you can settle into your room without delay. The staff is attentive and ready to assist with any inquiries, making you feel welcomed from the moment you step inside.
Room Quality
The rooms at the Bedford Hotel are easy to find, well-equipped, and impeccably clean. Each room features comfortable beds that guarantee a good night's sleep, allowing guests to relax after a day of exploring Paris. The bathrooms are also well-appointed, providing all necessary amenities in a spotless environment.
Amenities
While the hotel includes modern conveniences such as flat-screen televisions, some guests have noted that the TVs can be a bit tricky to operate. However, this minor inconvenience does not detract from the overall quality of the stay.
Breakfast Experience
The breakfast offered at the hotel is delicious and well-served, providing a great start to your day. Guests appreciate the variety and quality of the food available, making it a highlight of their stay.
Location and Accessibility
Situated in an excellent location, the Bedford Hotel is just steps away from key attractions such as the Madeleine and the Paris Opera. The proximity to public transportation makes it easy for guests to explore all that Paris has to offer. Additionally, parking options are available, enhancing convenience for those traveling by car.
A Historical Touch
For those looking to experience Paris from a hotel steeped in history, the Bedford Hotel has been welcoming guests for over 100 years. This rich heritage adds an extra layer of charm to your stay, making it a unique choice among hotels in the area.
Conclusion
In summary, if you're seeking a hotel that combines excellent service, comfortable accommodations, and a prime location in Paris, look no further than the Bedford Hotel. It stands out as an exceptional choice for both leisure and business travelers alike. Choose this hotel above others for an unforgettable Parisian experience!", 'The concierge, Harisch, made our stay!! He gave us fantastic recommendations for restaurants and got us into some lovely spots for dinners.

Our room was nice and very spacious. The bed, however, was very uncomfortable for what I‚Äôm used to (it was very very hard).', 'Perfect hotel. Perfect and friendly location, feeling of security in the hotel, nice staff who answered all requests, delicious breakfast, clean and beautiful rooms. Highly recommended my experience in Paris thanks to the hotel and I wanted to thank Charles Part, one of the owners, for the good service.', 'It all started the moment we arrived. Walking into the hotel, it‚Äôs beautifully adorned and sets the tone for a good stay, for a 4 star hotel. However upon check in is where the problems started. We booked on booking dot com and paid in advance, however the staff (front office manager) asked for my credit card for payment. I told her we‚Äôd already paid in full upfront and she snarly said ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think so‚Äù‚Ä¶. I told her to double check and she said oh yeah‚Ä¶ no apology for the remark. Strange how the front office manager could make such error.. had I not checked, I would have been charged again.
We made our way up to the room‚Ä¶ an hour later I had a call saying that my AMEX card was in the lobby as the staff didn‚Äôt return it to me. They didn‚Äôt bring it to the room or apologise, so I made my way down to collect it.
The entire aura and lack of manners from the staff is disappointing. Not one smile, not an apology.
The next day, the shower gel was not replenished, despite us using it all. The amenities are not up to standard for a 4 star hotel at a price of over 200‚Ç¨ per night. After the second night, still no replies of shower gel so I complained to the front office. Again, no apology, the staff just scrabbled to find a spare small bottle of shower gel in the drawer at front office. Besides this, there are no cotton buds or any other basic amenities you‚Äôd expect, no kettle, no tea or coffee, no water.  I have had better amenities in 2 star hotels. This hotel is 2 star parading as 4 star just because they have a restaurant onsite and a concierge service.

Upon checkout we were asked how many rooms, and how many adults in the room.. strange questions. No thank you for the stay or any form of sincerity.

Location is fantastic and the lobby and restaurant are beautiful. Complete let down from the staff (apart from bellboy who is friendly).

My advice to management: stop being so cheap and greedy. Provide proper amenities that reflect the level and cost of the hotel. Train your staff or hire people that actually want to be in hospitality.
Also, bed sheets and carpet have stains and holes. Not acceptable.', 'Good place , but I hated that the toilet is separate from the shower and sink! Imagine using the toilet then need to open tow doors to wash your hands.. there is no slippers, rope, tooth brush, water, or coffee corner.. if you need boiling water you need to go to the lobby to have one otherwise they will charge you for room service if they bring it to you.. the last thing about the open buffet I didn‚Äôt like it at all ( eggs, yogurt, cereal, mini croissants, sausages, and a small plate with 3 type of cheese only!! ) and it was pricey']

['An absolutely top-notch experience! I arrived at the hotel slightly earlier than the check-in time, and the gentleman at the front desk smoothly handled my check-in. He informed us that since it was our honeymoon, our room had been upgraded to a suite with a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower‚Äîwhat a wonderful surprise! The room‚Äôs view was breathtaking, and the ambiance made our stay unforgettable. The staff at the bar downstairs were incredibly nice and offered timely assistance.

The hotel‚Äôs location is unbeatable‚Äîright next to Chanel‚Äôs flagship store and Saint-Honor√©, making shopping extremely convenient. The only minor downside was that the breakfast menu remained the same for all three mornings of our stay, with no variety. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I highly recommend this hotel!', 'Although we were a big family with 4 kids, including infants, this hotel located in the middle of local shopping and just near Tuileries Gardens did super good sharing all its resources with us.
Personnel was very attentive and we had fun staying there, in a location very good for walking.
We tried the restaurant within the hotel, and all enjoyed a lot of- both food and service.
Very rich breakfasts too.
The only thing is non-spacious rooms for quite some money, but this is quite natural for Paris in general, especially for locations neighboring with top-brands-boutiques!', 'Stayed for our anniversary 20 years after our first visit to Paris and the hotel is incredible. Lovely touches in the room and breakfast was so good. Most of all of you get to meet beryl on reception count yourself lucky. She is a real credit to the hotel... Just wish we could afford to come back again......', 'Very friendly front desk staff and concierge
Capucine, the cat who "works" at the hotel
Good location
Good quality materials in the room
Very comfortable bed
Very high quality breakfast
The room in the lowest category is too small; I would choose a higher room category next time.', 'Very charming and welcoming hotel in a very ritzy area. The hotel staff has been nothing but helpful and friendly, from the reception, to the concierge, to the bar tender and everyone in between. Plus getting to play with the two resident cats is a treat on its own. We will definitely be back next time we come to Paris. Their breakfast buffet and amenities are also top notch.']

Adresse: 8 Av. Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
['A month later, I still have a clear memory of ‚Äúthe worst service and food in my lifetime.‚Äù Typically either the service or food isn‚Äôt great, but this was the exception. They both were AWFUL. The gentleman who greeted us, showed us to a table, and took our order is the rudest person who should be banned from interacting with customers. He mocked me while ordering and he then decided to speak Italian instead of French. We felt unwelcome as soon as we entered. He was a complete snob and full of himself and his Hermes belt he was proud to wear.
On top of the rudest service you‚Äôll encounter, the risotto and chicken Marsala was not good. I barely ate it. We decided to get a dessert and coffee somewhere after so we wouldn‚Äôt end the evening with such a poor experience. It dampened part of our trip.
We expected a wonderful dinner because the ambience is pleasant, but don‚Äôt let that deceive you. This restaurant is HORRIBLE.', 'I was surprised to read the bad reviews! Lucky, i had a pleasant experience today. This was my second visit, tried the Arabiata with added mushrooms, the seabass fish, risotto, sea food pasta and the tiramisu.
All was more than good.
Diffidently will visit again. I only gave it 4/5 due to the high prices.', 'Their tomato dishes are exceptional! The waitress let my friend use their charger and the street is also very nice and lively. Definitely would go again next time I‚Äôm in the city', 'What a wonderful way to watch life go by.
Excellent food.', 'The best restaurant in the heart of Paris! If you want tasty food with reasonable prices then this is your place. We ate pizza calzone and it was wonderful!']

Nom: H√¥tel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel
Adresse: 10 Pl. de la Concorde, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We stayed here for a magical 3 nights and the Hotel Crillon is a special place - from the moment you arrive, everything is taken care of seamlessly. The kindness and attentiveness of the staff is unmatched, and they make it very easy to relax and enjoy the amazing property and the city from its central location.', 'We had an amazing stay at Hotel Crillon! The staff was super friendly and made us feel right at home. The place is spotless, and the spa‚Äîwow, best massage we‚Äôve ever had! The breakfast was delicious, with plenty of tasty options, and every single employee was kind and helpful. If you‚Äôre lookin‚Äô for a place to relax and be pampered, this is it!', "If we could, we would give Hotel de Crillon 6 stars. Everything was perfect from the moment we arrived. The entire hotel is an architectural and design gem. You have check-in in a private room with the option of a welcome drink. Our room was ready on time, beautiful and clean. There is a coffee and tea set, minibar, fruit and sweets in the room. The bathroom had a wide range of toiletries with a very interesting design. We really appreciate the correct size of the bathrobes (smaller sizes) and the Dyson hairdryer. The bathroom has a small TV built into the mirror, so you can watch TV from the bathtub. During our stay, we also visited the wellness area, which has an incredible design. There is a steam sauna, a Finnish sauna, a swimming pool and relaxation chairs. Available is an extended range of toiletries in the dressing room. In the wellness area you will find many snacks in the form of fresh and dried fruit, tea, coffee, cereal bars, biscuits, water and lemonade. There is a staff by the pool who will take care of your comfort. We felt very good and had a great rest. We booked our stay with breakfast, which are in the iconic Jardin d' Hivre restaurant. There is a menu (not a buffet) from which you can choose whatever you like. The menu is extensive, including Benedict eggs, avocado toast, fresh orange juice. This restaurant also serves lunch, afternoon tea and dinner in the form of tapas and desserts (you can read more about Jardin d'Hivre in our next review). During our stay, we also visited the beautiful Bar les Ambassadeurs (you can read more about the Bar in our next review), which belongs to the hotel. You can communicate with the staff via whats app the whole time, the service is very fast and all the employees are perfectly organized, which we have never seen anywhere else in such a form. Thanks for the highest level of care. We will definitely be happy to come back here. More on instagram @larmarluxury.", 'We did tea at Jardin d‚ÄôHiver yesterday in the Hotel de Crillon, and it was a lovely experience. Beautiful ambience, excellent service (Ismael was very kind, friendly, and professional), and delicious food and drinks. Looking forward to coming back here next time we‚Äôre in Paris!', 'The most beautiful hotel in Paris. The rooms are very luxurious and spacious. The service is amazing and breakfast is absolutely delicious. It is also very good located near all the shops and attractions.']

Adresse: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√©, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
['This is my favorite hotel in Paris. We are always treated like family. The hotel is cozy and homey and beautiful. Service is an 11/10. I brought my puppy this time and they took amazing care of her by providing a beautiful bed and bowls and a custom place mat with her name. They offered to take her on walks as well! She left with a little toy. If I didn‚Äôt love the Bristol from my previous visits, this last trip has solidified that I will not stay anywhere else when I am in Paris. Thank you guys so much for your on incredible hospitality. I can‚Äôt say enough good things!!', 'An exquisite property. I visited the caf√© while waiting for a colleague. I appreciate good coffee and they had it. Was able to maintain also a lot of privacy ideal for conversations on Negotiation.', 'We had such a wonderful stay at Le Bristol, thank you for the warm hospitality and excellent service throughout the hotel which goes above and beyond!

A special thank you to Ivan for the warmest welcome and enjoyable tour around on our first day it was the perfect start to the trip! Thank you to Guillaume for your attention to detail and for the updated Parisian guide on what is new and exciting!

The breakfast was truly a delight and the crepes in Caf√© Antonia were the best I have ever had! We also loved the wonderful choice of restaurants within the hotel as well as the location.

Thank you for a beautiful and memorable time!', 'We had a private event at the Bristol Hotel.
- Location is great at the busy and sublime Faubourg St Honor√©.
- It was Christmas season so the hotel was wonderfully decorated
- The service at the event was very good
If you are wondering why it is 4/5 it is simply that the food at the event was average . Not bad for sure but nothing special .
I didn‚Äôt have the chance to see the rooms but the lobby and the restaurants are very nice .', 'I love this hotel.
Recently returning as back on my company approved list‚Ä¶.
The service from the front desk - reception and concierge - among the best and most personal I have seen across all my travels, globally.
Everything is super expensive, but.']

['We visited this restaurant for a special occasion and it was spectacular. The food was amazing, the staff and service was amazing. Lovely bar at the top and restaurant at the bottom. We celebrated my birthday here and my partner ordered a dessert and informed the staff it was my birthday and out came the sparklers and everyone sang happy birthday it was such a nice surprise. They truly make it specialü•∫ü•Ç‚ú®', 'Like the one in Dubai Buddha-Bar Paris offers an unforgettable dining experience. The wines, cocktails, and food were absolutely unparalleled‚Äîeach element perfectly crafted and delicious. The ambiance is equally remarkable, with its unique blend of elegance and tranquility that sets the perfect mood for a memorable evening.\n\nThe attention to detail and exceptional service made the experience even more enjoyable. I will definitely be returning and highly recommend it to anyone seeking a sophisticated and flavorful night out in Paris.', "Buddha Bar is super cute.  The ambiance and decor are quite trendy and hip. Definitely a spot to go for a special occasion dinner or a night out with friends. Food was delicious and tasty. We ordered the calamari, rock shrimp, the steamed shrimp dumplings, and the Buddha Bar roll for our starters. For our mains, we ordered the five spice chicken, the pork ribs, and the red curry prawns. The standouts were the calamari, rock shrimp, the pork ribs and the red curry prawns. I would definitely order all of them again. The biggest negatives were that there was an event that night, so it felt super crowded upstairs getting around and there was really only one server for downstairs, so we waited quite a while for things.  However, I'd go back and try them again on a regular night.", 'What an opportunity to visit Buddha-Bar Paris and dine! This has been in my bucket list forever and Buddha-Bar Paris did not disappoint. Selection of delicious sushi rolls and a steak cooked to perfection all surrounding by eye dazzling decoration and of course the soundtracks of Buddha-Bar. Strongly recommend it.', 'Best restaurant-bar in Paris! The location is great, the food, drinks, music and service are amazing! Congratulations to the chef and all the staff working there. My favorite food are the spicy sushi and the calamari fritti.']

Adresse: 9 Pl. de la Madeleine, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
['A Saturday night in Paris and the 5-course tasting menu for two with a bottle of wine. French fine dining at its best with all the classical touches - a good excuse to dress up and drink fancy wine. Remembered for dishes I don‚Äôt normally enjoy but loved. Masterful use of mushrooms, beetroot and asparagus. Perfectly cooked mains, craft and technique everywhere. The ambiance was a little quieter and the service a little colder than we are used to.', 'I had the five-course with wine paring. The sommelier‚Äôs selection of the food and wine pairing was deliberated. The service was impeccable. The food was delicious and flavourful. The asparagus was my favorite! Nice combination with ice cream.', 'My family went to Lucas Carton our Christmas lunch. The staff were lovely and very attentive, the atmosphere was relaxed and quite nice for Christmas Day. Unfortunately the food was a disappointment, during the meal I found a solid piece of metal in the venison. The staff explained this was because it was imported. However, considering ‚Ç¨1000+ was spent on the meal and I almost chipped one of my molars - I was very unimpressed. Both my sister and father were very sick after the meal, we hadn‚Äôt eaten anything prior (and didn‚Äôt feel well enough to eat anything after). My sister was projectile vomiting into the night, not sure if it was related to the meal but quite certain it was. I have had set menus before for other special occasions at a lower price point and the food was of a much higher quality. The champagne was lovely and again great service from the staff. The price point definitely did not match up to the quality of food - ‚Ç¨1000+ for three people.', 'A wonderful lunch on the very special occasion of our 40th wedding anniversary. The food was quite extraordinary accompanied by excellent wines. The service was, as would be expected first class.
We enjoyed ourselves immensely', 'We were transported into the old world luxury.
Delicious food but slightly bland for my Asian palette. Our waitress,Savannah took care of us really well and made us feel like family.
Be prepared to be pampered there for 5 hours if you select the 7 courses with wine pairing.']

Adresse: 17 Av. Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Went on Friday night. 4th visit over the years. Only 3 tables had guests. Food was uninspiring and presentation sloppy. Service was stiff, and unwelcoming aside from the reception downstairs. Despite an empty restaurant the sommelier forgot to serve a wine pairing with the main until we were finished. Did not apologise. I asked them if they could open the roof as my guest had never seen it, they opened it halfway and then closed it right away (it was not raining nor that cold). This place has gone downhill over the years - will not be back. Take your ‚Ç¨700 and pick another restaurant.', 'The epitome representation of what classic French fine dining was meant to be, I would say it is worthy to classify this place as a bucket list must go dining experience. I hope to recreate their fried potato puffs.', 'QoE: We had an exceptional dining experience at this restaurant "Lasserre"! The staff guided us to our seats on the second floor and extended a warm welcome with delightful complimentary items. They expertly assisted us in choosing drinks and dishes, including the exquisite "Macaronis farcis," "≈ìufs aux c√®pes," "canard √† l'orange," "pommes coing," "coupe billecart Salmon Rose", "coupe Laurent Perrier", "eau de Sail", and more. The service was efficient, and we were impressed by the use of technology to open the roof for a breath of fresh air. It truly added to the overall wonderful quality of our dining experience.', 'Just wow
The food was incredible
We got the tasting menu. It was kind of expensive, it cost two of us around ‚Ç¨800 included one bottle of wine.
The staff were super professional

It‚Äôs better to make a reservation for this place.', 'Good experience but a little bit too expensive compared to other fine dining restaurants in Europe!']

['I recently visited Laurent, and it has left a pleasant impression with its boudoir-inspired ambiance, perfect for a romantic date. The intimate atmosphere, dim lighting, and elegant d√©cor set the stage for an enjoyable evening. The addition of live music elevated the vibe, creating a soothing and sophisticated backdrop to the meal.\n\nThe food was delightful, the wine selection was pretty good as well, sommelier was helpful. The staff and service were top-notch, clearly handpicked to enhance the experience with their attentiveness and professionalism.', 'Great atmosphere. The service people are very professional. Food was worth the price. Very good choice for a lovely date.', 'I took my niece here for a special girls‚Äô night dinner, and we had the best time. The setting was spectacular, the service impeccable, the food and its presentation delightful. My review might be slightly colored by the champagne and wine that we consumed. My niece, Deanne Nguyen, the head of atelier at a small couture house in Paris, designed and made a special dress just to go to dinner at Laurent. I think her efforts were justified given the gorgeous al fresco dining patio.  The sommelier introduced us to a red Sancerre. We ate all the food we ordered, except we went a bit overboard on the desserts so those leftovers went into a take home box. I highly recommend the crab stuffed tomato, the sea bass, and the spinach. But the absolute best thing we ordered was the langoustine!', 'My favorite place in Paris. The food was excellent, especially the dessert woow. Everything was delicious, and the service was excellent.', 'Very well situated by the Champ √âlys√©e,  this one Michelin star restaurant has as you could expect, very high standards. The food is really good & tasty (with generous portions) and the wine was excellent! We stayed in the outdoor terrace which was pretty nice, especially in the summer. Service wise, the staff was knowledgeable and very friendly.']

['We went on a Wednesday in October when they were hosting the Velvet Dinner and the entire experience was incredible. We were a bit late for our reservation but they still seated us right away. We had attentive wait staff. We enjoyed drinks, the green bean appetizer and also chicken dish with au grain potatoes and dessert, everything tasted incredible! I would go back for the food alone. The price was very reasonable. The added bonus is the beautiful decor and the Velvet Dinner Burlesque show- so tasteful, cute and flirty. At the end of the show the restaurant turned into a fun dance party with great music anyone would know. Such a fun and memorable experience! I would love to return again!', 'The whole dining experience was very different from the reviews! Food was good and as well the service! The waiter was very polite and he recommended us a very nice white wine. Also, we noticed that he was the only one serving at least 5 tables. We chatted with him and he told us that on weekends, there are only 2 waiters attending to all the tables. So I can imagine the waiting time the other diners experience. Overall, dining there was pleasant n food is good. üòä', 'Extremely disappointed with the misleading information and excessive service charge. We were initially told there was an ‚Ç¨160 minimum speend, only to be hit with an ‚Ç¨80 service charge on top of our bill with a total of 370. This felt like a deceptive practice and left a very sour taste in our mouths. Despite raising our concerns, the issue was not resolved. Be cautious when dining here, as the final bill may not reflect what you were initially led to believe.

Ps: the food and the waiter who served us was excellent however the whole misleading charge defeated the whole experience as it felt like a scam .', 'The people, who served are kind, thoughtful and attentive! Love the service. I felt, our table is the only one in the entire restaurant, we are that cares for! Amazing!
The DJ music is phenomenal! I love it! I had a lot of fun!
The food is delicious!
The atmosphere is unique and I experienced another world.

Thank you!

Best regards,

Silvia

P. S.
I hope this mail finds you having fun!  üòÇüôèüå†', 'I had an amazing experience at this restaurant! Everything was perfect, from the atmosphere to the food. The Gatsby show was a fantastic touch, creating a vibrant and entertaining atmosphere. The food was absolutely delicious, with every dish prepared to perfection. The service was top-notch, making the entire experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend it!']

["Staff is so nice and friendly. And I'm obsessed with the blue moon chia pudding! Lot's of vegan options as well.", 'Food was good, the toilets need cleaned and serviced more often', "Expensive and noisy. A lot of people during week days lunch. It's good and tasty, but for 4 times less money, and more quiet, I prefer to go to Monoprix, and to eat at my office.", 'This large place is rare in Paris. I had nice experience here. The food is simple and fresh, good WIFI, clean and I love the design and interior of the shop. Perfect place to eat and drink something simple.', 'nice service. The waitress is warm and nice. Though I bought the cheapest bread, she still gave me a big and warm and nice smile. Thank u!']

['Went for lunch with my family. Opted for seats outside as inside was cramp and crowded. The weather was nice, not too hot and not too cold. Server was very accommodating and made sure we were understood and had everything we wanted. Free bread but very chewy and hard to bite. Food was good. Steak is better than the Escalope. Fries yummy, crunchy and salty. Order pasta instead of the escalope, a lot better.', 'Booked here last minute and it did not disappoint! Service was great, waitress was really friendly and gave us great advice on our orders. Food exceeded our expectations, some of the best food my friends and I have ever had. Every dish is so unique and special. We tried such a range of new food and were delighted. Would definitely go back.', 'A great intimate and cosy restaurant for some good food. Their sushi is quite average though.', 'We can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place. Service was unmatched and our server went the extra mile to take care of us. We appreciate you guys immensely for the night had.', 'The atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice and rich. The food is great and the staff are very friendly.\nOverall great experience']

Adresse: 2Bis Av. Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
["It's a very nice theater.
The behavior of the stuffs are also very nice.After watching the movie in the theater we went to the Cafe and it was very nice of a time with family.

The surrounds were also very nice and in the heart of Paris it's a nice place to visit with family and friends.

Usually it's not as busy as it seems and it's calm and nice of a place for people of young age.", 'The Ronde Point Theater is a Parisian theater, located in the 8th arrondissement, Avenue Franklin D. Roosevelt, near the Avenue des Champs-√âlys√©es.', 'The bar downstairs is a great place for a rendezvous, for business or pleasure, even if you aren't going to the theatre. If you are, get there early and admire the decor and study your fellow theatregoers - an eclectic bunch... The theatre upstairs is beautiful in a comforting old style way. Try and track down "Sono Io", the play we went to see. A moving, funny, vertiginous display of acrobatics and intelligent slap stick humour from a father and son team. A play about a father's legacy, his waning career, the inevitable descent into decrepitude and the exuberance of youth. Hilarious, thought-provoking and a hugely talented performance from Danny and Pepijn Ronaldo. ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'great theatre üé≠ with nice decorations.i really enjoyed the show', "Lovely theatre with roughly 700 places,  confortable seating I saw a great contemporary circus show from am Australian company (circa) would recommend to friends. There is also a restaurant on the lower floor which I haven't had the pleasure to try yet."]

['I initially gave it 5 stars but I am really angry now.

When I received my sushi in a paper bag today, one container of soup already leaked inside the bag. Nevermind, I drank it right away. I brought back another container of soup. Reaching home, I discovered that this soup leaked so badly, wet and tore the paper bag, and also destroyed my documents beside the paper bag.

I remember previously they wrapped to protect soup. I met a lazy staff today. Bad luck.

Previous review:

Good food, nice staff. Happy to buy menu midi maki on a Saturday, 12.9‚Ç¨ for 18 pieces + 2 soup :)', 'Planet sushi is one of thr best place to eat sushi in Paris. It might be a chain but the freshness of the food is amazing. The menu contains a wide variety of food and the staff are amazingly nice and friendly. Make sure to try the chirashi tataki. Also menu available for lunch üòÅ', "This place is great because unlike every other Japanese place in Paris, they are open through lunch and into the evening. The fish was very fresh and the staff was very friendly. I can't recommend this place enough! Such a great value and a very chic setting.", 'Chirashi was very nice. Bit pricy but the unique style of sushi and make is excellent.', 'I ordered my food online with a short wait time for pick up.  It was ready when I walked in and the server was extremely polite, even though my French is not good.  I really appreciated that.  It is very intimidating to speak a language you don‚Äôt know well and feel terrible about slaughtering.  The food was packaged well and came with everything needed to enjoy it.  It smelled wonderful and tasted magnificent.  Definitely will order from there again .  Merci pour ce repas merveilleux!!!']

['The coffee was a good quality. The Wi-Fi work real well. The tables are positioned towards the windows in a very nice view. A very small coffee, see photo, was $6.80.', "Beautiful atmosphere, beautiful food, excellent service. A bit pricey but you get what you pay for. We'll be back again! üá∫üá∏üá´üá∑", 'I was starving and had been searching for a place to eat for quite a while as I walked through the Champs-√âlys√©es. This restaurant caught my eye, but I was immediately put off by the state of the menu ‚Äì sticky, with the laminate peeling off. We ordered espresso martini and a Porn Star martini. The espresso martini was borderline acceptable, while the Porn Star martini was overly sweet with a random mix of alcohols that completely missed the mark. You can even see it in the photo.

The bread was served in a wire basket without a cloth, which meant crumbs scattered everywhere each time we tried to break a piece. To make things worse, we weren't even given a plate to butter the bread, so the table ended up full of crumbs. The tartare was tasty but poorly prepared, with large chunks and a lot of chewy white membrane. The burger was decent, but overall, the experience was disappointing.

This place tries to be "fancy," but as soon as you start noticing the details, it becomes clear it's just another wannabe, outdated, and poorly managed restaurant. I regret spending my money here and wouldn't recommend it.', 'Le Berkeley is a delightful restaurant nestled in the heart of Paris, offering a sophisticated dining experience with a touch of charm. The menu features a wonderful selection of classic French dishes, beautifully presented and made with high-quality ingredients.

The atmosphere is both elegant and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a romantic dinner or a special occasion. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring that every guest feels welcomed and well taken care of.

Standout dishes include the tender duck confit and the rich coq au vin, both of which showcase traditional French flavors. Don‚Äôt miss their exquisite dessert selection, particularly the chocolate fondant, which is the perfect way to end your meal.

With its refined ambiance and exceptional cuisine, Le Berkeley is a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in authentic French dining.', 'üêÅ üê≠ Stay away from this place! . We do not recommend this place at all. Not only was the food not cooked well, but at the end of the meal there was a mouse running up and down the middle of the restaurant. Steak was chewy, raw and small. Veal was cold and didn‚Äôt taste well. The shrimp was not cooked like described. The service was not good either. They didn‚Äôt bother to apologize for the bad food and they acted like the mouse was a regular occurrence. Terrible!']

Adresse: 101 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√©, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We came here as it was one of the few places we found open on Christmas, and we were pleasantly surprised. We got two pastries as well as hot chocolate and they were all delicious! The hot chocolate was especially one of the best I had in paris. The service was good and the staff was very friendly - we had an easy time there inspite of a small language barrier. Overall, an amazing experience', 'We have just tasted two different types of eclairs which were eclairs with chocolate and eclair with coffee. Both of them were the most qualified eclairs I‚Äôve ever tasted which were mild in taste and definitely you feel like eating more and more. I can honestly say that I fell in love with this taste!', 'I got a TooGoodToGo from here and the woman serving made me feel very unwelcome. I don‚Äôt know what part of me she deemed unacceptable as she was more polite to the person in front of me. But to me she was very rude. In terms of the pastries, I would say they were okay but a bit dry and not worth paying full price for.', 'Beautiful place, the atmosphere is ravishing and refined. Loved it. The pastries I tried did unfortunately not move me. The opera and the roul√© noisettes were good, but somehow too creamy. Taste was masked by the  amout of cream.', 'To be fair, their desserts and hot chocolate are amazing. Unfortunately, the service doesn‚Äôt live up to the expectations. The desserts were served on a saucer instead of cake plate.']

['10/10, highly recommend. Finally found a place in Paris that is offering great value for money, all the dished were super delicious, waiters were very attentive and we never had to wait. Will be back for sure', 'Delicious and inspired modern Japanese food. Ambience is chill and jazzy music sets the mood to relax. A pleasant surprise in Paris. Note: don‚Äôt expect this to be a cheap meal. Around 70 euros to start at least.', 'Excellent Japanese restaurant ! The miso black cod is a must üáØüáµ .

üìåClassy restaurant, small portions of course

üìå Authentic Japanese food but expensive one . üìå To try : ginger beef, gyoza, and miso black cod are exceptional ü§≠
.
üìåPrices: Starters(13‚Ç¨-28‚Ç¨) Tempura (16‚Ç¨-34‚Ç¨) Fish(28‚Ç¨-36‚Ç¨) Meat(25‚Ç¨-36‚Ç¨) California sushis 6pcs ( 8‚Ç¨-30‚Ç¨) sashimi 8pcs ( 14‚Ç¨-38‚Ç¨)', 'Very trendy Japanese restaurant more inspire by fusion than tradition. Fresh food, great service but you‚Äôre going there more for the atmosphere. Also very expensive.', 'I was so craving sushi!!! But sometime it is hard to tell who has fresh fish... this place is wonderful. We sat at the sushi bar and it was just perfect! They have all kinds of sushi and hot plates as well. Toro was absolutely delicious... now I have a favorite sushi place in Paris!!']

['I didn‚Äôt like the veal and the menu choices are rather limited so I imagine I could‚Äôve chosen better. Very pricey for a restaurant that‚Äôs not Michelin starred. Beautiful setting though.', 'This restaurant is a WOW!  Everything is first class!  The wait staff are very friendly yet provided 5-star service.  We did the 6-course menu which was superb.  The elegant dining coupled with the beautiful surroundings made for an memorable evening in a city where there are so many options to dine.', "This Michelin star restaurant deserves its star! We tried the 3 course menu and the food was simply delicious üëå The venue is spacious and they have a nice outdoor area to enjoy a meal on the terrace or even play p√©tanque! Overall it's good value for money on the food but the drinks in general are really expensive!", 'Amazing service, amazing food. Perfect all around!', 'Lunch or dinner, just book this restaurant.

Very detail, wonderful experience, staff very passionate about dishes, we came on the day of landing from another half of the earth with very harsh jet lag, but felt pampered and loved.

My husband is very hard to pleased especially in French cuisine, not that he‚Äôs picky, just simply hate cream/milk/anything white. However, chef done a professional and excellent presentation on his dishes, I tasted, OMG it‚Äôs amazing. The blue lobster‚Äôs sauce (creamy bisque) is truly heavenly, I‚Äôm jealous.

Not gonna enclose all the loving details, a must have over and over again if you are nearby.']

Nom: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Reviews: ['The food and service were outstanding! My daughter has a severe allergy to peanuts and all nuts. Which is stressful when traveling to Paris. Our waitress was able to speak to us in English and she made sure everything my daughter ate was safe. It was our favorite place we went to while we were in Paris! The Parmesan crusted chicken and raspberry Bellini were delicious!!', 'Had a wonderful dinner.  The manager regularly checked on us, helped with wine selection, the staff was attentive, and the food was excellent.  Cannot wait to return.', 'As a daily patron of this culinary haven, my commitment to savoring every dish on the menu continues. Exploring the diverse menu of this restaurant, my culinary journey led me to the exquisite Steamed Shrimp Salad. The freshness of the shrimp combined with vibrant flavors left a lasting impression. Following that, I had the roasted turbot with herbs and beefTenderloin a culinary masterpiece that even I tried a single bite, though not my order, transported me to a taste bud paradise.\nTo conclude, the Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e dessert was a delightful finale‚Äîlight, delicious, and an absolute must-try. Each visit unfolds new layers of flavor, making it a place worth savoring.\nAnd see you Today üòä', 'This place was a big disappointment. Our waiter was phenomenal, but the problem was that they kept seating him tables. I counted that he had 10 tables at one time. I‚Äôm sorry, no matter how good of a server you are 10 tables will drown you. The staff did nothing to help him out until one of his tables he couldn‚Äôt get to in a timely matter walked out. The wait for food was awful. Other tables who ordered well after we did got their food before us. The food was super high priced, small portions for the price, & BLAND! The manager did comp 2 of our meals, but man taste your food. Giving me watered down mayo on my shrimp salad & think that‚Äôs good is ü§Ø. The food looks pretty, but it wasn‚Äôt tasty. Thank goodness our cocktails & wine were good.', 'This was truly a remarkable place. The atmosphere was great, the food was very good and the service was excellent. They really do provide great customer service. The host and servers strike up great conversation and service was fast']

["Absolutely divine experience at L'√©vasion! Indulged in the best pork chop of my life paired with truffle pasta and a superb glass of red wine recommended by the owner. We also loved the French pastry dessert called ¬´\xa0Paris Brest\xa0¬ª.  A true culinary escape", 'Absolutely delicious, food and wine. Excellent service. Went there on a Tuesday, not very busy. The parsnip pur√©e that came along side the pork tomahawk was possibly the most surprisingly delicious item all evening.', 'Staff is friendly and attentive. The food was delicious. The egg mayo is excellent. I still dream of the Paris-brest. As the french would say tr√®s bon.', 'The steak and scallops were cooked perfectly. The waiter paired the wines with our dinner choices and it was perfect.', 'Perfect place! I went there on the recommendation of my friend, and it fully met my expectations. Delicious food and wonderful wine!']

Adresse: 19 Pl. de la Madeleine, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
["If you love truffle then this is the place for you.

The aroma filled the restaurant as soon as you walk in

Out of the the pasta, pizza and rocket salad, the pasta was the best but everything else was still delicious

Service was super quick and very friendly.

Prices ain't cheap but worth the money.

You can't book online and they won't reply to emails. Best to call to make a reservation", 'Visited this place with my family and we had a very nice dinning experience. They propose elegant place and the atmosphere is very welcome and cosy. Book a table in advance since there are not many tables available.  You can choose either if you want black or white truffles.', 'So many delicious complex flavors in dishes featuring black truffles.  Duck confit was perfectly cooked, with tender meat inside and skin perfectly crisped.  Champagne and wine menu matches menu.  Staff speaks  English with ease and excellent attentive service.  Do make reservations.', 'Exceptional service, food and atmosphere. Highly recommend reservations, even for lunch.

We were seated in a corner booth with a full view of the restaurant. 2 plates of Fettucine Et Cr√®me √Ä La Truffe hit the spot. Followed by Cheesecake Saveur Truff√©e and Chocolote cake and couple glasses of Sancerre. We look forward to dining here very soon.

One slight disappointment - the reservations forms specially asks if you are celebrating an occasion. I added a simple request. While dining, I discreetly asked our waiter if he was aware, he said yes, but there was no effort made to act on my note. This was disappointing because why ask? Oh well, the food was fantastic!', 'Very nice place.
Specially for truffles. Every meal was fantastic.
The wine list is special for truffle.
We will come back.']

["Quickly served with a lovely menu that changes daily. It tasted fresh even though it was warmed up to serve. Nice size desserts to go with it and it all tastes great!

Only downside I would say is that it's a shame they use so much disposable plastic, I would think real cutlery and more sustainable dishes would be a big improvement!", 'Excellent menu. Large portions !
Friendly, speedy service every day.

Highly recommend', 'All fresh and organic, tasty, friendly.. i highly recommend !', 'Among all the restaurants available on this street, I gave Epicure a chance. What a regret...

I have never eaten something so bland, I was tempted by the superb description of the dish but it was infamous, slightly elaborate chicken food.

There was an aftertaste in the mouth, the uncooked seeds, it was annoying with each bite, hence my words.

I had two other people test the dish who confirmed my disgust, the dish ended up in the trash..

Nevertheless, the service is great, dynamic team and ready-made dishes available.

I still think that you offer good dishes but the one I chose absolutely deserves to be reworked.', "It's fresh, the prices are correct however the water is really not good, so yes, it must come from the tap but this is also the case in other establishments and it doesn't have that unpleasant taste ."]

Adresse: 36 Rue du Mont Thabor, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: ["Book ahead- this place is small and packed but well worth the wait! I had the 3 course souffle meal but have to admit it was super rich and there are also choices to have a non-souffle option instead for different courses. Every souffle was perfectly cooked, light and fluffy, intensely flavoured and generous on the booze for dessert! Service was fantastic - 'Must do' when in Paris!", "Honestly a pretty decent experience. Was my first time having a souffle and I don't particularly enjoy the texture. Way to much egg white for my taste, but I did get the appetizer, entre, and dessert souffle. Probably to much, I would suggest avoiding that entirely.", 'Dinner at Le Souffle last night was marvelous.  Everyone in my group loved the food.  I was especially appreciative of the chef as I have Celiac disease and the chef made some adjustments on my behalf.  You will not be disappointed eating at this restaurant.', 'It was a nice evening. I prefer a more cozy and dimly lit atmosphere for dinner.  It was quite bright and white walled. The food was nice. The soup and dessert delicious!!!', 'Delicious place to eat this speciality of the french cuisine. Their food is so amazing and tasty. The dishes are well served. Many excellent options on their menu! The service was polite and efficient. A must go when you‚Äôre visiting Paris.']

Adresse: 16 Pl. de la Madeleine, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
["On a hot summer day, a refreshing cocktail was definitely well received.

Despite some other negative reviews about lack of service and poor staff. I did not find anything negative to say. Staff were welcoming and service provided in minutes, although it being rather busy at lunch.

We tried both mojitos, the Florida, and strawberry.

Both of which were amazing. Despite being a little expensive. It's central Paris everything is expensive!

I'd rather pay a little more for a very good cocktail than less for one that is below average.

In all a very good little cafe and restaurant with no complaints from us.", 'We had a lovely Paris experience at Le Paris London today. The food was delicious. I had the special of the day which was a lovely steak with a pepper sauce and a divine dauphinase gratin. Hope had the salmon. The owner was welcoming and happy to assist us with our questions and the waitress was also friendly.', 'The bar/restaurant is very nice with indoor/outdoor seating options. They have a fairly large menu and a solid cocktails and drinks menu. The waiters are very friendly and keen on helping.
Nice spot for having a good drink and grabbing a bite.', "My friend and I spent a lovely afternoon at Le Paris London.  The food was great, extremely gracious staff and nice atmosphere.  Special shout out to our server, Talibe, for his magnificent attention to detail and kindness toward us that made it an exceptional experience we won't forget.  We will be back ", 'Had to wait for a long time to get seated, even though the restaurant was not full. Rude waiter making sarcastic jokes because we took a while to order. For the prices, I expected better service. Steer away.']

Nom: Bistrot du Sommelier Paris Philippe Faure-Brac
Reviews:
['Had a wonderful dinning experience here.
Greeted by the boss, M. Faure-Brac himself.
Ben and Maria were both very helpful too.

We tried the millesime menu with wine pairing.
Superb wine pairing with delicious food.
Enjoyed the whole dining experience.
Highly recommended!', 'Lovely restaurant with a fun and immersive concept. Our waiter did a great job with presenting the ‚ÄúDiscovery Menu‚Äù and leaving us to enjoy the wine and the pairing before revealing the wine. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who has a more adventurous side and willing to be open to taking delicious wines and incredible food.

They also have an a la carte menu for those less adventurous üòâ', 'This was the BEST dinner we had in Paris. The restaurant had a cozy atmosphere and the service was outstanding. Philippe the chef/sommelier/owner was there over looking all the details. The people dining there appeared to be locals, another testament to the quality of the place. We selected the set menu with wine pairings. He asked us what our like and dislikes were in order for select the dinner. Every selection he made for us was like he read our minds. The wine pairings were exceptional, he even gave us a second pour of one of our favorites. As good as dinner was, the highlight of the evening was when he gave us a personal tour of his wine cellar located under the restaurant. Wow, after many years of collecting, he had quite a cellar. Many coming with stories he shared with us. Thank you Philippe for a memorable evening in Paris', 'Le Bistrot Du Sommelier offers an exceptional dining experience, blending exquisite French wines with top-notch service. The atmosphere is intimate, with cozy seating that invites guests to relax and enjoy their meal. The staff, led by a highly knowledgeable sommelier, expertly curated wine pairings for each course. Their recommendations, including a Muscadet and a Bourgogne, were spot on, elevating the flavors of each dish.

The highlight of the meal began with an octopus appetizer‚Äîso fresh and perfectly cooked that it didn‚Äôt make it into the photos! The main courses, as seen in the photos, showcased fresh, high-quality ingredients prepared with precision. One standout dish featured beautifully tender cuts of meat served over a rich sauce and accompanied by earthy mushrooms and vegetables. Each bite reflected the chef‚Äôs commitment to market-fresh ingredients.

To cap off the evening, the chocolate pastry dessert was indulgent, balancing richness with a delicate finish. The meal ended with an incredibly thoughtful touch‚Äîthe staff, noticing the rain, insisted on escorting us to our cab with umbrellas, ensuring we left dry and smiling.

Recommended by the renowned Les Frenchies travel guides, Le Bistrot Du Sommelier lives up to its reputation as one of the best dining spots in the 8th Arrondissement near Champs-√âlys√©e. It‚Äôs a perfect choice for anyone seeking not just a meal but an unforgettable Parisian dining experience.', 'We dined out six nights while in Paris and this is by far the best restaurant we ate at. Dishes were prepared with passion and thoughtfully served. Each plate has its own story and the ingredients are coming from local farms. One can taste the difference. Love the place that serve Michelin star food and are not pretentious. Octopus for appetizer and Rose fish were amazing. This is a must stop for us in the future. Thank you. üôè']

Adresse: 15 Pl. de la Madeleine, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Elegant place in the middle of Paris. The tartare was outstanding and the wine good. Fair prices considering the location.', 'Amazing experience ! Had a great family lunch with amazing French wines !', 'Nice restaurant with nice design! I like the salad which the staff recommended.', 'Nice little restaurant right next to the church. The service is quite nice, but not the fastest, the food is quite good.', 'What a treat! After a bizarre weekend of terrible service and disappointing experiences even at places where I am a regular (I live here in paris‚Ä¶), we chanced upon √©cluse not only open but with wonderful live acoustic music. The service was particularly lovely, even when it was clearly our mistake in ordering the wrong thing, they happily changed it - with a smile! What a welcome respite on a chill afternoon in place de la Madeline. A perfect way to finish our outing for the day.']

Adresse: 8 Rue du Commandant Rivi√®re, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We were craving a quick breakfast and found this place near the Grand Palais. The staff were so friendly and the service was incredibly fast even for prime lunch hour. I absolutely recommend the mushrooms in any of the savory crepes. They were amazing!', 'The service was great once I was seated.  Since I stopped by at lunch time on a rainy day, the wait time was over 15 minutes.  I ordered the Mont Blanc for my savory galette and the Suzette for my dessert.  Both were authentic and served warm.  My server suggested to have cider and it was definitely a good complement to my meal.', 'Cozy place for a wide cr√™pes menu both sweet and savory. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Would recommend over street stalls as you can order drinks to accompany your order.', 'Very popular creperie in the 8th arrondissement. We were seated right away but sat in the basement, which was cute and quaint. I had the Danoise with smoked salmon. It was fresh and delicious. The sweet crepes were the favorite though - the Raphael (Nutella and Speculoos) and the Gigie (caramel and butter with vanilla cream).', 'We booked a table for 4 at 12:30 and arrived at 12:40. However, our table had already been given away. I would have understood if they had informed us that, due to our delay, we would need to vacate the table by 13:15 for a second service or if they had called to confirm our reservation. But giving the table away without any communication is simply unacceptable.']

['The food is average, coffee is good. The toilet room was dirty, no soap, no paper, but it‚Äôs not a cheap place)))
The cafe is located in a quiet street, among boutiques. At lunchtime they will let you in if you will eat. prices are high, service is ok', "It's not cheap, but you're eating in a caf√© in Paris in the stylish pedestrian street that has boutiques from Chanel and Dior, so just enjoy.  Food was pretty good, the steak tartare offered better value than the petit filet, which lived up to its billing.  Chips and salad good.  Service was efficient.", 'Place is nice but the food was terrible and expensive, 12‚Ç¨ for a plate of scrambled eggs that appeared to be soup with a small bread that was hard as a rock, the coffee was worst than instant coffee and it came from a machine not from an espresso machine which for 8‚Ç¨ is a scam.

The service is ok, nothing surprising just regular Paris service.

The place is in a nice spot but definitely not worth the price, you pay top money and get low quality.', "Awesome place with great food and pretty much the only place with good service we experienced in 3 days in paris. Chich and trendy decor, nested in a cute arcade between the Dior and Chanel store, Well thought out and presented dishes, encompassing a range of tastes and flavours from around the world. They were also very accommodating with our 4 year old and made a dish for her that wasn't on the menu. Not cheap but it is what it is.", 'Tucked in an alley next to Dior. Freshest seafood I‚Äôve had in Paris and this place has outdoor seating and indoor seating. We had Thai salad with prawns very fresh. We also had Brunch with smoked salmon with avocado salad also very fresh with the fluffiest scrambled eggs. The menu is simple with other salad options, rigatoni, artichoke salad, tuna tartare, beef tartare, club sandwich (looks yummy) and desserts. Service is professional and friendly. No cheese options though as I always want a plate of cheese while in Paris.']

['It‚Äôs been a while since I had such good Korean food in Paris (but to be fair I haven‚Äôt been back in a while) with so many Korean restaurants in town recently, I knew I had to try at least one of them, and I was not let down at all.

The dishes were all flavourful, the rice was fluffy and the soups were delicious!

My favourites were the fried chicken, the soybean paste soup and the grilled pork dishes !', 'Fantastic restaurant in a great location in Paris, super friendly staff and great food! I tried both the Kimchi Jigae (Kimchi Stew with Pork) and the Jeouyuk Bokkum (Stir fried spicy pork with kimchi and veggies) and they were one the best I ever tried! Absolutely recommend.', 'Nice discovery.
I live Korean food and it was delicious.
I will definitely come back whenever I am around', "I went to a Korean restaurant and I was a bit disappointed with the salty and plain taste of the food.
I'm sorry. I couldn't post a good review", 'We chanced upon this korean restaurant just downstairs our airbnb. The food is so so good! Definitely authentic taste of Korean food. We had the soodunbu (tofu soup) and tteokbokki. High recommended to come try their food. Service staff was friendly and they know French, English and Korean.']

['I‚Äôve been to this chain a few times in Richmond - London, but was my first time in Paris. I stopped by to grab some takeaway, the lady taking my order was lovely. She noticed I was pregnant so she helped me find several sushi option that would not be a problem for me to eat. Would def go back.', 'Not high quality but fair for the price of lunch box with carrot salad.', 'What a neat and very eclectic place. I went for an early birthday celebration on a Saturday night without reservations. We walked in and we were told it was about an hour wait for a table, but we were given the option to sit at the bar or at the counter by the kitchen. We chose to sit at the counter. What an awesome spot. Hands down this was one of the coolest experiences I have had at a tapas spot.', "I'm not sure about the one star BS. We went there a couple of times. Staff was friendly, food was good...\nYou need to order your food, they make it fresh. Pretty good selection.", 'Canceled my ToGoodToGo Order 20mins before. I was already on my way‚Ä¶']

Adresse: 3 Rue Saint-Philippe du Roule, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
["We had a wonderful dinner in this 1-star michelin restaurant. We chose the standard option, and as a main menu, I chose veal.

The meal began with an array of appetizers that showcased the chef's creativity and skill. Each dish was beautifully plated, with flavors that harmonized and delighted the palate. The main courses (veal) were equally stunning‚Äîperfectly cooked proteins paired with imaginative sides and sauces that elevated the experience to something truly extraordinary.

However, the dessert course was where the otherwise perfect evening faltered. While the presentation was impeccable, the flavors and textures didn‚Äôt quite match the high bar set by the preceding courses. The dessert lacked the complexity and balance I had come to expect throughout the meal, feeling a bit uninspired compared to the rest of the menu.

Despite this minor setback, it delivers an outstanding dining experience worthy of its Michelin star. It‚Äôs a destination I‚Äôd wholeheartedly recommend for anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure, though perhaps with slightly tempered expectations for the final course.", 'Great restaurant! We enjoyed the food, the atmosphere and the service. We took the 175 signature menu with dietary adjustments (pescatarians) and each dish was absolutely delicious. Definitely deserves a second Michelin star.', "I've eaten a lot of great meals ... this place went straight to the top of my list.  Enjoyed the tasting menu so much that I invited my sister to join me when she arrived in town a few days later.  What a treat.

Great wine pairing.  I enjoyed some unique wine excellently paired with the food.

Atmosphere 4 Stars - the dinning downstairs (3 extra tables).  I would do it again in a heart beat, but the tables upstairs are much nicer.  To their credit, as soon as a table oped up upstairs, they offered to move me in front of the window.  So nice of them.", 'Amazing! This is the word to describe this experience. When we arrived, the owner came to our table and with a big smile explained all the details of the menu to us. The menu changes every day, and normally you have tw options for starters, two options for main course and two options for the dessert. All the dishes we had were perfect! Drinks were also very good! Staff was very nice and kind all the time. We really enjoyed this place.', "Creative, unpretentious, delicious. High class service and setting with the social atmosphere of your favorite mom and pop restaurant.

The chef personally greeted me several times, invited me and others to sit and chat over wine, and clearly took pride in his work.

Made a reservation for 1 with little notice and had no issues.

There are hundreds of great restaurants in Paris, but you have to choose one. Stop looking and just go here, you won't find a better experience."]

["We loved these little grocery stores while in Paris.

They offer a decent selection of fruit and dried goods and refrigerated goods as well.

But best of all, is their salad bars. They had plenty of vegan options at the salad bars, which were all delicious.

Every so often while traveling you get sick of eating out and not having fresh food, that's when a little grocery store like this is handy.

5/5.

___________________

Follow me for more reviews, tips and photos!", "Franprix was a convenient walk away from the Hotel Castiglione and I appreciated such a wide selection of food products in a relatively small space. The staff were polite and helpful. Early closing times seem to be common in the area, but I found franprix to be convenient as long as I planned ahead.

They have a fresh orange juice machine if you want a very high quality juice, which made for a refreshing change to soft drinks and prepackaged juices. The fruits and vegetables are more than adequate.

I especially appreciated the laid back atmosphere; the place wasn't crowded. I felt as though I could take my time considering products in a language that I was unfamiliar with. That was important to me.", 'They do not greet at any time.  But the worst thing is that they say they open at 8:30 and it was 9:00 and it was closed.', 'I walked 30minutes because google said it would be open on Sunday!!!!!!! Does this look like open????????????', 'I go every day believe me one think nice place and there have every think what you want']

Adresse: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√©, 75008 Paris, France
Reviews:
['It's my mom's birthday, and we are in Paris, so we decided to try a Michelin ***. We did the lunch tasting menu. I'm not into fine dining, but Epicure did make me think twice.

Food - "Exquisite" is the word. Every dish looks like a beautiful abstract painting. Multiple layers of flavors unfold into a harmony when tasting each course. Admittedly, there were 1-2 courses that we didn't enjoy as much, but the others were almost heavenly.

Service - Out of the world. During the three hours, the staff team took the best care of us. Warm welcome upon entrance, gently serving and introducing each course, recommending wines, answering my many questions on ingredients, changing utensils between each course, cleaning and tidying up the table every other ~15mins... In short, they make you feel like you are the most important person during that 3h. Sounds cliche, but who doesn't want to be treated like a king/queen?

Idea - Jewel in the crown. Right off the bat, I figured the tasting menu was trying to tell a story, about walking by the seaside, tasting the treasures of sea, earth, and sky. It was beautiful.

It was expensive and extravagant, we might not do it again for a while. But it was a meal that we might remember for a while.', 'To even say it was a fantastic dinner would not even begin to explain this place.  It has the best service from the time you sit down to the time they call you a taxi.  From the wine pairings to the caviar, I have never had a better dinner.  The tasting menu is a walk-through culinary wonderland. I highly recommend and hope to go back when visiting Paris again.', 'After visiting three other Michelin starred restaurants in Paris i can most certainly say that Epicure is my nr 1. Every single dish was great and the service was beyond friendly and relaxed. The restaurant itself is beautiful as well. Wonderful expierience!', 'One of my favourite restaurants in the world with a great captaincy by Mr. Fr√©chon. The service is exquisite and delivers a personalized experience with spot on recommendations and explanations. The food is outstanding with a great balance of innovation, creativity and tradition. A great respect for the ingredients in their cooking techniques, combinations and presentation.', 'To breakup our run of Michelin dinners, we decided on a lunch that offered the same full dinner menu at Epicure. I figured that it would be a long lunch which turned out to be a four and half hour lunch. Yes, the longest lunch of our lives. And it was worth every single minute!

The restaurant inside Hotel Le Bristol is gorgeous. We were met with a beautiful arrangement of flowers and rugs of pinks and violets. The warm reddish tones continued into the dining room where we were greeted with warmth by the staff.

The food here was exceptional with not a single course veering off in excellence. It ranged from the signature caviar with potato mousseline smoked in haddock with buckwheat crips and sour cream dressing, full of umami to the perfectly cooked langoustine in lemon and thyme, onion mango and broth flavored with coriander and citrus fruits. The candele macaroni with black truffle, artichoke and foie gras filling in parmesan cheese, and black truffle juice reminded of a similar dish at Acquerello in San Francisco in visual appearance and ingredients.

Out of the entire lunch full of numerous courses, there were three highlights. The salmon from Scotland in powder of tandoori spices, fennel and cucumber with mint oil and rice vinegar was stunning. Simply, it was the best cooked salmon I‚Äôve ever had in my life so far. If salmon is this good in Scotland, I wonder what other types of seafood exists in Scotland‚Ä¶ Before this, the best salmon I had was from Alaska. The hen breast poached in a bladder was incredibly moist that it cut like butter and the green asparagus with morels that accompanied it in a wine reduction with crayfish and golden chanterelles with Xeres was incredible. I immediately had a flash back to the piece of chicken served at La Grenouille in NYC some 16 years ago which was the best I‚Äôve ever had until this dish.
