We wanted to get a nice last minute dinner and this place was absolutely perfect. We were most impressed by the wine list and the bartender that gave us his recommendations. He was incredibly knowledgeable and very passionate about his wine. It was too impressive! The dinner and desert itself was very nice on its own! It was quiet and slow for their dinner service that night, so we got to enjoy some great food and a little bit of peace. Also, the cut on the steak was perfect! Beautiful marbling and it came through on the flavor.', 'Absolutely fantastic dinner from the wine selection to the exemplary service food was bang on true French cuisine. Was my first time here and if I was a local it would be my weekly. Thank you to Jvlien and crew for making us feel at home.', "Very nice French bistro. The lunch was delicious and in case you got time for an extended lunch including a nice bottle of wine, don't forget to ask for the wine list. The choice of wonderful wines is as amazing as the dishes that get prepared in  that small kitchen.", 'Very good food at reasonable prices . The wine selection is just incredible. Super good value for money. We had a Volnay and the restaurant price was just 10% above retail price. So that‚Äôs rather unusual that you can have really exceptional wines at good prices . The food overall was very good , they have a short menu but everything is outstanding.']

['We loved this place! So glad we accidentally found it! Food was great, the wine was amazing and we felt like guests! Thank you for the advises, information about each dish, the various cheeses, salami - from which part of France they are coming ! This was atmosphere and attitude one cannot find anywhere! Greetings from Sofia :) ', 'This restaurant is in the passage, I come often for lunch. Really good Italian food! Strongly recommend.', '‚úÖÔ∏è Quick Service, qualitative food
üö´ Too quick ?
üí∞Meal + wine + coffee : 25‚Ç¨

Looking for a central place to lunch with an old friend, he gave rdv at Coinstot Vino.

Easy access, we are in the middle of the "Passage" very authentic.
The team is nice and feel "passionate"

The service was REALLY quick (like in 2 min). We can imagine they have the habit to deliver for the work people coming arround.

At first, it was really appreciable as we have been able to enjoy without rushing. But then, at the moment I've put my fork down for my last bite, someone was next to my face asking me if I was done üò≥

SO! It was FAST and you CANT complain about it to a restaurant in Paris, BUT that ruined a bit the exp√©rience as I felt rushed to finish

On the other hand, food was 8/10 ! With a menu changing EVERYDAY!', 'This place is wild. Like Paris from the '70s. Servers taking multiple orders, going to wrong tables, people standing "outside" smoking at their tables. Good wine list and decent pizza. The sauce is a bit mezze-mezze, but the dough is good and chewy. The mixed charcuterie plate is great.', 'Google suggested it as a wine bar, there is VINO in the name, and we ordered and agreed on a ‚Äòheavy‚Äô red wine. The wine was OK, drinkable, with no defects, but in a strangely small glass for a red wine in a wine bar, the glass was quite dirty outside, and the temperature was fridge cold ‚ùÑÔ∏èüòÄ
The service and waiter were very nice, though! ‚òÄÔ∏è And we get a bottle of water and two glasses, plus a ‚Äòtasting‚Äô quantity of wine extra.
It would be useful to learn about serving wines, otherwise it may be better to remove the listing as a wine bar, as it can mislead customers.']

Adresse: 46 Rue du Faubourg Montmartre, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews:
['nice small typical restaurant (2 floors for sit down).
you can see the people cooking and preparing the noodles they will serve you.
noodles are very good and meals very tasty!
the bowl is also a nice piece of dish as its very deep, so you have a nice quantity and more space on table as its less large than usual.

you should stop by and try, their price range is also quite fair !
very good quality for this price !', 'Good place for asian noodles in Paris. If you are craving for noodles, this is the place to be at.
Their food portion is huge, so you can consider sharing as well! Food prices are reasonable too.', 'A large and affordable menu.
Really good', 'We liked it very much! The duck and the noodles and the salad with the chicken was perfect!', "Just finished one of the most amazing meals I had at Les Pates Vivantes.

Service was great with an English speaking waiter, the food was out of this world. I mean, nothing like I ever tasted before.

I never had a hundred year egg, and it was so special (I don't even like cold food).

If I lived in Paris I'd eat here every day. For the same price I pay for lunch in Tel Aviv I can get world class food."]

['Super yummy foods. Every single thing was great. Very friendly staff. I‚Äôll go back to this restaurant on my next trip to Paris', 'Arrived on a late Friday evening. Wife and I had the tartare, (the largest) escargot (we‚Äôve seen), onion soup, and the bone marrow. We enjoyed each and every one. It was pleasant service and chill laid back vibe.', 'My favorite dessert in Paris !!! : flan a la louche .
Eggs cocotte with fois Gras and Creme and the duck with mashed potatoes and cheese .
Great service !!!!!!
I will definitely go back !!!!', 'One of the best dinners I had in a while! Fantastic classic French food with a very cool and inviting atmosphere. We were very lucky to get a table without reservation, but I recommend making one in advance. Really good service, friendly and fast. Escargot and Flan were the top hits for me, although everything we got was very good.', 'I ordered delicious ravioli. It came hot and cheesy.
The atmosphere isn‚Äôt that great.
Service was quick and nice.']

['This is a French restaurant you must try when in France. The atmosphere was nice, and the decor was beautifully arranged, but the tables were quite close together, and our seating was right next to another table, which made dining a bit uncomfortable. We ordered French onion soup, duck leg, and cod with mashed potatoes. We were very satisfied with the food, especially the onion soup, which was incredibly rich and flavorful! However, the bread served before the meal was a bit hard. If we come back, we‚Äôll definitely try other main courses!', 'We came here for lunch, and the food was fantastic!

Highly recommend the duck breast and the beef tartar, both were very well prepared! The tartar was well seasoned, and the duck breast was cooked to perfection!

Shout out to the staff at Regence - we were in a rush and only had one hour for lunch. The staff was able to server all food and drinks in under one hour! We enjoyed our French lunch very much and wished there was more time for us to have a dessert.

The entrees plus tips came to be around ‚Ç¨70. Ever reasonably priced in Paris!

Come and have a delicious meal!', 'The food was good‚Ä¶especially the cream br√ªl√©e is a must order for dessert. We sit out side,the atmosphere was great. Must say the staff are very nice and gentle. They are super busy, but never show attitude to  tourist even at the peak time. I‚Äôm appreciated it  and we had a lovely lunch time there before visit the museum. thank you!', 'Service is great, food is good, location is good.

We had onion soup (so so) and escargot (very nice) for entree and
Duck leg, duck breast, steak and tartar (so so)

Thanks for a good dinner', 'We visited twice and ordered the duck breast, duck leg, onion soup, and snails. Every dish was absolutely delicious, and we enjoyed it all so much! The service was also excellent. The staff speaks English very well, which made ordering easy and enjoyable. We came with our child, and the entire experience was perfect. Highly recommend!']

['The food and coffee were very good, but came cold because of the weather. I recommend you find a way to keep the dishes warm in winter! Moreover, the plates were not very clean. But the experience is a must! A great view to Louvre, atmosphere is 10/10 üëåüèª', 'This was very nice. We enjoyed our time here with the crystal pyramid to our front. We had a 2 yr baby and the server was very nice. It is a very beautiful place. Then we went to Louvre! Overall it was a very relaxing experience!', 'The receptionist was outstanding‚Äîwelcoming, attentive, and set the tone for an incredible experience. The service was quick and efficient, and the combination of amazing food and a stunning view made it truly memorable. Just a heads-up: a reservation is a must!

As for the food:
‚Ä¢	The burger was flavorful and cooked to perfection.
‚Ä¢	The pumpkin soup was on another level‚Äîrich and absolutely delicious.
‚Ä¢	The arrabbiata was beautifully balanced with just the right amount of spice.
‚Ä¢	The croque monsieur was hands-down one of the best I‚Äôve ever tasted.

The coffee was good‚Äîsimple and satisfying. Overall, an unforgettable visit that‚Äôs worth every bit of the hype!', 'I came here by myself and had a wonderful time. I sat outside with great views of the Louvre. The salad I had had the perfect amount of dressing. The pasta was good. The service was great!', 'Our first breakfast reservation during this Pari trip. What better than having breakfast with a view of the Louvre pyramid.

It was cold and our host gladly provided us with blankets to make us comfortable.

The scrambled eggs were made to PERFECTION, Soft, fluffy and cooked just enough to make them creamy.
The pastries and bread were amazing.']

['We ordered 5 tapes and a soba . The price is good and quality okay . It‚Äôs a bit oily and salty somehow . It‚Äôs can be good if it is less oily .

I also order a take out salmon roe on rice . It is fresh and large , enough for two meals.

I have not try the ramen or rice dish but I think they can be on point from what I saw.

It‚Äôs hard to find such a causal place to have a meal and catch up with friends. The bar chair is a little high and can be hard to sit on it . There are less than 8 tables available.

Overall it can be a good place to order take out .  A little overpriced on some appetizers such as the spinach and the pumpkin', 'The chicken was very bland, no flavor what so ever, the whole dish was bad. The unseasoned chicken flavor was overbearing. The miso souo was very tatsty, the salad was mediocre but the seasoning of it was nice. The cold tea was okey , it kind of has the sane taste as matcha', 'Food was good, except the beef tongue which was overcooked. Good service', 'A nice Japanese restaurant in rue Saint-Anne offering authentic Japanese tastes.

The decor is very simple and relaxing with  good lighting (not too bright and not too dim). They have an open floor kitchen with a bar where u can sit eat and watch the cooks

For starters we had Gyoza from the specialities, Miso soup, Kimuchi, Korokke and Sashimi, they came quick then rest of food followed we had:
Niku
Nabeyaki udon
Tendon
Shake engawa yaki

All the Items were on top, fresh, tasty and full of flavor.

The staff are very welcoming and friendly. The one who attended to our table was very knowledgeable of the menu and quite educating about the  food and how it is natively eaten.

I highly recommend', 'Naniwa-Ya Izakaya is a good place for having udon noodles and soba noodles. The best thing in this place is the beef tongue for sure. It was so so delicious and definitely would come back just for that. The service is very quick and friendly. Would reccomend this place overall and the line wasn‚Äôt so so long']

['What an amazing place! Me and my wife went to the place with very late notice to the Resturant and they did the outmost to served us unique plates and cocktails on time before the kitchen is closed. We stay up to 1.00 am and still there are people inside having fun and enjoying drinks/wine/cocktails.
I strongly recommend cucumber cocktail.
Thank you guys we made our anniversary very special!', 'I have been invited by a couple of colleagues for lunch today. Despite some of the negative comments here I found the place nice enough.
I had some ‚Äúfritto misto‚Äù, which is basically fried seafood, and a veggie lasagna.
4 hours later I was twisting in my chair as I had to go to the toilet. And I kept going to the toiled several times, multiple times per hour.
I called them to say that I just had food poisoning but the person on the phone kept repeating that it was not possible as their fish is traced etc etc.
That was my only meal and now it is almost midnight and my intestine is still twitching.
Word of advice? Avoid!', "Awesome experience. The food was delicious and very well presented (the veau is super delicious, the best I've ever tasted). The staff is very cool and friendly starting from the waitress arriving to the chef. And what about the environment? Super cool, this open patio in which you can eat outside also during the winter. What else I can say? Go there.", '5 stars service! It was amazing The cote de boeuf is fire! The service is amazing! Thank you Micka√´l and Lucas! If you‚Äôre in Paris you have to go there!!!', 'Nice place, a bit fancy with an awesome inner courtyard.

The food is good, the service is good, the wine is good. Portions are correct. But honestly this is too expensive for what it is.

Maybe not my thing.']

['Such a lovely and cozy restaurant. The staff was very kind and welcoming. The food was super good, I especially loved the bibimbap. I will be coming back üòä', 'Best Korean food I ever had! I had the pork dish, my friend the kimchi jjigae. I would have loved to order some makgeolli with the food but it was very pricey. I ended up trying Gangnam beer which was very good as well.', "When I visited Paris last year, I ate so much that I visited again. I think I ate there 3-4 times while traveling because I have kids! All the food was delicious, especially the chicken, although the number of pieces looked small, each piece was as big as a fist and was delicious. The owner was kind and the side dishes were so perfect that I didn't even think of Korea while traveling!", "Beautiful restaurant right in the heart of Paris. We were craving Korean food and found this place nearby. They have a wide selection of dish to choose from and everything was very delicious, the Bulgogi had to be my favorite. The servers were very friendly and the food didn't take long at all. A very pleasant experience overall.", 'We were on our way to Palais Garnier when it came to lunch time, after checking many restaurants we found this Korean restaurant and we decided to give a try! This spot is so cozy the main floor was full and We were seated on the second floor, the staff was so kind even we don‚Äôt speak French they were so patient taking our order, the food was so delicious ( we loved the chicken and raw beef) honestly to be in a touristy area the food is so good and the price is so reasonable. I recommend it!!!!!']

['Stopped in for a quick cafe cr√®me and received exceptional service. As an American, my French is not good, but one of the waiters was so kind to me and even taught me a few words to say! I‚Äôll never forget him!', 'Typical French Bistro, exist more than 100 years. Fresh and delicious food.\n\n+ Historical place, where famous French socialist Jean Jaur√®s was killed at 31.07.1914.', 'We are so lucky to discover this historic brasserie with such an excellent staff and food. The food is very good and the price also. We retired it for the very nice atmosphere. Thank you for the staff.', "I've mostly come here to watch big sporting events - they generally have a projector up so it's easy to view even if it's busy (it often is). Prices are OK but service can be long when it's busy.", 'Offered two drinks because I spilled them']

['We were looking for good pizza and this restaurant was recommended. We ordered two different pizzas and both were delicious! Not a crumb left. The wine was ok‚Ä¶nothing special but it went well with my goat cheese with honey and salad plate. The prices were slightly high for what you got but our food was good. We also orders macarons and chocolate mouse‚Ä¶the macarons were ok but the mouse was delicious! Service was good. Parking is hard to find‚Ä¶it‚Äôs better to walk if you can.', "I recently dined at Pizza Firenze and had a fantastic experience. The pizza was delicious, with a perfect crust and flavorful toppings. The grilled chicken was cooked to perfection, tender and juicy. To top off the meal, the cr√®me br√ªl√©e was amazing, with a rich and creamy custard topped with a perfectly caramelized sugar crust.

The atmosphere at Pizza Firenze was cozy and inviting, with friendly staff and great service. The prices were reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food.

Overall, I highly recommend Pizza Firenze to anyone looking for delicious pizza and great food. Whether you're craving pizza, grilled chicken, or a sweet treat like cr√®me br√ªl√©e, Pizza Firenze has something for everyone.", 'Pasta here is like pasta from a school canteen. Wont mind if the chef can add a bit more ingredients  or veg to the food. Straight plain food and it is not cheap at 15 euros a plate.', 'this restaurant surely is one of the best Italian restaurants. while walking upon a quiet street me and my family found this restaurant and decided to have dinner there. best decision ever. the food is amazing the service is very good and the atmosphere is also very cozy and nice. its very pact for a hidden place', "Went there last Friday evening. The service was pretty good and fast, however, the food was less impressive. The garlic bread had no garlic flavour at all. When I queried it, the waitress pointed out to me that it was clear there was garlic herb butter on it albeit didn't tasted it. In order not to get into argument and ruining my evening I let it go. When the main arrived which was veal, the meat was cold and tough. I pointed it out to them, they gladly took it back and a few minutes later another dish arrived and it was piping hot. Not sure what they did to it, a new cooked dish? Too soon for that; they microwaved it and new sauce poured over it? More likely. Furthermore the meat tastes even tougher. I relented."]

['Intimate dining with creative, flavorful food and exceptional service. Generous with beginning nibbles and non-alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages were also abundant and appealing. Pictured is the famous chocolate mousse dessert.', 'Excellent upscale version of Lyonnaise style cosine in a light and pretty historic restaurant.
This is an Alain Ducasse property and we had recently eaten at his one Michelin star restaurant Benoit and this was better overall. Food was equally delicious but the service and comfort were noticeable better.', 'Fine dining restaurant with original recipes from Lyon in a classic atmosphere. The place is a bit pricey but they are serving excellent food quality in a very well preserved place (all the furnitures feel originals and the decoration is matching).
The dishes we ordered were all delicious and the recommended wine was great too.
Their service is very good and efficient.
They have a small menu with not many choices, I guess it is to keep a good food quality and update it according to seasonal products.
Their dessert are very interesting because they mix unusual flavors.', 'This was a wonderful restaurant. The staff was wonderful and kind and the food was fantastic! This was the best food we had in all of Paris. Even the atmosphere was amazing. I highly recommend to anyone in Paris!', 'This is a dainty restaurant that serves decent and delicate dishes! The atmosphere is great, and the service is prefect. We‚Äôll definitely visit this restaurant again next time when we‚Äôre in Paris. Highly recommended!']

['Your ordinary Starbucks but with a marvelous decor. Marble columns, murals and chandeliers are beautiful. Also here was the first place I heard the cute french accent from a waitress trying go call my name, so it made a sweet memory for me to remember!', 'This is the Starbucks to come to for the scenery, it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful. I also found some things to buy that I hadn‚Äôt seen elsewhere. This is a lovely Starbucks to sit in for a brief time, it‚Äôs obviously very busy, they also have a restroom for customers.', 'Starbucks offers a great atmosphere with its classic high ceilings and cozy interior design that feels both modern and inviting. The spacious layout makes it a relaxing spot to enjoy a cup of coffee, whether you‚Äôre there to read, work, or socialize with friends. The gentle background music and welcoming vibe add to the charm, creating a perfect blend of comfort and productivity. Always a reliable choice for coffee lovers seeking a dependable and enjoyable environment!', 'Was very disappointed. Everyone there for the same reason I was, to see and have a coffee at the prettiest Starbucks in Paris. It was overloaded with people, line up was huge and you could smell the toilets before entering. Once inside I was grossed out and shocked. I saw people walking in and straight back out.
Looks pretty but hygiene was a let down.', 'You won‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs a coffee shop!
From the outside it doesn‚Äôt look so beautiful, but inside is amazing and like a trip to the past.

Really loved the place. I strongly recommend the pistachio barr, it‚Äôs just another level!

It‚Äôs a must go!']

Adresse: 42 Pl. du March√© Saint-Honor√©, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: ['A CA-TA-STROPHE!!!\nThe local kebab is better!\nTo flee from afar!!!', "Parisian prices for this Parisian terrace and this is its main fault. 10 euros for a cocktail, 5 euros for a coke. Still okay but the price of the dishes is exorbitant: 25 euros for the mushroom and truffle risotto (but I didn't taste the truffle) and 20 euros for the Caesar salad. Certainly well presented but it remains a salad. Everything is correct but it's still expensive for what it is.", 'Good value for money for lunch. 19‚Ç¨ main course/dessert. Nice for the neighborhood', 'Virgin mojito 8 balls with a mint leaf \U0001fae0', "Very unpleasant welcome. I didn't stay to check the dishes."]

['‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Teppanyaki Devant Vous in Paris is a fantastic dining experience! The chefs are incredibly skilled, preparing fresh, high-quality ingredients right before your eyes. The wagyu beef and shrimp were highlights, bursting with flavor. The atmosphere is inviting, and the staff are friendly and attentive. Perfect for a special night out. Highly recommend!', 'Great place with great food.', 'Always fun to visit a teppanyaki restaurant. Here you‚Äôll find friendly service combined with good food, freshly prepared and greatly cooked in front of you.
Choices of Sake are a bit limited.
Ensure to make a reservation', 'When we entered the restaurant it was pretty empty. The food was of very low quality. The fried rice was overpowered by pepper. Overall disappointing food and experience. Way overpriced in terms of quality and taste.', 'One of my favorite places in Paris. Been eating here for 20 years. Delicious and the owner does a great job!']

['Love the curry here! We had the butter chicken and paneer spinach curry, both tastes wonderful and I love how they season the curry as they aren‚Äôt salty at all. Great service and the toilets are very clean too!', "Very nice food in the middle of Opera. Stop here if you're craving for a taste of India in Paris!", 'The food & the staff here is Genuine & too good. We could not resist ourselves from visiting this place literally everyday during our 5 days stay in Paris.

Do meet the owner, Arvind bhai & Geeta bhabhi.

TOO GOOD! A MUST VISIT!!', 'I visited this place for lunch on a working day afternoon and the restaurant was full. I ordered the most comforting Dal soup and paneer tikka and stuffed paratha(not in the pic).
Will visit again for the soup and the warm hospitality.', 'I had an amazing experience at Gandhi Ji‚Äôs The food was exceptionally good, every dish was bursting with flavor. The service was top-notch, with the staff being attentive. What made our visit truly special was the owner, who went out of their way to interact with our kids, making them feel welcomed and entertained. It‚Äôs rare to find such a warm and family-friendly atmosphere. I will highly recommend it if you are visiting Paris to try this restaurant!']

['Beautifully refined French cooking with Japanese influences. There was a highly inventive use of various seafood. The wine list also broad and has a huge selection of Burgundy.', 'Now la Table 53, the chef delivers a refined and farm fresh dinner. The service is very professional yet not stuffy, staff was very friendly.
Highlights of our dinner were the oysters, the fish (barbot) and the lamb which was delightfully buttery.', 'Really delicious discovery menu with top service to match. Like the chicken and dessert. Wide selection of wines esp from burgundy.', "Truly exquisite.
Implacable and friendly service.
We have tried the discovery menu.
Wonderful experimentation of seasonal transition colours and tastes.
Every dish was unique and splendid.
For a person who is usually abrasive of non-meat dishes it was all very special and delicious. I was really surprised and delighted.
From the cold oyster and spinach to the warm chanterelle and monk fish, my heart was won.
The desserts were orgasmic and amazing. An incredible mixture of tastes masterfully executed.
A very intimate and small boutique venue atmosphere.

The only 'complaint' is the accessibility of the bathroom.", "Very intimate place with a minimalist French cuisine produced by a Japanese team. Everything's perfect even the plate... It's expanding with a gyoza place and a bar nearby. And the environment is so Parisian! A good address to bring your friends or partners from abroad."]

Nom: Caf√© Oz The Australian Bar Grands Boulevards
Reviews:
['Bottled Australian beer was expired, tasted moldy. Staff eventually agreed to provide a non-expired, normal tasting beer after some arguing. Makes me wonder how they treat their food.

Music was good, ambiance okay.

Overall, avoid.', "We had coffe in this place ..
It's okay , with condensable price .. over all not bad", "I just had entered the bar and a guy from the security literally took my jacket and my purse off my hands  and told me to follow him to the cloakroom, even though I needed to have my purse with me. The guy from the cloakroom then took my belongings and AFTER he told me that I have to pay 4‚Ç¨ . I kindly explained to him that I don't want to pay this money, it is my right to keep my jacket on me, but his answer was that since I gave him my stuff I had to pay. Since he wouldn't comply, I just asked for a refund of the entrance fee to leave the place. Denied again. I had to wait until the end of the night to get my stuff back. In other words I felt taken hostage with a crappy music playing, and the most arrogant and useless cloakroom worker ever. And if you really wanted to protect our stuff with this policy , since I read your responses to similar reviews,  you wouldn't first of all been taking them without our permission and you wouldn't charge for this 4‚Ç¨ , this is clearly something you do to just take more money from us , let's don't hide behind our finger üòâ
In no universe the cloakroom costs 4‚Ç¨, especially for a place like this .
Only good thing the  security guy that was kind enough to help us and speak with the guy in the cloakroom to let us take my things back.", 'What a joke of an Aussie place. As an Australian, I was embarrassed by the sham. No one in Australia drinks Fosters. They had VB, but no XXXX Golds. I was there for NYE, where they failed to do a NYE count down! Absolutely shocking. They also played no Australian music. Could have very easily played Flume, Empire of the Sun, Dom Dolla or even Down Under (Luuude) - but Katy Perry triumphed. NYE there was my most disappointing experience in Paris. I only went since there aren‚Äôt actually any fireworks at the Eiffel Tower. Another sham.

Okay, one positive - They did have Bundaberg Gingerbeer.', 'Amazing place. Great vibe, food and drinks üòç']

["I liked the open kitchen where the lady was making dumplings. It seems that the restaurant is owned and operated by an elderly couple, who were very nice.

We ordered various dishes. Among those, I liked the Yangzhou fried rice. The dumplings were not good; I just couldn't understand why they were sweet. The Sichuan spicy fried chicken was also not spicy, but sweet. We arrived one hour before closing time, so maybe they were tired and provided subpar dishes. At least, that‚Äôs what I want to believe.", 'Such a sweet couple and staff, we ordered the XLB, seabass and greenbeans. Our favorite was the XLB, so juicy and chewy. The fish was fresh and tender and green beans were great to snack on!', 'Food was GREAT üëç. The owners are very friendly and nice. When we asked for the best route to the Effie tower, they help us and provided several different routes.

Eat here and I‚Äôm pretty sure they (both food and service) won‚Äôt let you down! üòá

The plates are beautiful too! (Near the opera so you can come here easily )', 'Ordered pork soup (with bamboo and tofu skins) and rice to go. This was the best plain white rice at a Chinese restaurant ever, even in the best Chinese restaurants in the states, moist and sticky, almost as if they used sushi short/medium grain. The soup tasted great, good flavor as it was freshly made, downside is that it was so freshly made that the pork ribs did not have enough time to simmer. I would come back to try the other stuffs. Seems like a small business, family owned and operated.', 'Best xiao long bao anywhere you go. This is truly xiao long bao heaven. We ordered three different kinds, pork, pork w crab meat, black truffle. All good and distinctly different. The other dishes were just okay. If you are not a fan of xiao long bao, it may not be your best choice of Chinese restaurant. But we are, and we are very happy']

['Food was good, drinks was well balanced. The ambiance is great to hangout. The first server that served us was rude, other than that everything else was ok. To access this restaurant you have to go through the hotel‚Äôs entrance.', 'Great food. Went for our 1 year anniversary and they surprised us with a special dessert. Make reservations.', 'Terribly disappointing breakfast experience. Please help me understand how the 2 pancakes on the plate equal the ala carte menu description for ‚Ç¨15!? Orange granola pancakes where? It took 10 minutes for anyone to bother to take my order. Manager insisted it was correct and took the price of the coffee off the bill... really?! And empty coffee cup most of the time (only one refill) Tres mal. Don‚Äôt bother with this place unless you want to fork out the ‚Ç¨39 for the buffet where you can be your own server.', 'The pictures of this restaurant are deceiving- they don‚Äôt have indoor seating as the pictures posted by them where there make it seem they have indoor seating with purple seats. I did reservations for my bday at this place hoping they were honest about advertising but when I arrived they just had outdoor seating‚Ä¶ you can imagine my disappointment!! I was dressed elegantly for a night at a indoor seating restaurant and I came there to find a outdoor informal terrace!!!! They didn‚Äôt even excuse themselves for the false photos!', "Funny thing a server at a 4 star hotel can't speak English in a operational level what a shame. We ordered something we got something elce when we tied to explain that just avoided my wife a completely waste of time. Congratulations on your horrible service  Bravo"]

Adresse: 13 Rue des Petits Champs, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews:
['It was wonderful experience for which was to be good food and service. Also, as korean, it is so comfortable to support br korean employee to order. He has good expertise for wine.', 'Willi‚Äôs Wine Bar in Paris is never a disappointment. We sat at the bar and ordered some wine, cheese course, and I got the quail. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The limited edition art posters that they make each year are very cool.', "We came here for an early lunch. We got 2 wines, the lunch set which comes with main and appetizer and a plate of meats to share. We finished it off with a lemon tart and an espresso.

The fish here was so succulent and nice. It was shocking how good it was. I would definitely get this again

The cold tomato soup was really refreshing and addictively delicious. I would get this again.

The meat plate was okay - it went well with the wine but not my top pick.

Lemon tart - the crust was too thick. But it wasn't too sweet. It was nice and tarte.

Overall I really enjoyed the ambiance of this restaurant. It was very laid back. The servers were nice and super accomodating. The food was good but definitely on the pricier side. I would recommend for lunch", 'Superb wine and cheese. Really wonderful rhone by the glass. Briefly met Mark who is incredibly welcoming. Highly recommend and easily became a favorite wine bar in Paris. Will return on all future trips. Also, thank you to Arthur who provided great recommendations and we really enjoyed speaking with', "Very neat wine bar with a large selection. The service started off great but once we had our wine poured, we didn't see our server again for a very long time. Cheese plate was quality."]

['The restaurant was cosy with nice decorations. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. However, the food was not as good as expected. My friend and I ordered escargot and onion soup as starter. Escargot was not made in the traditional way with the green butter but a stir-fried dish with mushroom. It tasted weird. The onion soup was a scammer for that price. The stewed beef was bitter due to the thick overcooked wine sauce. The vegetables and beef tasted plain. I had a hard time trying to finish the dish. My friend‚Äôs burger was okay. The dessert was good though. Overall, it was not a pleasant dining experience for us mainly because of the food quality.', 'We had a pleasure having dinner at Le Mesturet. The owners and staff are very friendly and make you feel welcomed. The food was delicious and the menu has rare French dishes that you would not find at most other places. The interior design is unique and makes the whole experience even more authentic. I definitely recommend this place especially for tourists that are struggling to find a good local restaurant.', "Came here by myself on a rainy Saturday evening at the end of a business trip to find a touch of traditional food.  They were very busy, but took care of me and gave me a nice table at the window near the bar.  The service was very kind and attentive.  They helped me through the menu and service since my French is non-existent.

The food was very delicious and authentic.  I had the burgundy snail casserole as a starter, which was warm and earthy and wonderful. As a main the sausage and smoked pork with lentils was flavorful and filling.   And for desert ice cream with profiteroles in chocolate syrup.  Top notch for every course.

Wonderful cozy atmosphere.  The place was vibrant and busy but also provided a nice relaxing vibe.  Can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff too.  Magnifique! Highly recommend this place!", 'This place is a must do in Paris.
We were served by Mohamed and his recommendations were spot on! He recommended the eggplant and goat cheese and it was a killer. We had veal and beef strip loin. So tender and juicy.
The wine was also on point. Had a classic pinot noir from bourgogne. So good!

Highly recommend.', 'Service was top-notch, and there‚Äôs plenty of seating. The food was okay, not amazing, but you get a lot on your plate ‚Äì we left super stuffed. The Paris Brest was the highlight, though the caramel drizzle made it pretty sweet. Wine by the glass is on the pricey side.']

['I had an excellent stay at Georgette! The staff were super friendly and accommodating. The superior room was clean and had everything I needed, and staff were quickly able to get me extras I asked for. Excellent location\nHighly recommended.', 'The hotel is recently renovated, really nice, tidy, exceptionally well designed interior, great hotel staff. Excellent bathroom, big towels and useful amenities. The rooms are extremely comfortable. The only little thing is the noise inside the hotel in the morning when guests are leaving and staff is cleaning the rooms. But in comparison to all the rest of the facilities, I can tolerate this. Will definitely come again. Location is great for my needs, vibrant night life around but not in the close vicinity of the hotel. Noise from the street disappeared around midnight. In all fronts the hotel was beyond the expectations', 'If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant with rooms above , that‚Äôs the place for you. Hotel Georgette is not a typical 4 star hotel with breakfast  Tracklin and bars, but with a restaurant where you can order a coffee juice omelette or cereal. A very nice gentleman welcomed me in the evening showed me around and helped with every request. and in the morning greeted me the lovely ladies at the front desk. The ‚≠êÔ∏è night bathroom with its technology was the perfect atmosphere for the end of the day.', 'Hotel in an excellent location, the rooms are very clean and very beautiful, there is a boutique atmosphere.  There is a restaurant under the hotel, but regardless, in the whole area there are many shops, restaurants, cafes and bars.  There are 2 metro stations nearby (the closest is about a 5 minute walk) The staff was very nice and helped with what was needed.   Had a great time!', 'My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Georgette in October and love it! All of the staff were kind and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, and the location was really great! Highly recommend a visit here!']

['We had a fantastic dining experience at Comptoir de la Gastronomie in Paris! It was our first time visiting, and we were excited to try some classic French dishes.

I had the frog legs (my first time), and they were absolutely delicious‚Äîcrispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I also tried the duck shepherd‚Äôs pie, which was nothing short of outstanding. The rich flavors of the duck paired perfectly with the comforting, hearty filling.

My husband enjoyed the French onion soup, which he described as the cheesiest he‚Äôs ever had‚Äîdefinitely a standout! He also tried the bone marrow, which he loved for its rich, indulgent flavor.

The staff was incredibly friendly and courteous, and it was a nice surprise that they all spoke English, making our experience even more enjoyable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a cozy spot to enjoy some classic French dishes with excellent service, Comptoir de la Gastronomie is definitely worth a visit.', 'I love this place I will definitely come back. Service was amazing. The food was delicious. Food head and the Doug gras ravioli were incredible but so was the French onion soup and the bone marrow. I would really have steak here but all French was great. Also had very good French wine. I wouldn‚Äôt have the frog legs here it was good but not amazing', 'The services are really great.

They provide a huge variety of France signature dishes. Yet, I do believe you can find some which worth the waits.

We have waited for like 20 minutes even we booked the table in advanced.', 'You should definitely book in advance!
Although we were lucky to pop in for lunch without a reservation and were seated outside (weather was great so no issue there).
Great service, food is highest quality, local french food just want we wanted!
Mains were big, so we shared 2 starters and 1 main, for 2 of us it was enough.
Next time we will come back for dinner!
Thank you!', 'Traditional French cuisine in a laid back environment. Service was really great from the moment we sat down. Our server and runner were both excellent.

We were a group of 5 so we really tried a variety of the menu. Standout item for a few of us was the Duck. You‚Äôve probably had it elsewhere in Paris as it‚Äôs a staple dish in most restaurants. I would say the Duck here was the best one I had in Paris. Fairly generous in portion and cooked to perfection. Only note to add is that they could use more sauce on the duck.
The Foie gras ravioli was a bit too heavy for me and it‚Äôs not traditional ravioli but more foie gras and long lengthy pasta noodle.
We would not recommend the cod fish pasta/risotto which was just underwhelming.
Highly recommend their desserts especially the chocolate brioche cake. That was the best dessert out of the ones they offered.']

Adresse: 16 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: ['We had our Christmas Day meal here and what a fabulous place! We had a lovely evening! I do have to say the oysters were a let down - almost zero meat, was definitely not an oyster that should have been served really. But everything else was great!', "The Art Deco building is fantastic and the food delicious but reasonably priced. Make sure to come early, so you don't have to wait in line for too long. PS: If you are noise sensitive this is not the place for you, the restaurant is one big hall. We didn't mind that much, though.", "Loved it here. I was late due to New Year's traffic, but they sat me immediately, even though it was packed. The food is wonderful for the price point, and I highly recommend it. My creme brulee was a bit eggy tasting, but overall, I am quite happy and would return.", 'This restaurant boasts a rich history and offers a charming ambiance, making it an ideal spot to experience traditional French cuisine. While the flavors may not be extraordinary, the inviting atmosphere more than compensates. Its greatest asset is the exceptionally fair pricing, making it well worth a visit overall.', 'Absolutely loved this place! The interior is simply incredible, a real atmosphere of luxurious Paris. I really liked the duck leg, it was magnificent. Tender and juicy, the meat just melted. I recommend everyone to visit, but be sure to book, especially in the evening.']

['Honestly, the hotel room we stayed in as well as the hotel corridors are in a state of disrepair that definitely requires renovation.

On the other hand, the staff is very friendly and ready to help as much as possible, so big praise for them.

The hotel is located near the stations of all types of public transport, and you can also visit some attractions on foot. The breakfast on the first day was plentiful, but on the other days certain foods were missing and they were replenished slowly.

The breakfast is not consistent in terms of quantity, so I definitely recommend that you go for it as early as possible.', 'Very nice hotel and good value for money.
The location is great, the rooms are quiet at night and a good size, the room itself was clean but there was a bit of mould in the bathroom walls which look like wallpaper to copy wood? That was a bit strange, I thought they were stains but when I touched it came off, so that was a bit disappointing.

Other than that everything else was great, breakfast with good range of options and staff very friendly. Would come back and recommend :)', 'They steal from the rooms. The worst hotel.

We stayed at this hotel and, on the very first day of our stay, experienced theft. While we were away, someone from the staff entered our room and stole all the money from our wallets. We are absolutely certain that this happened at the hotel, as the money was safe before, and our belongings were left unattended only in our room.

I strongly DO NOT RECOMMEND this hotel if you want to keep your belongings safe.

I would also like to warn future guests to be cautious of the manager‚Äôs potential response, which will likely claim that this situation is fabricated and deny the theft. This was an extremely negative experience. Avoid this hotel if you don‚Äôt want to ruin your trip.', "This is a budget hotel so don't expect high end decor, but this is without any doubt the most friendly and welcoming hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are exceptional. The hotel is clean, has the most comfortable beds and our bedroom and bathroom was spacious. The location is approximately 5 minutes walk from Gare de l'est so perfect for travel links. 'Happy corner' with it's free refreshments is something significantly more expensive hotels could learn a lot from! We (mother and 18 year old daughter) were totally satisfied with our stay.", 'The room was ok, perfect for 3 people but the tile was broken on the bathroom (more Asthetics) the cleaning lady always forgot something, it would be good if they check before leaving the room to make sure towels are left clean, paper towel is left and soaps are being refill. Front desk people were always kind and helpful to them 1000% great customer service at front desk.
Breakfast was decent, workers always trying to refill and put utensils since it was always busy. Overall good stay for the price and location']

['5 star dinner for sure! Really welcoming staff that helped to translate the menu and explained everything needed. Wood was really really good and the beef wellington is a must! We tried different kind of starters and that was a right decision. Nice selection of wines aswell to pair with every food. One of the best service we received during our trip in Paris. Definitely recommend to have a dinner here!', 'The leek and anchovy appetisers were carefully crafted with complex flavors. The leek especially was wonderful and I definitely recommend it. The carrot entree was a great recommendation from our waiter. Unfortunately the chicken main dish was a bit bland and lacked much variety in texture. The apple tartine was also a bit too burnt for my taste.', 'L‚ÄôOffice, led by Charles Nikitits, is a gem in Paris‚Äôs 9th arrondissement. It stands out with its fresh, seasonal produce and a menu that showcases Chef Charley Breuvart‚Äôs passion for seafood. Each dish, from inventive starters to sublime desserts like the deconstructed chocolate tart, is a culinary delight. The atmosphere is inviting, making dining here a joyous occasion. A must-visit for exceptional dining in Paris.', 'Enter a warmly welcoming restaurant environment, where each dish unfolds like a symphony of colors and flavors. The great service adds an additional layer of refinement to the overall dining experience.', 'An absolutely outstanding choice. Extraordinary seasonal menu, with wonderful produce and preparation, affordable prices, and friendly, thoughtful and warm service that is truly extraordinary. I will be back, and you will be too. A very easy must try for every visit to Paris.']

['Best restaurant in Paris I‚Äôve been so far! We had our Christmas lunch there and we had a great time. Typical dishes, both of pork and fish were delightful. Will definitely come back!!!', 'Exquisite and lovely Parisian dinner. The focus on quality products and service was exceptional. Glad that my friend recommended this place so that we could enjoy the French attention to food and service in a very established restaurant. Will definitely visit again the next time in Paris. Thank you to the team for the experience.', '‚ÄúA Culinary Delight in Paris!‚Äù
Le Pied de Cochon is a true gem for anyone who appreciates excellent food and impeccable service. The dishes are a perfect blend of tradition and flavor, crafted with high-quality ingredients and presented beautifully. Every bite is a celebration of French cuisine, from the classic onion soup to the succulent pork specialties. The atmosphere is warm and lively, making it a perfect spot for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Paris‚Äîthis place is a must-try! Bravo to the team!', 'I think this is one of the traditional french restaurants with a cozy decoration.
The onion soup is wonderful, the sweetness from the onion and the soup is not salty.
The mussel pot tastes brilliant. A simple way to cook lights up the freshness of the mussel.
The sea bass is surprisingly well. Crunchy skin with a moist fish meat.', 'Famous in Mexico City and of course in Paris, this French restaurant makes the most amazing pork dishes. I had the Pork Tenderloin in Morel Mushroom Sauce with the Potato Au gratin which was incredible! We also had the escargot and loved them too. Friendly service and great location just a 10 minute walk north of the Louvre Museum.']

['Fantastic experience for lunch. Everything was great, the service was attentive, fast, but without become a bother. The food was inventive and delicious. The house is perhaps nothing special, except for the historical significance. All in all, a fantastic experience for the 48‚Ç¨ it costs for the lunch.', 'We visited Auberge Nicolas Flamel for New Year‚Äôs Eve and opted for the five-course menu. The food was delicious, and the number of courses was perfectly sufficient to make for a satisfying dining experience. The service was also attentive and professional.

However, there were a couple of downsides that we‚Äôd like to point out. Firstly, the dining room was quite cold, and there was an uncomfortable draft around our feet, which made it hard to fully relax and enjoy the evening.

Secondly, there is no drinks menu available, which means you have no way of knowing the prices for beverages beforehand. We ordered tea, which was served in a teapot for two cups, but by the time it was poured, it was almost cold‚Äîlikely due to how long it steeped before being served. When we asked for a fresh pot, the same issue occurred, and the tea was brought back lukewarm. To make matters worse, we were charged ‚Ç¨36 for just four cups of tea (‚Ç¨9 per cup). If you‚Äôre going to charge that much for tea, it should at least be served hot. It felt very odd and disappointing to drink cold tea at such a fine restaurant.

Overall, while we enjoyed the food and the service, these issues with the drinks and temperature left us with mixed feelings about the experience.', "This establishment is a compact yet elegant dining venue, where every dish is a delightful revelation. As you savor each bite, you can discern the chef's myriad creative concepts in dish preparation, skillfully blending diverse flavors and textures on the plate. The culinary presentation is not only visually pleasing but also intricately nuanced in taste. The entire team demonstrates exceptional professionalism and warmth, making dining in this historic edifice a truly gratifying experience.", 'Wife and I went there on a Wednesday night expecting a great meal and it truly exceeded our expectations.  Their new chef seems to be settling in nicely.  As excellent as the food offerings were, the service and sommelier were more so. The service was relaxed, gracious, and attentive.  The wines pairings were outstanding. Many wines I‚Äôd never had tried before.  Overall, the best culinary experience I‚Äôve ever had.', "Amazing experience. The food and service were unlike anything I've ever experienced! Incredibly attentive and accommodating staff. We were given a small history of the house as well as a very through description of the wonderful food. They accommodated my husband's vegetarian diet and it was equally as delicious as everything else and the bartender made us some amazing Mocktails. Best experience at a restaurant we've ever had in all of Paris"]

['A nice and cozy restaurant which serves a 5-course degustation menu. Service is fantastic. Staff is super friendly and very knowledgeable. A delight to have a conversation with about food and wine in general. Food is quite unique. There is depth and sophistication in the taste of each course. Combining the sauces they elevate the flavours to a new level. The pork dish is not my favourite though. The desert or our meal is all corn based and was a delight. I don‚Äôt mind a Michelin starred restaurant with industrial style metal top tables and without table cloths; but on a very hot 36 degree day it was just way too hot inside.', 'If one is eating their way thru the city then this is a great spot to stop by. Situated on Rue de Nil this bustling street is a food lovers paradise with various artisanal vendors from seafood, deli, cheese, specialty coffees etc. Nearby is Plaq chocolate in which I believe the restaurant has some form of collaboration with as they offer their chocolates at the end of the evening.

My group of 4 and I enjoyed a lovely evening. As this micro restaurants ambience is quite intimate, it combines a bit of laid back feel with a touch of French elegance. One doesn‚Äôt feel so pressured or out of place. They feature a small partially open kitchen usually with only 4 chefs per night. Service was great and worthy of a Michelin star. Staff were knowledgeable and proactive of the menu and attentive to our needs. They also have wine pairing, decent selection of wines, and also wines by the glass.

The menu changes with the seasons so our group began with amuse bouche an array of tartlets. We found the tartlets quite tasty a perfect way to open up our palates for the evening. Their sourdough bread is amazing and is sourced from a bakery but I forget the name. Then we moved onto a scallop tartine and a ravioli in which I opted for the truffle add on. I did find the truffle add on not really worth it. It didn‚Äôt bring out the flavor of the dish nor was it fragrant. Since we are a group of 5, we collectively all found the Main protein dishes underwhelming which were a   szechuan pepper inspired monkfish with overly salty kale and a grilled chicken dish. While I do find the Szechuan pepper monkfish a bit more creative, the chicken dish was just not good. Finally, we ended the evening with desserts. Presentation of the desserts were very colorful and we honestly loved it. It featured a carrot pudding and cookie based chocolate dessert.

All in all service was Great but the main dishes were underwhelming. I do believe the menu changes frequently so I will say it‚Äôs Michelin worthy just dependent on the menu.', 'Wine pairing was very enjoyable. Scallops were very good. Monk fish was the most memorable.', 'A gastronomic treat! As requested, we left our stomachs in the hands of Chef and he did not disappoint.  From the amuse bouche to the end of meal treats our tastebuds were taken on a journey of amazing flavors and textures. I highly recommend Frencie!', "I would highly recommend this spot to any foodies in the area, every dish they served was so delicious, the servers were amazing, and the ambiance was stunning!!! We also got the wine paring with our meal which was a fun way to try some wines from the area! Even if you can't get a reservation I'd recommend going to their cute wine bar across the street!!!"]

['Every time our feet touch down in Paris, they take us right to Le 404.  The food is the star, but the ambiance and service take us right into a Moroccan fantasy!

Get the mint tea to start and finish, the 7 vegetable couscous is my fav, my kids and hubby gobble up the Moroccan meatballs and we always, ALWAYS, end with the oranges for dessert.  Trust me it is not as simple as it sounds.

We have been going for years and it just never disappoints.', 'Paris is a great place to eat North African food, and this restaurant serves excellent Moroccan food in a cosy and comfortable setting. They serve the tagine in an authentic clay bowl, and that was my favourite dish of the meal. The grilled meat was delicious too!', 'This restaurant features an enchanting ambience, welcoming staff, and exquisite homemade Moroccan food that is out of this world!  It was so nice to see chef make the rounds of the tables to meet clients and to make sure that they were satisfied. It was the best dining experience we had during our month-long trip in France.
Merci !', 'Authentic Moroccan food, everything we ordered is delicious. Very friendly staff and very nice restaurant
Highly recommended', 'The food is great and the vibe is cool. But they make each person at the table order a full entree which is stupid. My friends and I wanted to share an appetizer and a plate. The place is also SO SMALL so we were stepping over people and pushing their chairs out of the way to get into our table and to the bathroom.']

["I recently visited Andy Wahloo for drinks with friends, and overall, it was a great experience. The ambiance is fantastic, with top-notch music that sets the mood‚Äîthough it could have been slightly less loud to make conversations easier, especially since it's a bar and not a pub.

The outdoor setting is lovely, providing a relaxed and stylish vibe. The waitstaff were incredibly friendly and attentive, adding to the positive experience. However, the coat check attendant at the entrance was a bit peculiar‚ÄîI couldn't quite tell if he was being overly friendly or slightly rude, but it stood out.

While I can't confidently comment on whether the prices are expensive or reasonable due to limited experience in this area, the lack of Prosecco on the menu was a slight disappointment.

Despite this, I‚Äôll certainly be coming back for the ambiance and the welcoming vibe. A solid spot for a night out with friends!", 'What a threat!  Drink menu is super inclusive, lots of options and cocktails are spectacular.  Ambiance is cozy, seating is super comfortable, music is on point and the dancefloor is really cool. (yes it has a dancefloor).  Service is on point.  Highly recommended. (They have a coat check).', 'A quaint cocktail bar with a unique and creative menu. The bartender was extremely hospitable and concocted a delicious coffee based cocktail upon request that was off-menu. Would definitely recommend visiting more than once to try through their menu. Sampled a couple different cocktails and was not disappointed with any. Pricing is fair, about the same with most other cocktail bars, and the atmosphere is quite classy and cozy.', "A very pretty courtyard that offers a peaceful and intimate setting, which is already a very good point considering the hustle and bustle of the surrounding streets. The cocktails were quite surprising, even a bit disorienting I must admit as I wasn't expecting something so visually simple. Once tasted, the flavors are subtle and balanced. The staff was friendly and welcoming.", 'Kaled and it‚Äôs team delivered a top service. Cocktails were perfect and you can dance too!! Super recommended!']

Adresse: 34-36 Bd de Bonne Nouvelle, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Wendy, awesome. Food, outstanding. The burgers were cooked to a perfect medium rare. The Burrata was fresh and delicious. The prices surprisingly reasonable. Great decor and ambiance. Will return. Hope y‚Äôall enjoy ü§©', '5 star goes to the lady (blonde) who is in charge of outside part service. We did not have reservation but she gave us a good table. She serves all the food by smiling face. Foods are ok but the service increase the taste of the foods and make it perfect.', 'We liked everything, the atmosphere, the drinks, the food and the prices. So highly recommended!', 'My fianc√© and I stopped off at Delaville on a whim, as we were out and about in Paris on a Saturday night. Unfortunately, the experience was a bit of a mixed bag.

First of all, it‚Äôs worth noting just how close together all of the tables are and how loud the restaurant is - we were shouting to hear eachother. It‚Äôs safe to say, in terms of atmosphere, it was definitely not my favourite.

We got started with the tempura prawns, which were actively bad. They were soggy and deflated on the outside and weirdly full of fluid when you bit into them - I really disliked these and do not recommend them at all.

For the main course, I went for the ribeye (entrec√¥te) steak with b√©arnaise sauce and gratin dauphinois as the side. This was just absolutely gorgeous. The steak was perfectly cooked and melted in the mouth, whilst the gratin dauphinois was creamy and delicious. The b√©arnaise was one of the best I‚Äôve tasted to date, both flavour-wise and texture-wise. It was amazing!

My fianc√©, on the other hand, went for the creamy truffle spaghetti, which was a really watery, bland and underwhelming dish. This was a real shame, as he struggled to get through his main whilst I savoured mine.

Overall, Delaville was a really mixed experience, with some dishes being really unpleasant and others being delicious. This lack of consistency makes it difficult to recommend Delaville as, depending on your order, you may have a fantastic or awful experience.', 'Good service, pleasant environment.
They make their own beer!']

['Floderer is a legendary brasserie, and the recent renovations have added a fresh, modern touch. You‚Äôll find mixed reviews, but for me, this lunch at the ‚Äònew‚Äô Floderer was a hit. Exceptional product quality, great taste, and generous portions. Some of the service staff might be a bit inexperienced, but they‚Äôre eager and trying hard. Overall, a great experience!', "Outstanding French cuisine, friendly multilingual service, and a gorgeous ambiance make this a go-to restaurant if you're in the area and looking for some traditional dishes. If you like deserts, try the egg whites. It sounds strange, but trust me!", 'Discovery in this part of Paris. Just reopened after a major redecoration. A beautiful restaurant breathing a warm and luxurious atmosphere of times gone by. The service is excellent. The food is really good and the prices are very reasonable. I warmly recommend this restaurant to all who are visiting Paris and are looking for a good restaurant in the Gare du Nord area!!', "Great decor and location (the street is very lively) but that's it.\nService was slow and our waiter felt like he did not want to wait on us at all.\nAnd the portions are super small, this is common for Paris brasseries but this one took it to a new level.", 'I was here 6 years ago (pre renovation) and it was THE BEST seafood place in Paris. What a place wow! Now I came here again 2024 after the renovation and I have to say I was a bit disappointed. Huge tourist groups and high prices and a not very nice ambient. Oysters were great and the service was very very friendly. Place eventually also filled up with non tourists. 55‚Ç¨ for a large platter with Oysters etc, however some fish did not feel fresh.']

Nom: Le Plomb du Cantal Rive Droite
Reviews:
["Great atmosphere and service, very close to our hotel.  Not the best steak I've ever had, but the aligot (cheesy mashed potatoes) is their main thing and it was delicious!  Good onion soup, too.", 'Super beautiful atmosphere with a trendy crowd. It was raining outside, Olympic games opening ceremony 2024 Paris was being shown live and we enjoyed with the audience with fish and chips. Service was very warm and very fast. How awesome an experience can be. Really made my day.

Recommended.', "Aligot galore...

Was looking for a place to try the aligot. Saw this place from google.  Rather pricey but it was one of the best meals that we have eaten in Paris.  Simple and delicious.

We ordered the classic onion soup for starters, unfortunately (or fortunately) it did not come. As we had ordered Entrec√¥te 330 g. servie avec de l'aligot (28.00‚Ç¨). The Rib eye was huge, with very generous amount of aligot.

This is one place that we will return to again when in Paris. Great food, friendly service. Rather cozy atmosphere.", 'I had a duck breast with aligot. It was my first time trying aligot and I really like this texture but it was way too garlicky, couldn‚Äôt finish all the portion because of this. Portion size was huge. Overall, everything was pretty good , although I would say a little less of garlic in aligot would be much better.', 'Food was relatively pricey, but very good. Impressed with the onion soup and duck confit. We also ordered an entrecot ribeye steak which came rare.

Service was good and waiters were attentive. Pleasant lunch.']

['Came here with 2 other friends for dinner! We ordered mostly appetizers dishes to share because they simply looked more interesting than the mains üòÑ however, our server was very nice and recommended the in season sole (in photo) and that tadted very nice! I think it was too much food but it was tasty.\nWe all got the scallops (3 in total, 1 per person), in my opinion, the acidity of the sides overpowered the scallops and I could barely taste the freshness/sweetness of them. On the other hand, the beef tartare I ordered as my 2nd appetizer was awesome üòéüëç\nWe all shared a dessert mont blanc at the end which was also very nice, not too sweet I find~', 'One of the most amazing restaraunts that I‚Äôve ever been too, the atmosphere, the ambience, the food and their moktails! Absolutely amazing, 100% recommend their restaraunt when you‚Äôre in Paris, bring a loved ones, or your family, I went with mine, it‚Äôs now a ritual for us to come here whenever we‚Äôre in Paris, staff was so friendly and so on it, it was like home, cozy.', 'The decoration of this resto is incredible and cool. A cozy place to have a nice dinner with friends . My faves were the duck , foie gras, cabagge rolls and millefuille.', 'Amazing and special food! The food is so tasty and not regular classic french cuisine! Very recommend!', 'Had dinner here before Christmas with my friends who come to Paris. The food here is great and the atmosphere is nice. Love the interior design.']

['The burger is amazing in every way mouthwatering and tasty, and the prices are great too. The only letdown was the fries. It would be a perfect meal if the fries were better.', 'Stopped here for lunch on the way to the dog park & they were super friendly! They spoke to us in French but we got the gist of it & ordered a Smash burger, fries with a mayo dip, and the chicken pieces with their bbq sauce. Quick with the tap water & water for our doggie & they were very nice to him! Burger was delightful - it reminds us of Shake Shack, In n Out, and Hopdoddy burger. Which is to say it was SO SAVORY, we loved it. The chicken was also good, i loved the flavor and how crispy it was. The bbq was tangy & paired well with what we ordered.', "Americans have much to worry about with Blends LeCam burger..it's like a perfect marriage made in heaven and I wonder no one has thought of as sooner... But they did!! And it's cooked expertly... Totally legit!", 'Very good place the hamburgers amazing , the service 10/10 I really recommend it amazing taste good price and quality service made me feel like home thanks blend , and to the wonderful service by Agathe !!! Merci', 'Very nice staff, very friendly, great music and cool interior! We got a take away, kept warm ok which was good. Burgers delicious, and good fries. Cheesy bacon burger good, as was the signature. Would recommend to anyone, pretty good price, fast service but still great burgers!']

Adresse: 47 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews:
['100% parisian, not fancy at all and we like it this way
But so good ! Try the boudin, the saucisson and the choux !', "Food is ok. Again, nothing amazing. The price tho is incredible. It's really cheap. For 12‚Ç¨ you eat good food. Staff is really cool. Love the vibe and like the food, simple 3 dishes all year round. You should try !", 'I love this place, sadly the service can be sometimes the worst.

I was waiting outside for a table and I saw waiter coming in and out , one of them look at me but say nothing.

Then a table became available so I went and sit and that‚Äôs how I was previously told you need to do when I come in June.

One of the waiters (black hair with moustache) come and told I can‚Äôt sit because someone was before me waiting 20 min , I told them I was there for 30 min that the other waiter show me, the he says the girls were for 40 min , and the other waiter tells him that I didn‚Äôt ask to sit, did he really think I was staring at tables outside for 30 min for fun?

Well to finish with I didn‚Äôt saw those girls waiting outside I believe they were inside the bar and they were his friends or they just went to him telling in front of them‚Ä¶

I asked him if I could have the next table and he told me if I ask him politically‚Ä¶ the other waiter told me it was a table inside in that moment both of them left me on the street without table and I decided to leave.

- [ ] I was in so much shock that someone come to tell  me I can‚Äôt sit in their restaurant and I need to wait because a group ask him before me but I need to be polite to him while he is being rude to me‚Ä¶as I say I truly believe he knew those girls. And then say it‚Äôs a table but dos not tell me where just leave me there‚Ä¶

Because I love the atmosphere and food I come back another . Asked to another waiter how the table outside works and  he told me you see a table you sit the first one who sits got the table. If you look away and you lost your table your fault.

I didn‚Äôt have words‚Ä¶. Just say if you are not friend or common client they may told you to wait for another table and please to be extremely polite to ask for the another table or anything and hope more friends don‚Äôt come in front of you before you got another change to get a table.', 'This is really sad. Please owner of this place : read this. This place used to be very nice but now you are damaging it with bad choice of workers. Last Sunday 08.09  (around 5-6pm) I went with my friends telling them ahead of how of an amazing cool spot this is. We came in asking if we could sit in the back. The waitress ( young, white, dark hair, wearing a black white dress) said yes. We waited 20 min and since no one came to our table I stood up to ask her if she could take our order and that we would also like to eat smthg. She said yes. Again 20 min later no one came. I went again to her and she really answered ROLLING HER EYES : YEAH what do you want ? ... I said "please can you come to our table?" She then came over and would look at us annoyed. My friend asked her kindly if she would recommend anything. Her answer "just take any of the drinks of our menu. They are all good" .... My friend then ordered a Mojito and the waitress says "ah we don't have Mojito" \U0001fae0 .... I then asked her about the food and she says "kitchen is too busy right now and anyway the table you sat on is reserved soon so you can't eat anyway" .... Like WOW üò≥ I run two restaurants myself and I have never experienced such a bad and arrogant service. Serious you should straight up have a serious talk to this lady. I wonder why she's working there ? Maybe you don't pay her well or her colleagues harass her cause I cannot imagine a real reason of why she's do this as if she'd hate life. That's why I'm adding the date and time. And to her I wanna say : girl, you work in Paris , the most beautiful city in the world. If you hate your job leave it as I'm sure many people would love to do it and theyd do it with love. Really : find your placeüíó', 'You don‚Äôt go here for the food but for the ambience. I love this place as one that holds on to a very authentic Parisian experience.']

['40 year and still the Same atmosphere and  quality. Excellent staff. Was good to be back.', "If I'm in the mood for the good life üíÖüèªI dream of Joe Allen. A pleasant memory in the middle of my visit that I haven't stopped thinking about . The regulars here are great, almost perfect. I would like to come again. üíú", "Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! Music in the background was a mix of Nirvana, Queen, AC/DC, Johnny Cash, and other bands relative to the genre. Server was great and ensured our order was out in a very timely manner. One issue I didn't inquire about was the extra ‚Ç¨25 charge on my receipt. Threw away the receipt after I left and didn't really inquire about it. My loss if anything but double check your tickets. Other issue is the outside/outdoor seating (enclosed) and the amount of smoke. Of course, it's Paris, and people smoke and u have nothing against it (smoked for 20+ years). If you don't mind it, sit outside and enjoy your meal. Highly recommend the pulled pork! Would definitely return!", 'The place didn‚Äôt seem really interesting at the first glance but after trying it, I really changed my mind:

üçîFood (4,5/5): I tried the Joe Allen signature burger which was really really great. Maybe one of the best I ve tried. On the other side it was a bit pricey, yet I will definitely eat it again.

üõéÔ∏è Service (4,5/5): the head waiter was, at least in my occasion very very kind and attentive. I don‚Äôt speak French but he gladly answered my questions in English, joked a bit, made sure that everything is ok and made me feel welcome to bother him in case I have any problem with the food. However the other waiter and waitress that served our table was not so pleasant. I could describe them as a bit moody.

üåÉAtmosphere (4/5): the internal space is decorated quite nicely, giving nice cozy vibes. However the external one has nothing special.

üëçOverall (4,5/5): A pleasant experience. If being just a bit more pricey than the usual is ok for you, you should definitely try it.', 'I was craving authentic BBQ so I came to Joe Allen. YES. FIVE STARS. Ribs- amazing. Cole slaw- best I‚Äôve ever had. Sweet potato fries- heavenly. Vanilla ice cream + warm cookies, say no more.

This place is bomb.

Service was fast, attentive and they even generously gave us muffins from this mornings brunch in a doggy bag, for free.']

['What an incredible experience we had diving into the world of French wine and its stunning regions! As a wine enthusiast, this tasting was a revelation, giving me a vivid glimpse into the rich diversity of wines France has to offer. Paul from Britain, our fantastic sommelier, made the journey even more unforgettable with his expertise! It was a thrilling adventure for our taste buds!', 'I had such a lovely time here! Shared a 6 glass wine tasting with my husband, which included 1 champagne, 2 white wines, 1 ros√© and 2 red wines. The staff were knowledgeable and explained the wine in detail to us after giving us some time to conduct our own blind tasting.

My party of 3 arrived before 8pm and we were able to get a seat at the bar easily.

A lovely spot which I will definitely return again!', 'We first visited O Chateau in 2019 and knew we needed to come back!  We scheduled a wine & food pairing which was beyond fantastic. The food was the best food we‚Äôve had all week in Paris and the selection of wines were amazing. There were a couple that I would not normally try but they surprised me. The service was AMAZING. H√©lian, the sommelier, took the time to educate us on each of the wines and pairings. I‚Äôve done many tastings but this was superb! Samuel, was also fantastic and he did everything with a smile. Very nice atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place. 10/10', "Went for a Cheese tasting session as part of our Paris Pass and it's overall a nice experience at √î Chateau. We were offered 5 kind of Cheese curated from separate area of France. Each Cheese was unique in taste and the in house expert graciously explained us the origin of each Cheese. Complimentary Wine was also served which made the Cheese tasting session more delectable one.", "Stopped in due to other reviews while I was staying in Paris, and I have to say this place is very good. I'm an amateur when it comes to wine and decided to get the wine flight. The lovely women assisted my flight by giving me a breakdown of each wine from the France region I was drinking. The wines tasted fantastic and gave a tremendous cultural insight into wine and France. Highly recommend!"]

["The store itself is well maintained and kept cleaned but the staff is very slow.
You see them having a long detailed conversation about something even during rush hours when there's a long queue.
They also increased their prices and reduced portion sizes. The cheesecake is almost half of what it was a couple of months ago!", 'It‚Äôs always fun watching the barista take two minutes just to find my drink on the screen. And of course, I had to remind them twice that I brought my own cup for a discount‚Äîbecause why make it easy? The prices are already high, but they throw in a little bonus game: guessing if they‚Äôll charge you the right amount this time. Always double check, most baristas are inexperienced 18 year old apprentices with zero interest or motivation for the job whatsoever.

Honestly, McDonald‚Äôs has it figured out with their automatic ordering screens‚Äîquick, simple, and way cheaper. Starbucks might want to take notes. At least then, I‚Äôd get my coffee faster, waaay cheeper and with less hassle! And they compete in terms of dirtiness, (mabye mcdo is a bit better)', 'Unfriendly staff. I was just another American tourist stopping by and getting my coffee and some mugs‚Ä¶ and it is funny because Starbucks is an American company and this staff has no idea how to deal with American customers‚Ä¶', 'Was here from 14h-18h30. They have a good place to work / study. You can charge your phone / laptop almost everywhere is covered. The wifi is decent but somehow better than most Starbucks in Paris. Staffs are nice.', 'AVOID THIS PLACE !!!! Catastrophic ! Shame on you‚Ä¶ you never have oat milk - put dairy instead - i was really sick - pre order are never ready - worst staff ever']

Adresse: 10 Rue de la Grande Truanderie, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews:
['I‚Äôm from Manhattan, and this is literally the best Chinese food I‚Äôve ever had. The chef is a master.

The staff is attentive and sweet. The prices are reasonable.', 'I had the chance to celebrate my birthday there ; the place is very well decorated and service extremely nice and professional. We ordered two pekin ducks that were sliced in front of us to be eaten in crepes, and the rest of the meat was then served with rice. We also ordered dumplings which were all very good. Definitely recommend this restaurant that feels authentic.', 'My family used to come to Chez Vong when I was a kid, 20  years later I came With my wife and we had a great evening!

We ordered the restaurant‚Äôs speciality ‚ÄúPeking duck‚Äù and dim sum.

The food is incredible and service has high standards but yet everyone is very warm and friendly.

we lived 8 years in china and nonetheless our dinner at Chez Vong was one of the best we ever had!', "Looks very nice, but too expensive for what it is. Everything was too sweet which is common trick for flavour, the service was non existence. My mouth was numb eating here as eating cheap chemical chinese food, and I had to leave more than half of the meals we ordered. If I was the manager, I would ask what was wrong, but no question was askef. Maybe so many people leave things here, so it's their norm. I can not recommend here.", 'Wow, what a way to start our vacation in Paris on a whim!  The food was phenomenal, and as terrible Americans, we don‚Äôt speak any French, and the host and staff were SO friendly.  Some of the best Asian food we‚Äôve had in Europe!']

["Love this place. These sorts of divey type bars are my homes away from homes. No pretense, just good people and good drink. If I were living in Paris I'd need to live nearby hear to make it my local sort of thing. Bartender was playing really good music too. Make sure to look for the mobile in the back on the ground floor - it's suspended from the ceiling. Really cool little piece of art. I took a short film of it but can't upload it here, but there's a pic of it.", 'Cosy and nice place where to find some tranquillity and good food and good draft and bottled beers. The staff is welcoming and friendly.
