I found Unexpected Italian proper music that delighted my journey.', 'The bar is so cool!\nAnd very unique decoration\nGood music and the lock of WC is very funny', 'One of the  bests unique bars in Paris, very authentic and the owner Nico, amazing person.', 'A beautiful old bar right in the middle of everything.. Friendy bartender.. !']

['Amazing seafood. We got a selection of amazing fresh oysters 10/10. Also mussels platter is very good. Solid seafood place. Wines are just good though, nothing incredible.
Oh and definitely go for the Prunes in Armagnac for the dessert!', 'Great friendly service. The oysters and bread were beautiful. Good street ambience and large indoor dining areas.', 'Had a great experience at this place, although I do think it‚Äôs a bit on the expensive side. The service was great and the best part was the little restaurant cat that lives in the area. So cute! We got a charcuterie platter and thoroughly enjoyed it with the mustard. I wanted to get the oysters but was told it was too early in the day.', 'Very tasty food with good service. We brought our baby who they kindly accommodated. If I came back, I would definitely order the seafood again, which was delicious. The oysters were incredibly fresh and the sea bass and scallops were excellent. Atmosphere was good - laid back, relaxed and fun.

Disadvantages: wine is overpriced and we were asked to tip despite service being included on the bill. However, everyone was so accommodating, we thought this was well deserved!', 'Together with my colleague we had a dinner here. The oysters were very good! The cod fish as main was good too. The size of the portion looked small for the charged price, though. On the other hand, the inflation does affect the price of everything‚Ä¶
All in all we like the place and would not hesitate to book this cafe again.']

["Great craft beers, good cocktails et pretty good finger food for a pub, the staff's wonderful though, I highly recommend for any occasion but especially for sports!", 'Excellent service, delicious food, we had a great time', 'I went to Frog and Rosbif to watch the Autumn Nations rugby match between Australia and England. We chose the bar specifically because the Frog‚Äôs website said it would be showing the match. On arrival we double checked with the staff that they would be showing the match. When the match started they refused to put the sound on, at first claiming it wasn‚Äôt even technically possible. After several other people asked they finally put the sound on. I completely understand that a bar might not want to show sporting matches but if that‚Äôs the case don‚Äôt advertise it on your website and if customers specifically ask on arrival, let them know you won‚Äôt be putting the sound on. We would have simply gone to another bar, which is what we‚Äôll be doing next time.', "Came here for desserts and beer. Desserts were a cold old waffle with some nutella at 8.50‚Ç¨ and a weird cookie with cream at 7.50‚Ç¨. Probably the worse dessert I've ever had. Asked not to pay for the desserts at the end but management refused. Don't come here for anything else than beer.", "Friendly staff, decent beers. The food was a case of quantity over quality. I had a salad which was big but didn't taste great and the club sandwich was similar - feels like they're catering for an American audience - I'd personally enjoy smaller but tastier dishes"]

Nom: Les Parigots R√©publique - Restaurant Paris 10 eme
Adresse: 5 Rue du Ch√¢teau d'Eau, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews:
["One of those neighbourhood places that serve very comforting and no fuss food done well

Chou farci was good, tender cabbage and tightly packed meat.

Their chocolate mousse was smashing. It's not those super refined kind with very strong dark chocolate and acidic flavours, but more a super satisfying common man kind that's sweet enough. Full bodied, this is a must try, and rightfully their signature dessert", 'My husband and I ate here for dinner as it was close to our hotel and just wanted something quick and nearby. The staff was very friendly. The restaurant was cozy. The food was very good, my husband had the Stuffed Cabbage and I had the Crispy Pork. Both were fantastic.', 'We absolutely enjoyed this cozy and trendy bistro. For main dishes, we had the raw meat ‚Äútartare‚Äù, which is a typical offerings in Parisian bistros, and sirloin which was served with fries and a simple salad.

Great experience and great service!!', "It's a nice place close to the Place de la Republique, we went there for dinner, it was actually my birthday and I can say that the food was good, mine was not excellent, unfortunately, I had the beef and there were some parts that were hard and chewy, but my partner's was indeed very good, he had surff and turf. The prices are like Paris, but what I didn't like it it was that as soon as we finished dinner and the wine, there came the bill without asking if we wanted another glass or something. I found it a bit rude and we spent around 90 euros, we didn't linger at the table for free. The atmosphere is nice though, typical French bistro at night.", 'My family of four had a terrific meal here, in a fun and relaxed bistro setting with friendly staff and perfect food.  We loved the classics (steak frites, tartare) and also appreciated that the menu had interesting vegetarian-friendly alternatives.  My kids loved the Viennois and mousse for dessert.']

['A Must-Try in Paris

This famous restaurant truly lives up to the hype! I walked in alone and was warmly welcomed. The martini was perfectly made, the truffle escargot was juicy and unforgettable, and the duck confit‚Äîtender and flavorful‚Äîwas made even better with all the sauce generously poured over.

My server, Patrick, was friendly, attentive, and effortlessly charming. An exceptional dining experience I‚Äôll never forget. Highly recommend!', 'Had the best service with Elena serving us at our table. She was super friendly and the service was EXCEPTIONAL! She was extremely attentive and kept asking if things were ok. Apart from that, she made sure that our bill could be split so that we could claim it properly from our company. Top class service - thank you Elena!!', "Omg the food was amazing. Service was perfect, top-notch. The restaurant has 2 floors and areas with private balcony seating. The patio was cozy and cute, but inside was extra cute and inviting. Don't be shy of the line. People are probably leaving,  I waited just a short time, and it was totally worth the wait.  The frog legs were delicious my first time having them, and I'm glad I chose this establishment.", 'This was our favorite dining experience of our week in Paris. The service was old school and impeccable. The food was delicious and perfectly served. Even with thousands of dining choices in this city, we would return again and again.', "I was so happy to find a decent looking restaurant in Paris, which doesn't look, feel or smell like a pub. This felt like a classy place and it was a very nice unique touch that we could try frog's legs alongside the snails. Dishes were cooked to perfection and I've found the waiters very kind (which is unusual for Paris)"]

['I had such a wonderful experience at Au P√®re Fouettard! The atmosphere is absolutely delightful ‚Äì a warm, cozy interior that makes you feel right at home, paired with great music that perfectly sets the mood.

The service was top-notch, with the staff being incredibly welcoming and attentive. A special shoutout to the lovely girl Anna with two braids ‚Äì she was so friendly, spontaneous, and made the evening even more enjoyable!

And, of course, I have to mention the delicious espresso martini ‚Äì easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever had.

I can‚Äôt wait to come back. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a charming and relaxed spot!

It‚Äôs currently Monday, and it‚Äôs not busy at all. COZY!! VIBE!!! SOFT SEAT!!
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ 5/5', "The place has a nice terrace and the service was good. The waiter was very friendly and helpful. However, I was a bit disappointed with the food. I had the fish and chips and it came as small fish pieces that were over fried and became hard to eat. I think they could've done a better job with the dish.", "The food was great and the service was even better. It's not cheap but very reasonably priced compared to other restaurants in the same area.", 'wouldn‚Äôt recommend, skip this place if you can service was brisk and unfriendly (not a huge deal we‚Äôre in paris) but the food was the issue - worst of our whole trip. not sure what these guys think bruschetta is but it‚Äôs definitely not what we received (more like a pizza?)! the mojito was made with dark rum not white and had granulated sugar in it instead of syrup. croquette was more like an arancini ball and the bread was stale.', 'Stopped here for a bowl of soupe √† l‚Äôoignon. Great comforting soup, very pleasant staff (hard to find in Paris!) and nice atmosphere. Recommended.']

['Booked late night but we still managed to find a table. Arrived at 10:30pm to a small but incredibly lively and jovial venue. We were served by Charlie, who made us feel at home, provided excellent service, was incredibly friendly and spoke perfect English. The steak was cooked to perfection and was very tasty. We ordered mash and salad which paired very nicely. The Malbec we ordered was top-tier. And we finished off everything was a sweet apple pie and a free shot of Tequila from Charlie. We left feeling very full and satisfied. I cannot recommend this place enough!', 'Very good meat, more on the expensive side but very good
Starters were delicious', 'A taste of South America and the rare steak faire that we all deserve. Well executed ribye and sirloin cuts plus a wide array of delicious appetizers light up our evening. The wine list is also lovely and highlights the regions best labels.', "I recently celebrated my one-year anniversary at Anahi in Paris, and it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment we walked in, the ambiance was enchanting, blending a chic, intimate vibe with an inviting warmth.‚ù§Ô∏è

The food was absolutely phenomenal. Each dish was crafted with exquisite detail and bursting with flavor. We started with some delectable appetizers, followed by a main course that was nothing short of culinary perfection. The wine selection was impeccable, complementing our meal beautifully and enhancing the overall experience. ‚ù§Ô∏è

To top it all off, the dessert was simply divine. Every bite was a testament to the restaurant's commitment to excellence.üòç

Spending this special occasion with my boyfriend at Anahi made it even more memorable. The attentive and friendly staff ensured that every moment was perfect. I loved every second of our anniversary celebration here and can't wait to return for more magical evenings. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy an extraordinary dining experience in Paris! ‚ù§Ô∏è", "If you get the opportunity to dine here, don't pass it up. The food is divine. From wagyu ribeye to lamb legs, ceviche or empanadas, every bite is magnificent. We read mixed reviews but thought we'd try it. The venue is small, there's no doubt. But although we arrived late (our flight was quite delayed) they welcomed us graciously. We never would have randomly picked this restaurant by wandering Paris. It's a hidden gem. But we are so very glad we found it! Every morsel was perfection. We had champagne and an Argentinian red wine that surpassed our expectations very nicely. The staff is efficient, graceful, and kind. The patrons obviously love the restaurant and sit and talk and eat for hours. A gorgeous woman in red who seemed to speak better Spanish than French attended to us like we were old friends. Seriously, don't miss this experience!"]

['I was brought here by a French friend, so i can try something a bit different from what i was having during my stay in Paris. The place is big enough, you have a big selection of food, the price is good and the quality of the food is ok. For me this was just to experience the place, not my cup of tea, but i can say i enjoy eating here.', 'Food is ok,
Services good
Environment is good
Price upbeat able in center of Paris.', 'Despicable establishment.
Homeless man nodded off next to me,
urinals were overflowing with urine, food was raw and I got food poisoning .do not go here if you value your bowels or your sanity
( photos attached)', 'If I could give it a zero I would. The food was awful, I had chewy haddock , eclairs with rubber like chocolate and stale bread (see pictures below). I was on an exchange from England and there was a homeless person who was stealing food, then he was looking at the private parts of girls and boys, apart from they were 12 and 14 year olds. The toilets had hygiene AND A WINDOW LOOKING AT THE URINALS. Overall an awful experience with a pdf file, nightmare service and terrible food.', "We were supposed to come here to eat dinner for 3 days.

Today, the first day, we come here, have to wait 1:30h and see other classes getting kicked out and pushed around.

Somehow we get in, the trays are wet, forks and knives dirty, food is either cold, tasteless, or both.

Staff was very rude, food was barely edible and wait time was absurd.

Id reccomend going to the Subway right outside or the McDonald's closeby.

Hopefully well be able to get a refund and not come here again."]

['Solid Italian place in Paris with a traditional pizza oven. Just the service was this time pretty üëéüëéüëé. We asked for carbonara with spaghetti and no parsil. What arrived was a carbobara with rigatoni and parsil....due to allergies we had to sent it back and received carbonara with rigatoni again....the pizza was okay....after finishing, we ended up having the plates 40 minutes in front of us; and it was not busy. So the place was okay, service needs definitely to improve. They do speak a little English.', 'Great spot. Fantastic food. Friendly service. Legit Italian cuisine.', "The ribeye steak was really good. I asked for it medium and it was consistent throughout the whole steak. It was well seasoned and tastes so good that no sauce is needed to accompany it. If you want any sauces like ketchup you'd have to ask for it,  which is good so they wouldn't need to unnecessarily by default give sauce if the customer doesn't want any. The lady who served us was very accomodating and very welcoming especially towards English speaking tourists. My only regret is that I won't be able to come back in the near future as I have a flight to catch the next day. I would recommend this place to anyone.", 'Great place, the waitress and rhe chef were very kind and the food was good! Excellent margarita pizza', 'A very cosy restaurent and the food is great\nThe service is very good the waitress was extremely sweet , friendley and always smiling']

["We couldn't have asked for a better start of our long weekend trip than with lunch at Chez Georges. The food is deliciously not fussy, but superbly prepared classics. The service is just amazing. Staff that lets you try your best French (which I always try out of respect, but isn't good by any means) and elegantly helps with a few words of English at the right moment. The room is luckily still mostly filled with locals. Beautiful family gatherings, old friends sharing a meal, ugly men with beautiful women, and yes, there is always the bright-pink-sweatered American. It doesn't get more real then this. I would gladly eat here again, and again. Heck, I would live here if I could.
Until the next time!", "Really, really good. Old school. Best to get reservations in person or way in advance via email. The service and food are fantastic. The escargot were large and tasty. The pickled beef cheeks were new to me and enough for 4 people. The lamb chops were the best I've had. My wife's scallops were excellent. A little more expensive than some of the other similar French restaurants in the area, but the food and service were more refined.", 'Amazing amazing food, vibe and ambience. Highly recommend visiting if in Paris. We got reservation by phoning a couple of weeks in advance for a Friday evening. Turbot and the beef entrec√¥te were HUGE, eggs mayonnaise delicious and profiteroles you cannot miss. Loved the meal and the service was very friendly.', 'We were fortunate to dine at Chez George as there was a reservation snafu due to an airline delay.  Despite being too late for our table on a fully booked night, charming owner George would not turn us away. He served us the freshest radishes with a Campari spritz at the bar. His #2 kept us well entertained.  And lo and behold a perfect two top opened up! Thus began what was one of the best meals we have ever had in Paris.  Plump escargot yet not over garlic'd. The freshest mixed salad with zestiest vinaigrette.  Crunchy pomme frittes, creamy potato mash, Scallops done to perfection.  And a Chicken Supreme my wife contends was then "best chicken dish she has ever had."  We consider ourselves "Flanoisseurs" and the Flan at Chez George's won our number one spot (and we had just come from Spain!)  If you want a true French gastro experience at good  prices, don't miss Chez George.', 'We stopped by here an hour before closing and the staff were all super friendly to ensure we were seated. The service was exceptional throughout, and the atmosphere was the lively one we were looking.

Highlight from the menu was definitely the Beef filet steak with b√©arnaise sauce, and french fries.

Thank you to the Chez Georges team for an epic dinner!']

Adresse: 17 Rue des Petits Carreaux, 75002 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We ordered the meal of the day to have a fresh meal. The meat looked like has been cooked and let there for few days. The color and texture was changed. But we were hungry‚Ä¶. the gratin was absolutely cold. The presentation wasnt appealing neither. But this is all nothing if I tell you I got sick after this food üò´ guys you ruined our beautiful day in paris and left us with bad memories of such a fantastic city!', 'This was our second visit to this charming cafe, and once again, it was delightful experience. We ordered the set menu for breakfast, which is a fantastic deal at just 9.5 euros. For this price, you can enjoy a delicious spread including your choice of coffee, a croissant, French bread, and orange juice.

The staff members here are exceptionally friendly, attentive, and kind. A special thank you to Clement and Sergio for making our visit even more enjoyable.

It‚Äôs lovely to sit outside and soak in the surroundings, especially since the cafe is conveniently located right next to Sentier station. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to enjoy a leisurely breakfast before starting your day.

Highly recommend this cafe, and we will definitely be coming back again!', 'Fortunate to get an outside seat on a busy Saturday night. The steak frites special and a glass of red wine were just right for a solo dinner.', 'excellent food, incredible food, beautiful interior and atmosphere; a good spot for couples or families!!', 'Stopped in this cozy brasserie on a cold January afternoon for lunch and was warmly greeted by host and waiter, Clements. He was kind and friendly with a quick smile. As a solo diner he was very attentive and made me feel very comfortable and at ease. I was hungry for a light meal and chose the Cassolet of Mushrooms in garlic and a side salad. It was the perfect meal served hot from the oven accompanied
by a small side salad perfectly dressed with vinagarette. The Malbec wine paired well with my simple but enjoyable meal.
Thank you Clement for your warm smile and friendly conversation.']

['Food good. Service, good. Atmosphere... possibly because it was batting down with biblical rain,it was a bit sparsely populated. Probably with more people at a weekend (this was a Thursday) it would feel more atmospheric. But, we really enjoyed the place and would go there rather than the other local restaurants we visited.', '"Le Pachy Derme offers a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city. The ambiance is cozy, the service attentive, and the food sublime. Their signature dishes, especially the truffle risotto, are a culinary delight. A must-visit for food enthusiasts seeking French gastronomic excellence."', 'One of my worst dinner experiences.

We had to wait 25 minutes for our entree & 40 more after that for our mains.

We ordered the steak, & it was the size of my palm. It was literally a burger patty. Bit of a joke to be honest‚Ä¶ I could‚Äôve whipped up that meal in 5 minutes at home???

It was lively but not HEAPS busy, & the food was so mid, so there‚Äôs not even an excuse for it to take that long!

I‚Äôd avoid, there‚Äôs so many other nice places to eat.', 'Nice service, friendly staff and great desserts

Opens till late', 'I stayed at the hotel next door and walked over for dinner. I had a grain bowl and glass of wine. Food was fantastic and service was very quick.']

["Nice cafe in the center of town. Great food, but won't accommodate allergies, dietary restrictions or adjustments for vegetarians, so not ideal if you have those needs. Wait staff were friendly and welcoming.", 'It was Friday June 14th. The waiter was very polite and friendly even though he was the only one serving, the service is fast and the fried calamari are simply the best for appetizers, so yum!!! Merci.', 'A nice French Brasserie at the corner of Rue √âtienne Marcel, perfect to have a little escape from the busy streets of Les Halles. We ordered some simple dishes, it was good. The service was very prompt and we had a good time.', 'Very busy place. Would advise booking if you would like to sit outside. Had pizzas n both were lovely.', 'Stopped for midday snacks. Good food but overpriced.\n\nGot a french toast, the confit tomatoes with focaccia, and the baked cambrie(?). The french toast was excellent, the others were just okay. The portion sizes were way too small for the price']

Adresse: 23 Bd de Bonne Nouvelle, 75002 Paris, France
Reviews: ['I mean I understand that the location plays a role in price but doubling the price?', "Annoying hours,  drinks aren't cold", 'Has everything you would normally need, good alcohol and beer selection.', 'One of the most popular places to shop with in Paris... Good products...', 'An economical small supermarket with enough products']

['The food was tasty and it came quickly but we were very bloated afterwards
The service was quick but the waiters sometimes forgot what we asked for and they were always running over our heads
The table was small even if we were three on a table for four and the tables in general were very close together to the point where it felt like we were sharing a table with the couple next to us
The gnocchi with pesto was not gnocchi it was pasta shaped like gnocchi', 'Loved the food and also the ambience. Server Esther was great. We customized the pasta, pizza to our liking as we are vegetarians. Use Google translate to make sure you are communicating the order correctly. We will visit again. Highly recommended.', 'We arrived at la Perla and we had our two girls, the restaurant was full but the staff were so accommodating. They brought us up a table from outside to help squeeze us in. It was above and beyond. Nothing was a problem. They pizza itself was delicious and the restaurant had a lovely atmosphere. Estelle was our server and she was fabulous. She was so friendly and brilliant at her job. Thank you for helping to make our trip to Paris so memorable', 'Very good service, even better food! Zico was an amazing waiter! Gave me good lighting to take pictures of our food, loved him!', 'Absolutely delicious food. They offer very good gluten free options for any of the pasta dishes. The staff are so so nice here too. Definitely will go again']

['What a charming cozy eatery in the 3rd arrondissement of Paris! First of all, they got the best cappuccino I‚Äôve ever had in Paris: rich, balanced and smooth! Robert the owner told me they put in much effort into this, everything has to be right! They check the machine every day to make sure everything works right. I had pimped toast veggie sandwich and it was divine! My friend had classic pancake and he was in heaven! So glad we walked into this place. I followed its smell and found it in the alley.', 'We really liked this caf√©! The matcha latte was strooong but I liked it a lot. The vegan pancakes were amazing, not too sweet too. Can definitely recommend :)', 'Hearty vegetarian meal :) Exactly what I needed after a week of croissants üòÖ The coffee was very good too.\n\nI got their veggie stew bowl with egg and tahini. I think it could have used a bit more sauce and flavor, but still quite satisfied with my meal.', 'Quirky, cool and authentic veggie place with gluten free options. The owner knew what was in everything (including the milk!). Really good food and homemade cakes and cookies. Much needed in Paris ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Great veggie food! Komplex yet tasty dishes. The veggie stew is fantastic! Great, high quality tea selection and coffee! And nice people too!']

Adresse: 14 Rue de la Banque, 75002 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Absolutely incredible meal! The tasting menu had a wide range of food and were all phenomenal. We left absolutely stuffed. The wine pairing suggestion was also quite good. Possibly the best meal I‚Äôve had all year.', 'This review is mainly for the food! The restaurant has a cool atmosphere and great service, however way too expensive for the quality of the product. Most importantly, if you are craving traditional lebanese food this won‚Äôt hit the spot.

I got the hummus, which was very silky but lacked flavor. The fattoush which was awesome, probably my favorite. The beef kibbeh which I didn‚Äôt like because it came with a sweet basil sauce that I just didn‚Äôt understand.

For the main we got the mixed grilled plate: chicken was nice and juicy, kebabs were flavorful but a bit dry. The star was the garlic sauce.

So overall decent food, but extremely overpriced. I wish their flavors were more traditional.', 'Wow is this place busy. Highly recommend reservations although we didn‚Äôt have any and they seated us as we had arrived just at open (7PM) but a few walked in later and were told the wait times may be a bit long. The service we experienced was a little slow but the food made up for it. We ordered a few mezze dishes including the labne, arayus and the kibbeh (fried) and they were all tasty and well spiced.
Mixed grill and the beef grill came out shortly after with some french fries and everything was juicy and delightful and not overcooked.
Ambiance was nice and relaxed.
Highly recommended. Make reservations. You‚Äôll enjoy it.', 'We came for New Year‚Äôs Eve, and everything was perfect‚Äîdelicious food, amazing vibes, and incredibly kind staff. It was truly an unforgettable experience to start the year right. Thank you for such a warm and welcoming evening!', 'Restaurant is nice with good atmosphere. However food and wine are overpriced. We were 6 people and took the menu at 44 and 54 euros, we were expecting more quality food than hummus, salads and few skewers of meat. Wine is definitely overpriced, we tried the cheapest bottle at 37 euro in red and white and it was barely drinkable. Next bottles were at 46 and 59 euros. 87 euros per person for some food and wine to share was not a good deal']

['Quite a cool bar which is open till late at night with beers around 6‚Ç¨ during the happy hours and the service is quick.

The cocktails are priced at 12‚Ç¨ which are definitely worth it since they are very alcoholic. I tried gin and tonic.

A friend of mine reserved the space for his birthday through peerspace.

Since it was the Halloween night the place was quite lit.

The only downside of this place is that they do not accept cards below anything 15‚Ç¨.', 'Lovely quaint restaurant tucked in the passageway! The atmosphere is so cozy and the service was great. We met Adrien, a chef there, he did a fabulous job ensuring my meal was gluten free. The tapas were truly delicious. We will definitely return.', "Great event last Saturday 'La Guillotine' hosted by the wonderful Sasha KILLS and the Amazing Sheinara Tanjabi! Prices for drinks are average for Paris by night and there iare two floors (ground floor and the basement with a stage). Thumbs up!", 'Never going back. Rude staff, condescending, dishonest. Bathroom is on the bottom floor which can only be accessed with proof of purchase and noone tells you. 40‚Ç¨ on bad drinks (really below standards) and a mediocre to bad experience all in all. Avoid, there are much nicer places in the area.', 'Tucked away at the end of Passage Bourg-l‚ÄôAbb√© is a little bar with lots of character. The d√©cor is homely and very Parisian, with banquette seats, dark wooden tables and flyers and posters dotted throughout. Les Cariatides has the friendly feel of a local bar with a crowd of devoted regulars always in attendance.
However, thanks to its prominent live music schedule, there‚Äôs also a constant flow of jazz lovers, folk fans and young rockers passing through. Concerts, theater performances and even magic shows are held at least three or four times a week in the cavern beneath the bar. A tiny stage and small space make for an intimate, if sweaty, experience. It‚Äôs a great place for listening to new music, not least because almost all the concerts offer free entry. Count on a lively crowd, and be ready to bop along.
Upstairs, the bar is narrow, with a line of four tables along one wall and tiny ones along the other. Happy hour (‚Äúheure du crime‚Äù) runs from 6pm to 9pm, when pints are half price. The bar stocks a good selection of whiskeys and flavored rums. If you‚Äôre feeling peckish, sample one of the cheese or cold meat platters. They also do a couple of tapas and vegetarian dips.']

['great place for a excellent breakfast. combo‚Äôs are a great deal for the food and drinks. good coffee and service. toilets can do with a make over but especially the terras on the weekends are a great place to enjoy the breakfast and watch people. the egg benedict are  super.', 'The restaurant is located in a busy touristic and lifely area. The outside terras is packed with small round tables and two chairs. Rather tight setting. We ordered a pasta dish and a pizza. Not much place was left on the table after the plates were served. The food portions are rather small and while the food was good it had nothing special.', 'The food here is wonderful.\nI recommend the shrimp risotto and the pizzas. The service is excellent!', 'Very pleasant atmosphere, super nice service and wonderful food. We ordered for dinner: pizza Margherita, risotto with truffle, Caesar salad and fossils with pesto sauce. Everything was more than fresh and delicious. The terrace outside is super welcoming and cozy. We were served by a super nice waiter.\nThank you for the hospitality!', 'Excellent location in the bustling and stylish Rue Montorgueil in Paris. On a rainy December afternoon, we enjoyed a hearty lunch of hot chocolate, chicken burger, gnocchi, and salmon tagliatelle! Loved the service and food. Thanks!']

Adresse: 12 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The black cashier guy was very helpful and friendly.', 'Secretary all ways Good to me. When I needed medical suport she have everything against the pain', "Very bad story the staff are arrogant! We were speaking French and didn't understand what the cashier was saying so we asked could he speak in English and he told us that we don't speak English here and then proceed to add 2 euro too our shopping price. Very bad", "This Carrefour, like most outlets in Paris, somehow manages to look cozy and trendy at the same time. I don't know how you do it, you beautiful city you.", "Obviously, dont expect a store like in states. They may not carry as variety of items like in states but there's something more and I like it."]

Adresse: 1 Rue de la Boule Rouge, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews:
['Legendary Tunisian restaurant, the couscous maison is insane with rose flowers inside, the assortment of salads as well. The service and crowd is authentic and happy to enjoy delicious food.', 'Very friendly staff. The environment is great. You can tell that this spot is popular among locals.
Very big portions.

Fun fact: The walls of the restaurant are full of French celebrities who visited that place.', 'The food is ok, cozy place. But the waiter is "overwelcoming" , he didn't stop interrupting our conversations...he keep demanding for tip way before we finish our dishes..he was rude and made our diner uncomfortable..', 'We travel to paris and stop to eat Friday evening dinner.
One of the best coscouse I ate in my life.
The service is very friendly and foos is great.
I defently recommend this restaurant.', 'Fantastic restaurant serving honest, homely food. Be prepared for a fantastic meal when you order Couscous.']

["A pleasant evening listening and laughing to the hopefully future great stars of the DZ/ FR Stand-up world. As for the bar, Kind folks to their customers and quick service. I'll try to come back to try the food and for the fun every Thursday night.", 'Perfect bar!! Went here with some friends and the evening got better and better. We were able to play our music and the drinks were great!', 'Good place to hangout with friends. Lively music and crowd too.', 'very nice cost benefit, however it feels weird the mix between north africa and french food.
also some of the items were missing
20 euros per person with wine.
nice staff', 'This place is quite awesome with very tasty foods and desserts! It can get a bit crowded and loud at night but nevertheless the concept of eating at a farm is cool.']

["Cool place, very busy on Sunday, reservation is a must, i had a pizza parma .... don't know the rest of the name, it had cheese, ham, basil and dried tomatoes, delicious with very thin dough. I had a tiramisu napolitain or the original one it was delicious too.
Good place if you are in the mood for italian food, they have large variety from pizza to pasta to ravioli.", "Probably the best pasta I've had here in Paris. The menu is delicious, I can never choose just one type of pasta, I had to choose 3 to taste.
Will be coming back always.

Beef ravioli, Bergamo Casencelli, Fig and Stracciatella tortellacci", 'The best italian place ive been in paris
Preferable to reserve
It is very crowded even on weekdays
Staff are extremely friendly', 'The food is incredibly delicious, fresh products, high quality Italian cuisine at affordable price. very friendly staff, quick service. Thanks to Azia', 'If you are in Paris craving for Italian cuisine, this should be on top of your to-visit list. Everything is so delicious!
Salad are fresh, pasta is great, so even though line is long when you arrived there, just queue.. its worth it!  You are welcome!']

['Had this recommended to me and stopped in on a trip to Paris. Could not recommend it more! It‚Äôs a busy bustling restaurant but the staff interacts with you and makes you feel so special. The mezze deal is perfect for trying the whole menu. Everything is so lovely and authentic. We‚Äôre huge fans of Lebanese food and this would be top 5. Our server Kais was amazing and so was everyone we interacted with. Highly highly recommend!', 'Great food and service.  One of our best Paris dining experiences.  worth the effort to find, our waiter spoke enough English to have a fantastic experience.   very generous and tasty portions!', 'Amazing atmosphere, incredible food. Kais served us, he was very fun and warm!', 'Lovely libanese place with great service and and a very welcoming atmosphere. We had shared mezze as starters, excellent so much flavour. The grill dishes were very big portions and delicious. Our server Kais served a dry libanese white wine, so good we needed another bottle. Will def come again!', "All the appetizers we ordered were fresh and very delicious.\nIssa's attention and speed of service made us very happy. We are glad that we reserved this space for this beautiful and warm restaurant, otherwise we would have missed a lot. Thank you Issa and all staff Assanabel."]

['My husband and I went for dinner, we were hoping for a more traditional Italian restaurant, but it wasn‚Äôt. The food I ordered I liked, but my husband was less of a fan of his dish. There was miscommunication between the servers and the assistants because they kept taking plates and silverware away then bringing back new ones, all of which was clean. Overall I thought it was good, definitely interesting food, and worth a try! Oh and the tiramisu is on point for sure!', 'On a Trip in May 2024 in Paris, I visited the location with a large group of my friends. The service & food were amazing given that we were a last-minute walk-in as our other booking for the night rejected the addition of 2 more people. The service was amazing from start to end with off-menu options catered to our dietary requirements and all recommendations from the staff were amazing. I would recommend it for any event you might have while in the city, its worth the price, quantity and quality.', 'Wonderful Italian restaurant in Paris: delicious Italian dishes, super fresh just cooked for you. Excellent quality to price ratio menu. I can recommend this place.', 'What a wonderful dining experience.  The staff was amazing!  I can‚Äôt say enough about the food and wine.  I will definitely return.  The city is amazing and the people are so friendly!!', 'A friend of ours made the reservation. We got there not known it was a 1 star Michelin Star Italian restaurant. We had appetizers, main courses, a dessert to share and 2 sparkling wines. Everything was exquisite and the service spot on. Overall, great night with friends and experience. Would definitely recommend.']

Adresse: Centre Commercial Forum des Halles, 1 place de la Rotonde Niveau -3, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Starbucks Ch√¢telet-Les Halles in Paris offers a cozy stop with classic coffee options, dairy-free milks, and a few vegetarian-friendly snacks like salads, wraps, and oat bars. It's a convenient, comfortable spot amid the busy Ch√¢telet area‚Äîideal for a quick coffee break.", 'Amazing service! Thank you to the four employees who were working. One of them, a young woman, stood out for her excellent hygiene. Bilal was an excellent receptionist and handled my order with care. Another gentleman, whose name I can‚Äôt recall, prepared my drink perfectly, meeting my specific preferences. Great job to the entire team!', 'Once again Starbucks does not disappoint in not asking for my name and putting another one in its place. For the astute amongst you, my name is in fact not *So*.

And asked for a decaf frappucino, the barista decided that decaf means no coffee at all.

Save yourself the trouble, Starbucks will not care about their brand promise nor service.

Edit: apparently we are not the first customers to get just milk for their drinks, and just like the others we are expecting a staple response of "oh we are so sorry we will do better" from Starbucks ‚ú®.', 'I was laughed at by not one but TWO of the Starbucks workers for simply ordering a drink. I am highly disappointed in this experience and won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon. Service in London is 100x better service wise than whatever this was. I don‚Äôt recommend going there unless you want to be publicly humiliated!', 'It is right next to UGC cinema inside Les Halles shopping center, so it is always packed. Cool place to hangout with friends after movie or shopping or swimming. It is all we typically expect from Starbucks - great coffee, cozy environment and opportunity to meet our future or actual friends. The selection in this place is very broad, beyond what is often found at other places. I enjoyed sipping my coffee while biting on my cinnamon pan. Sofas are particularly comfortable here to share with friends as well as obviously available WiFi connection. Make sure to spell your name clearly as they have tendency to modify the name. I definitely recommend the place for the rest, good coffee and chat with friends.']

Nom: H√¥tel National Des Arts et M√©tiers
Reviews:
['Overall, our stay was a blend of highs and lows. The hotel‚Äôs location was excellent, giving us easy access to everything we wanted to see and do, and the room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. We appreciated the comfort of the bed and the stylish decor, which added a nice touch to our experience.

However, the customer service was a significant disappointment. While one staff members was professional and polite, others displayed a dismissive attitude that made us feel unwelcome. At times, it felt like our presence was more of a nuisance than anything else. Requests were occasionally met with a lack of enthusiasm, and on a couple of occasions, we encountered outright rudeness.

For a hotel of this standard, we expected a more consistent level of hospitality. Customer service is an essential part of any guest experience, and unfortunately, this aspect of our stay left us with mixed feelings. While we enjoyed the room and location, we left feeling that the hotel‚Äôs service needs improvement to match its otherwise excellent offerings.', 'The hotels doesn‚Äôt care about its guests at all. My bathroom door was jammed in the mid of night so I had no access to bathroom, called front desk offered me to use bathroom downstairs then offered I can go use bathroom to another empty room: the staff came up can‚Äôt fixed it till next morning. Imagine how horrible that night of sleep. And the door has lots scrape marks it is obviously lots people have struggled with it

When checking out, front desk said ‚Äúit happens‚Äù. No apologies no sorry. It is so bizarre how little compassion and courtesy  they shows to their guests and can get away with it.', 'I read great reviews about the hotel and location which in a way it is but also it is not. It‚Äôs near the  M4 and M11 which is great BUT THERE IS CONSTANT SIRENS GOING OFF from passing ambulance and police!!!!  SO ANNOYING!!!  And right now, someone is doing some hammering of something - it‚Äôs past midnight and I can‚Äôt sleep because of sirens and hammering. Staff is nice, rooms are small but I‚Äôm fine with that. Overpriced but it‚Äôs Paris. Anyway if you are going to party at night then it‚Äôs ok to stay here but if you want to sleep then don‚Äôt!!!', 'We had a great experience! The service was great, they were all very friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself and our rooms were beautiful. We had a beautiful view from our windows of the cathedral. And the location was also amazing! Nearby grocery store, cathedrals, museums, parks. Very nice area to walk around and explore.  Highly recommend!', 'I love this hotel! For the summer, we were 6 at the rooftop last night: we were warmly and properly welcomed by the staff that were so nice, and the bartender makes killer cocktails. Great expresso martini and perfect service! Thank you!']

["I had a fantastic stay at La General Hotel in Paris! The location is perfect‚Äîjust a few steps from the Republique metro station. The room was fresh, new, and impeccably clean, making for an amazingly comfortable stay.

The highlight of my visit was definitely the amazing service provided by Thomas, the hotel manager, and his crew. Thomas was incredibly welcoming, warm, and genuinely helpful throughout my stay. He made sure I felt right at home and went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect.

Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. I'll definitely be coming back!", 'Visited for 6 days (right before the 2024 Olympics)

Pro: the staff here is EXCELLENT! They are kind, attentive, and have lovely recommendations.

We didn‚Äôt opt in for breakfast and we had an awesome experience.

The location of this hotel was great. There were so many bars and restaurants near by. If you want to be near the Maris but don‚Äôt want to pay high prices this is a lovely option. We were so close to Paris East Station and many metro stations. Also you can find E-bikes close by.

So happy to be staying in this area of Paris and have more options and less tourists options.

Con:
The art is very eclectic and not my taste. The room we stayed in had a strange photo of a woman above the bed.

The rooms have a fragrance from the cleaning service (strong mint scent) that was much too strong for my party and I.', 'Hotel is well situated near a metro station and staff were welcoming and friendly. The room was great, though more attention to detail on cleaning aspect is needed in the bathroom. The hairdryer definitely needs an upgrade. Loved the toiletries, the little sweet treats and having a coffee machine in the room.', 'Loved our stay, staff were so welcoming (shout out Yanis). Rooms are small, but well done. Breakfast was really nice, freshly squeezed orange juice, smoked salmon, pastries‚Ä¶ etc.
Great value for money for a short stay in Paris!', "I didn't know what to expect but I was very happily surprised. The staff is amazing. When we arrived Florio happily went through a map of the area and things we might want to visit. He was very helpful and knowledgeable. There is breakfast available at the hotel but I did not indulge. The lobby is a fun experience. I did see a PS4 and some games but I only used the selfie camera to take some pictures of ourselves. The room is normal size for Paris (which is small) but the room was very clean had space to hang our clothes and spots to put away others. The shower is powerful! Not only for Europe in general but it's great compared to other parts of the world. I'll come back for sure."]

Adresse: 18 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
['I have lots of mixed feelings about this place... it is hard to leave a review as it really depends with what expectations you go there. Our story was that we wanted to go to a restaurant that had nice food and which has dancy dancy music that we could enjoy after dinner. Our observations are as following:
- too loud to have dinner here, even if the dancing area was not open yet, the music was very loud the whole evening
- the waiting time for the food was a nightmare... we waited 2 HOURS for the first appetizers to come and they still missed one plate... Then we had to rush between main dish and dessert because they were already cleaning the tables around so the party could start
- the food was ok, the cocktails were ok too, but the waiting time for the cocktails was long as well
- it is a good place to dance if you are into that specific music
The conclusion is that they are VERY understaffed as we were sitting exactly next to the open kitchen and we could see the cooks were preparing dishes non-stop. The waiters were running around non-stop as well, but the place had so many clients that it was not human for them to face it all.', "I've been there with my colleagues. The food was great! The ambiance was very nice, the music was cool. Good restaurant. Recommendable.", 'Friendly staff, tasty food: grilled lamb was fantastic!
Improvement points:
Payment - cash only.
No English menu, the waiter tried to translate it, it was but so easy.
Visible on the Google maps under the old name (Veduvio restaurant).
Some food (like beef steak) seemed to be overpriced (comparing to other sites in the area).', 'Good decoration and atmosphere but we went for drinks late , the entrance was 20 euros with a drink which is a lot, especially when there is no air-condition or ventillation and at some point you could not breathe. The dtuff was great and the drinks also.', 'Went there for a birthday event, liked the concept of booking a special room that have their own bar and selected music, good drinks, they do serve good cakes but the tapas were very average.

Also later if you join the late night DJ on main hall, the play wasn‚Äôt so good.']

["Amazing location if you're interested in shopping and the major museums. Great access to public transportation, bars, food, and it's safe.

Gym is very good by European standards.

Really appreciate the good blinds if you like sleeping in pitch black!", 'Great hotel, I loved the Mexican theme, it was really nicely decorated. The rooms were a very good size especially for Paris and being close to centre (didn‚Äôt even opt for biggest room, just the standard). Continental breakfast was great (cheeses, meats, eggs, pastries etc). The gym was a nice perk that I used. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. I didn‚Äôt have any issues whilst there, but the reception staff in particular couldn‚Äôt do enough for you, that team is very well trained in giving good customer service (it was all of them, not just one or two). I‚Äôd highly recommend this hotel.', 'So far so good. The check-in process takes like for ages. The room is decent and clean. Yet, the sound-proofing can do a much better job. Our room is near the escalator, could definitely heard people walking by the whole night. Also not to mention some romantic noise made by my neighbours. Lol', 'We left this hotel after one night of a four night stay. Front desk clerk didn‚Äôt even look surprised or ask why we were leaving. This room was super loud, and the shower/tub layout is a mystery. It‚Äôs not a wet bath, but the position of the shower nozzle and the small shower door would make it one. There is also a window between the bathroom and bedroom, so anytime someone uses the toilet, the whole room lights up. The room itself was dirty, dingy and depressing. We found a two bedroom apartment nearby that was about the same price and a million times better. I don‚Äôt recommend staying here unless you are a solo traveler who sleeps like the dead and only takes baths.', 'Clean and spacious room in a modern hotel. Well positioned in central paris and close to several places where to eat and hang out. Can surely recommend']

['Beautiful dinner spot. We went for Christmas Eve and the Live music was great! We had a Xmas dinner menu, the food was good - not the best we have had in Paris but very tasty.', 'Had a great experience with my friends in the restaurant! The food us amazing, and is worth the price! Loved she cheese board and the duck. Thanks!', 'Firstly the service is excellent, the waitress was extremely friendly, she changed the whole experience!
Food:
- Steak, very tender
- Foie gras, excellent
- Tartare, on point
- Snails, a bit disappointing
- Mocktails, creative and fresh', 'Amazing evening spent on New Year‚Äôs eve 2024-25. The atmosphere, the music, the friendly service, the amazing value menu combined to create a magical and memorable evening. Kudos to the staff who were friendly and accommodating even during a crowded second seating service of the evening. The music was also amazing as the last time. Highly recommended as a quintessential Paris experience.', 'Went here for Christmas Eve, staff was so lovely and the food was great! We got the full course menu and split everything but the main course, so it came out to about $70/person with a couple glasses of wine. Our main course was a little late, so they offered us a free glass of champagne! There was also live music at 9PM, which really added to the atmosphere. Overall, really great experience!']

Adresse: 20 Rue de la Pierre Lev√©e, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews:
['The food was very delicious, very friendly service and we loved the background music. Our best vegan restaurant so farnin Paris. We will come back!', 'We had lunch at this place.. excellent food, great service and had a good time üòäüíê thank you for the dish of the day.. was very tasty and so was the dessertüòäüíê', 'Really nice and tasty. However it‚Äôs overpriced!!!
Look at my photo, I‚Äôve paid 18‚Ç¨ for 2 little dishes, I‚Äôm not a big eater, but I was still hungry! Come on!', 'Delicious vegan food.

Super healthy & tasty at the same time.
Staff was very warm, atmosphere is homely. Nice for a date or spend time with friends or even to grab a quick meal.

Must try: the platter for mains & the artichokes for entree.

Soyafels, mezze, tempeh cannot be missed', "Another great vegan experience in Paris!

I'd recommend making a reservation.  It wasn't busy when I arrived at 7:30 but it was packed when I left an hour or so later.

I had the fried tempeh appetizer and the lasagna. The appetizer was good but not what I was expecting.  The tempeh was more of a paste that was formed into triangles and fried.  I didn't really see any individual soybeans.  Perhaps that's typical in Europe so I can't ding them for that.  Besides, it still tasted good.üòÅ

Now on to the star of the show, the lasagna.   Most of the reviews said it was good and they were correct.  It's the best vegan lasagna I've had in the 8 years I've been vegan.  The portion was large, with many layers.  2 people could probably share it if they also had appetizers.

This place is definitely deserving of its high rating.  I'll be back!"]

['Eclectic offering. Worldly menu. Nice and friendly staff. Love this spot. The Voyage au Madras was excellent- high praise coming from me as I‚Äôm from Madras. However, the vade entre√© needs a big recipe switch. throw in some onions, some black pepper and hike up some salt. Hummus was great! Cocktails were üî•. the marg deserves high praise.', 'Great place for dinner and/or drinks.
Food is different with an international fare.
Place is fun loud with a great vibe.
Staff is super friendly. Have been several times and always a good time.', "Large portions of exotic dishes from a rather jumbled menu, much like their decor which is not necessarily a bad point.

I think the variety adds to the spirit of the restaurant! Very cosy, slightly eccentric with excellent price points for a dinner out in town that doesn't break the bank. (15-18‚Ç¨ per dish + wine/beverage = 25‚Ç¨ or less)

I took the Himalaya and my friend order the fish and chips (the dish with the strange looking flat strips of chips on top).", 'Delicious food, fast service. I recommend it to everyone. I ate Voyage √° Madras vegetarian food, it was excellent. My friend asked for Amazonian fish and chips, which was also great.', 'I enjoyed the dish very much, I got a vegetarian plate and it tasted great, we also had the desserts which we enjoyed so much']

['Cozy spot with incredible food and a very nice staff, Tacos üåÆ are delicious and the collection of drinks are well curated for a Mexican place. The only downside is that the space is limited and you might have to wait to be seated. 5/5 overall!', 'I adored this place. Imagine this, you sit on the bar, order Frozen Margarita, Quesadilla, and chips&lentil dips, everything so yummy, you see the staff preparing, you talk with them and they explain. So lovely', 'I had been wanting to visit this place for a long time, and finally, the day came! This tiny taqueria is packed with authentic charm. Sitting at the counter, where you can watch the chef prepare each dish, adds a special touch to the dining experience. The atmosphere is so inviting, you can‚Äôt help but enjoy every moment‚Äîeven if you end up smelling like you‚Äôve been in the kitchen yourself. Trust me, it‚Äôs totally worth it!
Now, let‚Äôs talk about the food. The top three tacos you absolutely must try are the Carnitas, the Birria, and the Tinga served on a tostada. The flavors are incredible, reminiscent of the tacos I‚Äôve enjoyed in Mexico. One important tip: order one taco at a time. They‚Äôre best enjoyed fresh, as they tend to get soggy quickly.
If you‚Äôre in the mood for a drink after your meal, there‚Äôs a hidden gem‚Äîa speakeasy bar tucked away behind the kitchen. It‚Äôs a unique spot, but be warned, it‚Äôs not for the faint-hearted!
Overall, this place left such a great impression on me, and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back for more!', 'It is a small restaurant serving tacos, margaritas in the front. 2 tacos for ‚Ç¨9. Got the carnitas and lengua which was great. And a margarita for ‚Ç¨10. Then we went to the back which was behind an unassuming door which revealed a nicely decorated speakeasy. They had good drinks mixing spices and flavors. Would go again!', 'If you like cool cocktail spots put this near the top of your list. The front is a taco spot but don‚Äôt be fooled! Go to the back of the restaurant and you‚Äôll see a dingy swinging door that leads to a dark super cozy little hidden bar. The cocktails were excellent and mostly revolved around a Mexican/ Latino theme. I loved the hidden bar vibe, the cocktails were very great, didn‚Äôt get to have the food but this place is a must visit with some friends for a late night Bev.']

['Delicious seasonal food and always exciting lunch menu that changes every day - really fresh ingredients and refined beautiful plates. The brunch on weekends is also great - with options a la carte so you can build your own! The home-made granola is soo good!', 'Nice place for a simple lunch. Beautiful presentation. If the soup and side dishes can be served with the main dish, it would be more authentic Japanese.', "Lovely boutique hotel with great view over the Canal St Martin. Clean, good bed, friendly, helpful staff in a lovely and lively neighborhood of Paris. It's very close to the Gare de L'Est and Gare du Nord.
In the summer the canal is very busy, especially on Saturday nights, so do expect some noise (ear plugs are provided by the hotel).", 'when i arrived i was greeted by friendly and helpful staff, the resturant offed a suprising brunch on the weekends and a beatifully crafted menu on weekdays. Rooms have a lovely view and are fitted with thoughtfully chosen touches such as the toileties in the bathroom and even the tea bags. after speaking with staff, i learnt of the ECO ethos the hotel lives and breathes. a breathe of fresh air to say the least! it was even possible to leave my bags with reception while i explored paris after my check out. lovely hotel in a great neighbourhood. would recommend to friends and family', 'Sat night noise outside. It is a party area
But
What a delightful delightful boutique hotel with a lovely engaging front of house guy

Super large top floor room with canal views
Perfect']

Nom: Le Robinet d'Or(H√¥tel Restaurant quartier Gare du Nord Gare de l'Est, canal Saint-Martin)
Reviews: ['Exactly what we were after for our trip to Paris. Good room with everything we needed and excellent shower. Service and friendliness of all the staff (Terence in the bar/restaurant in particular) was a credit to your hotel. If we are back in Paris we will stay with you again.', "Incredibly clean and well thought out rooms with an attention to details. Built-in USB A and C ports for easy device charging. Comfortable bed. Shower with good shower pressure. L'Occitane toiletries and a Nespresso machine with ample pods in the room. Great heating in the winter. Quiet area with wonderful restaurants nearby. Easy access to the Metro system and walking distance to both Gare du Nord and Gare l'Est The hotel restaurant was particularly good and better than a lot of well regarded restaurants in the tourist areas. Nice staff that genuinely were approachable and wanted to help.", 'Excellent service. Close to Canal St Martin and a pleasant walk to Republique. The rooms are quite spacious for Paris. It was quiet, the bathroom was great - really nice shower. Bed was excellent and we had a coffee machine in the room, and a small fridge. No lift but we were only on the first floor. Very good breakfast - much better than most french hotel breakfasts. We also ate in the restaurant at night and it was really good.', 'Excellent and spacious room. Food serving is generous and very tasty! We were travelling with a one year old and many luggages, and was upgraded to suite.. super spacious not just compared to the usual paris standard, but by any standard! The room is beautiful, well decorated and spacious for our daughter to roam around. Ive been to many different hotels in paris and to boot, this one feels like a well-kept secret! Service was excellent! Will 10/10 come again!', 'We had a wonderful stay here. The staff were all incredibly kind and helpful. The rooms are lovely and very clean and comfortable. I highly recommend the petit-d√©jeuner, the selection of items is impressive and everything is very fresh. The location is also perfect, just a few minutes walk to a Metro station with many connections to get anywhere in the city.']

['We had the best French food in Paris last night! The dishes were incredible: black pudding, veal, sashimi sea bream, scallops, lamb kebab, squid, and chocolate mousse for dessert. The red wine paired perfectly with the meal. Highly recommend this place!', 'Very nice bistro and wine cave. Food is simple but delicious. Not overly heavy as tradition French cuisine might be, yet still had some interesting flavor combinations.', "Awesome atmosphere that's a bottle shop and with a limited wine by the glass option. The food is delicious and presented with flair. The owner was very proud of his cuisine. I might have offended him by just ordering one dish as I dropped by after a another lunch. This was highly recommended for wines. The service ceased however after I ordered my wines. Perhaps this is the Parisian service. The waiters are however very charming and I would love to visit again.", 'Starters were all epic!! We had canard and fish for mains and were both so tasty dishes. Ok it‚Äôs not average in prices but same goes for the taste. Service was excellent and even though we went for the cheapest wine option - since the list is big and also pricey- we were fully satisfied with our time there. Overall one of the expensive meals we had in Paris but definitely recommended!', 'Very delicious lunch at this small spot. The lamb kefta entree was stuffed with fresh herbs in an impossibly light pita. Friendly staff, nice natural wine list.']

['Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Best dish-desert. Both Pavlova and Cheese cake were superb. Lamb chops were delicious. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.', 'This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.', 'Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka. He takes classic French ingredients and adds Japanese flair. Each dish worked well with balanced, nuanced flavours that excited the palate. The rum baba is the best in the world. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.\nThe first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.)', 'The cuisine was superb!  The three course meal had four choices for each course and we (3) each chose different dishes to allow us to sample everything. The squid confit was amazing! Service was attentive and very friendly. Overall, a lovely experience. Highly recommended!', 'A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå']

['I went here for New Years Eve 2024. The menu was a prix fix. Service was amazing. The server was attentive and personable, making the bistro feel like a family-run establishment, but she still gave us space to enjoy the meal. The chocolate souffl√© is a must. Their addition of lime zest was such a twist that really elevated the dish.  I will definitely come back when I visit Paris next', 'Definitely a well above average lunch experience but the pricing is considerably above average as well.  All dishes were very good, such as the lobster bisque and the scallops and the chocolate souffl√© was part souffl√© and part moelleux for a creamy crispness that should be tried.  Wine by the glass was good and they are very careful with their pours.', 'This place was good for trying French cuisine. It wasn‚Äôt quite to my liking but good quality.

The scallops for starters were delicious, perfectly cooked and succulent.
We ordered the venison sharing platter (2 people). I personally found the meat very tough and fatty, and it was a very hearty, big portion. The vegetables were lovely.
Lamb and pork were also large portions, rich and hearty.

We ordered a chocolate souffl√© and a sponge with rum and cream. Chocolate souffl√© was great but the sponge with the rum was practically rum soup with some sponge. It was punchy!

Service was attentive and friendly for the most part, but I was a little disappointed by the snide remark when I said I don‚Äôt drink alcohol.

Think it just wasn‚Äôt to my palette.', "So, I just had the most amazing meal at Astier in Paris! Let me tell you, the scallops were just beautiful and so delicious. And you know what? I tried frog legs for the first time, and they were surprisingly yummy, flavorful, and so meaty!

The staff at Astier were incredible too. They were so friendly and had the best recommendations. We trusted every one of them, and they really made the whole experience extra special.

The place itself was so cozy, and it was the perfect way to end our vacation. It was a really French experience and I just can't wait to go back there! If you're ever in Paris, you've gotta check out Astier.", 'I came for the scallop but it was sold out. But the rest of the menu were also really good. Believe me the souffl√© is amazing with 3 different textures.
And the staffs were friendly, who tried to talk to me in Japanese.']

['Truly a PHENOMENAL meal. I‚Äôve been to Paris before and this was one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had. A great neighborhood atmosphere where people want to hang out after their meal with exceptional service and perfection in their food. The beef tartare is a must as well as all of the plats. There is not a single thing I ordered I wouldn‚Äôt order again or recommend to anyone looking for a great meal in the city. Tom (Hi Tom!) gave us the best wine recommendations to accommodate the entire groups taste and truly made us feel at home. I cannot recommend this place enough.', 'This place is now on my list of places to recommend when friends ask for restaurant recommendations when they visit Paris. Very inventive flavor combos, with a little Mexican inspiration. I really liked the crunchy salad. Great wine selection. Service was very friendly but unusually slow. There are many great options in this neighborhood and this is one of the best I‚Äôve found.', 'I was truly excited coming to the place. But as Warren Buffett says key to happiness is low expectations. Perhaps that‚Äôs the reason I was not too happy. I ordered cabbage entree and fish main (I believe it was cod). Cabbage was nice in texture and crunchiness but a bit to one dimensional in terms of Taste, I wanted a touch of sweetness or freshness in the end (to juxtapose the spiciness/ and pepper). Fish well .. the veggies been dead around it for far too long in order to resurrect that dish', "Came here with a friend~ great service! No English menu for those who need it but the waiters spoke English.
We had a lettuce salad with pumpkin seed sauce as appetizer, porkchop which was cooked very nicely with crispy skin (the skin was good) and the highlight, dessert, cake infused with bay leaf serviced with olive oil ice cream drizzled in olive oil. The dessert was very good! Never had anything like it and it was definitely a good experience üòã
I don't live in the neighborhood but do recommend for those who wanna dine away from the tourists in a calm area!
Had a really nice glass of Saumur wine too üëç", "Places like this deserve an option to give a sixth star. We were absolutely delighted with the food and service at Le Saint S√©bastien after a chaotic day of missed trains and gloom and doom weather. We were encouraged to order everything off the menu (we were a group of 4) and we were so glad that we did because everything was incredible. No notes! Run, don't walk to Le Saint S√©bastien if you're looking for a great dinner option."]

['The food is good but lower your expectations on having the same thing as the actual food in Cambodia. It‚Äôs understandable that the dishes are different as it is open in Paris and they have to make it mostly to satisfy the non-cambodians‚Äô tastes. Overall, it‚Äôs still a great restaurant.', 'We had a lovely time at this heavily underrated place! The food was absolutely amazing, and the service was top tier. Recommend x100', 'If you find this review helpful in some way, please give it a Like. Thank you ...

My friend who's been at this restaurant a few years back dragged me here for a lunch break even though it was a bit out of the way from where we were sightseeing. They must be popular in the neighborhood and in high demand - we went to their two "petit" locations (which didn't serve noodles with soup) before ending up at this "proper" location. All three locations were within walking distance & owned/operated by the same people. I'm very glad he dragged me here. They served both Cambodian & Vietnamese dishes. We had the spring rolls, pho with fried spring rolls & Cambodian chicken soup (I didn't realize this was served with rice, I requested to switch it out with noodle) along with fresh lemonade. Everything was authentic, delicious, vegetables were super fresh/plentiful and the meat (chicken, beef, pork) was tasty & cooked just right. I can see why it's very popular. I would definitely come back again & pay my friend forward by bringing others who haven't been here. There was indoor & outdoor seating. Be warned, the tables were very close to each other, the chairs were tiny and the table was tiny - we had to juggle all our orders. Also, beware smokers if you grab an outdoor table. Everybody made it work though.', 'Good food, bad service. It was very hard for the people to explain in English what kind of food they serve. The just put the food on our table and walked away. The taste was actually good, but not authentic (adapted to the taste of Paris people).', 'Recommended. Lovely Cambodian food in a nice setting just off Canal St Martin.
Loved the spring roll starter.
About ‚Ç¨54 for 2 - starters, mains and a carafe of wine.
We were there on a Sunday - seems to be open all day on Sunday.']

['Love this cheese restaurant! Will definitely be coming back again.
Since I open the door the cheese aroma is very strong and tasty, and apetiting.
Me and my best friend enjoying so much our fondue talk moments and also accompany with some delicious deli meats.', 'This raclette and fondu restaurant serves good quality cheese and generous portions! The lunch menu is good value for money, especially when you are hungry! üëå They also serve some local wines from Savoie to pair with your fondu.', 'I booked a romantic fondue dinner in Paris through The Fork app, which offered a 30% discount on the main menu. We enjoyed the cheese fondue and beef grill for our main course, followed by chocolate fondue for dessert. Although the waiter got distracted and forgot to bring part of our order initially, we reminded him and it was quickly resolved. Overall, it was a good experience with good food at a very reasonable price.', "Great place for lovers of raclette and fondu's! You may choose between fondus, traditional raclettes (with cheese) or meat. You will prepare the meal on grills integrated in the table. This makes it perfect for sharing. Note: you will get A LOT of food, so kids can share platters with grown ups.
We went as a family of 5 and everybody enjoyed the meal. It was a regular monday night, but the place were crowded, so we recommend reserving table. Friendly staff and good service. Perfect for a social and unformal meal.", 'Tourist place. Food is ok, but there are far better options. Setting is nice as you have the ‚Äúgrill‚Äù in front of you already installed as part of the table, so that is convenient. Wine is ok and reasonably priced. Service is not great either, not many smiles but lots of pressure to get out of the place to free the table for next service.']

Adresse: 19 Pl. de la R√©publique, 75003 Paris, France
Reviews:
['A French McDonald‚Äôs !

Went here very late night as it was one of the few places open. I don‚Äôt eat McDonalds here in the states so it was exciting to try it abroad.

The burger I got was unique and special to France but this was very bitter with a brown mustard and not enjoyable.

The macaroons on the other hand were amazing!', "Terrible absolute Terrible. How hard can it be to get a fast food Mac Big Mac. Place run by kids that aren't doing anything. They run around the back. Or out the front door to chat on cell phones while I'm standing and waiting. Others wait and watch. Let's try the places next door.", 'Two dark-skinned employees were very rude. I accidentally ordered here instead of takeaway so I politely asked skinny employee if I can get my order takeaway, so he looked at me with mean facial expression and just walked away without any words. 5 minutes later another (thicker) employee gave me my order but in place. So I asked politely again if I can get my order takeaway. This employee rolled his eyes and left me in mid-sentence. I finally got my order right but felt really offended. I don‚Äôt think people that dislike their job that much should be working on their job.', 'Nice place with fabulous view and also huge portion of ice cream üç¶ happy time spent there. Thanks McDonald‚Äôs', 'This gotta be the worst McDonald‚Äôs I have ever been in Paris all the black employees rude and disrespectful (I‚Äôm black as well) not a single ‚ÄúHello‚Äù they barely even look at you when you order my Big Mac came totally messed up I didn‚Äôt even bother to complain‚Ä¶ if you don‚Äôt like your job just leave or don‚Äôt apply‚Ä¶ simple']

['We visited this restaurant with our parents and loved the ambience. The staff was friendly as well. The food according to my family was great- however they had little to almost no options for vegetarians or people with allergies.
So that was a bit disappointing. The cocktails were also not up to the expectation as they sounded great in the menu but felt quite watered down unfortunately. I would recommend this spot for good non-vegetarian food and the ambience though.', 'Very nice environment and the food and drinks were good, however the main dishes were TINY and expensive, you need 2-3 main dishes to make up for 1ü§∑‍‚ôÄÔ∏è haha the rest was fine', 'Incredible location!

Looks like a museum but is actually a restaurant and bar.

A wonderful space for people to meet up and discuss in a unique setting.

Great food, fresh ingredients.

Vivid atmosphere and great energy.

The cocktails are incredible!

I highly recommend!', 'A true gem! Starting from the entrance, atmosphere and finishing with food and service. The waiters were very friendly and told a lot about the dishes they served. We came for dinner and later the place turned into a club-bar venue, so we also tried cocktails which turned out tasty as well. 10/10 recommend!', 'I was so exited to have a fish place. They keep the menu small so I thought the plates have to be amazing. The starters were really good, we had the  ceviche and the tuna. The main was very disappointing. I really liked the place, the service and the atmosphere but I think if the main is just better made and thought throughout this place would be a killer. The ingredients are good it was just the way they prepared it. I hope it‚Äôs going to change and I would love to come back. Until then have their two starters.']

['10/21/2024

Lovely dinner. The server was great and made sure we had everything the way we liked it. We sat outside but the indoor area looked really cute too. They made my food to the spice level I asked for, it was perfect and great taste.', 'Had a lovely lunch at MME Shawn, great service. The food is well cooked and had good flavour. The curry was light not overwhelming, which was appreciated. The papaya salad was good, wish it had a little less sauce. The chicken dish reminded of Kung Pao chicken, it‚Äôs was pretty tasty. As for a chain type establishment it‚Äôs good, perhaps not the most authentic Thai food however it‚Äôs delicious.  Will be back.', 'Great place with very beautiful ambiance and decorations !! Friendly staff and menu with lots of choices and options. Food presentation is vert beat and the portion is good. As for the taste I found it yummy!
All in all a great experience with good quality platters!', 'Excellent! Every thing on the menu is great. We took 3 different plats and what a pleasure! Highly recommended', 'A good variety of options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. We had the classic phad thai (vegetarian) the sauce was a bit sticky and the noodles was undercooked. The vegetarian thai red curry was brilliant, coconut base curry infused with lemongrass and bits of peanut. I would give 4 but -1 star for the ok service.']

["My experience with Korean food has always only been in restaurants since I never had the pleasure of visiting the country and this restaurant is pretty high on the list of places I've visited. The food was lovely and the staff was very helpful. My main reason for the 4 stars and not 5 was the quality of the kimchi which is very near and dear to my heart. It was a bit soggy and not as spicy as I'm used to. Don't let that discourage you from visiting this restaurant though as it's still very good quality food.", 'I saw the restaurant‚Äôs review and I was expecting the best Korean BBQ I have ever had. Unfortunately it was not the case. The food was OK. Everything was too sweet in terms of dishes and the quality of the meat as well as the marinades were slightly above average. The atmosphere in the restaurant though was great as it was buzzing. Not sure I would come back though.', "I had the pleasure of dining at this Korean BBQ restaurant in Paris and I must say it was a fantastic experience. The food was delicious and the service was excellent.

The menu offered a wide range of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. The meat was of high quality and perfectly cooked. The side dishes were also very flavorful and complemented the main course nicely.

The staff was very attentive and helpful, and they made sure that we had a great dining experience. The atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy and inviting, making it the perfect place for a night out with friends or a special occasion.

Overall, I would highly recommend this Korean BBQ restaurant to anyone looking for delicious food and great service in Paris. It's definitely worth a visit!", 'First time in a Korean restaurant and it was a pleasant experience. Never did such a bbq, so some guidance was needed and we got it there. The staff was friendly and helpful.
The food was delicious, have nothing more to add.
The atmosphere was nice as well, the interior of the restaurant fitted the kitchen.
