The opposite doses are neither displayed nor verifiable, and in addition extremely variable from one server to another.
We work in a building on Boulevard Gouvion Saint Cyr, and used to have lunch regularly at C√¥me, but many of us now prefer other places further away but more respectful of customers.', "I really liked the context of this restaurant, it's a very good idea to offer salads with a lot of diversity, the products are fresh, especially after physical training, it's perfect. The staff is warm with a manager who takes the time to offer you the best. I really enjoyed lunch at your place.", "The manager is horrible. The latter does not hesitate, in front of customers, to belittle his employees and speak badly to them. He quibbles about the quantities (very variable) while the price is exorbitant. It's been several weeks since I set foot there."]

["Been shopping here for the past couple of years, while we're in town. It's our favorite supermarket. üôÇ Definitely,  one stop shopping.", 'Just another minimarche', 'well organized', 'I give 5 stars for the staff who are really always smiling and for the non-stop opening days.\nOn the other hand, do something about the pests. I will not set foot in your house again as long as this smell of urine or mouse droppings is present. This is unbearable on every level.\nDo something quickly, this has been going on for several months.', "I happened to pass by the store today. It's a disaster. It smells like mouse urine. How is it possible that we do nothing? Where is the hygiene service?"]

['Visited beautiful Paris in December we had the best time, the hotel was in a lovely area we felt so safe walking back there late at night, the hotel was close to an RER station and metro. We arrived late at night and the welcome from the staff was so lovely, the hotel is typically Parisian and was so quaint, our room had everything we needed and it was so warm which was lovely as it was so cold outside,the breakfast was wonderful with everything we needed to set us up for our days visiting Beautiful Paris , we had the best time and we will definitely be back and would recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone', 'RJ is amazing and so helpful. All of the staff were amazing. Very nice place to stay. I would definitely stay here again. In tge middle of a nice neighborhood not too far away from everything.', "Really liked & appreciated a great welcome!  Merci monsieur Francis - soo Sweet was told of the surroundings and offered a coffee+ ü§ó especially from just arriving I also appreciate that respectfully!  üç∏‚òï
The style of the hotel is unique and eccentric.  There's definitely something that's been unique there.  Breakfast beautiful!  wish I stayed longer... Ohh and here's the thing about that,.. is I was so welcomed to stay another day seamlessly üíó.  That helped!
Much Joy,  üëã", 'My experience was awesome in This hotel
As its in a prime location
The rooms are clean although small
The recpetion and welcoming done all by this amazing person franz ‚Ä¶ he is such a nice welcoming helpful guy
The elevator stopped from working for a day
But franz made it easy for us as he would go the extra mile to help us', 'Very friendly and efficient staff.  Cute boutique hotel only 5 minute walk to the Metro.']

Adresse: 9 Pl. du Mar√©chal Juin, 75017 Paris, France
Reviews: ['The service here is incredible. Very attentive and friendly staff. The food is good and well executed, but lacked elevation as expected for restaurant of this caliber. We had the sea bass and scorpion fish, both of which were good, but not exceptional.', "Service was very poor. Only 1 server for an entire section of 10 tables. The seafood tower was not thoroughly prepared. The seafood had sand in it. The boiled shrimps were difficult to peel and eat. The entrees were very salty. When these matters were raised with the head host, he said to 'go and write a review.'... Strongly NOT recommending.", 'Delicious high quality dishes. Staff is attentive and not uptight at all for a place like this. However, no alternatives offered to any allergies / celiac guests so that‚Äôs a one star minus.', 'The seafood is excellent especially the lobster tartare, perfect! The dessert is also  distinct. The restaurant is just besides the metro and very convenient. The price is reasonable and the staff are very friendly.', 'Well, they seem to be under staffed as the service was a bit rush, was expecting a bit more attentive service for the price they charge.\n\nFood was great, especially the oysters. The Gillardeau here tasted noticeably better than other restaurants,  may be they have exclusive access to certain top grade oysters that other restaurants cannot get??? Just my assumption.']

["This is such a beautiful restaurant that I have been to before and i was just recommending it to my brother and his wife who will visit soon. I am slightly confused though as I work in the neighbourhood and I know it's been closed since at least May so how is it possible to negatively rate a restaurant when it is closed and you are claiming to have just eaten there. (Google absolutely needs to regulate this for ALL BUSINESSES, and maybe only allow posting with a link/receipt/photos etc). The food here is on another level (which explains the 2 Michelin ‚≠ê‚≠ê) . I especially love the fish dishes here, and the accompanying sauces which are always out of this world. And the desserts are just üòãüòãüòã All the staff here are truly wonderful, friendly and efficient. Strongly recommend here WHEN it reopens.", 'I would say I expect better service at a Michelin 2 star restaurant, based on the experiences I had in other Michelin restaurants. We had dinner at New Year Eve in this restaurant. And we spent around 907 euros in this restaurant.

In summary, food tastes are good. But I want to point out below issues I had for my dining experience:

First and most important one: for the dish ‚Äúblue lobster‚Äù, I found and ate one lobster shell in the dish. This is very dangerous: it can damage your tooth and even your throat/stomach if you swallow. So I pointed this out to the service staff, after long time waiting, finally the service manager came. The first reaction of this manager is, (here I quoted what he said), ‚Äúthis is normal, it is fresh‚Äù.  ‚Äî> this answer shocked me‚Ä¶  I don‚Äôt see the logic, freshness is irrelevant here. Even not fresh lobster can have shell, this is more about their food handling, this remaining and hidden shell in this dish can cause serious issues. And their first response is ‚Äúthis is normal and it is fresh‚Äù ???    The manager in the end apologized about this and said to give us free champagne as compensation. But I‚Äôm not comfortable with this whole process.

Second, the major service person who served our dish, became more and more sloppy when introducing the dish. In the end, he even did not finish one sentence when serving me the dishüòÇ  I mainly used the new year eve menu as my reference.

One last small issue is that when we asked if the water or sparkling water is complementary in our booked menu set, one of the service person said ‚Äúyes‚Äù. But in the final bill, we found it is not complementary. So we want a clarification. But the manager attitude is quite impatient, saying ‚Äúthis is impossible, I give you free champagne, but not free water‚Äù. ‚Äî> the champagne you gave, is due to the poor food handling and your apologies.  We already spent 840 euros as dinner reservation, do you think we really care about 20 euros of water??   So I lost patient and don‚Äôt want to argue anymore. The manager saw me and then said he will wave the water.', 'Absolutely amazing experience! We were seated with a view to the kitchen. The manager noticed our interest in gastronomy and we got into a conversation which made the whole experience even more memorable. The menu was fantastic and I remember most of the dishes vividly even after a year later (which is unusual).', 'The clumsy service, with dishes placed roughly, felt quite distant from the service expected at a two-star Michelin restaurant. Overall, it was disappointing compared to a meal over 500 euros.', 'Quick lunch stop in the neighborhood - üåü üåü Maison Rostang. Starting off with the amuse bouches (from bottom to top): ü¶Ä with clementine, curry and leek with an ü¶™ sauce as well as a little donut with mayonnaise. Next, different preparations of cauliflower with puffed buckwheat and a delicious, buttery puff pastry bread

Langoustine ü¶û with green peas \U0001fadb and grapefruit to add some acidity üòã . .

Green asparagus from Provence üíö served with kiwi and asparagus at the side and a curry vinaigrette. . .

Red mullet, crunchy fennel with lemon and a sauce made with foie üêüüî•üî• . .']

["I used to live near this bistrot so it's not my first time here - it is however my first time here under a new chef (Michelin ‚≠ê Chef with another restaurant) and staff  - it's been a few years since I last visited and throughout it all this bistrot stays consistent. Consistently excellent staff, Chef, produce and dishes. For starters, I took the Moules with pomme de Terre and a beautiful horseradish sauce. (My friend took a celeriac dish and her husband had a delicious champignon dish). For mains, my friend and I took Saint Jacques and topinambours and a delicious wine sauce (My friends husband took the couchon, done to perfection). For dessert, my friend and I took Millefeuile w/caramel and peanut sauce with rosemary ice-cream (exceptional ‚≠ê). My friends husband had the Ile flotant which we all tasted and was delicious üòã There are a few different menu options here including an amazing lunch menu 34euro, 3 course!!! We took √† la carte but we were happy to do so as we all thought the price was worth it. I recommend this place whether you are alone or in a huge group (I've done both) as its so welcoming and the Staff here give you an 'Irish welcome ' on your arrival and are very attentive but discreet, knowledgeable and friendly. I recommended just yesterday to my friends parents who will go there next weekü•Ç‚ú®", 'A very good restaurant. The food is really tasty.
Having been there multiple times, the 5 course meal and the 8 course meal are very tasty, the menu changes quite often. The food is very tasty. The service is very kind and the chef is very nice. The atmosphere can change: it is sometimes very intimate and quiet but it can also feel like a bistro being quite loud. In conclusion it is a really goods restaurant overall with ready food and nice staff.', 'We had high hopes for this restaurant considering it is part of a group that has many Michelin starred restaurants.
However, we were disappointed. We chose the degustation menu and to be honest all dishes lacked flavour rendering them forgettable. We had to ask for butter, as apparently they only serve bread here. When we asked for more butter, we had to do it twice and still it never arrived. The white wine was also served without an ice bucket. The service is nice and polite but the servers seemed overwhelmed with the tables. Also at some point, the noise coming from all tables was insanely loud.', 'Unexpectedly amazing meal. 5 course tasting was the perfect amount of food, not too much or too heavy at all. Next time we will do the 7 course! Beetroot ravioli was ingenious.
Staff was lovely and quite funny. Sommelier picked 2 really excellent wines for us and taught us some new things. We will definitely be back soon.', "Excellent throughout. Not only the food is top but we loved how relaxed and familiar the service felt here. A brilliant mix of fine dining and bistro vibes. And one of the best mix of Italian and French cooking I have experienced. Exceptional wine list and great recommendations from Giacomo, the hilarious sommelier. Please book in advance and trust the chef with the 5 course tasting menu, it is an absolute win. Can't wait to be back !"]

['The restaurant looks very nice, staff are very friendly. Unfortunately the food is not good, and not at all worth the cost. I would rather have Chinese food from a takeout place.', 'Amazing experience from start to finish, flavours, presentation, service and Mrs Ly herself was the kindest and warmest Chef l have ever met. She took time with each table to check on how the meal went and saw everybody out. She was extremely accommodating with families and children too. Definitely will go there again.
Rating of the overall experience: 10/10', 'Worst experience ever!
Imagine doing a reservation for a very special occasion and arriving on time for your reservation and then finding out that the restaurant is closed without prior notice.
Well, this exactly what happened with me with that restaurant. Even though I had reserved 4 days in advance and my reservation was confirmed, I arrived with my partner and the restaurant was closed. When I called them, they informed me that they had a technical problem but nobody tried informing me. Instead of saying sorry, they disrespected me over the phone.
I would never ever go again to that restaurant as they have ruined my special occasion and didn‚Äôt even say sorry.
NOT RECOMMENDED!', 'Best service we have recieved during our stay in Paris. Staff were super friendly and ordering/receiving food was fast. Food was superb. Highly recommend!', 'Good dinner at Chez Ly in an elegant authentic Chinese setting. Food is good but service could be more attentive and friendly.']

["Over the counter service is very bad, the staff are not prompt to deliver the food for take away leaving it on the counter while finishing their conversation. The sushi was warm and taste funny in taste and had to be thrown away to avoid food poisoning. Will not make a return to the restaurant as it is doesn't have any quality to be serving Japanese Food and in my opinion has failed HACCP Hygiene Standards by not actively practicing whilst ignoring the basic fundamentals of Restaurant Operations.\nService-0, Efficiency-0, Food-0, Hospitality-0, Customer Experience-0, HACCP-0.", 'Very nice staff and cool sushi/maki combos', 'Bad quality. Worse sushi I have had. The rice was dry from sitting out too long. The rolls are pre made and not fresh. Would not recommend at all.', "Fast service and sushi are already ready when you come. Great to just pick up food and go.\nSelection isn't varied, there are no menus and it's a bit on the expensive side.", 'It‚Äôs delicious but not 100% fresh']

['I did not know we could associate good, sushi and kosher. Very impressed.', "We searched a nice kosher sushi on paris, and nina sushi is one of nina sushi's restaurant chain.
The location isn't great, and the restaurant not really welcoming.
The waiters dont know english at all.
The price is average to prices in paris.
There is no sauces except soy sauce and teriyaki, and they dont have any gluten free dishes.
On the other hand, the sushi itself was really good, and came after 3-4 minutes ( 6-7 rolls).", 'Spent 15 euros here, they got my order wrong, it was to go. Only noticed once I got home. Forgot pieces of sushi and gave me end pieces of the sushi roll, that were empty inside.', 'Really delicious. Great service', 'Food is good. Rhe guy behind the bar is not friendly']

Adresse: 12 Pl. du Mar√©chal Juin, 75017 Paris, France
Reviews:
['What a lovely find this was. It was quite close to our hotel and the review looked good so booked quite an early table. The food was exquisite and the flavours were sensational. My wife also enjoyed a well balanced cocktail, something that we had found in other areas in Paris was jot so good, bring so strong almost undrinkable! Here however, it was perfect. Service was good and although my limited French with their limited English, we managed to get exactly what we wanted and was perfect! üòÇ', 'Was recommended by a friend and visited for dinner on a weekend. It was quiet in the restaurant in the early evening and I was quickly attended by the staff. Tried the Calamar Risotto (squid / seafood) accompanied by white wine. The serving of risotto came in a large, deep bowl that was heated up and kept the food warm till my last spoonful. The squid was splendidly fried but keep soft to the bite. The were two fried prawns and some sliced scallops. All of the seafood were very fresh and good quality and were given a right amount of salt that brought out the taste. The serving of risotto was generous, light in taste and had more of a porridge consistency rather than al dente but was nice and savoury. It balanced the taste of the seafood that was fried with garlic. The meal came with a bread basket and small appetisers of olives and blanched almonds. There was no need / no room for starters or desserts. Good experience but a tad pricey.', "Very nice and quite restaurant. The food is just done right and the service is top notch.
Try the milles feuilles; yes, you'll have to go back to the gym üòÅ", 'Service was great. Iberian pork steak was absolutely amazing.
Mussels with truffle wasn‚Äôt my favorite but that might be just my taste.

Thanks for the üç∑ Mademoiselle', 'Not quite as nice as before remodeling. Expensive for the quality and service.']

Nom: Le Grenier du Rire D√Æner Spectacle Paris
Reviews: ['We had a fantastic evening with the family. Great humorist & magician and warm welcoming from the owner. Cozy atmosphere and a lot of fun. Will come back soon!', 'Loved the ambiance and show. It was the perfect place to have a fun night out with my husband. üòú', 'Great experience. Great comedians. Great show!', 'Unique', 'Super moment']

['Very nice experience !
I highly recommend this restaurant. We went for dinner and it was beyond delicious.
Everything was perfect, from the welcoming staff to the tasty meals and drinks. One of the best burgers we‚Äôve had in town so far. The appetisers were also fresh and really well done.
I recommend !', 'The food was super good the burgers are delicious and juicy the portions are big and fairly prized', 'It has been a year since I moved to Paris and almost every week I try a new burger. Went to all the hyped ones from social media and before today, I still could not say that I found a burger that I REALLY enjoyed. But this placed changed everythig. Literally the best burger in Paris so far. Great ambiance, great service and really great food. 150% reccomend it!', "Restaurant Review: Schwartz's in Montreal vs. Schwartz's in Paris

Schwartz's, renowned for its legendary deli offerings, has made its mark not only in Montreal but also in Paris. Here‚Äôs a comparison of the two iconic locations:

Ambiance and Atmosphere:
- **Schwartz's in Montreal:** The original Schwartz's in Montreal exudes an old-world charm. The narrow, bustling space is filled with the aroma of smoked meats and the chatter of loyal patrons. It‚Äôs a no-frills, authentic deli experience that makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped back in time.
- **Schwartz's in Paris:** Schwartz's in Paris, while maintaining the essential deli vibe, offers a more modern and spacious setting. The decor pays homage to its Montreal roots with vintage posters and photos, but with a chic Parisian twist. It‚Äôs comfortable and inviting, yet manages to keep the essence of a classic deli.

**Food Quality:**
- **Schwartz's in Montreal:** The smoked meat at Schwartz's in Montreal is legendary. Thick, juicy slices of perfectly seasoned beef, served on rye with mustard, are the star. The poutine, pickles, and coleslaw are must-try sides that complete the experience.
- **Schwartz's in Paris:** The Paris location impressively replicates the flavors of Montreal. The smoked meat is just as tender and flavorful, and the portion sizes are generous. However, some purists might notice a slight difference in the seasoning, possibly due to local ingredient variations. The menu also includes some Paris-specific additions, which are delightful but not traditional.

**Service:**
- **Schwartz's in Montreal:** Service at the Montreal Schwartz's is quick and efficient, though it can sometimes feel rushed due to the high volume of customers. The staff are knowledgeable and friendly, adding to the charm.
- **Schwartz's in Paris:** The Paris Schwartz's offers a more relaxed dining experience with attentive and courteous staff. They take the time to explain the menu and make recommendations, enhancing the overall dining experience.

**Overall Experience:**
- **Schwartz's in Montreal:** There‚Äôs nothing quite like experiencing the original Schwartz's in Montreal. It‚Äôs a culinary pilgrimage for deli lovers, offering an authentic and unforgettable taste of Montreal‚Äôs food culture.
- **Schwartz's in Paris:** Schwartz's in Paris is a fantastic homage to its Montreal counterpart. It captures the spirit and flavors of the original while adding its own Parisian flair. It‚Äôs a great option for those craving a taste of Montreal in the heart of Paris.

In conclusion, both locations of Schwartz's have their unique appeal. Montreal offers the authentic, original experience, while Paris provides a slightly more polished and leisurely version of the beloved deli. Either way, you‚Äôre in for a treat!", "Everything was great. The waiter's recommendations were good. They do not use pork as meat."]

['Just bought some grocery from their store early evening today.
Products are well arranged so as the fruits and vegetables.
So you can find what you need right away.
üëåüòÄ', 'Not expensive..', 'Normal super market', "Compared to other grocery stores I've seen in Paris, it's not bad, great variety of fruit and vegetables, let's say it has practically everything.
Prices are quite high. But like everything in Paris.", "A variety of fruits and vegetables, fruits and vegetables, vegetables, fruits, hygien‚Ä¶ Accueil sympathique.

Very useful when coming home from work, the shop closes at 8.30pm. Great variety of products. Fruit and vegetables, groceries, alcohols, fresh and frozen drinks, hygiene... Friendly welcome.

A variety of products. From frutas to verduras, from drinks to alcohol, from bebidas to congeladas, higiene... Una bienvenida amistosa.

Very useful when I get home from get off work and the store closes at 8:30 pm. A wide range of products. Fruit and vegetable department, grocery store, alcohol, fresh and frozen drinks, hygiene... Friendly welcome.

The store closes at half past 20 o'clock for business purposes and convenience.Ë±äÂØå„Å™ÂìÅÊèÉ„Åà. Green fruit shop, Yabaiya, Aroko, fresh drinks, Frozen food, hygienic noodles... Friendly welcome"]

['We enjoyed most of the food and find it super interesting as there were many regular ingredients that was used differently.

We had a meat dish, while it was tasty, I couldn‚Äôt chew on the tendons on the meat, therefore had to use the restroom and spit it out. There was a fly that keeps coming to our table, but it is quite common in Europe so I wouldn‚Äôt say that‚Äôs a big deal.

We didn‚Äôt really enjoy the fruit dish, but for all the others we loved. The three types of butter were all great, but if you‚Äôre not used to French bread or just whole wheat bread, you might think the bread is a little too dry.

We had apple and pear juice. The apple juice was okay, but the pear juice was actually good.

The bottles place behind our seats were a kinda dirty. There was a lot of dust inside it, they should probably clean it more often.

Overall it wasn‚Äôt the best experience, but the good foods were really delicious.', "I ate here for lunch as recommended online to avoid the high dinner prices. The food was very good and the overall experience was about what you'd expect from a Michelin star restaurant, with elaborate place settings and procedures for everything to make it a fine dining experience.

With all that said, my gripes are as follows... They asked if we wanted champagne when we were seated, before receiving any menus. We weren't sure if it was part of the fixed menu or not, and we really should have asked. It turned about to be 24 Euros per glass... yikes. I understand that a lot gourmands go into spots like this to take in the whole experience regardless of the cost, but it seemed a bit of a price gouge. We certainly would have declined the offer had we known the price.

Excluding the champagne, it came out to about 60ish Euros per person including water for the fixed menu. I would consider this reasonable for the experience, but the food was not as good as I've had at other Michelin star restaurants, hence the 4 star rating.", '#41 see my reviews of all the Paris Michelin Stars.
Humble and Flamboyance. Endearing duo.

The interesting thing here is the result of two different characters. You have Laurent Lapaire, the flamboyant owner that spotted future multiple stars chef. You can feel his influence in the styling of restaurant for example. It‚Äôs very ¬´\xa0cosmopolitan ¬´\xa0, with modern design, beautiful tableware and even waiters that are not the typical old school √©toil√© staff. The other influence is the love for the good product and his passion for haute cuisine (basically, he goes to Michelin Stars during his spare time‚Ä¶). Interestingly enough, he s the type of character that you encounter with old school chef that owns their restaurant, very lively, opinionated, with a little light in his eyes. It‚Äôs more typical of the old school big name chef. Still, I appreciate a strong character with a passion. I‚Äôve noticed in some reviews here, that‚Äôs some may be put off by that. I understand. Still, you have to recognize that he brought some great chef to the Michelin world. I‚Äôm fine with a strong character from Brittany as long as he delivers.
Which brings me to the second point: the chef. I had the good fortune to speak with him after the meal. He‚Äôs just like his cuisine. Very humble, hiding his maturity, playful, just enjoying making great cuisine by making the most out of the seasonal ingredients. He‚Äôs not there for the fame, nor the money, he‚Äôs there for the beauty of it. I find it very refreshing and it does give me hope in an era geared toward the show and the visual (top chef, Instagram - on which I am ;-)).
The interesting result is it does work. The combination of those two different characters manages to work, and I guess it‚Äôs because they have in common the love for the good ingredients.
The mood/dressing code seems to be modern yet relax. I had a business friendly lunch, I saw birthday, I guess it can also work for couple.
Still, I‚Äôll put it more in the Haute Cuisine side, even if the character of chef is not pretentious.
It‚Äôs a very solid one star.
I had a great experience, and it grew on me after a couple of days (I never write the reviews just after, like the wine, you want to let it develop), resulting in a very endearing memory.

Update 2022: After years of helping chefs reach new stars (the list is so crazy with Septime, Toutain, Alliance etc‚Ä¶), the Agape manager found a Madonna. And it does bring a change in the house to have a lady. Ok, the Madonna reference was there because the new chef, Rebecca Lookwood, was her personal chef. Her resume doesn‚Äôt stop there by far. Top chef star in Brazil, formally trained in one of the best school in Paris, she even became journalist for a while.
Ok, what‚Äôs interesting? What does it mean for you? It means that the angle and even some of the ingredients will be very different from your average one star. She brings this diversity in the plate, with yet an attention to balance it. Interestingly, she‚Äôs from an English/Brazilian marriage, and I guess she‚Äôs used to be in between cultures. I would also note that being from Amazonia she is naturally eco concerned with a touch of interest in the ingredients medicinal power.  Extremely interesting and I‚Äôm looking forward to see her grow with Laurent s help. Speaking of medicinal power, he‚Äôs a strong advocate for the ‚Äúvin nature‚Äù (organic wine), which makes this restaurant way more ‚Äúeco concerned ‚Äú and ‚Äúexotic ‚Äú than it looks (and than others that are more into communication).

Even if it‚Äôs a new chef, given both track records, it‚Äôs definitely still a very solid star.', 'My wife and I had the 10 course tasting menu. What started off feeling a bit stuffy ended up being a fun experience. This is a one group/couple per table per night place. The whole tasty experience took 2.5+ hours, we enjoyed every last dish, even the "mouth preparer" aka palate cleanser.', 'A rather average experience, given that this establishment is a one Michelin star, in comparison to other in Paris.

Service was ok, it was lukewarm some staff were more affable than others.

However I am not here for the service. This year the restaurant celebrates its tenth year. I went to lunch, lunch is usually the cheaper option in comparison to dinner service. That is  not to say i did not splurge.

What I did like were - the lobster dish & the sweetbread.

What I dislike were - This is an easy fix, temperature in the dinning room should be comfortable, i know it‚Äôs cold and wet outside in Paris, as a dinner I don‚Äôt want to feel like I am in the kitchen with the chef. The anniversary menu was more expensive & was suppose to be a surprise, well everything on it were on the a la carte menu..if that was the surprise then yes it worked.

There were several options ala carte,3 courses, 5 courses and the anniversary menu which is effectively 7 courses. My advice if you decide to go choose the 3 courses or 5 courses or a la carte.

Overall there were some exceptional cooking, even with simple dish of beetroot collection was exceptional, however the 2 full size deserts was very unexpected and tipped the experience to feeling like you‚Äôve been overfeed and feel liked a stuffed turkey.
Also very surprising was the absent of a cheese course, seems like a serious misstep for a French restaurant.

So these were the reasons for the rating.']

["We took the 8 course tasting menu and the whole experience was fantastic! Each plate is meticulously presented then described by the waiters, which by the way are very professional. The food looks artistic and high quality, and there's an explosion of taste after each bite. The plates are generous too, as we were getting quite full after the 5th serving. Will definitely visit the restaurant again to try their next menu.", 'Me and my wife chose Frederic Simonin restaurant for our anniversary dinner after thorough research. And our experience exceeded all our expectations. We had a 4 course tasting menue, which in reality were more like 6, due to amuse-bouches sent between dishes. Services was top notch and even Frederic himself came out to say hi to all guests. All and all amazing experience, highly recommend! Mash potatoes were un-be-lie-vable! Thank all staff for making our special day truly special!', 'We chose the 8 course tasting menu. The food is very well made and presented. Some of the dishes are very tasty.
The restaurant has a nice decor and it feels very nice.
The only downside was the waiting time between dishes. Some of the waiting times were actually very long.
The waiters could be a bit nicer. The whole experience is not only about the food, the atmosphere and the service are complementary to the dining experience and that is why I say the waiters could be nicer and friendlier.', 'We just had the most wonderful family dinner here. The staff are truly lovely, the food was delicious, and overall it was a lovely, relaxed evening. There was a mix of end of year work functions, families and couples having dinner. We went for 5 courses with matched wine and were extremely full by the time we finished! The food was beautifully presented with refined flavours that interested us all. Highly recommend.', "Just noticed my review didn't get to be published
Visited in 2022

Restaurant design, entr√©e and desserts are great!
It was a good experience overall apart from our lady server who seem to be out of place in the restaurant‚Äî lacks warmth, being more personable, passion in what she does‚Äî we find that she needs more training in the service industry (as simple as placing the butter knife when it fell on the table after she moved the bread and butter on the corner of the table to serve the mains).
We're still considering to bring business meetings here should there be any guests in the future but hopefully the lady server have progressed by that time."]

['Lunch with colleagues and it was excellent! At times, I‚Äôve found Indian cuisine - at least in Paris - to have too much oil. Not the case here. Ordered the Naan Massala and lamb palak and bioth were excellent. Will return for sure.', 'We had a wonderful dinner here! The owner was so friendly and was attending to our table with respect and consistency. The food was delicious and !actually spicy! which for France is quite rare and much appreciated! The decor is beautiful and authentic and the owner explained how the wonderful sauces were his own personal recipes. The street was quiet which allowed us to have a very calm and personal experience, something that we always appreciate. The mango lassi was fresh and delicious ü§§ Don‚Äôt miss out on this while in Paris!', 'Nice music in the background. Restaurant is cute in ambience. Food was good but nothing exceptional. Garlic naan was very good.', 'Very good food and especially wonderful people. I recommend !!', 'Loved the mutter paneer and laccha roti. Havent had laccha roti which is completely made of whole wheat. The spicy chutney was amazing and one of a kind.']

['Classic. Creative, nicely plated cuisine. Favorite place with the locals, but Mario (the owner, I think) can handle at least 4 languages with ease. Fine dining setup for everything except red wine glasses could be better. Indoor & outdoor seating available. Good wines.', "Such a delightful spot - typical old-school Parisian charm and cuisine. Friendly service, they gladly split a main between two kids. It's an intimate spot - not sure why it isn't packed.", 'The best French restaurant with a great authentic atmosphere.

Thank you, chef Mario, making meals so delicious and for your beautiful smile!

Highly recommended!', 'Had lunch with my wife..........our new favorite restaurant.  From the greeting to the cafe........a great lunch experience.  Very happy with the food.  Service is tip top.  Clean.  Highly recommend.  Manage your expectations.....not a Michelin star or toque......but a place you want to frequent.  Full of regulars/locals as the owner was on a first name basis with most of the tables.  Will go back next week.', 'Great little gem in Paris! Small and intimate restaurant. Great honest and well-priced food. Where the locals come. Lucky if you get a table. Best for 2 people. Bon appetite!']

Adresse: 1 Pl. du Mar√©chal Juin, 75017 Paris, France
Reviews:
["Cute little spot with decent food. Wasn't too terribly overpriced. The beef and onions was better than the carbonara.", "The food was good, the atmosphere was alright but I have to say, some of the best service we've witnessed in any restaurant.

We wanted a restaurant that served French food near us and this one did. There were a lot of beers and wines to select from so we asked the waiter and he nominated 2 from our requests which were amazing. We tried others after and all paled in comparison. He was very friendly and attentive. We had to highlight how good service he provided. His name was Sandy. Again, one of the best service experiences we've had.

The food was good. Our starters were very nice. The mains were good and the deserts were very good and reasonable (so mixed).

The restaurant itself looked like it could do with a clean and maybe a sprucing up with. It was nice and supplied our needs though. Again, the highlight was the extremely high level of service provided by the waiter. Thank you again and we will return next year. üëç", "Adel was an excellent waitress. The atmosphere here is good with it being right next to the Metro train entrance. I would recommend the duck that had very tasty skin. The veal was also good but had a little bit of fat. The fish and chips could have been better but the cod didn't have any seasoning (very bland ).", "Ws our go to Cafe as we were staying around the corner.  Food was pretty good had lots of drinks and laughs here.  If only service could be just a little better.  Oh way it's Paris.", 'We wanted to have a late night dinner near out hotel. This place was great for place for drinks. We ordered the mussels with champagne and a side of fries.  The seating was opened and our server was prompt. The night was cool so another order of champagne did the trick. Great spot for tourist that was close to the trains and hotels.']

["Came to celebrate my birthday.  Lovely atmosphere but my steak was chewy, not great, and I found a hair in my fries. Even though my friends said their pasta and risotto was all right. Wine was good. I don't think I'll come again.", 'Good food, nice ambience, attentive service staff.', 'Nice French resto with a lot of options. The prices are reasonable & the service is great. Had a birthday here and did not dissapoint. The only drawback was that it the taste of the food was just good, not great or unbelievable, and this is not a bad thing actually.', "The chef did a great job with the food selection for the New Year's Eve dinner! We enjoyed the sea bass and beef dishes, with elegant presentation and generous portions. Friendly, cozy and chic atmosphere tucked away in a lovely neighborhood. Thank you for making our family's NYE dinner special!", 'Loved the place ! Food and drinks are of good quality and staff is nice and welcoming. Prices might be a bit high but you won‚Äôt regret it.\nTo top it off the blind test on the first floor and the private room allow you to plan for more than just a nice meal.']

['Good morning,

I tried to contact the owner of this restaurant a few months ago. Having not received a response. I leave this little message here.

I would like to know if the owner would be interested in my proposal which is to reopen the restaurant so that we can work together on a new artistic project.

You can contact me so that we can discuss it and I can present to you this beautiful project dedicated to mental well-being and creativity for all.

Sincerely,
Racha Gouasmi', 'Very beautiful products, beautiful cuisine.
Welcoming and warm service.', 'Excellent fish restaurant, surely one of the best in Paris.', 'An enigma... never opened...', '']

["One of the greatest food experience in Paris. Dishes, descriptions, ingredients, athmosphere‚Ä¶ You absolutely must try this culinary experience so as not to miss the opportunity to taste the chef's specialties. You will be extremely satisfied, for the courtesy, competence and ability shown off during dinner.", 'If you would like to try Michelin start restaurant with a reasonable budget I would recommend this place.
Excellent service and very friendly staff .
The food itself was an interesting experience , most of the dishes were very creative and an explosion of flavors.
The wine selection is on point and amazing.
The only comment is for the souffl√© as a dessert , it was a bit basic compared to the other dishes and it lacks creativity.', 'After admiring the classical art at the Louvre, I found it perfectly fitting to indulge in a Michelin-starred French traditional restaurant. Both starters are fantastic: the classic terrine stuffed with foie gras and chestnut was an exquisite taste of French culinary heritage, and I especially loved the luxury of scallop carpaccio with truffle. The lunch was incredibly well-priced considering the premium ingredients and quality. To top it off, the chef and owner Jacques Faussat was present, and I even got a photo with him‚Äîan unforgettable experience!', 'Amazing place
Was my birthday so my hubby surprised me with lunch here

Staff Sofier and Cril are so kind and friendly even spoke good English. They patiently explained the dishes and are very professional. Both of them so well groomed

Ambiance is elegant Cosy yet not overly fancy.  Loved the original wall which must have been hundreds of years old

Portion is good, lunch menu is super reasonable esp for those who wants to try Michelin restaurant without breaking the bank', "An absolute joy of a first experience with Michelin dining. The oysters in salt water gel on foi gras was a wonderful surprise.  The fenneled duck breast with butternut puree and roasted carrots was a lovely main course before a surprise offering of a cheese terrine.  Dessert of an apple tatrele with honeyed ice cream was a simple yet fabulous way to round out the night. Service was courteous,  attentive and patient with language barriers.  Would certainly recommend if you're in Paris and looking for a reasonably priced Michelin experience!"]

Nom: School Hospitality Of Paris - School Jean Drouant
Reviews:
['Nice college
Awesome facility
Nice faculty
Will teach you  untill unless you are not perfect in that part
Nice trick
Spacial thank you to this college for giving such knowledge in culinary arts
Love you all', "Rest
Great concept! The restaurant offers the school's students the opportunity to showcase their knowledge of the profession in a friendly environment, accompanied by their teacher.

Beyond the service which was very good, the menu offered was coherent, delicious and the price completely reasonable! We paid ‚Ç¨44/person for a desert starter menu, a cocktail and a glass of wine each.

We went on Thursday and we were welcomed by Mathieu who was able to advise us on suitable wines and explain the dishes offered. I wanted to keep the menu a surprise for my boyfriend and he played the game well by helping me do it in a good mood.

The experience was very pleasant and we plan to come back soon!", 'Excellent meal and very warm welcome from the students. Julie from the room service with her kindness took great care of the meal. Experience that we will repeat!', 'Very pleasant taste experience!
Very warm welcome and very good service in the restaurant of this great school.
Or we appreciated the emerging talent of the young waiters in the room, a little reserved, but full of goodwill and kindness.
The menu was very tempting and the dishes as beautiful to look at as they were to taste! Hats off to the chef and his brigade!
We had a great time and will definitely come back!
THANKS.', 'Very disappointing experience due to a poor quality meal.
Despite a pretty room and friendly young waiters, the cuisine was not at the level of a training restaurant but more of a canteen.
Yet with a menu at 25‚Ç¨, which is higher than in other practical restaurants but with a much lower quality and presentation of the dishes, if not ordinary; It‚Äôs a shame and regrettable.']

["An above average pizza place with large portions and affordable prices, especially considering the neighborhood. The menu includes pasta, raviolis and white pizza. There are vegetarian choices, but nothing that would make a vegan feel at home. The decor is nice and the service is good, making this a solid option for lunch if you're in the neighborhood, and a great option if you're looking for pizza.", 'I ate the most amazing pizza in Paris. The staff recommended the perfect wine, and they were polite and quick. I enjoyed it so much; I highly recommend this restaurant.', 'Having lunch here since the surroundings are closed because it‚Äôs Sunday. The food is ok and nothing specials from the taste..\n\nThe waiter is very helpful and kind', 'Marko from –¶—Ä–Ω–∞ –ì–æ—Ä–∞ is the cherry on top of this amazing delicious restaurant', 'Great Italian food, cozy place and a special thanks you to Marko']

["Le Bistro d'Alberto in Paris offers a five-star dining experience with exceptional service that sets it apart. The ambiance is cozy yet sophisticated, providing the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable meal. Each dish is a culinary masterpiece, crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients that burst with flavor. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring that every guest feels pampered and special. From the exquisite appetizers to the decadent desserts, every bite is a testament to the chef's skill and creativity. For an extraordinary dining experience in Paris, Le Bistro d'Alberto is an absolute must-visit.", 'Absolutely the BEST meatballs (Boulettes de Boeuf) I have ever had!', 'Best restaurant ever.\nAlways fresh food and welcoming.\nCarbonara best + tiramisu', 'Very very deliciousüòã', 'Correct.']

['Nice restaurant with good food. The menus were in French so we used the Google translate app to read them but the server spoke English and was very helpful in suggesting different menu items. The menu had a nice variety and interesting choices. Prices were fair for Paris. Would definitely recommend!', "Tasty. Chicken Egg rolls are fantastic. So are s√∂mai. Sesame chicken is delicious, but unlike anything I've had in the US as the sauce is a dipping sauce instead of the chicken being cooked in it, and the sauce itself is also completely unlike sesame chicken sauces stateside. The garlic rice is another dish in highly recommend.

It did feel like the staff couldn't be bothered with us, perhaps because we speak English. They also did not bring water often, nor bring enough as the carafe filled less than 1.5 glasses and we were 3 people.

Portions are very European and dishes are mostly in the $‚Ç¨20-25 range.", 'Kosher Chinese restaurant with great comfort food and classic Chinese dishes. Lots of food for small money. Very fast service.', 'So good! Very friendly staff, portions are very satisfying, flavor is delicious (like so delicious...must get the egg rolls!), and the wait time for the food was short. Overall amazing experience. Highly recommend!!', 'Omg! If you like Chinese food and you‚Äôre kosher - eat here! This is the most authentic Chinese food I‚Äôve ever eaten that was kosher - baring the fact there‚Äôs no pork or shrimp but hey‚Ä¶What an amazing meal‚Ä¶. Wish we had a restaurant like this in Jerusalem!']

['Cozy family run restaurant with good Portuguese home style food and excellent service by the staff. Arrived at 5 for drinks ended up staying for dinner, kitchen opens at 19:00.\nWill definitely return on my next trip to Paris', 'Lovely, family-run Portuguese resto with decent prices and great foods. We ordered chicken leg and ribs, both were great. Staff was friendly too and the whole place had a great atmosphere.', "We went for a beer and end up to stay for dinner.  The service was ok, is family business. Fresh beer and some olives for snack. Then the Bacalhau with patatos, huge portion was served. The restaurant is a cozy place, but I didn't like the decoration.The price is fair, 40 euros for 2 meal and 4 beers.", 'Wonderful food and great prices (worth the portions)', 'Arrived there before dinner hours and waited for 2hrs with beers and snacks. It was pouring down with rain, but we didn‚Äôt care as we new it was worth it. First time in Portuguese restaurant and it was delicious. Very friendly atmosphere and warm welcoming service. Definitely a must go in Parisüòá Obrigadaüôè']

['A really nice surprise in Paris. The food was good with fair prices. The ingredients were treated nicely and with respect which I always appreciate. The place has a cool but classic deco and the service was very nice, asking if everything was fine and making sure I had everything I needed. Definitely recommend the place. If you happen to go to some fair in Paris, it is in walking distance.', 'Very Nice place offering a nive menu of French cuisine with reasonable prices.

We had Soup de chef and terrine de reblochon et pde terre au poid fumee as starters

As main dishes we had a beouf bourguigon, yhe Piece de Boucher, Blanquette de la mer,  a Salade cesar and a Tartares de boeuf avec frites maison.

All items were 5/5 fresh tasty and mouth watering except the caesar salad was average though the chicken that cones with it was nicely cooked and juicy although it is a breast.

Staff are very welcoming and friendly. the person that attended to our table was smiley, patient taking our order and simply lovely.

Definitely recommend', 'nice vibes, friendly staff, have english menu!', 'Great menu, staff were very friendly, nice decor and a good view into Paris. Would highly recommend!', 'Very nice ambiance. Typical Parisian bistrot. Tartare nice, onglet as well. Smiling waitress. All good']

Adresse: 22 Rue Th√©odore de Banville, 75017 Paris, France
Reviews: ['Though I haven‚Äôt written reviews, I felt compelled to write this one to highly recommend this place.  We have felt welcomed and valued as customers from the very first time we dined at Le Petit Banville. It is a small, family-owned, and managed restaurant with excellent food and service. There are quite a few menu options without straying from a core French menu. The food is delicious. If you are looking for the French bistro experience, this place is authentic. Because dishes are made in-house, each time it really feels like having a home cooked meal. It‚Äôs perfect for couples wanting a cozy, intimate setting. It‚Äôs not fancy, but it is warm and real. Families with younger kids rest easy. They are family-friendly, with kid-friendly options. Getting there is easy also. It is just a short walk from metro lines and from Parc Monceau.  It‚Äôs worth it.', "Lovely small French restaurant with a homely feel. Had the butcher's cut (Morceau du boucher) with white wine. The beef steak was grilled and meat rare as I ordered. Came with a small salad and fries. Overall, the serving was small but suited my evening appetite. Enjoyed the cripsy fries very much. The steak was average. The cheese sauce helped lift the taste. The white wine recommended was nicely chilled. Good service and affordable meal.", 'What a lovely restaurant. Linda was our server, she is a gem and worth her weight in gold. She did a wonderful job dealing with our loud family of obnoxious Americans, she made excellent recommendations, and got all our orders perfect. Ask her what to order and then listen to her- she knows her stuff.\n\nThe chicken risotto is delicious!', 'This is an absolute gem of a small family restaurant. Good food, good wine, served in a charming surroundings. Just good traditional food, well done in a lovely setting. You may find better food in Paris but you will not beat this place as an all round great restaurant.', 'Just the restaurant you need if you want comfortable Parisian experience with really good food and excellent staff.  So glad we went there.']

['Nice place, the food was good but not more or less than expected. A solid sushi place that delivered upon my expectations. I was there about 1 hour before closing not much people and cozy.', 'Had dinner here and ordered Menu R3 - a set with a plate of sashimi (3 slices each of salmon belly and tuna), 2 nigiri (salmon and tuna) and 3 sticks of yakitori (chicken ball, chicken steak and beef wrapped in cheese). The set comes with rice, miso soup and a salad. Very fresh and good quality sashimi. Yakitori is freshly grilled, meaty and tasty. Tried the Japanese sake also that came heated up and served in a Japanese sake flask. A satisfying, filling and delicious meal with fresh well prepared fish and good sushi skills that stays close to traditional Japanese tastes. Polite, quick service, clean restaurant. Quiet on a weekday evening and away from the crowds.', 'Fast and delicious! Totally recommend it', 'Great low key sushi,  amazing food.... satisfied customers thanks üòä', 'Great sushi, and great customer service. 10% discounts frequently given!']

["Great place! It's run by a group of Chinese people, so I was able to use my Mandarin with them. The food tastes great and they will give you your fill. I recommend using the constructed menu, it's wonderful!", "Excellent sushi and sashimi from huge and beautiful menu, consisting of lots of pre-composed plates or your own selection from a grand variety of different pieces. Came with a good miso and a very nice cole salad.

Our waitress (who spoke no English) was completely uninterested, grumpy and approached us twice within the first minutes while we were still reading the menus. The third time she brought with her another guy from restaurant too and we got the impression that if we didn't order at this stage we'd be thrown out. Very strange feeling, and a pity considering their food was excellent.", "Warm Coca Cola & Water :(
Greasy food - we couldn't tell the difference between chicken and Pork there was so much grease!

Very nice staff and quick service though, very clean and modern.
Bit strange to see small children bringing the food from the kitchen to the seating area though.
Well Priced but wouldn't go back or recomend", "Don't go to that place if you are craving sushis. It tastes like everything except sushis.  The chicken nems were very oily and greasy. The noodles were super thick.. and not tasty at ALL", "Cheap! Soup from powder, salad not fresh, coconut perls frozen. Doesn't feel like a restaurant, not worth the money"]

['The Royal Malesherbes is a good Portuguese restaurant. The food is good and the fish (sea bream) are excellent. It is not necessary to make reservations for lunch during the week. You will be served by the boss and the cook is the boss. I recommend this restaurant.', 'Family restaurant with a warm welcome.
Portuguese cuisine is in full swing, in freshness, taste etc.... Everything is good I tasted Portuguese dishes as well as a homemade burger which was delicious..
you are hungry, go for it.. üòâ', 'The Royal Malesherbes (in the 17th): a well-cooked and well-grilled salmon but no seasoning and too much oil at the bottom of the plate. A dish at 19‚Ç¨ with no real taste, just ok.', 'An adorable boss and his wife, exquisite dishes at a very reasonable price and delicious wines... What more could you ask for? ;)', 'Very welcoming Paris address, with efficient service and rather advantageous prices: lunch, starter, main course, dessert for 16 euros.
At this price, unlimited access to the starter buffet, a nice piece of fish or a small piece of meat (pieces of meat are charged at an additional cost), and a slice of homemade dessert, often a tart or mousse. with chocolate.
The fish is very fresh and very good, served whole grilled with a drizzle of olive oil and fries or beans.
The starter buffet is very correct and allows everyone to adjust the quantity at the end, even for good eaters. The desserts are generally of good quality.
In short, an address with an advantageous quality/price ratio, all in a friendly setting!']

['We spent great time in the restaurant. Cuisine and wines were so great. In particular, the owner is so kindness and can speak English to explain all menu and recommendations. We were family and recommend for my kids with some arrangement. Tutty she is dog in the restaurant was welcome our family wellüòä', 'My hotel was just across the street, i came to try once with my hubby and found the food so amazingly well prepared. And i came back 3 other times with other friends, and it was so easy to please others as well. The environment was cozy and chic, staff were very nice, and they offer a list of food that is short but untraditional. Anyway, bravo to them will surely recommend to friends!

Recommend:
Dish: Gambas, Ballottine de volaille
Entr√©e: Bar, ≈ìuf mayonnaise.
Dessert: Capaccio d‚Äôananas

The seating is quite spacious, especially near the window area to the left of the entrance, it offers full sofa seats with nice/ warm lightings.

The chef has a semi open kichen, and is smiling to customers all the time, i‚Äôm always so delighted to discover passionate talents in all domain, and this restaurant is surely the highlight of my trip!', 'This was such an amazing find! The food and staff were excellent. We had such an amazing experience. The ambiance was everything as we had a corner table to ourselves. Unfortunately we found this gem on our last day in Paris. I recommend it to anyone who wants a tasteful, warm and delicious Parisian dining experience. Plus Tooty - who I wanted to make my own!!', 'we came 2 hours before closing time and they refused to serve us. You should change your working hours otherwise it‚Äôs confusing. We waste time walking to Thai place and got kicked out.', 'Incredible food and the owner was so welcoming! We are definitely going back when we visit Paris in September it‚Äôs by far our favorite restaurant in Paris']

['Perfect experience , it‚Äôs a family business
The service is fast and friendly  and the food is always perfect', 'Very disappointing, service is 0, we waited 30min to get half our order, food is very overpriced, everything tastes like canned food.', 'What a great experience

Amazing food

True authentic tunisian kosher food', "It's the best Jewish Tunisian food.
God bless you.", 'Here we find the best fricassee in all of Paris like the one on avenue de Paris in Tunis near the passage, with tasty salads and a little piece of hard egg on the side all in a succulent fritter!
Thank you Baba']

['Local brasserie with nice selection of play du jour. veggies are fresh.  In an area where most places charge 16 to 24 euros, theirs was 14  (as of this post).   Friendly staff.', 'so good to having lunch here. Price is reasonable and food tastes great and the quality is great as well.plus it is a good place take a break and have a drink as well.', 'Very nice place, for my part, the staff were attentive, welcoming, smiling and friendly my dish was very good and tender and I emphasize a little extra for the Christmas decoration, just magnificent', 'Great professional team, great atmosphere, impeccable quality of food! I always stop when I have the opportunity!', "I don't know cooking. I rate the service. A waitress who says nothing, neither hello nor thank you nor any word. No atmosphere. It brings your consumption and then that's it. Taking something back seems to bother her. No complicity."]

['I was not allowed to go to the toilet. very unfriendly people', 'Local restaurant.  Lots of large families enjoying food and fellowship.', 'Wonderful food in a friendly warm environment with great service', "We tried the Tanjia and the Riad tajine and they're just absolutely divine! Very well spiced and the sauce is perfect (not too watery, not too greasy, and exactly the perfect amount). The service and the ambiance are also very good, and it's even better if you coincide with a wedding party in the restaurant üôà", 'Very tasty! The best in Paris...']

["‚ÄúI visited twice while transiting from Lyon-Paris-London for a business conference. On my first visit for dessert and wine, I was warmly welcomed and received excellent service, particularly from a gracious lady server who made me feel truly at ease. As a bilingual Filipino quite adept in English, the interactions were brief but respectful, and I appreciated this warmth‚Äîalong with the delightful food and ambiance‚Äîso much that I returned for dinner the next day.

The second visit started well, though I noticed a new, taller server who seemed less welcoming. Despite a busy atmosphere and my request to be re-seated, I enjoyed a graciously served meal and a pleasant experience. However, each time this taller server passed and brushed my side due to the tight space where I was in, there was no ‚Äòpardon‚Äô or acknowledgment, which I thought was customary in France.

When I went to pay at the same spot as the day before, the tall server abruptly waved me aside, directing me where to pay without a word. This felt unwelcoming, even rude. Another server who also served me graciously the day before, perhaps noticing, kindly asked where I was from, and when I replied 'the Philippines,' he responded, 'Oh, I thought you were from NY because your English is good!' Although I knew this was meant well, I found myself wondering afterward: ‚ÄòDid these 2 incidents really just happen back there?‚Äô

While the food was enjoyable, this interaction significantly impacted my experience. I hope the restaurant can work toward a more inclusive and welcoming environment for all guests.

Let me again acknowledge the lady who served me. She was warm, gracious, and made me feel welcomed which I genuinely appreciated. Her hospitality was a bright spot in my experience here.

*This review was written by the reviewer yet ran thru chatgpt for conciseness and applicability for a review.", 'Excellent restaurant. Their empanadas are very tender and not spicy at all. We also took a very refreshing gaspacho and grilled cheese (that I liked a bit less due to quite bitter taste). Open this August, which is a miracle here in Paris :)', 'Good place famous for meat and Argentinian meat', 'Very nice cozy ambiance, with good food. A bit expensive, specially the wine, but overall sweet service!', 'Excellent cocktails (better than in many fancy bars) and delicious food for a d√©cent price. Nice ambiance. A little secret place to definitely try in Paris.']

Adresse: 9 Pl. du Mar√©chal Juin, 75017 Paris, France
Reviews: ['High prices for excellent cuisine, it is true. Friendly service but a few oversights. Cozy atmosphere.', '4 euros for an Expresso.\nPardon ?', 'Waiting 20 min without any server showing up.', '', '']

['Beautiful place - great value for the lunch menu - creative chef!', 'This is one of my favourite places in Paris - reasonably priced modern and creative food. The food is original and delicious, the wine list is stunning too. Do not hesitate to ask waiters for their suggestions!', 'So good!!
Modern setting
Kind staff
Great dishes
Fair price

Ravioli & mushroom as a starter: amazing...
Beef with potato and veggie puree entree: pretty good
Saussage with mashed potatoes entree: pretty good
Strawberry chocolate crumble dessert: pretty good
Lemon cream coconut pinapple dessert: amazing

Will go back for sure.', 'We went there for dinner mainly because we wanted to see the paintings that were on display. The service was prompt and friendly, however not too knowledgeable about the wine and food menu. The food was ok, however not outstanding. For the quality and taste the price was too high or for the price the quality and taste not good enough - depending on the point of view.', 'It is the worst restaurant I have ever neen to. Terrible foods and terrible people! The meat has strong fishy smell. The discount they claim is a fake. They never intended to offer any discount. Terrible restaurant and staff. Never go to this horrible place!!!']

['The restaurant is magnificent, the man is so nice and the spring rolls are deliciousxxx!!! I went back there at least three times during the day the prices are great ‚Ç¨4 for 5 chicken spring rolls and the man even offers to reheat them for you if you take them to go I love this restaurant ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è', "I should have listened to my instinct when entering the restaurant, I now regret not having done so... I won't go back there, for the sake of my health...", 'Good evening I just took meat beef spices and white rice and vegetables 20 euro very disgusted room taste like really disappointed we more I abite we high never again', 'Very good canteen, plentiful and reasonably priced. The Bo Bun is a real delight and the welcome is warm. Unmissable, to have in your list of favorite restaurants. To do and to do again!!', 'Very good Asian caterer; The bo bun is excellent!!']

['Absolutely fantastic experience! The food was amazing‚Äîauthentic, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The service was incredibly friendly and fast, making us feel right at home. The happiness and warmth of the staff added to the wonderful atmosphere. Highly recommend for anyone craving a perfect Italian meal!', 'SO GOOD - we we‚Äôre so glad we checked this place out! It was close to our hotel, and we were looking for a local restaurant and we stumbled upon this place. The staff is so friendly and accommodating and the food was out of this world! A little pricey but so worth it. Their truffle tortellini - has to be one of the best I‚Äôve ever had! I would definitely recommend this place!', "The food here is exceptional, and the waitress is incredibly friendly. I can honestly say it's one of the best pastas I've ever had.", "I try not to miss a review worth sharing whether it's to honor a chef's plating, outstanding deliciousness, give credit to exceptional service, or to share feedback on front or back of house services. I must have been pretty proud of my research and selection of this hidden Italian gem in Paris as I totally forgot to take any pictures. Somehow I was able to catch myself just after our entre was finished. But the remains of the devoured affogato should give you an idea just how delicious the entire meal was...", "Always a pleasure to have the best Italian food in Paris!

This is not my first time here, and I can say with 100% confidence that whatever you get here will 'transport' you immediately to Italy! Could not recommend this place any more. Far exceeds my expectations every time. The little limoncello they give at the end just adds to the whole experience!

We got truffled burrata for starter to share, and for main, the lemon spaghetti and seared tuna. Everything was delicious and we got a red wine to accompany which was excellent as well.

Couldn't move by the time we left but that is the only complaint I could have :) :)

Five stars from me with a we will be back!"]

['The employee there which is a girl that has no uniform is rude! Avoid/a fuir.", 'Ordered on the self-service booth, for table delivery. Sat upstairs, cleanliness was passable (loads of trays and dirty papers a bit everywhere). Can be improved.', 'This McDonalds is one notch better than other McDonalds in my opinion, give it a try. Expect the same McDonalds quality with a tiny touch better tasting food.']

['I recently had the pleasure of dining at Nagano Restaurant and I can confidently say it exceeded all expectations. From the moment I walked in, the warm ambiance and friendly staff set the tone for a wonderful experience. The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive without being intrusive, and they made thoughtful recommendations that elevated our meal.

As for the food, it was nothing short of spectacular. Each dish was a delightful combination of fresh ingredients, expertly prepared with attention to detail. The flavors were vibrant and well-balanced, showcasing the chef‚Äôs mastery in every bite.

What really stood out was the consistency of excellence throughout the meal. Every course was served promptly, with each item presented beautifully, and the flavors were fresh and robust. It‚Äôs clear that Nagano Restaurant]is dedicated to both the quality of its food and the satisfaction of its guests.', 'Very close to ESCP and the food is fresh and with good portion. I recommend coming with a few friends to share some appetizers!', 'Amazing! Big rolls comparing the usual small Parisien sushi. And a really good price, best sushi i have tried so far', 'Loved the food and the service was super fast :)', 'Delicious! We loved the food and were really happy with the service. The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere was enjoyable.']

['It is alright, just what you expect from a Carrefour.', 'I‚Äôve always had a very nice experience. Fast lines and friendly staff. ['Very delicious pizza and the staff are very nice! My family travelled from China love it! The products are fresh, the dough soft, the atmosphere friendly, the manager very sympathetic. In short, a moment of happiness.', "Good pizza, service first class good atmosphere, so good that we ate here 3 evenings out of 4. Couldn't fault the food and 2 very good red wines.
