Seriously I would go back for the food but he made the service extra special, so I would return just to see him again as well!', 'On July 14, 2024, my wife decided that we should have lunch here. While she was attracted by the mussels dish, I ordered a set lunch with escargot as appetiser. It was the first time we could afford the time to have lunch at Montmarte!', 'Had a heartwarming experience at the delightful Chez ma Cousine on a cold rainy day in Paris. The diverse menu would accommodate any desires. The choices we made were excellent. The wait staff is multilingual and charismatic. Would return any time we are in Paris by Sacre Coeur.', 'Absolutely lovely restaurant. Tasty fantastic and very affordable menu .5 star .I have  here diner every time I am visiting Paris', 'The waiters were kind to us, unfortunately the food is quite mediocre, except for the onion soup which was delicious.']

['Delicious blue cheese burger with a generous portion of fries. Service was great, both waitresses who served me on Friday evening were friendly and attentive. Very quick service and the food was very good and comes with an affordable price. Recommened.', 'Perfect place to enjoy a drink and or food! Lovely atmosphere & friendly staff. Definitely recommend!', "My salmon was undercooked inside....but it's Paris....so I wasn't going to argue with the cook on what is considered cooked Salmon Pave.....However the Plate Presentation was very nice!!\n\nBut service was just so so...I seated myself, which is fine...Its  Clichy street..They are very busy....But After delivering my food nobody came back to ask me how I was doing or Am I enjoying my food... offer me any bread( baguette)on the side..They simply came back when the plate was done ...I took the bill and left quickly as I did not enjoy a service that much", 'Very nice and tasty place on the Paris map. Very friendly staff.  Quality of the food on a very high level ( beef just a bit to chewy). Good prices. Nothing left on the plates. Thank You!!!']

['Really nice venue with a cafe upstairs and a basement bar downstairs. Great stop when you are exploring Montmartre. By the time it's round 3, everyone has pretty much gone.", 'I had a terrific time here. I thought the beer and food selection were great and the staff were very friendly. Thank you Louis for being such a gracious host of the open mic. See you next time!']

["If you're looking for an Irish pub atmosphere with exactly the right divey/homey feel but menues and countertops recently wiped down, this is it.  Musical taste is great too. Mixed grill is lovely.", 'Stopped in for a Scotch after a concert at La Machine de Moulin Rouge. Will definitely visit again. Shows live sports. Close to The Basilica of Sacr√©-C≈ìur de Montmartre and moulin rouge.']

['The food here is amazing! I loved the frog legs. The service was also amazing. This is such a great place to just sit and relax. The vibrant atmosphere of Montmartre makes it all the better. It is convenient as it is very close to the Sacr√© C≈ìur. I recommend coming here when visiting Montmartre.', 'Great choice in Montmartre for ambience and food. Sit outside if you can and watch the world go by over a glass of wine. Our waiter, Yanis from Algeria, went above and beyond what we expected with complimentary Calvados and blue cheese after dinner. Highly recommend.', "Stopped by on a Thursday for lunch and we were seated immediately upon arrival without reservation.  Nice interior and service was friendly and efficient.  Food is a bit pricey but was served hot and was quite tasty with one exception - the Milieu de rumsteck Simmental (steak) was perfectly cooked medium rare; however, it was tough piece of meat that was difficult to cut and eat.  The black angus burger was cooked perfectly rare as requested.  Also ordered the Bonne Franquette Menu which included:
Salade Bonne Franquette with chicken
Saucisson pistache de Collette Sibilia et lentilles beluga
Glace et sorbet artisanaux
The Salade Bonne Franquette was well prepared and fresh; however, the pieces of chicken needed a little salt and pepper which wasn't on the table and I didn't want to ask.
The Saucisson pistache de Collette Sibilia et lentilles beluga was quite tasty and served hot.   The lentilles beluga were the best lentilles I've ever tasted - perfectly cooked (slightly crunchy) and were not at all mushy with a delicious sauce.  The sorbet desert was tasty but a bit too sweet for my taste.

If you in the area of Montmartre, I highly recommend you stop here for lunch.", 'Immediately a wonderfully comfortable feeling when you step inside. The staff are friendly. The food is delicious! If you go to Montmartre then this is the place to enjoy some food and a delicious wine. We will definitely come again!!!üëçüèº', 'We had lunch in this beatiful location in the middle of Mont Martre, the atmosphere was very god and we were in the earth of Paris.
The staff was kind and helpful. We lunch out and I took fois grass and a chicken in a sauce.
I got to say the food was mid and the prices little bit high.
But,on the whole was a good experience.']

['Had a great time. Service was quick and friendly! Food was yummy too :)', 'I found this restaurant on The Fork and with 20% discount on offer it turned out to be very good choice. The quality of food was amazing, fresh and so tasty. I recommend cod ceviche in coconut milk - picture attached. The place was packed on Saturday night, lots of local  people which is always a good sign ! The service was very friendly and polite but perhaps because the restaurant was so busy, it was less efficient than I would expect. Overall- a wonderful experience.', 'Very nice place I visited where it has a cozy atmosphere. The staff where by heart friendly and smiling. The food was really tasty and nice an affordable. This place is close to public transportation and locals eat here which also gave nice experience', 'I don‚Äôt visit Paris often, but when I do I try to visit la Table des Anges. For me, the best restaurant in Paris. High quality food but in a relaxed and enjoyable environment. The owner/chef are very jolly and the whole place has such a lively atmosphere. Of course it‚Äôs a restaurant and so food has to take pride of place and it does - great menu and great flavours.', 'A great neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere on my favorite street in Paris. A good deal on the formule for dinner, too.']

Adresse: 17 Rue des Trois Fr√®res, 75018 Paris, France
Reviews:
['The menu is overall not bad, and it‚Äôs a weirdly funny experience drinking from the baby bottles. The cheese fondue is alright, but it only comes with bread.

PS: You better have a reservation to get in. The place is pretty tight, and the tables are glued to each other. You literally need to step on the chair if you‚Äôre sitting against the wall.', 'I‚Äôm giving this place 5 stars because this is such a unique, fun and amazing experience! The place is super small! MAKE RESERVATIONS! The fondu was delicious! I didn‚Äôt think we were going to get full but we did! Remember, if you‚Äôre sitting in the middle of people, the person sitting against the wall will need to climb over the table! You are definitely super close to your neighbors so if you‚Äôre on a one on one date, you‚Äôll definitely be right next to strangers! But make friends! That‚Äôs the fun in this experience! Definitely would love to come back if I make it here again!', 'Cannot fault this hidden gem! We were lucky enough to snap up a reservation on the day - but definitely recommend booking in advance (and confirming your booking) to avoid disappointment. The atmosphere was brilliant and we made some wonderful and hilariously fun friends on the table next to us. If you get a chance to visit this independent family business, you won‚Äôt be disappointed! We‚Äôll be back for sure!', 'A must in Montmartre.
Book in advance to avoid surprises.

The quality is really worth the price (31‚Ç¨ each person).

The baby bottle is fun to use.
The fondue is good but be prepared for the French cheeses which have a particular taste.
The bread is fluffy and not crunchy, it could be improved.', 'Will always dream of this fondue! The service was great, generous portions, and great drink portions. I came alone so I was a bit anxious about it but the staff made me feel at ease and the fondue was one of the most delicious things I‚Äôve ever tasted!! I‚Äôm sad that I didn‚Äôt get a bottle to take away. Hopefully they can ship one to London?']

['Wonderful location and beautiful restaurant. The outside area is surrounded by street artists who are incredibly talented and the staff of the restaurant are polite, friendly, and they speak very good english. The food is quite expensive but it is worth it, the mussels go to the very bottom of the bowl and the Camembert was both creamy and delicious. Overall I would definitely recommend dining here.', 'While the food was good, this was the worst service I‚Äôve experienced in Paris. The waiter was rude, impatient, and made no effort to assist. They messed up my order and even charged me to fix it. When I tried to give feedback, they literally told me to comment on Google rather than listening, showing no interest in improvement. It‚Äôs a shame because the place has a lot of potential, but based on my experience, I cannot recommend it.', 'Philippe was amazing! Food was very good! The mulled wine is superb. Price fixed menu was a good deal.', 'Great experience. Onion soup was delicious. Philippe was superb. We truly enjoyed our time at La Cremaillere!', "Very atmospheric and interesting place! Very good food, we highly recommend the pizza. A huge minus for the service - we asked for a small glass of home wine, we don't know that there are different sizes, because no one told us. We waited a very long time for service, from asking for the bill we waited 20 minutes. When we got the bill we found out that the gentleman chose the wine he wanted and instead of a small glass of wine we paid for a double."]

["Very nice place. Food excelence. Dessert Cr√®me br√ªl√©e delicious, one of the best I've had.
2 main dishes, dessert and a carafe of wine 73 EUR.
I highly recommend this place. It's a good idea to make a reservation in advance because there may not be a free spot if you come in from the street.", 'Guinness, Magners cider - and delicious food. We love stopping here for a bit of a Irish respite from France. It‚Äôs a huge place with air conditioning, beer, fun, big screen, TVs. And good bathrooms.
The service has always been excellent, and the people are friendly.
Pulled pork nachos and bacon nachos come on a huge plate and they are delicious with lots of guacamole . Chicken sandwich is amazing.', 'The food was very good and tasty. Very fresh. Definitely a good place to have some food and drinks.', 'Very friendly service with great ambience ! Great views of the city and the sacre coer basilica area!', 'Best place ever!!! We had our birthday party in the bar last week,  and it was amazing!  Kahina and Marie made a super ambiance for all 30 of us!‚ù§Ô∏èüéâ Thank so so much!']

['We visited this charming restaurant in December and were so impressed by its cosy atmosphere. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. The French onion soup was absolutely flawless, while my daughter‚Äôs flank steak was cooked to perfection. The Caesar salad was also fantastic. This was hands down our favourite meal of the entire trip!', "I'd give 4 stars to atmosphere but that's about it. Located at a very nice commercial segment of Montmatre, this place could do way better with a decent chef. Food was below average. Not a single dish was at the level that it should have been, given that people travel from all over the World to try French cuisine. Cocktails were lazy and half hearted, food was almost uncooked. They are doing great for themselves due to their location, but I'd recommend you look for something else if good French food is what you're looking for.", 'Great place. Good food. Here‚Äôs what would make it 5 stars:
- provide a plate for the bread dip without being asked.
- care enough when 2 out of 6 escargot were empty.
- apply 2-bite-2-minute rule.
- check on the customer now and then.
- be kind.', 'Our visit to La M√®re Catherine at Montmartre was simply unforgettable! We had delicious oysters and prawns, and the service was incredibly warm and attentive. Despite not having a reservation on a Saturday evening, they still managed to get us a table ‚Äì just fantastic! We felt comfortable from the start and thoroughly enjoyed our evening. The owner gave us such a heartfelt farewell that the night will remain in our memories for a long time. We signed our bill with a kiss, and we can‚Äôt wait to come back on our next visit to Paris. See you soon, Dina & Alex!üíã', 'You will not regret the decision to come here. Let me explain:

We dined with the pass mind you! When we came the restaurant was absolutely full. They told us we must dine outside. My father in law was too cold to stay outside, it was quite an argument because we paid for it already! The host saw us and we told him the embarrassing situation. He went to the neighboring restaurant (owned by the same owner) to seat us, to which they couldn‚Äôt. My father in law surrendered thankfully.

The manager came, he looked at us seriously, and then asked us of our culture. We shared the same culture and he could tell!

Regardless they were so professional, courteous and accommodating in however they could have been.

Let‚Äôs get to the food, the essential factor.

Food: For appetizer we had 1 escargots, and 3 of les ≈ìufs mayonnaise.

I had ≈ìufs. They were made for true love. The texture of creaminess and layers of the flavor all came together like a ballet. A ballet that could make a hater of the ballet fall in love. It had truffle, and the salad mixed in had just the right hint of balsamic vinegar to lift the flavor of the truffle which I confused for some in spicy wasabi substitute but no. It was so delicious it made start writing the review to give it 5 stars in everything already.

But that‚Äôs just the beginning.

I asked Michael the manager which is his preferred entree. He said the Beef. So three of us did while one of us had the Chicken and Fries.

We understood why the restaurant had every seat filled. The beef‚Äôs tenderness was just right like the shoe on Cinderella‚Äôs foot. The sauce it was glazed in melted in your mouth like a fresh warm blanket with a tang that was truly alive.
And the potatoes. Again, the texture. I wish I could explain it better but it just felt like they were given the precise time and temperature mix up to remind you that cooking truly is a science as well as it is an art. They brought bread both for the appetizer and for the entree which of course have not missed once since we have been in France. We used it to complement every centimeter of sauce left in that plate. The carrots and mushrooms couldn‚Äôt be forgotten either as it was a symphony.

The chicken was perfectly cooked, of course, fall off the bone. Glazed with a sauce that was like a peanut sauce and it really was so fancy. I tried just a bit of it, and the fries with it did not miss.

You think I‚Äôm being extra? Overdramatic? Look at the picture of the beef and potatoes. Michael had places mine on the table for me. He carefully adjusted the plate so that the text on the plate would face me correctly. So no I am not being ridiculous. Everything here was ridiculously good. The epitome of what is fine dining. The taste struck that moment to me in ratatouille where the food critic goes back to his childhood. I‚Äôm not kidding.

Now the dessert. The. Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e, was like no other. The top crust, standard deliciousness, can‚Äôt change how that goes. The cr√®me, was almost curated? How did they do it? Almost like they pre toasted the milk? They literally gave the cr√®me layers to its richness. The slight chill of it reminded me I‚Äôm not in the US.

Michael talked with us for quite a while through it all. This place is no joke. The oldest operating restaurant in Place du Tertre. Birth place of the word Bistro, and so much more rich history. Frequented by many popular public figures, and truly, a part of my history for my family we will not forget. Thank you Michael and thank you to your staff, your chefs really deserve their flowers. Cheers']

['We stopped by for some quick snacks and picks one savoury (pain with mozzarella and tomatoes) and one sweet (pain aux raisins) pastry. We liked them both enough. Overal Paris bakery prices.', 'A small local bakery with friendly and helpful staff. The lady at the counter took the time to explain all the different sandwiches to us in English. Unfortunately, we couldn‚Äôt find the pistachio croissant, but the macarons made up for it.', 'A really good bakery. Even though it‚Äôs very popular and quite touristy, it still has kept its standards and offers great pastries. The pain au chocolat is particularly good as well as the Petits pains suisses aux p√©pites de chocolat.', 'My favorite bakery I found on my trip to Paris!! The ham and cheese croissant was delicious and the pistachio croissant was OUT OF THIS WORLD. It‚Äôs a must-try!!', "Worth Trying

A fairly average experience. Nothing too unique within the store and prices above par.

Pain au chocolate - par, not buttery, but not dry. Much more bready than average, so it's a heavier bite. Good structure."]

Nom: Le Coq & Fils - the Poultry House
Reviews:
['This is the best roast chicken you will ever have, no question.
We had the mashed potatoes, but the exceptional star was the Mac and cheese. Extremely rich and flavourful.
The staff are also great.
A fantastic experience overall.
Highly recommended!', "Would love to go again! The food was fantastic. We had starters, roast chicken, and a bottle of ros√®. Probably some of the best roast chicken I've ever had! The sides were incredible as well... the service was fair, a little pressing but not bad. The place itself was a little classy but not pompous.", 'I dined here Friday before last my first night this trip to Paris & the food, service, & convivial atmosphere were fantastic!

The coq au vin was so delicious I even ate the mushrooms, which I normally hate. My son was impressed!

The atmosphere was convivial with all the cooks in the front room joking around. I told one of them that the mac & cheese was LEGIT, but it didn't quite translate. I tried to explain with "too legit to quit", but it still wasn't enough, so I said "VRAIMENT vraiment"!

Also, this mac & cheese reminded me that Thomas Jeffrrson was the one who brought the recipe for mac & cheese back to the US, so we have the French to thank!

Despite it all being delicieux, I could only eat half, so I took the rest back to my hotel & ate them the next night. The leftovers were amazing, as stews often are!

This restaurant would be perfect for US or Canadian Thanksgiving or Christmas! The manager said reservations fill up quickly, even a month ahead, so if you want to dine here for the holidays next year, get those reservations in at least 6 weeks ahead.', 'A beautiful restaurant with very attentive and helpful staff. We had the Coucou des Renne, which was tasty but a tad dry, which might be the breed of chicken. The confit gizzards and chocolate mousse were delicious', 'Edit: Delicious chicken and sides were good too. Service was very attentive and friendly. Wine was decent too. You may get a bit discouraged by the prices but it‚Äôs worth experiencing what the Chef will offer you and the impressive push to change the perception of poultry as a culinary experience. Quality and dedication.']

['We enjoyed a beautiful dinner and our waitress was amazing!!!! We  had a pretty tough day at the Eifel tower and  the Louver with the long wait lines and the weather was not the best. But we decided to get a bite while we waited for our train. The waitress spoke English and was very sympathetic to our situation. She was the best. She really saved the day for our family. Would definitely love to eat there the next time we are in Paris.', 'Perfectly cooked quality steak and the cheese fondue was very generous and delicious for the price. Wish we had this franchise back home!', 'Food was great, workers were very polite, for the location prices were really low. Thank you', 'Not too bad chain restaurant, just wished some of the meats could have a thicker cut. For the Rib-Eye, asked for it to be cooked medium-rare, but it came out well-done. I could understand since the steak was very thin, so it wasn‚Äôt really anyone‚Äôs fault, just wished I knew beforehand and would‚Äôve ordered another steak that can be cooked medium-rare.

Other steaks that my friends had however, delicious.', 'We had a late night dinner at this place, everyone was nice and helpful.
We ordered an onion soup, which was okay, then flank steak with fries.
The meat seemed small but in the end I was perfectly full, and the sauce was really good.']

['A great establishment: good food, fast service, a nice location, and great prices. The croque monsieur at 12‚Ç¨ are an absolute delight. They all come with fries and salad. The burgers are also really good and reasonably priced. Really recommend stopping at labutte if you are in the area', 'TERRIBLE SERVICE.

Writing in English so the translation is better for everyone.

The place has a pretty good offer of fries + beer for ~5‚Ç¨, which is great for Paris. But the service was pretty terrible.

First, they practically force you to order something the moment you sit at the table. But that‚Äôs not the worst part.

I read some reviews on Google maps about the staff making you pay more for the stuff you ordered, since most people simply don‚Äôt check the bill, so I naturally wanted to check.

First, I tried simply to take a lot at the bill the waitress was giving me, and she slapped my hand when I tried to look what she was putting to me. Then (I don‚Äôt why exactly) she went away and another waiter came to me to show the bill. He was ultra hesitant to show me it, and angry. But finally after trying for the third time he allowed me to simply see what I was paying for.

I later discovered with my friends that one person paid on extra and they didn‚Äôt took it out, so it was paid double.

Do yourself a favor and just go to the place in front of them that is cheaper.', 'Great place to drink and eat. Reasonable prices . Tasty foods. Nice lication. Overall good .', 'Good food, good wine in the heart of Montmartre. I really enjoyed my Goat Cheese burger', "Easy going, but with style, great music and even better burgers! Nice selection of tap and craft beers. Quick, efficient service with a smile and won't hurt your wallet. Highly recommended."]

["Enjoyed our lunch at this quaint restaurant near to Abbesses. The food was great and the prices reasonable and fair. The bar manager / waitress seemed to be having a tough day and was quite stressed out but this happens in the restaurant trade and is to be expected from time to time. It's a tough line of work. But no harm done and we enjoyed and would recommend.", 'We loved the burgers, well done and the fries not overcooked
The waiter was soooo sweet and kind, always available with a smile and this is rare in Paris
The stood is delicious,
What I didn‚Äôt lie just the table was sticky and toilet not so clean but in general a good experiment.', 'Amazing customer service! The prices are very reasonable, and their charcuterie is incredible ‚Äì full of flavor, with high-quality cuts and perfectly sized portions. Highly recommend, merci!', 'Nice food, on a very cozy restaurant. Very good and friendly service.', 'Decent priced restaurant in the heart of Montmartre. Ordered the Ti Punch (small shot but so tasty) escargot, steak and salad (Note: French folks don‚Äôt like when you try to change your side.. I asked for all salad and no fries). They completely forgot about our escargot starter but we didn‚Äôt have our heart set on it. Kitchen is fast. Two gluten free options on the menu. The staff were kind.']

["*Edited for clarity*. We had an enjoyable meal at Le Poulbot. We were a bit rushed with a time limit from our tour manager who only gave us 45 minutes for a dinner. I had tried to make a reservation while walking to the restaurant, but we arrived before I could finish the form. The manager, while not pleased that I hadn't finished making the reservation, he graciously sat us anyway.\nThe Onion soup was excellent and perfect for a chilly evening. The desserts also were great, delicious comfort food. The staff were attentive and did everything they could to accommodate our schedule even on a busy evening.\nDo yourself and them a favor by making a reservation here. You won't be disappointed.", 'This was the best dining experience of my entire life PLEASE GO HERE!!! best steak and French onion soup I have ever had and our waiter is actually the best ever I love him so much. His name is Alan‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Fantastic experience. The place is a small charming restaurant that really gives off the Paris vibes. The burata started was amazing, the duck in red wine was one of the best I ever tried, the steak was full of flavour and cooked to perfection, with desert being ice on the cake to wrap up a perfect experience. Perfect for taking your loved one on a date. Highly recommended!', "I visited last year. It was the most perfect dinner I had in Paris. The server was nice, too. I'm so curious about the name of the dish I ate that included strawberries and raw fish as appetizers!! I will definitely visit again to eat that. Please stay there for a long time! ", 'I was recommended Le Poulbot by someone who grew up in Paris and frequently visits- small menu, quaint atmosphere, traditional french comfort food, and very local despite the touristy neighborhood. I got the escargot (which was the best I‚Äôd ever had!!) and the duck, which had the perfect savory and sweet balance. Eleanor, my server was so amazing! Please try this restaurant if you are in Montmartre :)']

['Enjoyed a fabulous meal here with my Daughter. Made welcome from the start. We cannot praise the food or service highly enough. The Restaurant has the perfect ambience too. Cannot wait to return in 2025.', 'Our BEST meal in France. Food was wonderful and so flavorful. If something sounds exotic or odd, just trust. Nothing on the menu disappoints. Especially recommended the chicken and the beef bourguignon as well as the crayfish appetizer. Service was amazing, and staff were very good at explaining the dishes. Plates also came out with some extra sides. The restaurant itself was very homey and cozy. Traditional French recipes like grandmother would make.', "I came here for lunch on Friday without a reservation, which was no problem. The host was friendly and she seated me right away. The host speaks English so it's no problem if you're an American or foreigner. The space is tight inside so I would recommend making a reservation for large groups.

I had the lunch special (app-main-wine-coffee) and ordered escargot, beef pastrami with eggs, and red wine. Everything was delectable and made to perfection üëåüèª

Note that the service and pace at resturants in Paris are slow compared to American standards. The French certainly take their time to enjoy their meals and leisure. Come in, slow down, and enjoy a traditional home cooked French meal at Le Bouclard üçΩ", 'Felt incredibly privileged to find and eat at this place....as an Englishman it is the sort of french restaurant you imagine in your dreams. The ambience, the service and my word, the food! All the classics are present and correct and my only sorrow was that I was eating alone. If you are in Paris there is simply no excuse for not eating here.', 'Superb! We made two reservations as we had a group of eight, and they accommodated us in sitting altogether.

Food was delicious. What we ordered: escargot, crayfish tails, foie gras (order the one that comes with boiled potatoes), mushrooms, onion soup, veal breast, beef pastrami, chicken and the chateaubriand ‚Äì everything was perfectly cooked with amazing flavor. Wine suggestions were also perfect in pairing with the meal.

Service was efficient and they ensured we were well taken care of. Bread was refilled as needed, as were beverages. Takes cards. Make that reservation, it will be worth it.']

Adresse: 75 Bis Bd de Clichy, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews:
['We were in Paris for the thanksgiving weekend, looking for a bar to takes some drinks. And we find thr perfect place the night before our flight back home. And we had a blast there, the people, the ambient, the music different genre. And the drinks were good. Definetly will come back again.', 'A good bar for me to relax and watch tennis. Very open and airy. Bartender is very nice. Cheese plate was shockingly huge', 'Was in this bar on Saturday 7th October match day Scotland v Ireland, brilliant service cold beer and very friendly what a great atmosphere , recommend The French Flair 100 %', "Expensive we order 2 cocktails for 29 euro.

Good vibe nice music.
Toilet is bad but every toilet in a club is bad.
We are from the netherlands and we looked for a club but couldn't find one till we found this one. Its nice, we didn't experience any bad vibes from the bouncer like many other reviews on other clubs.", 'Good bar, but not amazing. DJ is a nice guy, not gona lie. Spent a good night there.
Food is not very good, and cocktails are poor in alcohol.']

['Came to Marcel‚Äôs to get out of the rain & I ended up having brunch.  The food is excellent, great coffee, good service & relaxed atmosphere.  I got the English Breakfast & pancakes.  It‚Äôs all good!  I enjoyed watching the rain from the beautiful glass windows.  It‚Äôs located in a beautiful neighborhood in Montmartre where you can walk around and explore.', 'Loved this place. Had been great service, food, and a can‚Äôt-beat location. But the last few visits left much to be desired. Quality in both service, drinks, and food has gone down. Thought it may have just been an off-day, but it‚Äôs sadly a new normal. For an example, here is the ‚Ç¨14 French Toast now. The former was tasty and thoughtful with 2 large fresh bread slices and rich caramel. This was small and very stale. A big disappointment.  Hope it goes back to what it was.', 'Came to brunch to this spot on my Paris vacation. It was one of the best dishes I had during my whole trip! The aesthetic of the place is beautiful and the service was great. This whole neighborhood is so good to walk around and see beautiful structures.', 'Food tasty and service good! Found a bit pricy for the the quantity', 'Super sweet staff, and amazing food. We had the French toast and egg salad sandwich, would totally recommend it.']

['As much as I have heard this restaurant is a tourist trap, we still ate here and had a pleasant experience. The staff was super friendly and our table gave us a great view onto the street for some nice people watching;) Around 8pm, a piano player performed which was also a nice touch. The food was pretty good, but the atmosphere and staff really added to the overall experience!', "The food is reasonable for a highly touristic location. It's good enough don't expect a gastronomic dish.
Anyway the atmosphere is amazing, waiters and waitress are welcoming. Diane is terrific üëç
Had a amazing time there on this 4th of July.", 'I have never meant 5 stars everything more before. I have said best ice cream in the world only a few times. I‚Äôve said it again here. If you understand what a palette is, yours will be here for a treat. Everyone here is warm like their food. A bucket list item in your life sincerely.
If you want to know how mastering a craft is, make sure you ask for Hashim, he shows the art that it is to wait a table. He matches the composure of the entire dining experience from start to finish. Blessings to everyone in this restaurant.', 'We came here thanks to the Go City Pass for a champagne tasting session. The cafe has a great ambiance with warm lighting and nice wall art, and we thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

The pass includes a set of pastries (four different types of desserts), all of which taste great. You can also choose your beverage; we opted for champagne, which was delightful to enjoy during winter.

The cafe‚Äôs location is strategic, and we highly recommend it if you have a sweet tooth.', 'We came here to discover French cusine. We had frog legs, duck liver and snails as starters. I have a bias about frog legs but they were really tasty. The snail didn‚Äôt suit my taste even though they were good. For the main corse, I had a duck confit which was delicious. Their service was exceptional and they staff was friendly.']

['We enjoyed it. Service was good: fast and nice. Food was good. We had croque madame and crepes. Crepes has strong alcohol flavor, I guess, they should be flambee a it longer. Chocolate sweet and tasty. Creme brulee was absolute heaven', 'Lovely atmosphere, wonderful waiter and delicious food!
We had 2 different types of the omelettes with salad and both made a very wholesome meal alongside the complimentary bread (also very good!).
Everyone was friendly; helpful and although busy, service was quick!
The street musicians playing whilst we enjoyed our meal topped it off. They make a very good Diablo drink. Very memorable experience', 'Historic site, with really good (but not the very best) traditional french dishes in wonderful Montmartre. Picturesque, and lively corner location. We loved sitting outside. Somewhat slow service/food, but we enjoyed the time there and were not in a hurry.', 'I was here in April and had a fond memory of this place so we visited with our family for a dinner. It‚Äôs historical place and such a warm and cozy place. We got seated right away since it was 4:30 pm.  I wasn‚Äôt sure if I give 3 or 4 stars, because I really like this restaurant but there are so many other good restaurants in Paris so I decided with 3 stars for the quality of food..
Mussels had no taste. Even though it had onions and celery, it seems like it was boiled in water without any wine. Fries were good. My daughter had a special plate with steak w peppercorn sauce, salad and fries. It was ok. Escargot was average  French onion soup was ok but not great. Price is reasonable and ambience is amazing.', "Their services were impeccable, and the dishes were nothing short of culinary perfection. There was a small band playing lovely music with crowds gathering to listen. The escargot were perfectly cooked, as was the duck breast. The onion soup was like nothing I've ever had and I only want it that way from now on. It was more of a chicken broth than beef and it was very rich without being too salty or heavy. The gravy on the duck paired nicely with the French fries, making a poutine of sorts. Lovely place. Don't believe the negative reviews, some people are just sour. Have an open mind and give it a shot. You won't be disappointed."]

['We had the dinner here (in the late evening in the end of October). There wasn‚Äôt crowded at this time and we very liked everything.
The food was very tasty. From three dishes we enjoyed all of them - the lamb, the beef stew and the pizza pepperoni.
The atmosphere was also very nice - live music, good mood and vibes.
Prices like in all Paris - higher, but if you enjoy your time and food - it‚Äôs reasonable.', 'I told the waiter, the next time I visit France, I know I will be coming back here. And I hope we get to see Mina again üòå

All the places I‚Äôve reviewed on our trip to France, once again I‚Äôve been absolutely blown away.
We have been reviewing places that are one of a kind, special occasions. This bar is where you frequent all the time.

Very decent prices,
Phenomenal food
Generous drink portions
And a warm ambience.

So good I don‚Äôt want to spoil it for you. For example the pizza felt like a Nona made it at home.

That‚Äôs all I‚Äôll say about the food.

Such a beautiful experience I don‚Äôt want to spoil it for you. We were here Christmas night and they were open without a hesitation in place. Thank you for saving Christmas.

Just Go.', 'We had a nice diner at the restaurant and the lady was very friendly. But we did pay ‚Ç¨10 for a Coca Cola‚Ä¶ The soda‚Äôs are not on the menu so I would recommend to ask prices before you order. When I wanted to pay, she asked me ‚Äúso how much do you want to pay‚Äù, it made me feel forced to give a tip. I did have a good time but I would not go again.', 'So, let me start off with, "NO!  I'm not a plant review" Go ahead and Google my name as you will find I live in the USA, I've been to Paris a number of times (3) but have only been to this place once.  Also, my wife and I have eaten at a number of places in Paris (mostly in Montmartre) but we have not been to the same place twice in the 3 times we've been to Paris (again, Montmartre mostly). . . but this ends now.  Because we will definitely go to Clarion again when we come back.  The reason why we haven't done the same place twice (again, especially in Montmartre) is that THERE ARE SO MANY GREAT PLACES TO EAT IN PARIS!
(Deep Breathe Pause) But I digress . . .
Now, let's start with the review with Clarion.  First, though, I don't get why this place got bad reviews.  I have a theory.  Let's start with I bet most of the 1-Star Ratings are from Americans and I really mean, "Typical Americans" who have never been to France before.  These are probably the same people whose first words out of their mouth is "Do you speak English?"  SWING AND A MISS!!  The only place(s) you're gonna be able to start with those very "offensive" words and get decent service is McDonalds on the Champs Elyssess (two blocks down from Arc De Triomphe) or very expensive tourist trap restaurants near the Eiffel Tower and/or Jardin des Tulieries.  Seriously.  If you're gonna venture out to places that are not tourist traps, please, please, s'il te plait! Use Google Translate to at least learn the following, "Je se deslole" Pronounced: Jay-duu Day-suu-lay, .  Say it with confidence, "Je suis d√©sol√© mais mon fran√ßais est nul."  Or Jay-duu Day-suu-lay mai mon fran-say est null . . . meaning, I'm sorry but my French sucks.  Learn little phrases that we normally say in the USA, like "Two Chocolate Crossaints" or "Deux (Dew) Crossaints (Kraw-sawunts) au (OW!) Chocolat (Choc-co-laaat). Or whatever else we say when we are just shopping.
(2nd Deep Breath) Again, I try to digress.
(End Scene posture) Sigh.
Now, let's talk about Clarion.  This place is great.  The ambiance as with all places in Montmartre has that "Midnight in Paris" feel.  It's so chic.  It's so warm.  It's so inspirational to help you think of anything art.  The service was fine IMO.  I believe the reason why this place got a lot of bad reviews of the service was because they were probably wondering why IT TOOK FOREVER TO GET MY ORDER IN! is because in France, they don't rush you to anything.  You savor everything, from when your first glass of beverage to when dessert is served.  You won't be rushed like pretty much all the Chevy's, Hooter's, Chili's and Applebee's in the USA.  The French want you to enjoy the hard work they put in cooking their food.  And that's what Clarion wants you to enjoy.  From the Escargot (Yes, I gave it a chance and if you like Garlic and Olive Oil, you love this stuff) to the Ribeye.  It was Mag-Ni-Feek!"  The large glass of their French Beer is something ALL WARM BLOODED AMERICANS WILL LOVE!  Alex, our server, was awesome!  What I have learned about the French is that if you make the effort by pulling out the Google Translate page and at least type what you want to say and make the effort to try and say it (instead of just showing them the pix), they'll give you the respect for at least trying.  Eventually, they will give you a break by just looking at what your typing and then answer your question.  The place really deserves better ratings and I heavily recommend if you're in the Montmartre "arrondosment" of Paris, you need to go to this place.  And if you are in a rush then learn, "Pouvez-vous s'il vous pla√Æt pr√©cipiter ma commande car nous devons √™tre quelque part. . ."  Or savor the flavor and the art that is Paris . . .and say "Pa-Reee!"', 'ü§Æü§¢Disgusting food, disgusting service. The manager of this place is incompetent and has no idea what he is doing. If you see this don‚Äôt go here. I ordered pork wellington with mashed potatoes, these smart people cut up some bits of pork (no pastry) and slapped it onto my plate and instead of mashed potatoes they gave fries never informing us that they are out of stock. This has to be the worst place i have ever been. Horrible üëéüëé']

['They have a set menu here with unlimited dessert. Delicious food. Nice vibe. Good value for money.', 'Such a cute bistro next to our Airbnb. I really enjoyed the morning coffee and croissant', 'Such a great expierence. The food was delicious. Steve (the waitress) was so pacient and friendly. If you are from Latin America (like me) its kind of expensive but i recommend you to eat there', 'We stumbled across this place after leaving Montmarte (which was absolutely packed and impossible to move on a Sunday). The restaurant has a cool, laidback vibe and all of the wait staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.\n\nWe had the mayonnaise eggs (delicious), the burger and the confit pork (incredible). On Sundays the do a meal deal we‚Äôre you get loaded toasts, a drink and a juice and a dessert, which also seemed like a good option. Would definitely go again if I went back to the area!', 'I looove the supreme de poulet, and their burger is great ! the cheddar sauce really makes it, also enjoyed the Sunday brunch w all u can eat dessert :O']

Adresse: 7 Rue des Trois Fr√®res, 75018 Paris, France
Reviews:
["The location is fantastic, in the charming Montmartre area of Paris, providing a quintessential Parisian atmosphere. We sampled a variety of dishes including the Onion Soup, Escargots, Grilled Octopus, and the special steak of the day‚Äîa perfectly cooked Lamb Shank. It's worth noting that the menu has been updated, so the food offerings we enjoyed were different from those mentioned in previous reviews.
If you're in Montmartre, I highly recommend giving Le Progress a visit for a memorable meal.", 'This place is really terrific. Its placed well and has large windows so you can enjoy the view while eating.
The food looked small but I got full anyway.
There really isnt anything bad I can tell from my experience and i would defently recommend it to others', 'Good service, decent starters, not so good main, nice vibrant atmosphere.', 'Excellent little French bistro with a friendly waitress. The food was high quality. The ambiance superb sitting out looking at the street. Yes it‚Äôs Montmartre are and yes it‚Äôs touristy (isn‚Äôt all of Paris really!). But it doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean it‚Äôs bad. The chef clearly cares about the food and the staff care about the patrons. Well worth stopping in', 'Perfect bistro to eat at in Montmartre and/or after visiting Sacre Coeur! Large menu with many ‚Äúclassic‚Äù French options - we tried many items and all delicious!']

['Fabulous restaurant with a mystic deco. The food is very authentic to Vietnamese cuisine. The owner is very kind . Good choice of red wine. The place is located in the famous area of Mont Martres. Worth a visit if you go to Mont Martres but should book in advance .', "Sourire de Sa√Øgon offers an unforgettable culinary experience in which innovative Vietnamese cuisine, impeccable service and a calm atmosphere come together to create a real masterpiece. The interiors are beautiful and I'm impressed with the attention to detail. Amazing.\nBanh Cuong, Frog legs, Thit Nuong...", 'It was a pleasant dinner and with enjoyable food. Me and my dad are very big fans of Vietnamese food and culture and so we found the decor and atmosphere cute. All in all it was good experience.', 'Love this place! Beautifully decorated and very classy husband and wife owner.  The food is fantastic.  It‚Äôs also the place that hosted many celebrities around the world.  Have a visit and experience the best!', 'Second time dining here since it‚Äôs in our neighborhood. We love the coconut milk dish dish. They were nice and gave us a table despite not having made a reservation.']

Adresse: 47 Rue Catherine de la Rochefoucauld, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews:
["We've been here before and it was really good, but this time it WAS INCREDIBLE! Easily the best vegan place we have eaten at in Paris and we've been to them all. I can't tell you what we had now, something peanut butter and something plantain, but it was all superb. Not as expensive as the breakfast we had at Mildred's in London the next day. We'd REALLY miss this place if it closed. If you are vegan please support vegan businesses like this to keep them open!", 'Had such a great experience!! The service and ambiance of this place are what makes it special. The staff is nice, chill and very patient. There is also a deejay playing music softly to accompany you as you eat, good music: a mix of R&B, modern-jazz and west coast hip hop, very nice touch. Food is good too! Nice proportion and fun dishes, if you are vegetarian its perfect for you! Will definetely be back. Recommend anybody in the area to check it out.', "Best Afro vegan food in Paris ! Amazing service and the atmosphere is so special ‚ù§Ô∏è if you've never been, just stop scrolling and go !", 'We came here by accident and it turned out to be the best food by far during our 6 days in Paris.

We had starters, 2 main dishes, dessert, ice tea and cocktail. We are newbies regarding West African cuisine, and our random picks were altogether amazing!
Also the waiter was super nice, all in all a perfect experience ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'Amazing place, cozy decor, nice staff and delicious food. Highly recommend yassa rice, lemonade, beignets and cocktails.']

["I was so happy to find a Hungarian themed restaurant in Paris! Unfortunately it's more like a beers and burgers place, visited by locals, and only a limited amount of hungarian dishes on the menu, but the stuffed cabbage and the chicken paprikas were super tasty! For these two meals I'd give 5 stars. However the fr√∂ccs was a little bit warm and the soda water was not bubbly. There were only 2 waiters for the entire inside and outside area which meant even thought they tried their best, things would go a bit slowly. The place felt like a regular pub, unfortunately if that is what the demand is in this area, it's what they will supply. Great potential though!", 'Great experience. Cozy well made Hungarian food with calm ambiance and pleasant staff.', "Ate here twice during a recent stay in the area. The food is Hungarian and was really good on both occasions and the service was really quick. They managed to decipher my rudimentary French easily and explained the menu fully. The choice of beer is fairly limited but this is Paris and they're not renowned for beer drinking. Would definately eat here again.", "A truly delightful dining experience üôÇ. I had the goulash and the wife had stuffed cabbage rolls along with some tasty cocktails as we waited for our food.  This is very much a local dining establishment and we were fortunate to arrive early enough to have some personal time with the owner.  He's very proud of the food he personally prepares and rightly so.  My goulash accompanied  by spatzle was flavourful and tender.  Wife, who is picky about her sauerkraut was very pleased and enjoyed the rolls.  All in all an enjoyable time!  We were early 17:30ish and as we were leaving the regulars began arriving and it's popular", 'I love the atmosphere, the stunning view, and catchy music. I have been served delicious meals & coffee. Especially, the woman staff, she really nice, merci!!']

["Popped in here for a drink after a long day exploring Paris. Nice place and pleasant staff and pints for 5‚Ç¨ during their long 'Happy Hour'. Returned the next evening to try the food. We had the chicken with a Normandy cream sauce, which was very nice and we both enjoyed it.", 'If you‚Äôre looking for a place to eat, this isn‚Äôt it. The wait staff took incredibly long to bring our menus and our drinks and even longer to take our orders. The restaurant wasn‚Äôt even that busy for having a 19:00H dinner

We ordered the Magret duck and the steak rib for our entrees and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e for dessert.

Both entrees were overcooked, dried out and cold like it has been sitting out for a hour. The potatoes were the best thing on the plate.

The cr√®me br√ªl√©e had better days but it was still edible

Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt come back here unless it was to drink and smoke with everyone that sits outside', 'Great place! Plenty of food. Great price. Won‚Äôt go wrong.  They served us fast. I do recommend beef bourginoun. We had onion soups, steak with roquefort and pasta. All great flavor.', 'It was so good and affordable that we went twice in one night, price was so reasonable for the food and drinks in Paris.', 'Great French cuisine with a carafe of Rose. Lovely Parisian atmosphere. Served with a smile.']

["An authentic japanese restaurant with a large menu and tasteful cuisine, but in the end the price-quality balance can only be found in the dinner sets. A la carte is not just worth it for the price you'll pay. 30‚Ç¨ for a tempura don with 2 shrimps, broccoli, zucchini and carrots? Not even a shiitake, eggplant or sweet potato? Also, they shouldn't have started sushi offer, it's clearly not their strong suit.", 'Masayo san‚Äôs great connoisseur and seasoned skill has brought tremendous variety of Japanese cuisine goodness.
my great friend also recommend her wine selection might give you surprising marriage with each dish! Desert are also great one.', 'Tasty, but too expensive.

I had high hopes, however the high prices do not match the offerings. 28‚Ç¨ for a marinated mackerel bento with too few side dishes. 10‚Ç¨ for a cold matcha drink. At this price, more smiles from the talented chefs would be appreciated.', 'THE BEST!! We randomly discovered this restaurant and i have never tasted better udons in my life!! So yummy', "I was expecting better.

The food was very tasty and good, but not worth the dinner price in my opinion (we had the 59‚Ç¨ menu + one sake tasting for 35‚Ç¨). Also, the diversity was lacking: two of the dishes had bass; two had mackerel. With only 7 dishes, it shouldn't be hard to find other fishes, meats, or even vegetarian options, right?

The most positive surprise was to be found during dessert: the strawberry mint sorbet was fantastic."]

['Fabulous meal, perfect service.  Very affordable.  Perfect lunch in my opinion we had a lovely bottle of wine , I highly recommend and would happily return at any time.', 'Love this locals feeling place. Easy to get a seat for lunch. Little harder at dinner time. Very good food and good service. Not the most vegetarian friendly place. Good wine by the glass!', 'I knew the chef was talented just by looking at the photos others had posted. Every dish confirmed it‚Äîdelicate, delicious, with layers of flavor and contrasting textures. I only realized while writing this review that they have a Michelin star, and they truly deserve it.', 'Excellent meal. Impeccable service.  Visiting Paris with my husband and son. We enjoyed the three course meal. It was delicious. Definitely recommend! Be certain to make reservations!', 'A delightful experience to end our Paris Olympics experience.

Having experienced all variants of food in Paris, some sub par, this place definitely shone. The service was impeccable with a sense of care given and they even allowed us to chat with another table until we were the final tables still going ü§£

The vibe, the atmosphere, the style, all on point. Not cheapest but was within expectations.']

["Was harrassed as we were waiting in line by a customer who appeared to be friends with the cashier (around 9:50pm on Monday). We purchased a bottle of wine and asked if the cashier if they could please open it. He refused despite having a cork screw sitting right there on his till. The customer's friend behind us in line made intimidating remarks to us related to us being white. We felt somewhat threatened and left disappointed.", 'Very very bad service from  security.
I never goon there.', 'Went in this evening, on a Sunday, there is a huge queue for more than 30 minutes. The 2 employees didn't do anything like operating the cashier, just waited there to watch the show.

Neither employees spoke English and snatched an item out of my hand and told me simply I cannot buy it, not sure why. And then in the end, she told me "I can speak English now" in a very patronising way. Not sure whether she could speak English when I was asking her a question then.

I would avoid as a tourist. Just go to Carrefour down the road.', 'Just for you guys , when they say they close at 9pm , it means 8pm üòÇ.
Also prices are crazy ridiculous, you can go to the Carrefour nearby , way cheaper.
Ridiculous üòÇ', 'Extremely poor selection, always dirty with unfriendly staff. The ‚Äúno alcohol after 12 on Sunday‚Äù is a just ridiculous.']

["Excellent food and service in a cosy atmosphere. Deco from 1800s holds up well. Looked after us with excellent recommendations and food.

Some of the best Beef Tartare I've had and excellent lamb and steak options too.", 'We really loved our meal here - the staff were friendly and happy to answer my questions about gluten free options, there was atmosphere in spades thanks to a live piano performance + the general decor, and the food was simple but delicious. We had the ‚Ç¨35 fixed dinner menu, which included 3 courses.', 'How this place received such high ratings is beyond me. Onion soup was bland, escargots were difficult to remove from its shell (frozen?), duck confit was overly salty and skin is not crispy.

Pity as the atmosphere was nice.', 'Absolutely delicious food and wine, accompanied by lovely service! Dined with my partner and friends and we opted for the 3 course menu for I believe ‚Ç¨35, what a bargain. Would highly recommend the duck confit and creme br√ªl√©e. If you have never tried escargot before, this is the place to try. Couldn‚Äôt fault it at all - would definitely recommend visiting for high quality, cosy French dining.', 'Absolutely delicious food and wine, accompanied by lovely service! Dined with my partner and friends and we opted for the 3 course menu for I believe ‚Ç¨35, what a bargain. Would highly recommend the duck confit and creme br√ªl√©e. If you have never tried escargot before, this is the place to try them. Couldn‚Äôt fault it at all - would definitely recommend for high quality, cosy French dining.']

["One of the best Indian food I've ever had and I've tried many locations in europe and usa.
The level of spice and flavor was on point. The meat was succulent and very tender. This is my second time here in a week and not my last.", 'What a nice treat. Karki was such a nice human.
Loved the tea she made for us as well as loved the chicken biryani.

Love the hospitality. They were about to get closed but still served us.

Will definitely recommend a visit here.', 'The ambience is fantastic, the people are warm and welcoming, and the food is absolutely delicious! A special mention to Karki‚Äîshe is incredibly sweet and makes you feel right at home‚ù§Ô∏è', 'The food was delicious and a highlight in itself but what made my birthday really special was the friendly, attentive and overall wonderful staff. Thank you so much. Will definitely be back.', 'Such a lovely place in a great neighborhood! I was welcomed so warmly with a delicious cocktail. The staff was super attentive and friendly. The food is absolutely delicious! I‚Äôll definitely be back‚Äîyou should give it a try when you‚Äôre in Paris!']

['At this restaurant I visited a few days ago, I met the best kimchi stew of my life! It is not a Korean food with a strange taste modified to suit the local area, but a real depth and taste of the original Korean food! The small-sized seafood green onion pancake I ate as an appetizer was also excellent. I understood why many certification stickers on the restaurant show window were attached. It will be a very valuable experience not only for Korean travelers who miss Korean food but also for French people who are curious about Korean food culture! I highly recommend it!', "First of all,  the taste of the food at this restaurant is not bad. However, I do not recommend this place. The reason is simple: they overcharged me without my consent.That day, after finishing my meal, I asked for the bill from the owner (a gentleman, probably Korean). The bill showed 39 euros. I indicated that I wanted to pay by card, so the man brought out the payment machine. I tapped my Visa credit card on the machine. After a moment, he asked if I needed a receipt, and I said yes. I didn‚Äôt pay much attention to the receipt and left with my family.After leaving the restaurant, I was organizing my things and took a closer look at the receipt. To my surprise, I noticed that he had charged me 40 euros, which was 1 euro more than the bill.I understand that some establishments might expect customers to leave a tip, but that doesn‚Äôt justify him taking extra money from me without asking. Even in the U.S., where tipping is almost mandatory, it‚Äôs clearly shown on the bill. If this Korean owner had asked me beforehand whether I was willing to leave a tip, I might not have refused. But his decision to take a tip without my consent made me very uncomfortable.That‚Äôs why I do not recommend this restaurant at all. It made me feel that he is dishonest. If he is willing to take an extra euro from a customer's credit card without permission, how can I trust the quality of his ingredients? How can I trust that he wouldn‚Äôt cut corners with the food to make more profit?", 'Had dinner here after a bit of shopping. They had vegan options and were kind enough to make some swaps. A little expensive for what you get but they make up for it in service and the ambiance of the place.

Ambiance 5/5
Service 5/5
Food quality 4/5
Food portion 4/5
Price and value for money 4/5

üíô @lifewithaua', 'Absolutely AMAZING service, the food is delicious, and really reminds me of food from traditional Korean restaurants. Unlike any other Korean place in France! I would eat here every day. It was a pleasant and yummy surprise', 'Authentic Korean food in Paris. Only one waiter to take orders, deliver food and check out. Even so, the waiter always wears a smile. So you might have to wait one hour to have your food on the table.

Totally worth it. If you are from Asia and miss Asian food during long trip in Europe, shin Jung is definitely somewhere you should visit.']

Adresse: 56 Rue Notre Dame de Lorette, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews:
["I do recommend this place.
Please go and try it out. This was my first time eating Ethiopian food and surprisingly I liked it.
It's so diffeyrent from my culture and that deserves my respect. I can't remember what we had.  The names are hard but ask for the more traditional stuff and also try their beer.", 'The young man in restraunt was friendly and food arrived in a timely manner. Having tried and experienced Ethiopian food many times - I was disappointed with the portion size as well as the Injera was very fresh. Not authentic as I hoped.', "Very good. They served our three dishes on one big plate to share - which makes it very friendly and casual.

Using cutlery is a no-go for the owner so you'll have to eat the traditional way..", "Nice surprise. Very welcoming. Good to be in contact with food and ingredients. Only thing is that it's a bit dark in the restaurant.", 'We came to eat right after the restaurant closed.

My friend is vegan and we were struggling to find food in the area for her. They so generously made us food togo.

The gentleman Alexander was so kind and good natured, and recommended a few vegan dishes for us that we took back to our hotel.

Surprisingly, even after a 20 minute walk, the food was so fresh and delicious. It was one of the best meals I‚Äôve had my entire life and we didn‚Äôt even order any meat dishes!!

I am going to sleep feeling very well fed and happy thanks to this restaurant kindly serving us after they were closed. Highly recommend, the food was seasoned well and injera was fresh and so tasty. The service was just the cherry on top, I‚Äôm so grateful!!']

['A very positively surprising experience A neighborhood cafe run by a nice family and well skilled indeed.

The highlight of our Paris trip.

Simple and beautiful scrambled eggs and eggs on nest; the latter served with a nice tomato paste
The French toast was absolutely amazing. Very homy style and clearly made with love
Totally recommended if you are heading to montmarte!', 'This place was so delicious and homey I went twice for breakfast. When I‚Äôm in a new city I try to try new places, but I just felt so welcome and taken care of.
Upon my return I learned that it‚Äôs a family owned business. The young man who took care of me both times was so lovely and patient. He even remembered my coffee order! \U0001faf6üèΩ
I can not recommend this place enough, even just for some simple scrambled eggs with cheese. Yes I know, so basic yet so delicious! There are no photos because I was busy enjoying it all. Patatas bravas also yummy!!!

This man not only looks after all the guests and kindly explains the menus etc, but he also squeezes the juice fresh, makes the coffee, busses tables and so much more. So impressed.
Go here, be nice and tip them generously! Support small businesses üíú merci for everything!', 'We stopped here for a quick breakfast. We were welcomed in as the first guests of the morning. The family was very kind to us and the food had a home-cooked made with love feel. We enjoyed our breakfast very much.', 'This is a very nice & cozy restaurant to have your breakfast/brunch while visiting the Montmartre area. The food is great. Price is very reasonable. Super friendly and awesome staff! Highly recommended!', 'fantastic food and lovely service. stellar drinks, too. the samosas were ridiculous and so was the pineapple jam on the pancakes. also, it is a gorgeous place ! i very much recommend. the menu is in french and also english.']

["I didn't have dinner at Soleil, I came for the stand up comedy. Good beer, friendly staff, nice show. You really need to be a French speaker....", 'The steak is absolutely delicious! I really enjoyed it, and it exceeded my expectations.', 'I visited Au Soleil on Saturday night and we had an amazing time! The staff were so welcoming and lovely, especially Moha (the barman downstairs)! He was super kind and patient with us. The music was so good and we had such a gorgeous evening there - will definitely be returning!‚ò∫Ô∏è', 'I visited Au Soleil on Friday night, with my friend, from the UK and we had a fantastic time. Moha served us and was very friendly and helped us decide what drinks to have. The music was very good, we had an amazing night‚ò∫Ô∏è', 'The food was excellent, as was the service. Great atmosphere, we sat outside. Perfect place to grab brunch before climbing Sacre Coeur. Will be visiting again next time I‚Äôm in Paris.']

['What a hidden gem. We are Thai food lovers and it‚Äôs our go to. We had a lot of sour experiences yet we keep trying and I am glad we tried Ayyuthaya. It‚Äôs authentic and super tasty. We‚Äôre vegetarian and loved the green curry and fried rice. The food is super simple, clean and almost feels home made. There‚Äôs not a lot going on in the dishes and oil is used in moderation. I was blown away by the honest fried rice and hearty green curry

Google maps says the place closes at 11:15 but when we went at 10:45 we were told they‚Äôre closing. So call ahead if you‚Äôre going late', 'Really lovely place, super friendly people, small and cosy but the food is mostly very good! Highly recommended', 'I had nice  dinners 2times. Cozy, calm and romantic spce at night with candle light.I enjoyed the mood. kind host helped  me  have  tasty dishes, also  the  price of  menu is  reasonable. Almost 11~15euro. I recommend  this  place  including tourists.There is delivery seivece. Thanks  for nice  time!

Photo : Fried Vegitables &prawns (I asked for spicy souce)with rice  .15Euro.', 'In the heart of Pigalle, authentic Thai cuisine. A favourite so book or arrive early', "Just got back from Paris & we were staying like a block away from this restaurant in Pigalle so we decided to give it a try instead of another larger restaurant that had a rep for being a tourist trap (and had a stupidly long line to get in!).
We didn't have a reservation at Ayutthaya but we were welcomed & seated within minutes. Service was excellent even though they were very busy. The Thai food we ordered was fabulous! We had a very nice meal here & would definitely eat here again!
Thank you Ayutthaya!"]

['First of all, their hospitality is amazing. I had a long layover in CDG and made a reservation, but open checking in, I realized the reservation was for the previous day (honest mistake on my end). The woman at the reception was kind & understanding and managed to squeeze me in for a 1:30 time slot. The food was fantastic and the wait time was not too long. I ordered the beef tongue carpaccio, scallops, and raspberry pavlova as part of the set menu they offer. Highly recommend!', 'Wonderful restaurant with delicious food, friendly service and lovely atmosphere. My husband and I went for lunch and both had the three-course menu. The food was incredible in flavor, preparation and presentation. The salmon and beef carpaccio starters were notably great and my husband said the souffl√© was the best he‚Äôs ever had. We had our baby with us in a stroller and they were very kindly accommodating for the extra room. I look forward to returning one day!', 'Absolutely spectacular meal! The service, presentation and food was impeccable, I loved this restaurant. I came for lunch with my coworkers and we all ate everything on our plates so fast I don‚Äôt even think we even chewed lol. I would highly recommend this wonderful restaurant', "Fantastic experience! Tasty dishes, local and a friendly service. It's on Michelin's bib rating. French food at its finest. Great choice of excellent wines too. Highly recommend it if you are visiting Paris.", "I had my best meal since arriving in Paris at Les Canailles! Despite the absence of an English menu, the staff's understanding of English and the availability of Google Translate made ordering a breeze.

I opted for a main course from the chef‚Äôs specials, and it did not disappoint. The dish, featuring sweetbreads, was exceptional‚Äîperfectly cooked with a delightful crispy texture. It was the best sweetbread I've ever had, surpassing even those from Michelin-starred restaurants. The accompanying artichokes were equally delicious, and I left my plate spotless.

Les Canailles is a gem, and I will definitely return to explore more of their menu."]

['Our last burgers in Paris - and they were great! Great service, extremely friendly and great food at very reasonable prices.', 'They serve good pub food at a reasonable price. I enjoyed the relax atmosphere even though the music volume was a tad too loud. I want to compliment the young man who served me. He looks like he enjoys what he is doing. I will highly recommend this place.', 'Came across this bar on a corner as we descended from Montmartre onto Pigalle via Rue des Martyrs on a Saturday afternoon.
I believe it can get very busy later in evening but a great spot on a Saturday afternoon. Great big windows to people watch - as well as outdoor seating. Loved the distressed look.
Fantastic prices - can get a pint of Grolsch for ‚Ç¨5.50 but loved the Barge IPA for ‚Ç¨8.
Glass of wine - ‚Ç¨4.', 'Great place for a beer or wine at night . They have also food to eat with your drinks with good prices compared with whole Paris .', "Soooo... the thing with this place... It's quite cheap for Paris prices & for me, they've got one of the tastiest salads in the city - the salade ch√®vre chaud!!!!!! I've tried some other food here though and it wasn't as amazing, the service also is super slow at times, so it depends if you're lucky or not üôàNevertheless, what speaks for it, is its laid back and chilled atmosphere, which is perfect for meet-ups with friends or dates! It somehow has that kind of Parisian charm! If you're lucky & get a little sunny spot on the terrace, you'll enjoy everything even more, while having your spot for people watching üòè (and grab that ch√®vre chaud salad at the same time üòú)"]

['Good neighborhood branch of the franprix chain. Price is affordable and many selections. Along rue damremont.', 'Two stars for being open on Sunday evening when practically everything else was closed. Good selection of fresh and prepared foods. There is a microwave do you can heat microwave-ready dishes. Water, alcohol, and juices are available. Some household and personal hygiene products are available too. Cashier was welcoming.', "This place needs to be struck off 'pick up point' - I carefully arranged two deliveries of expensive wine to collect while I was in Paris for a few days. Chronopost sent me an email telling me my deliveries were there to collect, so as soon as I arrived I went to collect them.  The woman told me 'nothing for you' and refused to help.  It transpires she had refused to accept the delivery because it was 'too large'  - really!  at most 24 bottles of wine in a supermarket.  God knows how I am going to get my one b4 I leave France!  The manger is a horrible, vile, brutish excuse for a human being who should be sacked !", 'Small supermarket but has all the essentials: water, wine, cheese, bread, meats and veges. Better selection of wine than much bigger carrefour around the corner.', "On Sunday 2nd of July 2017 we bought a yogurt especially done for baby. However we've noticed the limit date of consumption was July 2016, that means the product for baby was out of consumption since one year, terrific for a food product for baby. We got our money back plus an additional yogurt product, but I have to share this important information to consumers: be careful!"]

['food was delicious with interesting flavour combinations. i had the crab salad with a very special crumble on top that was totally unexpected but very nice. the cod was excellent. service and atmosphere were both very warm and friendly. will definitely return.', 'Fantastic & delicious food. Poor service.  We walked in off the street, not knowing anything about the restaurant or the need for a reservation (we just happened to be passing by). The server was obviously not happy that we didn‚Äôt have a reservation and made a grimacing face as she spoke to us. However, we were offered a table. We were the only customers in the restaurant when we arrived. We waited for 10 minutes and finally asked if we could have water and drinks because we were parched from walking. I spilt my water by accident (it was quite loud too) and the server never got up off her stool to assist. I had to ask for a dry napkin. The plates were not cleared between servings and we had to move our dishes to the side of the table so the suggestion could be obvious that we wanted them cleared. The veal was mouth watering and oh so tender. Everything was cooked to perfection. We were really disappointed that the 2 staff members were not on par with the Chef. The experience could have been mind blowing but the service really tarnished the experience. Would return-for the food and certainly hope a new service staff is present and well trained. Highly suggest you make reservations.', 'When is about food depend from person to person, but in this case I think everyone will be impressed, this was in our case. If I‚Äôll pass this part of Paris, for sure I‚Äôll visit again the restaurant.', 'In our last night of Paris, we were looking for a local restaurant with French cuisine and my wife found this spot. The food was delicious and definitely filling, we left feeling stuffed. We chose the 3 course menu which included a starter, entree and dessert. Although the food was great, the service was a bit slow. We weren‚Äôt checked on very often and the person next to us had to remind the waitress that he was still waiting for his dessert. All in all still recommend this michelin star restaurant.', 'It was okay! I think some of the food items were just not my taste. The space is really cozy and the servers were really nice. We had some language barriers and they were extremely accomdating. The fois gras was okay. The beef was good. The dessert was yummy as well (minus the nut allergy).']

['Good range of craft beers and friendly and helpful staff. Lots of regulars and good atmosphere.', 'Good bier and good space to be, total 5 stars place.', 'Exactly what you want from a beer bar. Only French products is a interesting choice. Around 30 beers to pick from and a small but good whisky collection. Cheap! The place is not big though. They sometimes make food, not all the time but when they do its worth it! Definitely a place to step in if your looking for French beers.', 'Good beer and very friendly staff', 'Not sure what I was expecting here at 5pm, midweek. Pretty run down, even by dive bar standards. Had a reasonable range of beers available by bottle and one or two on draft. The main complaint was that it felt very unwelcoming. The staff were little more than reluctant beer dispensers. No vibe, no atmosphere. Might be good when busy but very much a quirky locals bar. Not worth going (a long way) out of your way to visit here.']

['We arrived here for a late evening dinner. Surprisingly, we were not greeted by the so-called ‚ÄòParisian‚Äô attitude. Staff was extremely friendly and smiley. Totally family friendly (although would have been nicer to have a high chair available for the toddler). There‚Äôs a kids menu. Despite a late evening dinner, food was really well executed. House wine was great. Value for money! Would we come back? For sure! Thank you staff for the patience and welcoming service.', "We visited this restaurant in France with high expectations for the French cuisine, but unfortunately our experience was marred by the poor service.

My friend and I waited patiently to be seated and then approached the staff to request menus. The waiter rudely told us to just wait for him, but he never came over to our table. After about 40 minutes of being ignored, I went back inside to try to place our order, but the waiter got upset with me and told me to return to my seat and he would come eventually.

Regrettably, we ended up having to leave the restaurant without ever being served or getting the chance to try the food. The total lack of attentiveness and the rude attitude of the staff made for a very frustrating experience.

I'm surprised by the poor level of service, as the French cuisine is usually known for its excellence. This restaurant seems to fall short when it comes to providing a welcoming and professional dining experience. I would not recommend visiting unless they can significantly improve their service standards.", 'It is a great restaurant that deserves you to take your time enjoying your courses and drinks here. Chicken is crispy outside and chewy in the meat. The couscous is a definitely must-order, super yummy!
Salmon with avocado is the best combo in terms of flavor and taste. All in all, you absolutely don‚Äôt wanna miss it.', "The food was remarkably unremarkable. The epitome of neutrality. Neither discernable good or bad in any way.

I did, however, find some remarkable points to note:

The first was in the form of a rather sweet looking mouse that ran out from somewhere behind me to linger under the empty table next to me. I'm not sure what it found to eat, but it reappeared shortly after looking somewhat more disgruntled.

The second was that, on paying the bill, the waiter invited me to add on a tip in such a way that there could be no dignified response to the negative.

I honestly didn't mind the mouse, and probably wouldn't have mentioned it at all, but the business with the tip pissed me right off.", 'Perfect overall, well priced, well served French style Parisian restaurant. Very happy to have found it']

['The service is very slow.. it takes several adjustments of the delivery time.. if you wish to order in future you need to order in 1-2 hours in advance..', 'I ordered a veggie hut pizza with fake meat and they put real meat on my pizza. When I came home I realised while eating my pizza that the pizza had a very meaty taste and when I checked it was full of bacon and grounded meat. I went back to complain and the guy tells me that I should know what I order because on the veggie pizza with fake meat they apparently put also real meat???? What the actual f is this answer. And what the actual f is this pizza? I got super pissed at the guy that at a point his colleague had to interfere. I never had a problem with them before but this is unacceptable.', "The place is just kinda ugly, but for the rest I was kinda surprised. The quality of the pizza is decent and it's not that pricey. Recommended if you have a craving for pizza and want something quick", 'Nice food but communicating with them as a non french speaker was not very successful. Asked for 1 beer and they charged us 4 beers (we did get them)', 'Nice pizzas, friendly staff, take away only. no dine in.']

["What a disgusting food they are selling. I ordered chapatis and none of them was roasted/ cooked properly. I don't understand how can somebody serve such low quality food. I've attached the pictures as a proof.", 'Very tasty with many different options.

The service is great, the staff is very friendly.

Place is a big small but has a cozy atmosphere.', 'As a failed bramacarya I do like to find prasad but this isn‚Äôt. As others have said, the table dressing is a bit disrespectful. I can‚Äôt throw stones, I was wearing a kangaroo skin coat with a cow hide vest. Life is life. Still, it was a very nice meal.  If you‚Äôre looking for a tasty feed and not a religious experience, I recommend.', 'This is sooooo good! I was craving Indian food that‚Äôs decently priced after a long time eating European food. The Kottu parotta came with two innovative sides- eggplant and soya chunks based. Absolutely loved it! Make authentic Indian vegan food famous again instead of paying >20‚Ç¨ for subpar hype vegan food. üí™', "I love indian cuisine !!
Can go 1 week without indian food !
Great service and evry was the best that I had.
I mean the best indian restaurant ever that I've went to so far in my life !
Fell in love with indian kinda cuisine from the age of 11-ish and I am turning 21 in this December! I can proudly say that I never went without having indian cuisine for months and years!!
I couldn't take any photos because I was hungry and the food was looking good !"]

['Got recommended this restaurant by a french local. Food was flavourful and authentic. 40 euros for 3 courses is an absolute bargain for the value and the high quality food. The steak was cooked perfectly and lamb was really tender. The oysters were fresh and tasted really good, the creme br√ªl√©e was the best of my whole stay in France.
